Name: Phoenix
Text: (Boy am I nervous!)

Name: Mia
Text: Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, h-hiya, Chief.

Name: Mia
Text: Whew, I'm glad I made it on time. Well, I have to say Phoenix, I'm impressed! Not everyone takes on a murder trial right off the bat like this. It says a lot about you... and your client as well.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... thanks. Actually, it's because I owe him a favor.

Name: Mia
Text: A favor? You mean, you knew the defendant before this case?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. Actually, I kind of owe my current job to him. He's one of the reasons I became an attorney.

Name: Mia
Text: Well, that's news to me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I want to help him out any way I can! I just... really want to help him, I owe him that much.

Name: Butz
Text: (It's over! My life, everything, it's all over!)

Name: Mia
Text: ... Isn't that your client screaming over there?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah... that's him.

Name: Butz
Text: (Death! Despair! Ohhhh! I'm gonna do it, I'm gonna die!!!)

Name: Mia
Text: It sounds like he wants to die...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, yeah. *sigh*

Name: Butz
Text: Nick!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey. Hey there, Larry.

Name: Butz
Text: Dude, I'm so guilty!! Tell them I'm guilty!!! Gimme the death sentence! I ain't afraid to die!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!? What's wrong, Larry?

Name: Butz
Text: Oh, it's all over... I... I'm finished. Finished! I can't live in a world without her! I can't! Who... who took her away from me, Nick? Who did this!? Aww, Nick, ya gotta tell me! Who took my baby away!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... The person responsible for your girlfriend's death? The newspapers say it was you...)

Name: Judge
Text: The court is now in session for the trial of Mr. Larry Butz.

Name: Payne
Text: The prosecution is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The, um, defense is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Ahem. Mr. Wright? This is your first trial, is it not?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-Yes, Your Honor. I'm, um, a little nervous.

Name: Judge
Text: Your conduct during this trial will decide the fate of your client. Murder is a serious charge. For your client's sake, I hope you can control your nerves.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thank... thank you, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: ... Mr. Wright, given the circumstances... I think we should have a test to ascertain your readiness.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-Your Honor. (Gulp... Hands shaking... Eyesight... fading...)

Name: Judge
Text: This test will consist of a few simple questions. Answer them clearly and concisely. Please state the name of the defendant in this case.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defendant? Well, that's Larry Butz, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Correct. Just keep your wits about you and you'll do fine. Next question: This is a murder trial. Tell me, what's the victim's name?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Whew, I know this one! Glad I read the case report cover to cover so many times. It's... wait... Uh-oh! No... no way! I forgot! I'm drawing a total blank here!)

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix! Are you absolutely SURE you're up to this? You don't even know the victim's name!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, the victim! O-Of course I know the victim's name! I, um, just forgot. ... Temporarily.

Name: Mia
Text: I think I feel a migraine coming on. Look, the victim's name is listed in the Court Record. Just touch the Court Record button to check it at anytime, okay? Remember to check it often. Do it for me, please. I'm begging you.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. Who is the victim in this case?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... the victim's name is Cindy Stone.

Name: Judge
Text: Correct. Now, tell me, what was the cause of death? She died because she was...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: She was struck once, by a blunt object.

Name: Judge
Text: Correct. You've answered all my questions. I see no reason why we shouldn't proceed. You seem much more relaxed, Mr. Wright. Good for you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thank you, Your Honor. (Because I don't FEEL relaxed, that's for sure.)

Name: Judge
Text: Well, then... First, a question for the prosecution. Mr. Payne?

Name: Payne
Text: Yes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: As Mr. Wright just told us, the victim was struck with a blunt object. Would you explain to the court just what that "object" was?

Name: Payne
Text: The murder weapon was this statue of "The Thinker." It was found lying on the floor, next to the victim.

Name: Judge
Text: I see... the court accepts it into evidence.

Name: Mia
Text: Wright... Be sure to pay attention to any evidence added during the trial. That evidence is the only ammunition you have in court. Touch the Court Record button to check the Court Record frequently.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Payne, the prosecution may call its first witness.

Name: Payne
Text: The prosecution calls the defendant, Mr. Butz, to the stand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, Chief, what do I do now?

Name: Mia
Text: Pay attention. You don't want to miss any information that might help your client's case. You'll get your chance to respond to the prosecution later, so be ready! Let's just hope he doesn't say anything... unfortunate.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh, Larry gets excited easily... this could be bad.)

Name: Payne
Text: Ahem. Mr. Butz. Is it not true that the victim had recently dumped you?

Name: Butz
Text: Hey, watch it buddy! We were great together! We were Romeo and Juliet, Cleopatra and Mark Anthony!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Um... didn't they all die?)

Name: Butz
Text: I wasn't dumped! She just wasn't taking my phone calls. Or seeing me... Ever. WHAT'S IT TO YOU, ANYWAY!?

Name: Payne
Text: Mr. Butz, what you describe is generally what we mean by "dumped." In fact, she had completely abandoned you... and was seeing other men! She had just returned from overseas with one of them the day before the murder!

Name: Butz
Text: Whaddya mean, "one of them"!? Lies! All of it, lies! I don't believe a word of it!

Name: Payne
Text: Your Honor, the victim's passport. According to this, she was in Paris until the day before she died.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Indeed, she appears to have returned the day before the murder.

Name: Butz
Text: Dude... no way...

Name: Payne
Text: The victim was a model, but did not have a large income. It appears that she had several "Sugar Daddies."

Name: Butz
Text: Daddies? Sugar?

Name: Payne
Text: Yes. Older men, who gave her money and gifts. She took their money and used it to support her lifestyle.

Name: Butz
Text: Duuude!

Name: Payne
Text: We can clearly see what kind of woman this Ms. Stone was. Tell me, Mr. Butz, what do you think of her now?

Name: Mia
Text: Wright... I don't think you want him to answer that question.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yeah... Larry has a way of running his mouth in all the wrong directions.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Might be better not to get involved in this one...)

Name: Payne
Text: Well, Mr. Butz?

Name: Butz
Text: Dude, no way! That cheatin' she-dog!

Name: Phoenix
Text: My client had no idea the victim was seeing other men! That question is irrelevant to this case!

Name: Payne
Text: Oof! *wince*

Name: Butz
Text: Dude! Nick! Whaddya mean, "irrelevant"!? That cheatin' she-dog!

Name: Butz
Text: I'm gonna die. I'm just gonna drop dead! Yeah, and when I meet her in the afterlife... I'm going to get to the bottom of this!

Name: Judge
Text: Let's continue with the trial, shall we?

Name: Payne
Text: I believe the accused's motive is clear to everyone.

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, quite.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh boy. This is so not looking good.)

Name: Payne
Text: Next question! You went to the victim's apartment on the day of the murder, did you not?

Name: Butz
Text: Gulp!

Name: Payne
Text: Well, did you, or did you not?

Name: Butz
Text: Heh? Heh heh. Well, maybe I did, and maybe I didn't!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh. He went.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I know! I'll send him a signal...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (TELL THE TRUTH)

Name: Butz
Text: Er... Yeah! Yeah! I was there! I went!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Well, Mr. Butz?

Name: Butz
Text: Dude, chill! She wasn't home, man... So, like, I didn't see her.

Name: Payne
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Payne
Text: Your Honor, the defendant is lying.

Name: Judge
Text: Lying?

Name: Payne
Text: The prosecution would like to call a witness who can prove Mr. Butz is lying.

Name: Judge
Text: Well, that simplifies matters. Who is your witness?

Name: Payne
Text: The man who found the victim's body. Just before making the gruesome discovery... He saw the defendant fleeing the scene of the crime!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order in the court! Mr. Payne, the prosecution may call its witness.

Name: Payne
Text: Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is bad...)

Name: Payne
Text: On the day of the murder, my witness was selling newspapers at the victim's building. Please bring Mr. Frank Sahwit to the stand!

Name: Payne
Text: Mr. Sahwit, you sell newspaper subscriptions, is this correct?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Oh, oh yes! Newspapers, yes!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Sahwit, you may proceed with your testimony. Please tell the court what you saw on the day of the murder.

Name: Judge
Text: Incidentally, why wasn't the phone in the victim's apartment working?

Name: Payne
Text: Your Honor, at the time of the murder, there was a blackout in the building.

Name: Judge
Text: Aren't phones supposed to work during a blackout?

Name: Payne
Text: Yes, Your Honor... However, some cordless phones do not function normally. The phone that Mr. Sahwit used was one of those. Your Honor... I have a record of the blackout, for your perusal.

Name: Judge
Text: Now, Mr. Wright...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes! Er... yes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: You may begin your cross-examination.

Name: Phoenix
Text: C-Cross-examination, Your Honor?

Name: Mia
Text: Alright, Wright, this is it. The real deal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... what exactly am I supposed to do?

Name: Mia
Text: Why, you expose the lies in the testimony the witness just gave!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Lies! What?! He was lying!?

Name: Mia
Text: Your client is innocent, right? Then that witness must have lied in his testimony! Or is your client really... guilty?

Name: Phoenix
Text: !!! How do I prove he's not?

Name: Mia
Text: You hold the key! It's in the evidence! Compare the witness's testimony to the evidence at hand. There's bound to be a contradiction in there! First, find contradictions between the Court Record and the witness's testimony. Then, once you've found the contradicting evidence... present it and rub it in the witness's face!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... okay.

Name: Mia
Text: Touch the Court Record button and point out contradictions in the testimony!

Name: Sahwit
Text: I was going door-to-door, selling subscriptions when I saw a man fleeing an apartment.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Isn't a man leaving an apartment a common sight? I find it odd you would take notice of him...

Name: Sahwit
Text: Er... heh. I don't know. He just seemed strange to me, that's all. Like he was mad, and yet frightened at the same time. Just like... a criminal fleeing the scene of a crime!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense requests that the witness refrain from conjecture!

Name: Payne
Text: Of course. What the witness means is that the man he saw looked suspicious. So, what happened next?

Name: Sahwit
Text: I thought he must be in a hurry because he left the door half-open behind him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Half-open... you say?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Yes, yes, the door was open halfway. Yes. I watched for a moment, but no one came to close the door. "That's odd, in a big city like this," I thought...

Name: Payne
Text: I see. And what happened next?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Thinking it strange, I looked inside the apartment.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What gave you the idea to do that?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Well, the door was half-open, you see. Isn't it only human to want to... peek? We climb mountains because they are there! It's the same thing.

Name: Payne
Text: Truer words have never been spoken! Anyone would look inside!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... why did Payne cut him off so quickly?)

Name: Payne
Text: So you looked into the apartment. What happened then?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Then I saw her lying there... A woman... not moving... dead!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you sure she was dead?

Name: Sahwit
Text: W-Well, no, I guess I wasn't. But, she wasn't moving at all, and there was blood everywhere.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess that would look fatal to anyone...) Very well, what happened next?

Name: Sahwit
Text: I quailed in fright and found myself unable to go inside.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you didn't touch ANYTHING in the apartment?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Um, yes. I mean no! Nothing.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Okay. What happened next?

Name: Sahwit
Text: I thought to call the police immediately!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You "thought" to call the police? Does that mean you didn't actually call them!?

Name: Payne
Text: Please, please... Listen to the rest of the testimony. You thought to call the police... What happened next?

Name: Sahwit
Text: However, the phone in her apartment wasn't working.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The phone in her apartment wasn't working?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Yes. I mean, no, no it wasn't. Right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But you said you didn't go into the apartment... or did you!?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Oh, oh, that? I can explain that! There was a cordless phone on a shelf in the entranceway. I reached inside and tried using that to call...

Name: Payne
Text: And the phone wasn't working, correct? What happened next?

Name: Sahwit
Text: I went to a nearby park and found a public phone.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why use a public phone?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Well, you see, I don't have a cell phone. And, being the middle of the afternoon, there was no answer at the nearby apartments.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ah, right... what time did you call again?

Name: Sahwit
Text: I remember the time exactly: It was 1:00 PM.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: 1:00 PM! Are you certain?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Yes. Absolutely.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... He seems really confident.)

Name: Mia
Text: 1:00 PM? Wright. Doesn't that seem strange to you? Present some evidence to contradict him!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You found the body at 1:00 PM. You're sure?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Yes. It was 1:00 PM, for certain.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Frankly, I find that hard to believe! Your statement directly contradicts the autopsy report. The autopsy notes the time of death at sometime after 4PM. There was nobody to... er... no "body" to find at 1:00 PM! How do you explain this three-hour gap?

Name: Sahwit
Text: !!! Oh, that! Oh, er...

Name: Payne
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Payne
Text: This is trivial! The witness merely forgot the time!

Name: Judge
Text: After his testimony, I find that hard to believe. Mr. Sahwit... Why were you so certain that you found the body at 1:00 PM?

Name: Sahwit
Text: I.. er... well, I... Gee, that's a really good question!

Name: Mia
Text: Great job, Wright! Way to put him on the spot! That's all you have to do: point out contradictions! Lies always beget more lies! See through one, and their whole story falls apart!

Name: Sahwit
Text: Wait! I remember now!

Name: Judge
Text: Would you care to give your testimony again?

Name: Mia
Text: Wright! You know what to do!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I've got this one.

Name: Sahwit
Text: You see, when I found the body, I heard the time.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You said "heard"... Not "saw"?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Yes, heard. All I saw was the body lying there... I didn't think to look at anything else, least of all my watch.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hmm... Isn't that a little strange? So you're saying you "heard" something. But if you were so shocked by the body, you wouldn't hear anything at all!

Name: Payne
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Payne
Text: The witness did say he actually heard the time. It's ludicrous to suggest he "wouldn't hear anything"!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I have to agree with the prosecution. Witness, continue your testimony.

Name: Sahwit
Text: There was a voice saying the time... It was probably coming from the television.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you sure it was a television and not... a radio?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Well, no, I guess it might have been a radio.

Name: Payne
Text: Incidentally, there was no radio on the premises. There was only one large television.

Name: Mia
Text: Wright! I can't put my finger on it, but something about this seems fishy. Something about "hearing" the television...

Name: Payne
Text: The witness has testified. He heard the time.

Name: Sahwit
Text: Oh, but it was three hours off, wasn't it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: How do you explain the gap!

Name: Judge
Text: Well, witness? Can you explain this?

Name: Sahwit
Text: I guess the victim must have been watching a video of a taped program!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: A.. video?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Yes, that would explain why the time was wrong!

Name: Phoenix
Text: True, true...

Name: Mia
Text: Wright! I think the problem lies someplace else...

Name: Judge
Text: We're agreed that you heard the time at the scene, then.

Name: Sahwit
Text: That's why I thought it was 1:00 PM!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you sure the voice you heard said it was 1:00 PM?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Yes, I can practically hear it now. It was quite clear.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Payne, has the prosecution verified this testimony?

Name: Payne
Text: My apologies, Your Honor. I, too, have only just learned that the witness "heard" the time.

Name: Sahwit
Text: Oh, I'm really sorry. I only remembered it just now.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hold it right there! The prosecution has said there was a blackout at the time of the discovery! And this record proves it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You couldn't have heard a television... or a video!

Name: Sahwit
Text: Gah!!! I... well... urk!

Name: Judge
Text: The defense has a point. Do you have an explanation for this, Mr. Sahwit?

Name: Sahwit
Text: No, I... I find it quite puzzling myself! Quite! ... Aah! W-wait! I remember now!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Sahwit? The court would prefer to hear an accurate testimony from the very beginning. These constant corrections are harming your credibility. That, and you seem rather... distraught.

Name: Sahwit
Text: ...! M-my apologies, Your Honor! It... er, it must have been the shock of finding the body!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, Mr. Sahwit. Let's hear your testimony once more please.

Name: Sahwit
Text: Actually, I didn't "hear" the time... I "saw" it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That strikes me as a very suspicious mistake.

Name: Sahwit
Text: Yes, I can see how you'd be a little doubtful... I'm really sorry. I only just remembered that table clock!

Name: Judge
Text: A "table clock"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: A "table clock"? Was there a clock at the scene?

Name: Judge
Text: This is the first I've heard of it!

Name: Sahwit
Text: Yeah, the murder weapon! The killer used it to hit the victim!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The... murder weapon?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Yes, the table clock that was used as a weapon! That's what I just said. Did you doze off in the middle of my testimony or something?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Something's fishy here...)

Name: Sahwit
Text: That must have been what I saw.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why didn't you tell us that in the first place?

Name: Sahwit
Text: I guess it just slipped my mind! I'm not really sure how it happened myself...

Name: Payne
Text: The witness says he saw the table clock. End of story.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait just a moment! The murder weapon wasn't a clock. It was this statue! Now how is this supposed to be a clock?

Name: Sahwit
Text: Whaa!? Y-you with your "objections," and your "evidence"... Just who do you think you are!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Just answer the question, Mr. Sahwit.

Name: Sahwit
Text: Hey, I... I saw it there, okay! That's a clock!

Name: Payne
Text: Your Honor! If I may...

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, Mr. Payne?

Name: Payne
Text: As the witness stated, this statue is indeed a clock. The neck is a switch. You just tilt it, and it says the time out loud. As it doesn't look like a clock, I submitted it as a statue. My apologies.

Name: Judge
Text: I see. So the murder weapon was a table clock after all. Well, Mr. Wright? It appears that the witness's testimony was correct. This is a clock. Do you have any problems with his testimony now?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, there is a gaping hole in the witness's testimony!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The only way he could have known the weapon was a clock is to hold it in his hand. Yet the witness testified that he never entered the apartment! Clearly, a contradiction!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... indeed!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The witness knew it was a clock, because he went into the apartment

Name: Phoenix
Text: You're lying! You were inside the apartment on the day of the murder!

Name: Sahwit
Text: Oh yeah? Prove it! Prove I went in there!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'll do better than that! I can prove you were the one who killed her! You struck her with the clock, and the shock of the blow triggered the clock's voice! That was the sound you heard!

Name: Judge
Text: Order in the court! Intriguing. Please continue, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor. Mr. Sahwit. The sound must have left quite an impression on you. Understandable, since the murder weapon spoke just as you hit the victim! That voice was burned into your mind. That's why you were so certain about the time!

Name: Payne
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Payne
Text: W-w-what's the meaning of this? This is all baseless conjecture!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Baseless...? Just look at the witness's face!

Name: Sahwit
Text: Ngh... grrrah!

Name: Judge
Text: Would the witness care to elaborate? Did you strike the victim with the clock?

Name: Sahwit
Text: I... I...! That... that day... I... I never! Look... I... the clock... I heard, no! I mean, I saw...Saw... nggg! Gwaaaaaaaaaaaaah! Shutupshutupshutup! I hate you! I-it was him, I tell you! I saw him! H-he killed her and he should burn! Burn! Give him death!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order in the court I say!

Name: Payne
Text: Your Honor, a-a moment please! There isn't a shred of evidence supporting the defense's claims!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: You claim the sound the witness heard came from the clock... Do you have any evidence?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The whole case is riding on this! I'd better think it through carefully!) Yes, Your Honor. The sound Mr. Sahwit heard was definitely this clock. A fact which is clear if you simply try sounding the clock

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let's sound the clock now, here in this court. Your Honor, may I have the clock? I ask the court to listen very carefully...

Name: Alarm clock
Text: ...*beep*... [I think it's 8:25.]

Name: Judge
Text: That certainly is a strange way to announce the time.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, he is "The Thinker," after all.

Name: Judge
Text: So, we've heard the clock. What are your conclusions, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Payne... can you tell me what time it is now?

Name: Phoenix
Text: As you can see, this clock is exactly three hours slow! Precisely the discrepancy between what Mr. Sahwit heard and the actual time of death! So, Mr. Sahwit... Try to talk your way out of this one!

Name: Sahwit
Text: ... ...Hah! Hah hah! You forgot one thing!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh... what's he talking about...?)

Name: Sahwit
Text: While it may seem like that clock IS running three hours slow... It proves nothing! How do you know it was running three days slow on the day of the murder!? If you can't prove that, you don't have a case!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! (He's right! How am I going to prove that!? Dammit! I was so close!)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright? It seems you lack the critical evidence to support your claim.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: This means I cannot let you indict the witness. Unfortunately... This ends the cross-examination of Mr. Frank Sahwit.

Name: Sahwit
Text: I come all the way down here to testify, and look what happens! You treat me like a criminal! A criminal! You lawyers are all slime!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Grr! I almost had him! Sorry, Larry... I failed you. There's nothing I can do about it now...)

Name: Mia
Text: Not so fast, Mr. Sahwit!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mia! I mean, Chief!

Name: Mia
Text: Listen up, Wright! Don't throw this one away, not like this! Think!

Name: Phoenix
Text: But, Chief, it's over. I can't prove the clock was slow the day of the murder! Nobody can prove that!

Name: Mia
Text: Um... well, yes. But that doesn't mean you can't still win! Try thinking out of the box! Don't waste time doubting the facts. Assume the clock was three hours slow and... Think through it! Ask yourself, "Why was the clock three hours slow"? Figure out the reason, and you'll have your proof! Right, Wright? Can you think of a reason as to why the clock would be three hours slow?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Wait! Maybe I can prove it!

Name: Mia
Text: You must have evidence somewhere that can prove it, Wright! Find it and let them have it!

Name: Judge
Text: Well, Mr. Wright? You say the clock was already running slow on the day of the murder... Have you found evidence to support this claim?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course. There is a piece of evidence in the Court Record that can prove my claim beyond a doubt!

Name: Sahwit
Text: Hah! Tough words! Let's see you pull this one off!

Name: Judge
Text: Let's see this evidence that proves why the clock was running slow!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The victim had just returned home from abroad the day before the murder. As we all know, the time difference between here and Paris is nine hours! When it's 4:00 PM here, it's 1:00 AM the next day there. The clock wasn't three hours slow, it was nine hours fast! The victim hadn't reset her clock since returning home! That's why the time you heard when you struck her dead in her apartment was wrong! Proof enough for you, Mr. Sahwit? Or should I say... Mr. Did It!

Name: Judge
Text: O-order! Order, I say!

Name: Judge
Text: Well... This case has certainly turned out differently than we all expected. Mr. Payne... your witness?

Name: Payne
Text: He... er... he was arrested and has been taken away, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: I have to say, I'm impressed. I don't think I've ever seen someone complete a defense so quickly... and find the true culprit at the same time!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thank you, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: At this point, this is only a formality, but... This court finds the defendant, Mr. Larry Butz... Not Guilty

Name: Judge
Text: And with that... The court is adjourned.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Whew... I still can't believe we won!)

Name: Mia
Text: Wright! Good job in there! Congratulations!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Th-thanks, Chief. I owe it all to you.

Name: Mia
Text: Not at all, not at all! You fought your own battles in there. It's been a while since I've seen a trial end on such a satisfying note!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I've never seen the chief looking this happy... If she's this glad, imagine how Larry must feel!)

Name: Butz
Text: My life is over...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Larry! You're supposed to be happy! What's wrong now!?

Name: Butz
Text: Aww, Nick... Don't worry 'bout me! I'll be dead and gone soon!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Good! Wait, no! I mean... Bad! Bad bad bad! Larry, you're innocent! The case is closed.

Name: Butz
Text: ... But... but my Cindy-windy's gone, man! Gone forever!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Larry, she was a... Nah... Never mind.)

Name: Mia
Text: Congratulations, Harry!

Name: Butz
Text: H-Harry...?

Name: Mia
Text: Yes, you! I can practically see the headlines now: "Harry Butz, Innocent!"

Name: Butz
Text: Heh... um... thanks! I really owe you one. I won't forget this, ever! Let's celebrate! Dinner? Movie? My treat!

Name: Mia
Text: Oh, no, I couldn't.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hey, I was the one who got you off the hook!)

Name: Butz
Text: Oh, hey! H-here, take this! It's a present!

Name: Mia
Text: A present? For me? Wait... Wasn't this the evidence that...

Name: Butz
Text: Actually, I made this clock for her! I made one for her and one for me.

Name: Mia
Text: R-really? You? You made this? ... Well, thank you. I'll keep it as a memento.

Name: Butz
Text: Yo, Nick... Can you believe it? I was so into that chick... And... and she was just playing me for a fool! Don't that make you wanna just cry? *sob*

Name: Phoenix
Text: Larry...

Name: Mia
Text: ... Are you so sure?

Name: Butz
Text: Ex-squeeze me?

Name: Mia
Text: I think she thought quite a lot of you, in her own way.

Name: Butz
Text: Nah, you don't gotta sympathize with me, 'sokay.

Name: Mia
Text: Oh, I'm not just sympathizing, really. Isn't that right, Wright? Don't you have something to show your friend? Something that proves how she felt about him?

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-huh? Oh, yeah, right! (What the heck is she talking about?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Check this out, Larry. Proof Positive you weren't just some chump to her.

Name: Butz
Text: Huh...? What about that clock?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is the clock YOU made for her, Larry! And she took it with her when she traveled.

Name: Butz
Text: Whatever. She probably just needed a clock, that's all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You think so? It's a pretty heavy clock to take traveling.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, make of it what you will.

Name: Butz
Text: ... Hey, Nick. I'm glad I asked you to be my lawyer. Really, I am. Thanks.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hope that made him feel a little better...)

Name: Mia
Text: Well, I think our work here is done! Shall we be off?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, I guess so!

Name: Mia
Text: Say, how about dinner. On me? We'll drink a toast to innocent Butz!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah!

Name: Mia
Text: Oh, speaking of Harry... You were saying part of why you became a lawyer was because of him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Er, yeah. Part, at least.

Name: Mia
Text: You'll have to tell me more about it sometime! Maybe... over drinks?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh oh, I'm late. Huh, that's strange. The chief must have gone home already. She said her sister was coming over so we should all go out for dinner... ... What's that smell...? Blood...? Mia! (Maybe she's in her office!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: That smell... Blood!

Name: Maya
Text: ... *sob* Sis...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Someone's there!) ...! Chief? Chief...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chief!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Who are you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The strange girl dropped out cold. I left her lying on the office sofa. I went back to the chief where she lay under the window. Her body was still warm... I could feel it when I held her shoulder. Then, all too quickly, it began to fade... Until finally she was cold.) Chief...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right! I'd better call the police! ...? That's funny... A few of the screws on the receiver are missing... It looks like someone was halfway through taking it apart.
Police!? Please, come quick!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wh-what was that!? Someone screaming from outside the window!?) ...! She's staring right at me! She's holding a phone in her hand...

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! (That girl just now... where'd she go!? I put her right there on that sofa...! Uh oh... I hope she didn't run on me.) Yipes! (Don't scare me like that...) Umm... Excuse me but, who are you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's okay. I work here.

Name: Maya
Text: Maya... Maya Fey.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maya... Fey?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Before Mia died, she wrote a message with her own blood. She wrote it on the back of this receipt.

Name: Maya
Text: ! Th-th-that's MY name! W-why!? Why would she write my name?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Please, just calm down.

Name: Maya
Text: W-why would Sis write my name?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh-oh. Now I've done it...)
*whee-ooo* *whee-ooo*... *whee-ooo* *whee-ooo*...

Name: Phoenix
Text: ! The police! (Sounds like they're coming this way!)
Freeze! Police!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Alright, I'm Detective Dick Gumshoe, see?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Gumshoe...? What an odd name.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: We received a report from the building across the way, see. Got a person saying they saw a murder.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It must have been that woman I saw.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Anyway, I don't want either of you moving one inch, 'kay?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Great. Just great. Maya... Wait, she wouldn't have... nah.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Whoaaaaaaaaaaaah! Scuze me!

Name: Maya
Text: Eek!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: This word "Maya" here mean anything to you?

Name: Maya
Text: ...! Um... that... That's my name...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: WHAAAAT!? The victim drew this here note in her own blood, see? With her dying breath, she wrote down the killer's name!

Name: Maya
Text: K-killer...? I'm not--

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Case closed! You're coming down to the precinct, ma'am.

Name: Maya
Text: W-what?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wow, they have poor Maya locked up like a criminal.)

Name: Maya
Text: Oh! It's you! The lawyer... G-good morning.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Good morning! (She looks so tired...)

Name: Maya
Text: Um... Are you going to be my attorney?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'd better give it to her straight...) It's up to you.

Name: Maya
Text: Up... to me?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. I don't think this is something I should decide. After all, you're the one in trouble here.

Name: Maya
Text: ... They're never going to believe me... are they? Even you, when you found me in the office. You looked at me like I had done it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Did I look at her like that?) No, no! I never thought...

Name: Maya
Text: I-it's okay. I understand. ... And... I've also heard about you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Heard...? Heard what about me?

Name: Maya
Text: I... was talking to my sister on the phone the other day...

Name: Maya
Text: That's what she said!

Name: Maya
Text: I-I'm sorry! I didn't mean to trouble you...

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, it's okay. It's true, I guess. But... at the same time, I can't just sit and watch! When I think of the person who did this to Mia...

Name: Maya
Text: ... I know...

Name: Phoenix
Text: There's something I've been wanting to ask you...

Name: Maya
Text: Yes?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's with that outfit?

Name: Maya
Text: Oh, this? This is what all acolytes wear. It's my uniform, you could say.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A-acolytes? Like people in religious training? What is it you do?

Name: Maya
Text: Oh! It's nothing strange, really! I'm a spirit medium. ...In training.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A s-spirit medium!? (I'm pretty sure that qualifies as strange.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could you tell me about the day of the murder?

Name: Maya
Text: Yes! Let's see... that morning, I got a call from my sister. She wanted me to hold onto a piece of evidence for an upcoming trial.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Evidence?

Name: Maya
Text: Yes. That clock shaped like "The Thinker."

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The one Larry made...) How could that have been evidence in a case?

Name: Maya
Text: Um, right, she said something about that... ... I remember! Do you want to hear it in her own voice?

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-her own voice!?

Name: Maya
Text: Yes. I'm pretty sure our conversation is on my cell phone.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You recorded it!

Name: Maya
Text: Yeah! I forgot how to delete those things.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you say you have a conversation with your sister on your cell phone? Let's hear it!

Name: Maya
Text: Right! Oh! I just remembered: that detective took my cell phone. Sorry.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, right. (Of course...) Next time I see Detective Gumshoe I'll ask him for it.

Name: Maya
Text: I'll write you a note so you don't forget, okay?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sure, thanks.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Something the matter?

Name: Maya
Text: Um... I was wondering, could I ask you a favor?

Name: Maya
Text: This is the address of a famous lawyer. My sister gave me this a long time ago. She said if I was ever in trouble, I should call him. And, well, I'm in trouble. Do you think you could go ask him to represent me?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sure, why not? I'll go ask.

Name: Maya
Text: Thank you so much! I have no one else to turn to...

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...? Say, what about your parents...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... I see. Don't worry, leave it to me.

Name: Maya
Text: Thank you! The trial's tomorrow... at 10:00.

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-what!? Tomorrow!?

Name: Maya
Text: Tomorrow.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What if this guy refuses!?

Name: Maya
Text: They told me that if I don't find one, the state will pick an attorney to defend me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The office is filled with police officers. They're all busily searching for clues...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey! You there! This is a crime scene, pal! No trespassing! Umm... Sorry, don't I know you from somewhere? Wait, you're that Butz guy, aren't you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, no, Phoenix Wright. (How could anyone mistake me for Larry!?)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Ah, guess I got the wrong name, Mr. Wright. Sorry 'bout that. That Butz guy, he was a killer! And you're no killer! Right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He WAS proven innocent...) Umm... right. And you were...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... Gumshoe, wasn't it? Dick Gumshoe?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Right! At your service. Hang on! That's Detective Gumshoe to you, pal!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Anyway, get the name right. And don't go calling me "Dick"...

Name: Police
Text: Hey, Dick! Get over here!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-yes, sir! B-be right there! Umm... ahem! You're her lawyer, right, pal? If you got business here, you'd better do it quick!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Whew! He thinks I'm Maya's lawyer...!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: About Ms. Fey... did you do an autopsy?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hmm? You want to know the results, eh?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Now don't you look at me like that, pal! It's no use! She might have been your boss, but that doesn't mean you get any special treatment. Alright, alright. You can see the report, but that's all!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, about Maya...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yeah! I'm looking forward to the trial! Sorry, pal, but this is one trial you aren't going to win!

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-why do you say that?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The city's put Prosecutor Edgeworth on the prosecution!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Edgeworth...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I'm sure you know what that means, you being a lawyer and all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I was wondering... did you see Maya Fey's cell phone?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh that? I have that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Do you think you could give it back?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Sure! I mean, wait a second, pal! Tricky lawyer!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh-oh, he's on to me!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Okay, I can't be straight with this guy... but what should I tell him?)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Something the matter?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, no, um... T-that carrying strap on the cell phone...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: This? Hmm... it says "The Steel Samurai: Warrior of Neo Olde Tokyo"... "The Steel Samurai"... that action hero on TV?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, you see that strap is a collector's item... She... was worried it might get lost if it went down to the precinct.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That what she said?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um. Yes.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... Okay, pal. I wrote down all the numbers she called anyway. Here you go.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Seems he didn't notice the recorded conversation...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess I've asked all the questions I need to.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You all done, pal?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, yes, thank you. I'll be heading out now.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, wait. One more thing I wanted to mention to you. I don't suppose you're planning on talking to that witness. Anyway, you'd better not! No influencing the witness with your lawyerly ways, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (Come to think of it, I had completely forgotten about her...) The... witness?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yeah, Miss April May. I'm sorry 'bout this... But I can't tell you anything about her!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, you just told me her name. Miss May, huh?) So you've sent her home already, then?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Ahah! You're trying your lawyerly tricks on me now! She's not to go outside her room until the trial!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So... she's still in the hotel across the way.) I guess I should know better than to try to get a detective to leak information.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You got that right, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Time to pay a visit to Miss May!)

Name: April
Text: Well! Hello there, handsome.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Umm... hi. (Smooth, Wright, real smooth.)

Name: April
Text: You're the lawyer, aren't you? The detective told me... He said, "Don't say nothing to that lawyer, pal!" Tee hee!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Memo to self: thank Detective Gumshoe for making my job harder.)

Name: April
Text: Gee! This is all like something out of a movie! It's all so exciting I can hardly contain myself! Ooh! Let me go freshen up so I can look the part of the beautiful eyewitness!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I pity the lawyer that has to cross-examine this one.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (There's a screwdriver stuck in this drawer. I wonder what's inside? Let's take a look...)

Name: April
Text: Hey! H-h-hey!!! What are you doing!? No touching! Oooh. Bad boy! Y-you really shouldn't pry around in other people's rooms, now. You wouldn't want to make me upset, would you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Upset!? I thought she was going to explode for a second there! I wonder what could be inside the drawer?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... seems like Mr. Grossberg is out. Well, maybe I should just wait here for him to come back.)

Name: Grossberg
Text: *Ah-HHHHEM!*

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If that wasn't the most over-the-top clearing of the throat I've ever heard!)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Ah hah! So, you're the one they say has been looking for me?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... y-yes, that's me! (He looks even... grander than I imagined!)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Hmm...? That badge on your collar...? Ah, so you're a lawyer, are you now?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes, well... yes.

Name: Grossberg
Text: And what do you want? I'm not particularly busy these days... Please, proceed!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Not busy...? Then how come no one could get in touch with you?)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Hmm? Something the matter? You came to see the one-and-only Marvin Grossberg, did you not? Well, here I am, boy! What do you want? Out with it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... w-well, sir, actually it's about Maya. Maya Fey.

Name: Grossberg
Text: ...! Ah... yes. Maya Fey. Go on.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm? Why the strange reaction?)

Name: Grossberg
Text: A-cha-cha. I'm really quite busy here, son. I can't go taking cases on a day's notice! No, it's quite impossible.

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-wait a second! How did you know the trial was tomorrow!?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Urk? Ahem! A-anyway... I'm afraid it's entirely impossible for me to represent her. Sorry. End of discussion.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's going on!? He refused me before I even got a chance to ask him! What do I tell Maya...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: How can you just refuse like that! Please, tell me why you won't take the case!

Name: Grossberg
Text: Hmm? Eh, ahem! Well, you see it's just... I'm busy, you see!

Name: Phoenix
Text: But the client is Mia Fey's sister!

Name: Grossberg
Text: Hmm... ahem.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mia trusted you... She knew her sister would be in good hands.

Name: Grossberg
Text: Yes, yes, of course I know that. However! I'm sorry but, I must refuse. Sorry. Good-bye.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Creep. Fine. I don't have time to argue with you anyway. I'll go look elsewhere.

Name: Grossberg
Text: *grumble*... Think not.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Did you say something?

Name: Grossberg
Text: I think not, I said.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what do you mean?

Name: Grossberg
Text: I'm terribly, terribly sorry. But I'm afraid that no lawyer worth their salt will take on this particular case. Terribly sorry, m'boy.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why!?

Name: Grossberg
Text: I... I cannot say. ... I beg your pardon, but could you leave? Now? I've nothing more to discuss with you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's going on here!?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: How did you know Mia Fey...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: ... She... worked here. A long time ago. Quite the apprentice, that one. Learned my techniques in the blink of an eye! She left one day, quite suddenly... She had a mission, you see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A "mission"?

Name: Grossberg
Text: You could see it in her eyes. She followed it with a burning passion. Never looked back, that one.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's... quite a painting.

Name: Grossberg
Text: Ahah! You noticed! It's my pride and joy! Impressive, isn't it? Well? ISN'T IT? The color of the sky! The hue of the sea! The weave of the straw hat! It's worth at least three million. I have no intention of parting with it, of course. No, I won't sell it! Not even to you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I wasn't interested...)

Name: Grossberg
Text: It's not for sale!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm not buying! (Geez!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hiya.

Name: Maya
Text: Oh! You're back! Did you find the lawyer?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... well... (What do I tell her?) Well, see... (Just be honest!) I... I really don't think you should use that guy. He... didn't seem healthy. He was all skin and bones!

Name: Maya
Text: ... What really happened?

Name: Maya
Text: You don't mean... He refused to help?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Urp.

Name: Maya
Text: ... I see. I've been abandoned, then.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, who was this man who, um, "ruined" your mother?

Name: Maya
Text: About 15 years ago... there was an unusual murder case. It made quite a stir, everyone was talking about it, apparently. The police were running out of leads, and they were getting desperate...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait... they didn't use a spirit medium, did they?

Name: Maya
Text: The police convinced my mother to try to contact the victim.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wow... So, what happened?

Name: Maya
Text: The case was solved... we thought.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You "thought"...?

Name: Maya
Text: The man my mother helped the police capture was innocent.

Name: Maya
Text: The police's consultation with a medium had all been carried out in secret, of course. But... A man found out about it and leaked it to the press. He told all the papers that my mother was a fraud, and the media jumped on it big time. She... my mother... became the laughing stock of the nation.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see.

Name: Maya
Text: ... White...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Excuse me? White?

Name: Maya
Text: That was his name. My sister told me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: White? Hmm...

Name: Maya
Text: Just a little longer now before the state-appointed lawyer comes, I guess...

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (4:00 PM. Time's up. What should I do? Do I just leave her and go home...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: I've made up my mind! I'm going to defend you whether you want me to or not!

Name: Maya
Text: ! Why?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why? Well...

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (No one is as sad as a person without any friends. I know... I've been there. A long time ago. Why did I become a lawyer in the first place...? Because someone has to look out for the people who have no one on their side.) Maya...

Name: Phoenix
Text: I won't abandon you. You can count on me.

Name: Maya
Text: ... That's so kind of you... *sniff*... ...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well! Let's fight this one and get you out of here!

Name: Maya
Text: R-right! Thank you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Whew, she smiled at last. She looks like an entirely different person!) One last question... You are innocent, right?

Name: Maya
Text: Yes! And I trust you... So you trust me, too, okay?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's a deal. (So, what next... There's something that's been bugging me... Just what was inside that strange woman's drawer? It was when I tried to look into the drawer that she got all defensive. There has to be something in there!)

Name: Bellboy
Text: Good afternoon, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Excuse me, you are...?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Ah, I beg your pardon, sir! I am the bellboy of this establishment, at your service, sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, right.

Name: Bellboy
Text: I've just come up to deliver room service, sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... do you know where Miss May might be?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Ah. I believe our guest Miss May is currently using the, er, facilities...? If you've no need of anything, I'll be taking my leave. Please, stay as long as you like. Enjoy...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah... Wait... no! Hey! ... (Why does it seem like every time I come here, I end up embarrassing myself? Wait... now's my chance to snoop around a bit!)

Name: Bellboy
Text: Ah, I almost forgot!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Gah! Y-you came back quick!

Name: Bellboy
Text: Might I ask you to inform Miss May that there is a message for her? Please tell her that Mr. White, of Bluecorp phoned.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, right. Sure. (Mr. White... of Bluecorp? Where have I heard that name?)

Name: Maya
Text: White... That was his name. My sister told me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ("White" was the name of the guy who ruined Mia and Maya's mother! Could it be a coincidence?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: There's a screwdriver sticking out of that half-open drawer. Now's my chance to see what's inside! ...! What do we have here! A... wiretap? Hmm! What would a woman like her be doing with a thing like this?

Name: Phoenix
Text: There is definitely something suspicious about this "Miss May"! Why would she have something like this in her hotel room? There's a story behind all this, I know it! Alright... I'll be using this bit of evidence in tomorrow's trial, that's for sure. For Maya's sake... I'll get to this woman's bottom! Wait... I mean ... you know what I mean.

Name: April
Text: Oh, bellboy...? Still there?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh, time to scram! I look forward to tangoing with you tomorrow, Miss May! In court!)

Name: Judge
Text: The court is now in session for the trial of Ms. Maya Fey.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense is ready, Your Honor. (Miles Edgeworth... I'd better not show any signs of weakness today, or he'll be on me in an instant.)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth. Please give the court your opening statement.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Thank you, Your Honor. The defendant, Ms. Maya Fey, was at the scene of the crime. The prosecution has evidence she committed this murder... and we have a witness who saw her do it. The prosecution sees no reason to doubt the facts of this case, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: I see. Thank you, Mr. Edgeworth. Let's begin then.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You may call your first witness. The prosecution calls the chief officer at the scene, Detective Gumshoe!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Witness, please state your name and profession to the court.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Sir! My name's Dick Gumshoe, sir! I'm the detective in charge of homicides down at the precinct, sir!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Detective Gumshoe. Please, describe for us the details of this murder.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Very well, sir! Let me use this floor map of the office to explain. The body was found by this window, here.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And the cause of death?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Loss of blood due to being struck by a blunt object, sir! The murder weapon was a statue of "The Thinker" found next to the body, sir! It was heavy enough to be a deadly weapon, even in a girl's hands, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: The court accepts the statue as evidence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (They're still calling it a "statue"...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Now, Detective...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-yes sir!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You immediately arrested Ms. Maya Fey, who was found at the scene, correct? Can you tell me why?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yes sir! I had hard evidence she did it, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. Detective Gumshoe, Please testify to the court about this "hard evidence."

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... The very moment, you say. Very well. Mr. Wright, you may begin your cross-examination.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes, Your Honor. (Cross-examine what...? I couldn't see a single contradiction in that testimony...)
...whoosh... SMACK!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hey! Maya just threw something at me... What's this? "When my sister couldn't find any contradictions in a witness's testimony she would bluff it and press the witness on every detail! The witness always slips up and says something wrong... It worked lots of times!" Heh... I should have expected Maya would know some of her sister's tricks! Alright. Let's give this a try!)

Name: Judge
Text: Something the matter?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, Your Honor. I'd like to begin my cross-examination.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: As soon as the phone call came in, I rushed to the scene!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Who did you say you got a call from?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey pal, don't play dumb! You know who! The call was from a customer at the Gatewater Hotel, right across from the crime scene!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... okay, I pressed. Not sure it did much, though.) Right. Please continue.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: There were two people there already:

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe, how long would you say it took, between you receiving the call, and your arrival at the scene of the crime?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hmm, right... I'd say it was about 3 minutes!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Th-that's pretty fast!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Our motto this month is "quick response"! That's how I got there before the killer got away!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Indeed! So, tell us who the two people you found on the scene were.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yes sir!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The defendant, Ms. Maya Fey, and the lawyer, Mr. Phoenix Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you absolutely sure it was us?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Listen pal, your dumb act will only get you so far! With her funky hippie clothes and your spiky hair? You two stand out like... like suspicious people at a crime scene!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well... he does have a point about her. She is pretty unmistakable. I should pick my points to press with a little more care...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I immediately arrested Ms. Maya Fey!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why's that? What's your reason?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Why? We had a witness account describing her!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hold on just one second!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-yeah?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If I heard correctly... You said you arrested her because you had "hard evidence" she did it, correct?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Huh? Did... did I say that? Me?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I heard you say it!

Name: Judge
Text: You did say it.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You said it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Exactly what about this suspicious woman in pink's claim was "hard evidence"!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Wh-what!? Miss May isn't suspicious, and she sure isn't pink, pal! W-well, I guess she is pink...

Name: Judge
Text: That's enough, Detective Gumshoe. Do you have any more solid proof other than her claims, Detective?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Umm...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm! I guess pressing can have its advantages!)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... Yes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Gah!)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Sorry, I got the order of things mixed up in my testimony, Your Honor Sir! There was something I should have told you about first, Your Honor!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, Detective. Let's hear your testimony again.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Before we begin cross-examination, I have a question for you, Detective.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: Why didn't you testify about this vital piece of evidence the first time!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Ah... eh... I know. I'm real embarrassed I forgot about it, Your Honor Sir.

Name: Judge
Text: Try to be more careful! Very well, the defense may begin its cross-examination.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: After securing the suspect, I examined the scene of the crime with my own eyes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And did you find any evidence?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Now, now, don't jump the gun on me, pal. Just listen. I'm getting to the good part!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I got a bad feeling about this...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I found a memo written on a piece of paper next to the victim's body!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Just because you found it next to the body doesn't mean the victim wrote it!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Ho hoh! Then who did write it, smarty-pants?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-who? Um...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Th-the killer! Anyone can see that!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hoh. You're saying the killer wrote her OWN name!? Buddy, please!

Name: Phoenix
Text: She was framed!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hold on. If that's the case, where's your evidence?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ah... (Urk!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hah! I guess that was a bit of a tall order for you. Those without evidence shouldn't open their mouths, Mr. Wright.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yeah, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Argh...!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well, Detective? Tell us what was written on that memo you found.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: On it, the word "Maya" was written clearly in blood!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Do you have proof it was Mia who wrote that!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Of course I do, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh... he sounded pretty confident. This might not be good...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Lab test results showed that the blood was the victim's!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: What kind of "tests" were these again?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Huh? What kind? Umm... well... I hear they take the, um, little bits in the blood, the... er... hemo... hemogl... Hermo... goblins... hobgob... Er...? Herma-goblin bobbin... I-I refuse to testify on this matter, sir! I'm no expert on blood tests!

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, that was quite clear. You may continue with your testimony.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Th-thanks, pal. I mean Your Honor Sir.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Detective Gumshoe.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-yeah?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I think you can expect a pleasant bonus in your next pay check.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh? Oh hoh hoh.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That was a mess...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Right! Where was I?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Also, there was blood found on the victim's finger!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: On which hand was the bloody finger, Detective?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The right hand!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... she WAS right handed...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hah hah hah! Nice try!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh... I guess it wasn't too hard to see what I was getting at there.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Before she died, the victim wrote the killer's name!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe! Do you get a lot of cases where the victim actually writes the killer's name?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Sure! It happens all the time in books and the movies!

Name: Phoenix
Text: This isn't a movie, Detective.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oof!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let's talk about reality, shall we?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Umm... I guess, I haven't heard of many cases... no.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Don't you find it a little odd that the victim would write down a name? Especially the name of her own sister?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Ah, yeah, actually, you got a point, pal.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Stop right there. The witness's opinion on the matter is irrelevant! The facts are clear: the victim wrote down the name of the accused... The victim told us the name of her killer!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That didn't go so well...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Th-that's right! What he said!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe! There's one thing I want you to clarify for me here. You say that the victim, Mia Fey, wrote this note. That she was accusing the defendant, Maya Fey? That's really what you're saying?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Wh-what? This isn't one of those lawyer tricks, now, is it? Of course she wrote it! Who else could have!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You have it backwards, Detective.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: B-backwards?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The victim is the only person who absolutely could NOT have written it! This is a report from your department, Detective. "Immediate death due to a blow from a blunt object." She died immediately!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: But...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: No "but"-ing your way out of this one, Detective!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! The defense has a point.

Name: Judge
Text: Someone who died immediately wouldn't have the time to write anything down.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mr. Wright. I beg your pardon, but when exactly did you obtain that autopsy report?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-when...!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It was the day after the murder...

Name: Judge
Text: The prosecution's point being...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That autopsy report is outdated, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: A second autopsy was performed yesterday, at my request! "Death was almost immediate due to a blow from a blunt object... But there is a possibility the victim lived for several minutes after the blow." I received these results this morning.

Name: Phoenix
Text: N-no way!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor! It's quite easy to imagine that the victim did have time to write "Maya"! That is all.

Name: Judge
Text: I see!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Damn you, Edgeworth! I should have known you'd have something up your sleeve!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Why, Mr. Wright, you look shocked! Something you want to say?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Edgeworth... I've heard there's nothing you won't do to get your verdict... What reason could you possibly have had to request a second autopsy report?

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! The defense will refrain from personal attacks on the prosecution!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No matter, Your Honor... Mr. Wright. Say what you will, the evidence in this report is undeniable.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor, I submit this report to the court.

Name: Judge
Text: U-understood. The court accepts the evidence.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well, Your Honor? The evidence strongly suggests the victim was identifying the killer.

Name: Judge
Text: I suppose that's the obvious conclusion, yes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Darn! This isn't good!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution would like to call its next witness. This poor, innocent girl saw the murder with her own eyes!

Name: Judge
Text: Let the witness Miss April May take the stand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Exactly what part of her is "innocent"...?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Witness, your name, please.

Name: April
Text: April May! At your service! *wink*

Name: Judge
Text: Order! An introduction should not require any reaction from the crowd! The witness will refrain from wonton * winking!

Name: April
Text: Aww... Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is not good... She's already captured the heart of every man in the court!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Tell us, where were you on the night of September 5, when the murder occurred?

Name: April
Text: Um... gee... I was, like, in my hotel room? Tee hee. I checked in right after lunch.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And this hotel is directly across from the Fey & Co. Law Offices?

Name: April
Text: Mmm... that's right, big boy.

Name: Judge
Text: Please testify to the court about what you saw.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: I see. It is a remarkably solid testimony. I don't see a need to trouble the witness any...

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-wait, Your Honor!

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What about my cross-examination!?

Name: Judge
Text: I thought the witness's testimony just now was quite... firm. Didn't you?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mr. Wright... I understand you were Ms. Mia Fey's understudy, were you not? You must know her techniques well. Her cowardly way of finding tiny faults in perfectly good testimonies...

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-hey! How dare you!

Name: Judge
Text: Well, Mr. Wright? Will you cross-examine the witness?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'll gladly proceed with the cross-examination. (If only because I have a feeling Edgeworth doesn't want me to! She has to have some weakness!)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, you may begin your cross-examination!

Name: April
Text: It was, like, 9:00 at night. I looked out the window, y'know!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did you do that?

Name: April
Text: Huh? "Why"? Like, why what?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did you look out the window? Were you expecting to see something?

Name: April
Text: Oh, well, um... gee!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What? That's it? She can't get out of this question that easily!)

Name: April
Text: I sort of, y'know. I had a feeling!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, I have a feeling she's trying to avoid the question! Maybe I should press a little harder on this one?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If I go too deep, I might not come back out alive... I'll back off for now.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You looked out the window. What did you see next?

Name: April
Text: And then, oooh! I saw a woman with long hair being attacked!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The woman with long hair... that was Mia Fey?

Name: April
Text: Um-hmm! Slender, sort of, well, some people might say pretty, if that's your thing.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Your... thing?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And the person attacking her?

Name: April
Text: The one attacking her was the mousey girl sitting in the defendant's chair!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: How do you know she was the defendant?

Name: April
Text: Huh? Well... y'know! S-she had a girlish physique. Women know these things. Look... I-I just know, okay?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There was only one person at the scene of the crime with a short, girlish figure. The testimony is bulletproof, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He's right...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Her testimony certainly does make sense... And everyone in the court keeps siding with her. I'd better not press too hard on this one.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So then, tell us what happened to the victim.

Name: April
Text: Then the woman, like, dodged to one side and ran away!

Name: Phoenix
Text: She "dodged"? Dodged what!?

Name: April
Text: Well... the attack!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Please, continue your testimony.

Name: April
Text: But that girl, she caught up to her and... and... She hit her!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: How did you know it was my client!?

Name: April
Text: Huh? Well, I... gee! First of all, she had a girl's physique! And, and secondly, she was... she was small! Who else could it be but her!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (She has a point...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hold on a minute! That testimony stinks!

Name: April
Text: W-what!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Miss May, I'm willing to bet that you saw nothing

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you really see the defendant at all!?

Name: April
Text: Urp!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! What's the meaning of this?

Name: April
Text: Yes, what is the meaning! Somebody tell me because I'm clueless! About this, I mean!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Okay... If you had really witnessed my client, Maya Fey... You would have noticed her clothes before noticing her physique!

Name: Phoenix
Text: No one wears clothes like this on a daily basis! Except her! And I'm no expert on fashion, but her hairdo looks far from normal to me! However, the witness's testimony mentions neither of these things! The testimony is bogus!

Name: April
Text: But... but!

Name: Judge
Text: Still, we don't know if she was dressed that way the night of the murder...

Name: Phoenix
Text: She was, Your Honor! I saw her. And so did Detective Gumshoe! What do you say to that, Miss May?

Name: April
Text: Rowr! What are you trying to say, you mean lawyer! I-I saw what I saw. I... just didn't think all the trifling little details were necessary, darling.

Name: Judge
Text: Miss May. The court would like to remind you to please omit nothing in your testimony.

Name: April
Text: I'm sorry, Your Honor. I'll be a good girl. I promise. *wink*

Name: Judge
Text: Your testimony again, if you would.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Damn, I almost had her!)

Name: Judge
Text: I... see. I only wish you had been so detailed from the beginning. Please begin the cross-examination.

Name: April
Text: I did see everything! I did!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you saw me then, too?

Name: April
Text: Of course! I'd remember that spiky hair anywhere!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Spiky...?)

Name: Judge
Text: The witness will refrain from personal attacks on the defense attorney.

Name: April
Text: Aww, was I a bad girl? I'm sowwy.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well... continue.

Name: April
Text: The victim--the woman--dodged the first attack and ran off to the right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Is that "right" as in your right, as you looked from the hotel?

Name: April
Text: Um... which hand do I hold my knife in again...? Right! It was my right hand! Right?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Satisfied, Mr. Wright? Please continue.

Name: April
Text: Then the girl in the hippie clothes ran after her...

Name: Phoenix
Text: How convenient for you to remember her "hippie" clothes!

Name: April
Text: That's what you--I mean, that's what she was wearing! Oh, and her hair was all done up like a bun!

Name: Judge
Text: What happened then?

Name: April
Text: And she hit her with that weapon! I saw it! I did!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Where did this weapon come from?

Name: April
Text: She picked it up from the desk!

Name: Judge
Text: I see. What sort of weapon was it?

Name: April
Text: That... that clock! Um... the kinda statue-y clock? "The Thinker," I think?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: A... clock? (Didn't this come up in another testimony recently...?)

Name: April
Text: W-well? Don't look so sour, Mr. Lawyer. You can't win them all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No... but I have a feeling I'm on to something now!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Miss May. What you said just now was quite... revealing.

Name: April
Text: Revealing? Oooh, you'd like that, wouldn't you. Naughty Mr. Lawyer...

Name: Phoenix
Text: You just said that this statue of "The Thinker" was a clock. But there's no way of knowing that just by looking at it!

Name: April
Text: Urp!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Another person in much the same position as you recently called this a "clock," too... And he was found guilty... of murder!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Miss May. Can you explain how you know this was a clock?

Name: April
Text: Oooh... urp!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The witness saw the murder with her own eyes! That's all that's important here! The defense is trying to confuse the issue with trivial concerns!

Name: Judge
Text: Yes... yes, of course. You will withdraw your question, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: But questions are all I have, Your Honor! And as you may recall, I've caught murderers with these questions before! (Well, only once...)

Name: Judge
Text: ... ... Objection sustained. You may continue to question the witness.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Whew, that was close. If he stopped me there, the trial would be over!)

Name: April
Text: Huh? What? So... what happens now?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What happens now is you answer my question! How did you know it was a clock?

Name: April
Text: What...! Th-that's... ...Because... I heard it? Yes! I heard it say the time!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you've been to the law offices of Fey & Co.!

Name: April
Text: N-n-no! Hey, I didn't say that! Why would I go there! I heard from my hotel room. Hee hee!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The law offices of Fey & Co., where the murder took place, are very close to the hotel. She could easily have heard the clock!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. Well, Mr. Wright? Are you satisfied?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, Your Honor! (I can't give up now!) I'm not satisfied because it couldn't have rung

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, members of the court... It is inconceivable that the clock in question rang!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That clock is missing its clockwork!

Name: Judge
Text: H-how could you possibly...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Just have a look... As soon as you can!

Name: Phoenix
Text: See anything interesting, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: It is as the defense says!

Name: Judge
Text: This clock is missing its clockwork! It's quite empty! Mr. Wright! Would you care to explain to the court the meaning of this?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It is as you can see. The "clock" was empty. It couldn't have rung! Therefore, this witness... is a big, fat liar!

Name: April
Text: F-fat!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, Miss May?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Tsk tsk.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Quite a show you've put on for us, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He knew the clock was empty! Somehow... he knew!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm afraid you've forgotten one thing, however. Indeed, the clock is empty. As you say... it can't ring. However, we must ask: when was the clockwork removed? If it was after the witness heard the clock, then there is no contradiction!

Name: Judge
Text: ! Hmm! That's true. That is a possibility. The clock might have been emptied after she heard it.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And that is exactly what happened, Your Honor!

Name: Judge
Text: Well, Mr. Wright? Can you prove when the clockwork was removed?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ho hoh! Impossible, of course...

Name: Phoenix
Text: I have proof.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: W-what!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wasn't it you who told me "proof is everything"? Well, I was listening. And now I'll show you the "proof" you like so much! The evidence that proves when the clockwork was removed is...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Take a look at this!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. That's a very cute cell phone.

Name: April
Text: Ooh hoo! You have a girlie phone!

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-wait! Wait! This isn't my phone! Listen! This is the defendant's cell phone, and it contains a recording... A recording of a conversation she had with the victim on the day of the murder!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The defendant's cell phone!? Th-this wasn't brought to my attention!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Perhaps Detective Gumshoe overlooked it?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: *grumble* (The good detective better remember he's up for evaluation soon...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (My heart goes out to you, Edgeworth. Not.) Let's hear the conversation.

Name: Cellular
Text: *beep*...

Name: Maya
Text: [So you just want me to hold on to "The Thinker" for you, then?]

Name: Mia
Text: [If you could. Ah... I should probably tell you, the clock isn't talking right now.]

Name: Maya
Text: [Huh? It's not working? That's lame!]

Name: Mia
Text: [I had to take the clockwork out, sorry.]

Name: Cellular
Text: *beep*

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, I think this recording makes it clear that the clockwork was already gone... and this was recorded in the morning, before the witness even arrived at her hotel!

Name: April
Text: Muh... muh... muh!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, Miss May? Would you care to explain this to the court? Just how did you know that weapon was a clock!?

Name: April
Text: ... W-well...! Well, isn't it o-obvious? I saw that clock before! Um... what store was that again? I-I go to so many! Oops! I forgot! *wink*

Name: Judge
Text: So the witness had seen it before. That would make sense. Does the defense have any objections, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes

Name: Phoenix
Text: The witness claims she had "seen it before." But this directly contradicts a piece of evidence already submitted to this court!

Name: Judge
Text: Well then, let's see it. Please produce this evidence that will prove the witness had not seen the clock before.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's simple. This clock was never in any store, ever!

Name: April
Text: W-whaaat!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: A friend of mine made that clock. Only two exist in the world. And the one that isn't here is in police custody!

Name: April
Text: I-impossible! Everything is sold in stores!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Miss May, I think it's high time you went shopping for a better excuse...?

Name: April
Text: Mmpf...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh? Excuses not on sale today?

Name: April
Text: Oooh? Oh ho ho. Mmmrrrrph! Ooooorrrrrrr ggggghhhhhhh... hhh!!! What's it to you, porcupine-head!? That stupid clock doesn't matter, okay!? She did it! And she should die for it! Die!

Name: Judge
Text: W-w-whoa! Let's not get ahead of ourselves. T-this is a court of law, and the witness will remain calm!

Name: April
Text: Hrrrgh... hrrrh... Hrrr... heh. Oh? Oh! Oh? Oh hoh ho! S-silly me! *grunt* Did I, um, like... lose it? I guess I did. Tee hee! *wink*

Name: Phoenix
Text: (S-scary...)

Name: Judge
Text: Miss May, let me ask. Tell me, how did you know the weapon was a clock?

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... oh dear. Does the defense have an opinion on this... behavior?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Okay, this is it!) Yes, Your Honor. Allow me to explain how I see the truth of the matter. Miss April May, you knew the weapon was a clock because...

Name: Phoenix
Text: The witness had never held the clock in her hand! However, she had heard that it was a clock!

Name: Judge
Text: She "heard"...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That is correct, Your Honor. There is no other way she could have known "The Thinker" was a clock! And I can show you the proof!

Name: Judge
Text: Well, this is interesting. Let's see it, then. Show me evidence proving that the witness had "heard" the murder weapon was a clock.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Have a look at this.

Name: April
Text: Ah! Oooh! Th-that!? Eh heh...

Name: Phoenix
Text: I found this in Miss May's room.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! Please explain to the court what this is!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Miss April May? You were tapping the victim, Ms. Mia Fey's phone, were you not?

Name: April
Text: Oooh. Oooooh!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor, This is irrelevant!

Name: Judge
Text: I'm not entirely sure that it is. Objection overruled. It troubles me that our witness was in possession of a wiretap.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This is outrageous! Does the defense truly claim that the witness was tapping her phone?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Absolutely!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Even if that was the case, (which it's not) you still have to prove one thing! Did the victim ever say that the weapon was a clock on the phone? Can you prove that? I THINK NOT!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh yeah? I THINK I CAN! It's simple!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: WHAAAAT!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Here's my proof. The proof that the victim said, on the phone, that the weapon was a clock is...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: I present the defendant's cell phone.
