Name: Judge
Text: Yes, we've seen that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Listen once more to the conversation between the defendant and the victim.

Name: Cellular
Text: *beep*...

Name: Maya
Text: [Mia! What's up? You haven't called in a while.]

Name: Mia
Text: [Well, actually there's something I want you to hold on to for me.]

Name: Maya
Text: [Again? What's it this time?]

Name: Mia
Text: [It's... a clock. It's made to look like that statue, "The Thinker." And it tells you the time!]

Name: Phoenix
Text: Miss April May! You used a wiretap to listen to this conversation! That's how you knew "The Thinker" was a clock! Am I wrong!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor, this is ridiculous!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, look at the witness's face? Does she seem amused to you!? The defense demands an answer.

Name: April
Text: La... laaa... lrrrrgf!

Name: Judge
Text: Witness, answer the question. Did you tap her phone?

Name: Judge
Text: Miss May!

Name: April
Text: Shut up, all of you! What gives you the right to talk to ME like that! You... you LAWYER!

Name: April
Text: I-it's no fair! All of you g-ganging up on me like that... Oh, so I'm the bad girl, is that it? Is that it!? Uh... uh... uwaaaaaaah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That did it! The court's seen the real Miss April May now! Now to deal the final blow!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did you tap her phone?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Answer the question!

Name: April
Text: Do I have to? Isn't this a murder trial? Isn't tippity-tapping er... irrelevant?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Gah! She's saying exactly what Edgeworth wants her to say.) Miss May. You were tapping the victim's phone! I hardly call that "irrelevant"!

Name: Judge
Text: While this court does not condone the defense's tone of speech, he has a point. Well, Miss May? Do you have an explanation for the court? Can you prove you had nothing to do with this murder, even though you tapped her phone?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hah! I'd like to see her pull THAT off!)

Name: April
Text: Mr. Lawyer, I saw that evil, evil grin! You were probably thinking "I'd like to see her pull THAT off," weren't you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Damn... she's good!)

Name: April
Text: Well you're not the first man who's thought that! And of course... I can, and will!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You can't be serious! No way!

Name: April
Text: Way, I say! Way! Oh, and I assure you I'm serious, Mr. Lawyer! Hmph! Okay? So, the killing happened around 9:00 at night? Why, that's just when I was getting room service from that sweet bellboy...

Name: Phoenix
Text: R-room service!?

Name: April
Text: Ice coffee, I believe it was? Ice coffee? You know? Like normal coffee, but COLD. If you don't drink it quick, the ice melts and then you have... regular cold coffee.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I-ice coffee...!?

Name: April
Text: Think I'm making this up? Ask the bellboy! *wink*

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ergo, the witness was not on the scene at the time of the murder!

Name: Judge
Text: So, where does that leave us...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It is my great displeasure to inform you... That the witness appears to have been tapping the victim's telephone. However! That is a separate crime, with no bearing on the current case whatsoever! Her testimony stands! She saw the defendant, Maya Fey, commit murder!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No! They're going to let her just walk away! There's no way I can win this unless I tie Miss May to the murder somehow...)

Name: Judge
Text: Well, does the defense have anything to say?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, well... (Come on, think of something!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense would like to call the hotel bellboy as a witness! There's something suspicious there, and I'm going to get to the bottom of it!

Name: April
Text: I think you've sunken quite low enough already.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I object to calling the bellboy!

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-why? What's your reason?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Because I hold that the wiretapping had nothing to do with the killing!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: However... If you agree to one condition, I'll consent to calling this witness.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Condition...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If Miss April May's alibi is not called into question after you examine the bellboy... Then you will recognize that Miss April May was not the killer, thus she is innocent! Therefore you must accept the verdict of "guilty" for Ms. Maya Fey! That is my condition.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What...!? I'd better find something suspicious in that bellboy's testimony... Otherwise Maya will be declared "guilty" on the spot! What should I do...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Alright! I've got nothing to lose! Except for... well, everything!) Understood. I accept your condition.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. Fool... You fell right into my trap!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh!) Uh... um, wait...

Name: Judge
Text: Very well! The court calls the hotel bellboy to the stand!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I believe we're ready for the witness to testify. He certainly does look like a bellboy.

Name: Bellboy
Text: Yes, sir. I received your summons in the middle of work, sir. I'm happy to be of service.

Name: Judge
Text: That tea set looks rather heavy, so without further ado, the witness may begin his testimony.

Name: Bellboy
Text: Very good, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: I see. The defense may begin its cross-examination.

Name: Phoenix
Text: R-right! I'm ready. (I hope... This is it... If I can't prove Miss May was involved with the murder now... Maya will be finished!)

Name: Bellboy
Text: I am the head bellboy at the fine Gatewater Hotel, in business for four generations!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What exactly is it you do at the hotel?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Why, anything required of me, sir. I check in guests, I check out guests. I clean rooms, I make beds. I even deliver room service, sir. I checked Miss May in personally.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you always so... so prim?

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. You will refrain from asking frivolous questions...

Name: Bellboy
Text: I believe I received a call after 8:00 in the evening from our guest, Miss May.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you sure it was Miss May on the phone?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Absolutely, sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-how can you be so certain!?

Name: Bellboy
Text: I checked Miss May in personally, sir. Not only did I see her in all her stunning radiance, but I also heard her voice. And then I saw THEM, and I... Ahem. Er... ahem! The point being, I remembered her quite well, sir.

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, what then?

Name: Bellboy
Text: She asked for an ice coffee to be brought to her at 9:00, on the dot, sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: 9:00 "on the dot," you say?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Yes. I confirmed that detail several times. She was watching a program on the TV, and wished to drink after she finished, sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (9:00... the time of the murder!)

Name: Bellboy
Text: I brought it to her at precisely the requested time, of course.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Precisely" 9:00, then?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Precisely, exactly, and most definitely, sir, 9:00 PM.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How can you be so sure!?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Miss May was quite insistent that it be brought then. "Oh, bellboy? Tee hee! I'd like, like, ice coffee at exactly 9:00!" Something like that, sir. Therefore, I knocked on her door at the crack of 9:00, sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Why would she be so particular about the time?)

Name: Bellboy
Text: And I delivered the ice coffee to our guest Miss May, herself.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You are sure it was Miss April May herself?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Ab-SO-lutely, sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Ab-SO-lutely"...?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Yes, sir. As in, "so very absolutely," sir. It's an endearing mannerism of mine.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How come you're so very certain!?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Well, when I brought the room service, sir... S-she... the guest, sir, favored me w-with a, um, an "embrasser," sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Embrasser"!? Is that French for "embrace"?

Name: Bellboy
Text: It's French for "kiss," sir. But not a french kiss, sir! More of a peck on the cheek.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-why would she have done that...?

Name: Bellboy
Text: I believe, perhaps, she was momentarily swayed by my prim demeanor, sir. It was a moment I shall never, ever forget, sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Sounds pretty fishy to me... I think our Miss May was up to something and wanted the bellboy to remember her!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... It's no good! (There's nothing there! Is... is that it!?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Tsk tsk. Finally, you understand. This bellboy has absolutely no reason to lie! Now... If you have any decency, you will end this rather tedious cross-examination here!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. It was a bit tedious. The witness may leave the stand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I can't let this happen... can I?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-wait! Please wait!

Name: Judge
Text: Yes? Does the defense have something to add?

Name: Phoenix
Text: One last question... let me ask one last question!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor, I must object. This charade of justice has gone on long enough!

Name: Judge
Text: Now, now, Mr. Edgeworth. Alright Mr. Wright. I'll give you one more question, that's all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Okay. This is really it, now. This is my last chance! What do I ask him about...!?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: T-tell me again about er... room service!

Name: Bellboy
Text: A-again, sir? At exactly 9:00, I delivered room service to Miss May in room 303. The guest had requested ice coffee... $18 was the charge, as I recall.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see... ...? E-eighteen dollars? Doesn't that seem a bit expensive?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Y-yes, well, ice coffee for two, you know. And we don't skimp on the ice, sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (...! What did he say!?) What did you say!?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Ah! Oh... er... rather, quite!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Bellboy! Tell us the truth now... Was someone else staying in Miss May's room?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I object! That was... objectionable!

Name: Judge
Text: ... Objection overruled. The witness will answer the question.

Name: Bellboy
Text: Er... yes, I see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did you not mention this in your testimony!?

Name: Bellboy
Text: W-well, sir, you er... you didn't ask!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Nice try!) That's the sort of thing you're normally supposed to mention!

Name: Bellboy
Text: Ah, yes, quite. Indeed... It was the, er, good barrister there, Mr. Edgeworth, who...

Name: Bellboy
Text: He asked me not to mention it if I wasn't specifically asked, sir.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Oof! Y-you fool!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I've done it... I've won!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Miss April May checked into a twin room... with a man. Correct?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Yes, sir.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Then, when you brought them room service, you didn't see that man in the room...?

Name: Bellboy
Text: That's right, sir.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! We have just learned of another person involved who may have been the murderer! In this new light, I hold that it's impossible to judge the defendant. You agree, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Who! Who is this "other person"!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Simple, it was...

Name: Phoenix
Text: The man who checked in with Miss May!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Oof!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! As has been previously revealed, Miss April May was tapping the victim's phone. Yet Miss May herself has an alibi at the time of the murder. However, that does not clear the man that was with her! The bellboy saw no one else in the room at the time of the murder!!!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: M-my, what a convenient little setup... but it's too late...

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Too late"? I suppose you'd like it if it was too late, wouldn't you... After all, it was you who hid the presence of the other man from this court!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Oof! Upstart... amateur...! T-these accusations are... ludicrous!

Name: Judge
Text: Enough! The court acknowledges the defense's argument. I expect the prosecution and defense to look into this matter fully! Am I understood?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes... *gasp* Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: That is all today for the trial of Maya Fey. Court is adjourned!

Name: Maya
Text: Mr. Wright! You were amazing in there!

Name: Phoenix
Text: R-really?

Name: Maya
Text: I think I might be your newest fan!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, I was just "doing my job" you know... heh heh.

Name: Maya
Text: Then again, that other attorney was pretty cool, too...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Maya
Text: That face of his! With his eyes wide, and trembling lips! It sent shivers up my spine!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hmm... if you say so.

Name: Maya
Text: So, what happens with me? Do I get to go home now?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, no. I don't think so. Not yet.

Name: Maya
Text: Oh... I see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But I got a great lead in today's trial!

Name: Maya
Text: A "lead"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That man with Miss May! He's the key!

Name: Maya
Text: Oh! I get it. What happened to Miss May after that, anyway?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I heard they arrested her. I guess she's learning her charms won't work everywhere. She's probably at the detention center now. I may have to go down there later. Anyway. This case is far from closed.

Name: Maya
Text: Yes sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm going to find out more about this man.

Name: Maya
Text: Do you think he was the one who...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maybe so.

Name: Maya
Text: Sis...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Don't worry, I'll find him by tomorrow. I promise.

Name: Maya
Text: I'm counting on you!

Name: April
Text: Well hello! I didn't expect anyone to visit me in such a dank place as this... It's really quite... moving. Not! You stinking lawyer! I hope you die! Have you come to laugh? Yes, laugh at the fallen Miss May!

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, not really, there's something I wanted to ask.

Name: April
Text: Unfortunately, there is nothing I want to BE asked. Haven't you done enough questioning, you...! Spiky-head!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Here we go again...) Please, you're scaring the security guard.

Name: April
Text: ... So? What is it you wish to ask of me, then? Hmm?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (For starters, how did you get to be so totally whacked!?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Have a look at this.

Name: April
Text: Look, I've said several times, I'm not telling you... ! Where did you...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ah hah! A reaction!) This is him, isn't it?

Name: April
Text: What? Who? When? Why...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It IS him. This is the man who stayed in your hotel room the night of the murder!

Name: April
Text: No! No, that's not right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Nice try, Miss Cooperative.)

Name: April
Text: D-do you have proof that was him? Hmm? Y-yeah! Proof! Show me proof!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'm so close!)

Name: Bellboy
Text: Ah, welcome, sir! Quite the performance today, if I dare say so myself.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, um, thanks. Sorry for putting you on the spot like that.

Name: Bellboy
Text: No, no, not at all, sir! Your efforts today can only help the Gatewater's "rep," as they say.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? "Rep"?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Yes! Our reputation will swell as the hotel where the murderer used a wiretap! We can charge a premium for the room, of course. It will be great for business, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whoa, whoa! Miss May hasn't been charged with murder.

Name: Bellboy
Text: I, too, will become famous! "The Bellboy who brought the murderer ice coffee"...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Why do I feel like we're both stuck in the same bad dream...)

Name: Bellboy
Text: So! You are our honored guest. Please let me know if there is anything I can bring you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I wanted to ask you about the man who was with Miss May...?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Ah, yes... He struck me as a real "Lady Killer," if you'll pardon the expression. I knew it from the moment I saw him, sir. He and I are of the same ilk. We both carry the scent of... danger.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (There we are in total agreement, Mr. Psycho Bellboy.)

Name: Bellboy
Text: If you had a photo of that man, I'm quite sure I could identify him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A photo. Hmm...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's this? Old photos? There are two lying here. Something's been written in pencil on the backs. "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A," "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit B"... Let's take a look at these...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why would Grossberg have a picture of this man...? This might be a valuable clue... I'll take it for now. I'm just borrowing it. I'll return it later.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait a second... Wasn't there a giant painting hanging on that wall...? Yeah... yeah, it was a painting of fishermen.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wasn't it? It wasn't a very memorable painting, anyhow.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Take a look at this photo.

Name: Bellboy
Text: ... That's him, Detective.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... I'm the lawyer.

Name: Bellboy
Text: Oh, I know that! I just wanted to say "Detective" once. You know how it is.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No. No I don't.)

Name: Bellboy
Text: Without a doubt, that is the man who checked in with Miss April May. How about I write an affidavit swearing that that's him!

Name: Phoenix
Text: An affidavit? (This guy is way too excited about this...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, sure. Why not?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Yes! I've always wanted to write an affidavit, sir. From hence forth I will be known as the "bellboy who swore the affidavit"!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Just hurry up and write it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Not even Miss May can play dumb to this!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thanks for this.

Name: Bellboy
Text: No no no, not at all, sir! I hope you'll use it to take that Miss May down hard, sir! Hard!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Why do I sense an unhealthy level of excitement behind that unchanging smile? His tea set is rattling!)

Name: April
Text: YOU AGAIN!? Can't you take a hint and stay gone?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey, the only reason I'm back here is because YOU won't talk to me!

Name: April
Text: Oh, so it's MY fault now? You don't just have spiky hair, you also have a spiky heart.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That does it. When this case is done I'm shaving my head.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could you have a look at this?

Name: April
Text: What's that?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The bellboy's affidavit! He told us everything he saw. He told us about the man you checked in with. He told us who he was.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now I'm getting somewhere!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is it, all or nothing! Time to do a little bluff.) No use playing dumb! (If, indeed, that's an act.) If you don't talk, I'm taking this photo to the press!

Name: April
Text: Whaaaaat!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Even though he should be a witness to murder, this man is in hiding. I'm sure the press would have a field day with his reputation!

Name: April
Text: ...! Ooooh! Fine! I'll talk! You... you win, Lawyer.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yes! Man, that felt good! It's great to be alive!)

Name: April
Text: Why are you pumping your fists in the air?

Name: Phoenix
Text: *cough* Now, tell me about the man you were with.

Name: April
Text: That man... He's my boss. Redd White, the president of the information gathering conglomerate, Bluecorp.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Redd... White?) "Information gathering?"

Name: April
Text: Well... I suppose you could call them a detective agency.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hmm... So this is the man that was with you the night of the murder?

Name: April
Text: ... I'm... I'm scared to talk. I don't want to end up like her!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (...!) It's okay, I'll just ask Mr. White himself.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Can you tell me where Bluecorp is located?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Mr. Redd White, at last! Finally, a lead on this guy! If April May couldn't have done it, that leaves him! Time to take action!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Alright, this is getting ridiculous. Where the heck is that loafer?)

Name: Grossberg
Text: *Ah-HHHHEM!*

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ah, that old familiar clearing of the throat...)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Ah hah! You again.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, hello, Mr. Grossberg.

Name: Grossberg
Text: ... Well, well. You were quite the thing, my boy.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Excuse me...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: The trial! The trial!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He was there...?)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Reminded me of myself when I was a youth!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess something got passed down through Mia... maybe?)

Name: Grossberg
Text: It brings back memories, it does! "Ah... the days of my youth... like the scent of fresh lemon..." you see. ... I apologize.

Name: Grossberg
Text: I... It was all a bit too much for me, my boy. Seeing you today, I... well, I... ...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I appreciate the reminiscing, but I'd much rather you gave me some information!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you came to see the trial?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Yes, yes I did. Something was bothering me all last night, you see. I couldn't get a wink of sleep.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Really? What was that?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Well, you see, it's just... Mia's sister, that poor girl. My boy, I owe you my thanks, truly. I don't know what I would have done if things had gone poorly for the girl.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If you were that worried about it, why didn't you offer to defend her!?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: The other day I'm sure there was a big, pretentious-looking painting on that wall...

Name: Grossberg
Text: "Pretentious-looking"...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well... you know the one I mean. Anyway, where did it go?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Ah, yes, well... I... got rid of it. Got quite tired of the thing, really. I, er, sold it, you see. Yes, that's right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Sold it!? I'm not sure I buy that...) Wasn't that painting rather important to you, sir? Did something happen?

Name: Grossberg
Text: I don't see how it's any of your business! Please, speak no more of that accursed painting. I didn't... I... *mumble* *mumble*

Name: Phoenix
Text: Excuse me, I was wondering about this photograph...

Name: Grossberg
Text: Where did you get that!? Give it back at once!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm sorry to have taken it without your knowledge. But... I have to know. Who is this man? He was most likely in April May's room the night of the murder.

Name: Grossberg
Text: ! What's that you say!? A-are you QUITE sure? My boy?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What has him so flustered I wonder...?)

Name: Grossberg
Text: I... I beg your pardon, but I must ask you to leave. I need to be alone.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (...! He's fallen silent as a stone. A rather large stone. I guess I should return that photo.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (What's with the surreal dcor...?)

Name: White
Text: Welcome! Please furnish me with the title of your personage!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What the...?)

Name: White
Text: Your name! What's your name? I was just inquirably asking the title that you go by.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... Wright. Phoenix Wright. ("Inquirably"...?)

Name: White
Text: Mr. Wright, is it? Right, I see... Splendiferous. Perhaps I have intimidated you with my giantesque vocabulary...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What is this guy's problem!)

Name: White
Text: I'm Redd White, CEO of Bluecorp. You know, Corporate Expansion Official? My business dealings bring me into contact with the elite of the elite. So I'm afraid I am not used to conversing with the wordily-challenged.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What a fruitcake!)

Name: White
Text: Hmmm, let me guess... You are an attorney fresh out of law school, are you not? That's the only explanation for why you would come to meet me like this!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What does he mean by that?)

Name: White
Text: No matter. So, what business does a "mighty" lawyer have with a man such as myself?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yipes! This guy's arrogance meter is off the scale!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Miss May is an employee of Bluecorp, is she not?

Name: White
Text: Correct. She was my secretariat. What a shock it was to hear what she has done!

Name: Phoenix
Text: "What she has done"... You mean the wiretap?

Name: White
Text: Indeed! She is paid to answer phones. Tapping them is NOT in her job description. She does gather information for us as part of her duties. But, I assure you, we do not condone illegal methods! It is ineffable that she would do this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It sounds like he's trying to turn Miss May into a scapegoat...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: On the night of the murder were you in April May's hotel room?

Name: White
Text: Who can say? I seldom pay attention to mundane details such as time and place. My motto is: "Don't worry, be happy!"

Name: Phoenix
Text: Still, Mr. White... The hotel bellboy has stated on the record that he does remember you very clearly.

Name: White
Text: ... No matter! The bellboy can say what he pleases. I still won't talk to you. If you want me to speak, put me on the witness stand! Although I doubt you'd be capable of doing that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm. He raises a good question, actually... Why didn't prosecution call him as a witness? He should have "seen" the same thing as April May!)

Name: White
Text: Oh hoh hoh. The police... the courts... To me they are mere toys. Playthings for my amusement!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What kind of company is Bluecorp, anyway?

Name: White
Text: Ah, excellent question! We buy and sell various kinds of information. We are a company of the future! You might say, we ARE the future!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Sell... information?)

Name: White
Text: In just 10 years, I've built this business up into the grand office you see now. Ah, in case you were wondering, Bluecorp was named after the color "blue"! I, Redd White of Bluecorp, as founder and CEO, named it so! And why, you ask? Because I like the color blue of course! Fantabulistic, is it not?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... there's something that's been bothering me.

Name: White
Text: Yes? What might that be?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That big painting on the wall over there...

Name: Phoenix
Text: You know, I've actually seen that painting before.

Name: White
Text: Oh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Just yesterday, actually.

Name: White
Text: Your point being...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: My point is simple. Er, rather, my question is simple: Why is that painting hanging on your wall?

Name: White
Text: ... Mr. Wrong, was it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wright.

Name: White
Text: It appears you do not fully grasp your position here. I ask again. Who are you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Umm... huh? A lawyer?

Name: White
Text: No, my feeble friend. A "mere" lawyer. Worth nothing. Zilch. Zippo. Nada! Just like that sorry excuse for an attorney, Grodyburger!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wh-what!?) Ungh! Oof...! Unh... uhhh... (He... he punched me!)

Name: White
Text: Well, Mr. Lawyer. What will you do, eh? Charge me with assault? Charge away, I welcome it! For it is YOU who will be found guilty!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What...?

Name: White
Text: Heed my exposition! The police, the courts, they all do my bidding.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So you say... But I wonder... Is that kind of control really possible?)

Name: White
Text: I don't expect you to understand. It is a world beyond your compensation. ... You came here from Grodyburger's, I presume?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Grossberg's... yes.

Name: White
Text: Then you must ask him: Why is it that this painting of his hangs here? Perhaps then he will tell you? Perhaps he will explain how a man can live life purely for personal profit! ... Go now! Skedaddle! There is nothing more to discuss!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Huh? I don't think he's noticed me standing here. Maybe I should... clear my throat?) Aaa-HHHEM!

Name: Grossberg
Text: Jumping Jehosephats! Oh! You!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's wrong? You looked so pensive... like an old man at the end of his days.

Name: Grossberg
Text: Hmm? I'm not senile yet! I was just thinking about this whole mess...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Something's really bothering him, that much is clear.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, I paid Bluecorp a visit.

Name: Grossberg
Text: Oh? Oh, I see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Grossberg... I have to admit, something has been bothering me.

Name: Grossberg
Text: Oh? What is it? Well, out with it, my boy!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You see, it's just...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Grossberg, sir... There was a giant painting hanging right there the other day, was there not? The one you said you had "no intention of parting with"? Well, I saw it. Today. It was in the CEO's office at Bluecorp. Redd White's office.

Name: Grossberg
Text: ... So... you noticed. I suppose I should have guessed you would. It is a large painting...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Grossberg, I know you and Mr. White are connected somehow!

Name: Grossberg
Text: C-connected, you say?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes! And I know what it is...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. White has something on you doesn't he? Blackmail?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think that painting is fairly gaudy proof.

Name: Grossberg
Text: ... Very well. This may be the chance I've been waiting for. Maybe it's time to get this off my chest, so I can finally rest easy again. After all, you were Mia's understudy. Perhaps it was fate?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's he talking about...?)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Redd White is a man who makes his living through intimidation. Bluecorp is a company that excels in finding people's weaknesses, I'm afraid. I've been paying them for 15 years now...

Name: Grossberg
Text: All because of the "DL-6 Incident," as you may have guessed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The name on the back of those photographs!)

Name: Grossberg
Text: As you suspected, I could not stand in defense of Maya because of this. White would have destroyed me if I did.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So that's the connection!)

Name: Grossberg
Text: It is hard for me to tell you this, my boy. But arresting Redd White will be nigh on impossible.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Impossible? Why!?

Name: Grossberg
Text: He has information on everyone. It gives him an iron grip! He owns judges, attorneys, prosecutors, police... and politicians.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!?

Name: Grossberg
Text: They are bound, unable to do harm to themselves, and therefore, to him. Don't look at me like that. What you see is nothing more than the weight of many years.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What is the "DL-6 Incident"?

Name: Grossberg
Text: "DL-6" is nothing more than the sorting code the police gave the case. It was 15 years ago now... I received a request from a medium. A spirit medium.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A medium...?)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Her name was Misty Fey.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Fey!)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Indeed. She was Mia's mother. She had been investigating a murder at the bequest of the police. And... she failed. As a result, the police called her a fraud.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is what Maya was talking about the other day!)

Name: Grossberg
Text: I did all I could for her, and in the end, cleared her of wrongdoing. That murder case, however remains unsolved to this day. That case, is the DL-6 Incident.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But why were you blackmailed over this, Mr. Grossberg?

Name: Grossberg
Text: The DL-6 Incident was top-secret at the time. It made sense. The police didn't want people to know they were using a medium! They couldn't let people know. But one person found out. I... I told him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You told White?

Name: Grossberg
Text: He offered me riches... It is an embarrassment to me now. Because I talked, the police were mocked far and wide. In secret, they began looking for the one who sold them out. Of course White heard about it, and he came to me. Only this time, the offer was blackmail.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... I see.

Name: Grossberg
Text: ... White controls the law of this country as he sees fit. Yet if you would still challenge him... Have a close look at Mia's office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mia's office...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: She followed his every move for years. She may have recorded something of what she found.

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's funny, looking at this room, it seems... so normal. Hard to imagine a murder took place here. Mr. Grossberg said there would be clues... Maybe I should have another look.

Name: Phoenix
Text: All the cases the chief ever worked on are filed here. They're in alphabetical order. Let's take a look... Which file should I look at...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let's see if there's "A" record in this file that catches my "I." "A"... "B"... "F"! "Misty Fey." That's Mia and Maya's mother. Hmmm... Should I take a look?

Name: Mia
Text: "'I have tarnished the Fey name.' Leaving only these words, my mother vanished. I was determined to find the ones who had made my mother blame herself in this way. Using the E.S.P. that runs in my family, I held an audience with the dead. Finally, the names of two men surfaced. One was Marvin Grossberg, a lawyer who sold my mother's information for riches. The other was the man who sold that information to the press. This parasite, who makes his fortune on threats and coercion... His name is..."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hmm. The record stops there. ... So Mia knew Grossberg...

Name: Phoenix
Text: *sigh* Well, no harm in flipping through a bit, I guess... The biggest part's here at the end in "S"... "Suicide"? Eww... She has a collection of suicide reports. There's politicians... policemen... ... ...! There's writing on most of these in pencil. "White"...? This is Mia's handwriting. Wait, I get it! Mia thought he was involved in these "suicides"! White drove them all to... ... I can use these newspaper clippings. Hmm... let's find the most disturbing one...

Name: White
Text: Well, aren't you persistent.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry, but there's something I have to ask you.

Name: White
Text: Mr. Lawyer, I really hate having to repeat myself... But it seems the message has not yet penetrated your thick skull... Stop bothering me! If you try my patience further, I fear a nasty accident may occur. Do I make myself clear?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Transparent...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is the only clue that Mia left me... I'd better make this one count!) Mr. White... see this? It's an article describing the suicide of a politician.

Name: Phoenix
Text: He was embezzling secret government funds. Then, one day, word got leaked to the press. The very next day he took his own life.

Name: White
Text: And this concerns me how...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I found this article in Mia's office.

Name: White
Text: Miss Mia...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: She had a file filled with articles like this. Every one of them was labeled with a single word... "White."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. White, I know what you did to this politician.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You were blackmailing him!

Name: White
Text: Blackmail?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Not just him, either. You were threatening and coercing hundreds of others! You were involved in all of the suicide cases that Mia investigated! This company is built on blackmail! I'm right, aren't I?

Name: White
Text: What a bizarre accusation. Mr. Wrong... What is it that you should be doing now? Investigating me? No no no. I think not! You should be searching for the one who killed Miss Mia!

Name: Interphone
Text: *beep*

Name: Interphone
Text: [Secretary's Office, hello?]

Name: White
Text: Mr. Wrong will be leaving now.

Name: Interphone
Text: [Yes, sir. I'll send someone right away.]

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait a second, Mr. White...

Name: Phoenix
Text: You are absolutely right. I should be looking for the killer now. And actually, I've done better. I've found him. He's sitting right in front of me.

Name: White
Text: Just what are you insinuating?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mia was on to you. She was keeping tabs. For this reason you had April May tapping her phone. Then, Mia was murdered, and all the documents about you mysteriously disappeared. So, the culprit would be...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Even a child could work it out, Mr. White. You did it!

Name: Interphone
Text: *beep*

Name: Interphone
Text: [Secretary's office.]

Name: White
Text: We won't be needing an escort for Mr. Wrong. Instead, please connect me to the public prosecutor's office.

Name: Interphone
Text: [Of course, sir. One moment please...] ... [White? That you? What are you doing calling me at a time like this!?]

Name: White
Text: Hello. Chief Prosecutor? I've changed my mind. I want to testify tomorrow.

Name: Interphone
Text: [What's this about?]

Name: White
Text: The Mia Fey case. I witnessed the murder, you see. And, thus, as a very important witness, I would like to testify.

Name: Interphone
Text: [What? Why now? I thought you said you didn't want to go to court?]

Name: White
Text: Quietude...! I told you I changed my mind, didn't I? Oh, and one other thing. Send the police over here right away. The man is standing right in front of me. He looks dazed but could be violent!

Name: Interphone
Text: [What? What man?]

Name: White
Text: Are you even listening? The executioner! The hatchet-man! The liquidator... The killer, man!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!?

Name: Interphone
Text: [Mr. White... this isn't another one of those...]

Name: White
Text: Chief Prosecutor. I do not believe you are in a position to freely offer your opinions to me, correct? I'm telling you to send the police, now!

Name: Interphone
Text: *beep*

Name: White
Text: ... Did I not tell you, Mr. Wrong? You are a mere lawyer! As was Miss Mia.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How dare you!

Name: White
Text: I'll point the finger at you, and you will be tried as Miss Mia's killer! The case is as good as settled. No lawyer of any worth will defend you. I have friends in the local lawyer's association, you see. You'll be given a lawyer so stupendously inept that they make even you look competent.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I... I feel faint.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Detective Gumshoe, reporting, sir! Aaa! Butz! Hairy Butz!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wright, actually. Phoenix Wright. And my friend's name is "Larry"...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, right! Sorry, pal. Butz was that murderer, right?

Name: White
Text: Detective Gumshoe. I present to you, the man who killed Miss Mia Fey!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: W-what!?

Name: White
Text: Take this despicable human being into custody. ... Farewell, Mr. Wrong!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I can't believe it's only been a day since the first trial. My trial begins tomorrow. White's going to set a trap for me. And the prosecution will be in on it, of course. Edgeworth, included. An attorney was assigned to me by the state, yesterday. I refused. I had an idea.

Name: Maya
Text: ... Wright! Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, Maya! Great, they let you out of detention.

Name: Maya
Text: Just now, yes. It's all thanks to you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hah. Now I'm afraid we've switched places.

Name: Maya
Text: What? You mean, you...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I explained what had happened to Maya. ...

Name: Maya
Text: I don't believe it! How many people does that man need to destroy before he's satisfied!? My mother... My sister... And now you! This has gone too far! Mr. Wright, please tell me, is there anything I can do?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... well...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, you could cheer for me in court.

Name: Maya
Text: Cheer for you? You mean... like a cheerleader?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Um, yeah, like that.

Name: Maya
Text: Alright! Leave it to me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Maya
Text: I'd better go get a uniform and some pom-poms...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... W-wait. Wait wait wait.

Name: Maya
Text: What what what?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm kidding! It was a joke!

Name: Maya
Text: No way!

Name: Phoenix
Text: No really, I was kidding. But thanks. It's good to know you're on my side. (And there really isn't anything you can do for me anyway...)

Name: Maya
Text: But... but I can't just sit here and do nothing! I've got to give that man a piece of my mind!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Just a piece...?) Okay. Then, come to the court tomorrow.

Name: Maya
Text: O-okay! I'll be there! I'll show them a thing or two!

Name: Judge
Text: The court is now in session for the trial of Mr. Phoenix Wright.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright... Are you sure you're up to doing this?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor. I will be defending myself.

Name: Judge
Text: Understood. Very well. Mr. Edgeworth, your opening statement, please.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: As the details of the event are already quite clear to the court, today we will hear the testimony of another witness to the defendant's crime.

Name: Judge
Text: I see. The prosecution may call its witness.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That went far too smoothly! Why didn't the judge ask Edgeworth why his witness didn't testify before!? It's like... it's like he already knows why! Hmm. If anyone's going to raise an objection about this, I suppose it's me...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Edgeworth, you owe an explanation to the court! Why didn't this witness testify in the trial against Ms. Maya Fey!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. I'm ever so sorry! Mr. White is a busy man, and besides... at the time, I thought that Ms. May's opinion was all that would be needed. Again, my sincerest apologies to the court.

Name: Judge
Text: Excellent, Mr. Edgeworth. I appreciate your demeanor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Great. He gets to show off and I get nowhere.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I would like to call Mr. Redd White to the stand!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Please state your full name.

Name: White
Text: You wish to know the title of my personage?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Er... your name?

Name: White
Text: Yes! That is what I said! Oh dear, do my locutions confuse?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Name!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (These two are great together...)

Name: White
Text: My name is Redd White. But my friends call me Blanco Nino. I am the CEO, or to use a more common term, the President, of Bluecorp.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Did you know the victim, Ms. Mia Fey?

Name: White
Text: That would be a negatory! No, I did not.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... You were at the Gatewater Hotel the night of the murder?

Name: White
Text: Correct.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And you witnessed the murder from there?

Name: White
Text: Ahem. Why tell you what you already know?

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, Mr. White. You may begin your testimony.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If I can't rip this guy's testimony apart, I'm done for. Why do I always feel like it's the end of the world and I'm the last man standing?)

Name: White
Text: Ho hoh hoh. I hope you have made your peace with God, Mr. Lawyer!

Name: Maya
Text: Let him have it, Phoenix!

Name: White
Text: Let's see, it was about 9:00, I believe.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How do you know what time it was?

Name: White
Text: Because I am always abso-posi-lutely perfect, you know?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No no no, you're not getting away with that!

Name: White
Text: You are so mistrusting, Mr. Lawyer! So... what was the proper term for "secretary" again...? Anyway, Miss May ordered room service for 9:00. It happened soon after the room service arrived.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm. That's what Miss May said, too.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: True, the bellboy who brought the coffee saw Miss May. But he testified that he did not see you at the time!

Name: White
Text: Ahem. This is your concern? Silly Lawyer! Miss May received the coffee outside the room! Of course he could not see me. He would need X-ray vision to pull off something like that!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Tell us, what were you doing at the time?

Name: White
Text: I was quietly perusifying... er, that's "reading" to you, some papers by the window.

Name: Phoenix
Text: By window, you mean the one directly across from the Fey & Co. Law Office?

Name: White
Text: Correct! That is the only window, you see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And there you were reading... papers?

Name: White
Text: Correct! The Gatewater is a businessman's hotel, and I am a busy man who had business to do!

Name: White
Text: Then I heard a bedlam coming from outside!

Name: Phoenix
Text: A "bedlam"?

Name: White
Text: It must have been when you attacked, I assume.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: We see. Continue.

Name: White
Text: Surprised, I turned to look at the building across the way.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you were reading your papers until you heard that sound?

Name: White
Text: But of course. I am no snoop, peeping out of windows at night.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No snoop? Yeah, right! You've made a career out of snooping!)

Name: White
Text: It was then I saw him: a spiky-haired man attacking a woman with long hair!

Name: Phoenix
Text: S-spiky-haired!?

Name: White
Text: Needless to say that man was none other than you, Mr. Lawyer!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What you just said directly conflicts with Miss May's testimony! Miss May clearly stated that the assailant looked like a "girl"!

Name: White
Text: I've always been proud of my eyesight, Mr. Lawyer.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Just what is your eyesight?

Name: White
Text: Counting both eyes... 40!

Name: Phoenix
Text: 40!? Don't add them together!

Name: Judge
Text: I think the witness is trying to say his eyesight is good.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hey, whose side is the judge on, anyway?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And what did you do then?

Name: White
Text: I called Miss May over at once. She, too, was surprised of course.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What was Miss May doing at that time?

Name: White
Text: She had just finished watching a soap opera on the TV, and was weeping openly.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you know she had been tapping the Fey office phone?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Irrelevant! That has nothing to do with the case at hand.

Name: White
Text: I care not. I will answer the lawyer's bold inquiry. Miss May was acting alone when she tapped the phone of this Fey woman.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You'd make a good politician, Mr. White.

Name: White
Text: Ho hoh! After all, I am "El Presidente."

Name: Judge
Text: Please continue.

Name: White
Text: The victim, she... she ran away, but you gave chase!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Can you be a little more detailed about that? I think it's worth knowing exactly what happened.

Name: White
Text: Of course! Comprende! I understand! The victim was attacked, by you, and ran to the left. You gave chase, and struck her down!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Are you sure?

Name: White
Text: As you know, I am always abso-posi-lutely perfect!

Name: Judge
Text: Perhaps you could change your testimony to reflect this new detail.

Name: White
Text: The victim ran to the left, and you gave chase!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you sure about that?

Name: White
Text: How many times must I say it? I am abso-posi-lutely perfect! End of story!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (How many times must I hear that?)

Name: Maya
Text: Psst! Phoenix! Doesn't something about that strike you as a little odd?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait right there! Mr. White, you've dug your own grave!

Name: White
Text: What is this!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You said the victim ran to the "left." But that directly contradicts Miss May's testimony! She clearly stated that the victim ran "right"!

Name: White
Text: ...! Oh hoh hoh. It is simple. You have misheard her.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think not. Look at the floor plans... The killer was here. And the victim, here. If the victim ran to the left, as you claim she did... She would have been running directly away from the door! She would have been running into a dead end! Don't you find that odd?

Name: White
Text: ! Very strange... I did see her run to the left... I did.

Name: Maya
Text: Phoenix... look at his face. I don't think he's lying about this one.

Name: Phoenix
Text: True. (Maybe he really did see the victim run left...? So he did witness the killing...? Wait a second!)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: Miss May says "right," and Mr. White says "left." Can you explain this contradiction to the court?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Both witnesses are telling the truth. (For once...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hah! I doubt it! Er, rather, that does not clear up the contradiction!

Name: Phoenix
Text: There is one scenario that would explain their conflicting accounts.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Obviously, the witness was not viewing the crime from the hotel!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! What do you mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, what do you mean, he was not "viewing the crime from the hotel"!? If he was not in the hotel, where could he have been!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: In the law offices of Fey & Co., of course! More specifically, he was standing here! (Show the court where Mr. White was standing!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is where he was! Look! When the victim ran for the door... If he was watching from this point, to him it would appear that she ran to the "left."

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Please! This is no time for jokes in ill taste! That is where the killer was standing!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! I will have order! Anyone disturbing the order of this courtroom will be held in contempt! Mr. Wright! What are you suggesting!?

Name: White
Text: R-r-rapscallion!!!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The postulations of the defense are a distortion of the truth, Your Honor!

Name: Judge
Text: Indeed. They do seem a bit far-fetched...

Name: White
Text: ... Ho hoh hoh! You provide us with so much entertainment, Mr. Lawyer!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What now!? He's... laughing!?)

Name: White
Text: The hilarity of the moment made me remember something... It appears I have been unclear, and for this, I apologize. Mr. Your Honor... Might I be allowed to testify once more?

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, let's hear your revised testimony.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Good luck. You can't fix a broken testimony, buddy!)

Name: White
Text: Miss May's testimony was correct... as was mine!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean by that!

Name: White
Text: That is what I am about to explain! You Americans, always so impatient! It does not become you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hey buddy, you're an American, too!)

Name: White
Text: When you assaulted the girl, she first ran to the left.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean "first"?

Name: White
Text: "First"? That is what comes before what happens "next." You do speak English, right? Please, sit back, relax. I will try to use simple words for your benefit. First, she ran to the left, and then...

Name: White
Text: And then you hit her, savagely! That is what I saw.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I didn't hit anyone!

Name: White
Text: Now, now, Mr. Wright. There is no point hiding things from this court.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm not hiding anything!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution requests that the defense refrain from interrupting the testimony!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright, you have been warned.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Why's he mad at me!?)

Name: White
Text: Next, with the last of her strength, she ran to the right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean "next"!?

Name: White
Text: "Next" is what comes after "first."

Name: Phoenix
Text: I know that!

Name: White
Text: Then that is all you need to know, Mr. Lawyer. As I said, she turned and made a desperate dash to the right.

Name: White
Text: You chased her, and delivered the final blow.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Stop saying it was me!

Name: White
Text: But, it was you.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mr. Wright! If you claim that it was NOT you, then show us proof!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Argh! Can I do nothing right? Nothing!?)

Name: White
Text: May I continue?

Name: White
Text: That is what Miss May saw.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: So each of you saw different parts...?

Name: White
Text: Abso-posi-lutely! That's right, of course!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Where did he pick up that annoying phrase...?)

Name: White
Text: Anyway, moving along!

Name: White
Text: You see? You hit her twice!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: So were you watching both times?

Name: White
Text: I suppose I was. And please excuse me for not testifying to this sooner!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. White! The victim died from a "single" blow!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you have to say to that?

Name: White
Text: Er... Erp!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now's my chance to hit him where it counts!) Mr. White. Wasn't it you who told this court you were "abso-posi-lutely perfect"?

Name: White
Text: Mmph. I will refrain from using this phrase from now on.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, if you could ask the witness for a new testimony...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The witness is obviously confused, Your Honor! I would like to request a 10 minute break!

Name: Judge
Text: Yes... yes, quite.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The witness is confused because he's lying! I emphatically request that there be no break, Your Honor!
(Yeah! We want justice...!)
(Don't let him get away!)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. If the witness would care to revise his testimony...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The crowd's on my side! No slipping out of this now, White!)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. White?

Name: White
Text: O... okay...

Name: White
Text: Umm, well, see--I looked at the other window when I heard that thing fall.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You heard "that thing fall"? What exactly was "that thing"?

Name: White
Text: Huh? Oh... oh, that? Umm... the glass light stand!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Right... the one that had fallen over at the scene.)

Name: Maya
Text: Phoenix! Doesn't something about that strike you as odd?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yeah, that is odd. I'll press further.) Mr. White.

Name: White
Text: Huh? W-what?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You're saying you saw the glass light stand?

Name: White
Text: Y-yes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Then change your testimony to reflect that!

Name: White
Text: S-sorry. My bad...

Name: Judge
Text: The witness will revise his testimony.

Name: White
Text: Okay okay. Of course.

Name: White
Text: A light stand was lying on the floor when I looked.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The "glass stand was lying on the floor"? That's the first I've heard of this. Why didn't you tell us about the stand before?

Name: White
Text: W-why? Me? W-well... I was instructed not to... wait! One moment! Give me a minute to gather my thoughts. I am so... so confused.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (White's falling apart.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor! Please, I ask that you do not allow the witness to be badgered any further!

Name: Judge
Text: M-Mr. Wright. Please refrain from badgering the witness...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor. (Edgeworth is on the ropes!)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The witness may continue his account.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. White. It was impossible for you to have seen the light stand!

Name: White
Text: Whaaaat!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The stand broke into pieces when it fell!

Name: White
Text: Ooof!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Just by seeing the broken pieces you would have no idea it was a light stand! So tell me, exactly when was it that you saw the stand? Answer the question!

Name: White
Text: ...! I-isn't it obvious? I saw the stand before it fell over!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... you saw the stand before the victim was attacked, then?

Name: White
Text: C-correct! That would be no problemo, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: There's a big problemo, er, I mean problem here.

Name: White
Text: What problem is this?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. White, let me make sure I have this straight... You saw the glass light stand through the window, from the hotel... before the incident occurred?

Name: White
Text: Correct! That is so! It's conclusive, definitive, undeniable... unimpeachable!

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, it's impossible! You couldn't have seen the stand!

Name: Judge
Text: What? Why couldn't he? You have proof?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I sure do, Your Honor!

Name: Phoenix
Text: A person in the hotel could not have seen the stand before it fell over!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look at this!

Name: Judge
Text: These are the floor plans to the scene of the murder, yes?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Correct, Your Honor. Now, look... If you were to look through the window at the office... This is the area you would be able to see! Here! Well...? Note that the stand is not within the visible area! Well, Mr. White! What do you have to say to that!?

Name: White
Text: Er... erp! Ri... dicu... losity...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. White. If you were in the Gatewater hotel as you claim, you could not have seen the stand before it fell over! In fact, you wouldn't have been able to see it after it fell, either! There's no way you could have recognized the broken shards as a glass light stand! So, when did you see the stand, Mr. White? It must have been the moment that it fell! And the only place you could have seen that from... is inside the Fey Law Offices! In other words, you were at the scene of the crime, when the murder took place!

Name: White
Text: Gaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr... White?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. White.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You did it, didn't you?

Name: White
Text: ... Mr. Your Honor. I... I... Miss Mia... ...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Heh. Looks like we're about to get our verdict!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That's far enough, Phoenix Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-what!? (Urk! I forgot about Edgeworth!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mr. White...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I think the time has come. Shouldn't you confess your crime now, hmm?

Name: White
Text: W... what?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I said, you should confess your crime. Ergo, confess that you placed the wiretap!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The w-wiretap!?

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Mr. Edgeworth! Explain to the court what you mean by this!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Distinguished members of of the court... Mr. White is slightly confused. Allow me to explain.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I really don't like the way this is headed...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: As you know, Mr. White is the CEO of Bluecorp. He ordered his secretary, Miss April May, to tap the law offices of Ms. Fey.

Name: Judge
Text: What does that have to do...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor. The question is: when was the wiretap placed in the office, and by who?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No! You wouldn't!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mr. White. In order to place the wiretap, you entered Ms. Fey's office. Am I correct...?

Name: White
Text: ... ! C-correct! You are most correct, Miles!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Give me a break!

Name: White
Text: Yes... in order to place the wiretap, I breached the Fey & Co. Law Offices! That is when I saw that accursed light stand!

Name: Judge
Text: Now I'm confused. Please explain to the court what all this means, Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Gladly, Your Honor. Mr. Phoenix Wright has made his position quite clear. He has determined that Mr. White knew the glass stand was in the office. He has shown that there was only one time Mr. White could have seen the stand: At the very moment of the murder! Thus, Mr. Wright would like you to believe that Mr. White was the murderer!

Name: Judge
Text: I see.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: However! It is a fact that Mr. White had been to that office well before the murder took place! He went to place the wiretap! He could have seen the glass light stand then. Ergo, Mr. Phoenix Wright's theory is revealed for the baseless conjecture it is!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. White! You will testify to the court about this wiretap!

Name: White
Text: Ahem. Leave it to me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I... I feel faint.)

Name: White
Text: It was the beginning of September... the week before the murder.

Name: Phoenix
Text: D-do you have proof!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Miss April May knew the details of Ms. Fey's phone conversation! This proves that the wiretap was placed before the murder!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh... right.

Name: White
Text: I had entered the Fey & Co. Law Offices.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Was it really you that went into the office? Or was it Miss May?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Unidentified fingerprints several days old were found in the Fey & Co. Law Offices. Those were obviously Mr. White's.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (And if I know Edgeworth, he's already run a check on those prints...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Now, Mr. White. Tell us why you went to the Fey & Co. Law Offices.

Name: White
Text: Of course, I had done so to place the wiretap.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did you tap Mia's phone!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That has no bearing on the current case, Your Honor.

Name: White
Text: Bluecorp is a detective agency of sorts. We have a responsibility to protect client confidentiality!

Name: White
Text: That is when I saw this glass light stand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did you notice something as innocuous as a light stand!?

Name: White
Text: The light stand was made entirely out of glass. It was quite stylish, so I guess it made a lasting impression on me. Such a beautacious thing deserves attention, does it not? That is all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh! Don't tell me I've run out of ammo!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Tsk tsk. I'm afraid that's as far as you go, Mr. Wright. The time has come for you to admit your defeat! You fought... honorably.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No more... I can't take this anymore...)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright? Are you giving up?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Y-yes, Your Honor.

Name: Mia
Text: (Phoenix!)

Name: Mia
Text: (Phoenix! Over here!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I know that voice! ... M-Mia!?)

Name: Mia
Text: Never give up, Phoenix!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Where... Where am I? The waiting lobby...? What happened? ... Oh, right... I lost the trial. I was... hallucinating. ...

Name: Mia
Text: Ah, you're finally awake.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Gak!

Name: Mia
Text: H-hey! Phoenix! ... "Gak"? That's no way to greet an old friend! Phoenix, I want you to look at me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-You're... M-Maya...?

Name: Mia
Text: Didn't you know the Fey women have strong psychic powers...? When you accepted your defeat in court... It appears that was enough of a shock to awaken Maya's true powers.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... Maya is channeling you, Mia?

Name: Mia
Text: That's right. I am Maya, but I'm also Mia. Now, I want you to listen to me, Phoenix. Maya never gave up. You can't either! That's what I came here to tell you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! B-but!

Name: Mia
Text: We don't have much time, Phoenix. Now listen. You've already won.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh...?

Name: Mia
Text: You have that Receipt in the court record, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... oh, yeah! The one you wrote "Maya" on...?

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix! White wrote that, not me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... so what do I do with it?

Name: Mia
Text: Look at the front of the receipt!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The... front? (It's a regular receipt... Looks like it's from a famous department store. "$1,000.00"... wow, big spender! "Item"... "glass light stand"...! "Date of purchase"... "September 4"...) ...! September 4!

Name: Mia
Text: That's right, Phoenix. I bought that stand the day before I was killed!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whoa!

Name: Mia
Text: Now, what did Mr. White say in his testimony?

Name: White
Text: It was the beginning of September... the week before the murder.

Name: Phoenix
Text: He said he saw the stand the week before the murder!

Name: Mia
Text: There you go! I think the court is about to reconvene! Go do it, Phoenix! You know you're innocent, now you just have to prove it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right!

Name: Judge
Text: The court will now reconvene for the trial of Mr. Phoenix Wright. Is the defendant... rather, are you alright, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. Sorry, Your Honor. I'm fine now.

Name: Judge
Text: Then, let's start where we left off.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor. There is nothing to go back to! The cross-examination of Mr. White is finished! All that is required now is for you to pass judgment on the defendant Phoenix Wright!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! Please, give me one more chance. I promise you, this is the last time I'll ask you!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... But, as Mr. Edgeworth has noted, the trial is more or less finished. Mr. Edgeworth, do you have an opinion on this matter?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I say... let us give Mr. Phoenix Wright his "last chance."

Name: Judge
Text: Very well! You may begin your cross-examination.

Name: White
Text: It was the beginning of September... the week before the murder.

Name: White
Text: I had entered the Fey & Co. Law Offices.

Name: White
Text: Of course, I had done so to place the wiretap.

Name: White
Text: That is when I saw this glass light stand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look closely at this. See the word "Maya" written in blood...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Bwah hah! You're grasping!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think not. Look at the other side of the receipt.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Th-the other side?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor. Would you tell the court what is written on the other side of that receipt?

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Well! A "glass light stand"! And the date of purchase... Why, that's the day before the murder!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You see! Mr. White. When you allegedly entered Fey & Co. Law Offices at the beginning of September... The stand could not have been there!

Name: White
Text: Kwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahh!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, Mr. White? Can't get out of this one, can you?

Name: White
Text: No... It's impossachievable...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh... he's losing it.) ... Well, Your Honor. I understand there must be quite a bit of PRESSURE on you. But I think you'll agree you can't judge me "guilty" under these circumstances.

Name: Judge
Text: ! ...... Very well. Then, that is all for the trial of...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Not so fast, Phoenix Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Eh? (What! No way he can worm his way out of this one! Oh wait... I forgot. It's Edgeworth.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There is a certain thread of logic to the defendant's claims. However! There is no concrete proof that Phoenix Wright is innocent!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ergo! I would like to request one more day before Phoenix Wright is granted his freedom. I need time to make one more inquiry into this matter.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Another inquiry...!? This isn't going to be another one of those "updated autopsy reports"! This guy just makes up evidence as he pleases! This is bad...!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. White's guilt is obvious! There is no need to prolong this trial any further!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. Well, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If anyone is going to call Mr. White to trial, it would be me, the prosecution. I need a day to ascertain whether your claims have any basis in factual evidence!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. I see. Objection denied!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whaaaat!

Name: Judge
Text: The completion of the trial of Mr. Phoenix Wright will be postponed until tomorrow.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No! There's no telling what will happen if I can't end this now! Edgeworth is sure to come up with--or just make up--something! And after Mia showed up to help me and all...)

Name: White
Text: Mr. Your Honor! May I go home?

Name: Judge
Text: Of course. Thank you for your time.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Gah!)

Name: Mia
Text: The witness will stay!

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix! Read this note out loud.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mia? What's this...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor. If I may...?

Name: Judge
Text: You're quite persistent today, Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (You bet I am! My life is riding on this one!) I have something I would like to read to the court!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The memo Mia had given me was a list of names. Many of them sounded strangely familiar. People in finance, famous celebrities... That's when it happened.)

Name: White
Text: S-s-stop! Desist! Halt! P-please, stop! Make him stop! How... how did you get that list!?

Name: Mia
Text: Mr. White. Admit your guilt, right here, right now. Or else this list will be released to the press!

Name: White
Text: ... I... I confess. I confess. I... I did it. I hit her. I hit Miss Mia with "The Thinker"! ...

Name: Mia
Text: Case closed, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Well, I see no reason to continue this trial. Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: You've done it again! That was quite a spirited defense!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor. I guess you could say that. (If only you knew how "spirit"-ed it was!)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. Well! This court finds the defense... Ahem! Rather, the defendant, Mr. Phoenix Wright... Not Guilty

Name: Judge
Text: That is all. The court is adjourned!

Name: Mia
Text: Well, I never thought I'd be saying this again... But, congratulations! You're lucky I was born a Fey!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm lucky I had both you and Maya on my side.

Name: Mia
Text: I'm glad you made it. ... Thank you, Phoenix. You risked a lot to help me... and Maya. I won't forget it as long as I live!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (As long as you "live"...?)

Name: Mia
Text: ... My time here's running out.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Mia
Text: Maya's powers are still weak. I can't stay here that long.

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-what!? No! There's still so much to say!

Name: Mia
Text: Don't worry. I'm sure we'll meet again.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ch-Chief!

Name: Mia
Text: Hee hee. I'm not the "Chief" anymore. Phoenix? Can you come to the office tonight... say, 9:00?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The office...?

Name: Mia
Text: I'll see you later.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chief... Mia!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Being here, it's hard not to think about that night...)

Name: Maya
Text: You came!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mia...

Name: Maya
Text: I was kinda worried you might not.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Of course I came...

Name: Maya
Text: Well then! I'm pretty hungry. How about a burger?

Name: Phoenix
Text: M-Mia...?

Name: Maya
Text: ... Bwah hah hah! You should see your face!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mia!

Name: Maya
Text: What are you talking about? It's me! Maya!

Name: Phoenix
Text: M-Maya...?

Name: Maya
Text: What, did I look like my sister?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Look like... you WERE her!)

Name: Maya
Text: Hmm! I might be able to use that. "Oh, Phoenix! Go to the store and buy me lunch, would you?"

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uhm, Maya... Why are you here?

Name: Maya
Text: Because of this! See? Mia wrote me a letter. "Take care of Phoenix for me."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Take care of... huh?

Name: Maya
Text: She means the office! This office! Someone has to help with the new Wright & Co. Law Offices, right? And who better but me! Maya Fey, reporting for duty! Wait, no, on second thought, let's make this casual! Yo, Nick! Maya here, ready to get down to business! You... don't mind me calling you "Nick," do you? It's a great name! Mia said that's what your friend Larry calls you.

Name: Maya
Text: You know what this means? We're partners!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You know, when I think about it... It is Maya's fault I'm here now. But... If it wasn't for her I'd probably be in jail! "Wright & Co. Law Offices." It's got a good ring to it. Yeah! Thanks, Maya!

Name: Mia
Text: (Good luck, Phoenix. I'll always be here... watching.)

Name: Maya
Text: Right! Okay, Nick, let's do it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Do... what?

Name: Maya
Text: Burgers, dummy! Burgers! There's a great burger joint just down the street. C'mon! Time's a wasting!

Name: Phoenix
Text: O-okay! Wait up!

Name: Maya
Text: That rocked! "See you in Hell, Evil Magistrate!!!"

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whoa! Stop waving that broom around!

Name: Maya
Text: Oh, Nick! I didn't know you were here!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course I'm here! What was that surreal show you were watching?

Name: Maya
Text: What!? Nick, you mean, you don't know the Steel Samurai!? He's only the most popular TV hero for young people!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Young...? Like, how young?

Name: Maya
Text: Umm... 10 years old?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Then what the heck are YOU doing getting all excited!?

Name: Maya
Text: Hey! I'm only 17! That's seven-"teen." See? I'm a teen! Not like you, Nick.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey! Don't talk to me like I'm your grandpa or something. I'm only 24 myself.

Name: Maya
Text: Then watch it with me! He's really cool! And... it's really popular! When they asked grade school kids what they wanted to be, "Steel Samurai" was no.1!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I really worry about kids these days.

Name: Maya
Text: Gramps! Well, the Steel Samurai's over. I guess it's time to close up the office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I guess... Wish we had some clients!

Name: Phoenix
Text: A month has passed since my trial. Mia's murder was the talk of the town for some time... But no one paid any attention to the Wright & Co. Law Offices... How am I going to pay the rent this month?

Name: Maya
Text: It'll be okay. I'm sure some big client is just around the corner!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hmph.

Name: Cellular
Text: Brrrrring... Brrrrring...

Name: Cellular
Text: *beep*

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-hello? This is Phoenix.

Name: Maya
Text: N-N-Nick!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maya? What? It's still early...

Name: Maya
Text: I-it's the Steel Samurai! The Steel Samurai got arrested!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? You mean the guy on that show?

Name: Maya
Text: Yes! They're saying that the Steel Samurai killed a villain!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Umm... Isn't that what he's supposed to do?

Name: Maya
Text: Yeah, on TV!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, on TV.

Name: Maya
Text: No! I mean, he actually did it! In real life! He skewered a villain with his Samurai Spear!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I have absolutely no idea what you're talking about.

Name: Maya
Text: Just come to the office, quick! Please, Nick!

Name: Cellular
Text: *beep*

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maya's here... watching television.)

Name: TV
Text: Now for the morning news. The actor Will Powers was arrested yesterday. Powers plays the lead role in the popular kid's show "The Steel Samurai: Warrior of Neo Olde Tokyo." He was arrested on suspicion of murder. The victim was Jack Hammer, who plays the villain known as the "Evil Magistrate." His body was found still inside the Evil Magistrate costume. The "Samurai Spear" was also found stuck through the body. Police believe this was the murder weapon, and are investigating further.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... This has to be a joke.

Name: Maya
Text: No, no, no! It's a nightmare! The Steel Samurai is over! The world is over!

Name: Cellular
Text: Brrrrring... Brrrrring...

Name: Cellular
Text: *beep*

Name: Maya
Text: Yes... Wright & Co. Law Offices. ... What!? Nick! I-it's the Steel Samurai!

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-what!?

Name: Maya
Text: Yes... yes, of course! We'll be right there!

Name: Cellular
Text: *beep*

Name: Maya
Text: Let's go, Nick!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Go? Go where?

Name: Maya
Text: They have the Steel Samurai down in detention!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So what!?

Name: Maya
Text: So, I've decided this will be our first case!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's wrong, Maya? It's him! In the flesh!

Name: Maya
Text: Umm... Is that guy really him?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whaddya mean "that guy"? Of course it's him! Will Powers, our client! That's him.

Name: Maya
Text: Um, maybe I shouldn't be saying this... But he definitely did it. Murder. At least once. Maybe twice.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whoa whoa whoa! What are you saying!?

Name: Will
Text: Umm...

Name: Maya
Text: Y-yes!?

Name: Will
Text: Something wrong...?

Name: Maya
Text: N-no! No!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is getting off to a great start.)

Name: Will
Text: I know, I know. You're disappointed, aren't you?

Name: Maya
Text: D-disappointed!? Oh, no. Oh no.

Name: Will
Text: No, it's okay. This is the real me. When I got the part of the Steel Samurai, with that mask... I decided I would never show my face in public until the job was over. It's the kids, you know. I didn't want to wreck their dreams.

Name: Maya
Text: Oh...

Name: Will
Text: I guess it didn't matter. So much for dreams. I wonder what they think of the Steel Samurai now. *sniff* Uwaaah!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What?

Name: Maya
Text: He's a good guy! I mean, he's good!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah.

Name: Maya
Text: He didn't do it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maybe you could start by telling us what happened.

Name: Will
Text: Y-yes. Of course. It seems like it was only yesterday. Actually, it was only yesterday. The cast had come down to Global Studios for a run-through. We went through a few action sequences at 10:00 that morning. There was a rehearsal scheduled for 5:00 in the afternoon. But when 5:00 came around, and the staff gathered at the studio... The Evil Magistrate was found lying in a crumpled heap near the set. They took off his mask... And discovered that it was Jack Hammer... dead! He had been expertly skewered with the Samurai Spear.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The "Samurai Spear"...?

Name: Will
Text: Yes, it's a long spear that I... that the Steel Samurai uses as a weapon.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Now, where were you on the day of the murder?

Name: Will
Text: Well, that morning I came to studios at 9:00. We worked through some action scenes until noon. Rehearsal was to begin at 5:00, but I was a little tired. So after lunch, I took a nap in my dressing room. When I woke up, it was after 5:00! I was late for the rehearsal! I hurried to the studio... and found everyone looking shocked. They arrested me on the spot, and brought me here.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So he was sleeping the entire afternoon of the murder? Some action hero!)

Name: Will
Text: What will the kids think? *sniff*

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think I should probably check out the scene of the murder...

Name: Will
Text: Right... Global Studios. I'll draw you a map.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow! Nick! Let's go!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'm willing to bet 10 bucks she asks for autographs.)

Name: Maya
Text: Wow! So this is where they make the Steel Samurai show! Awesome! Aren't you excited!?

Name: Oldbag
Text: Hey! You there! You want in, you gotta go through me!

Name: Maya
Text: O-oh... s-sorry! W-we're, um, lawyers.

Name: Oldbag
Text: Oh yeah? Well that's great. I'm security! And it's my job to make sure that gawkers like you stay OUT.

Name: Maya
Text: G-gawkers?

Name: Oldbag
Text: Gawkers! Sightseers! Tourists!!! I know the type. You heard about the incident and came to snoop around. Youths today! Something horrible happens and all you can think of is sightseeing. Wasting your time at a place like this. Don't you have jobs you should be doing? Or do lawyers not work like the rest of us? Maybe I should become a lawyer too.
