Name: Phoenix
Text: (Edgeworth...)

Name: Vasquez
Text: I was with Sal and Oldbag, the security lady, when we found the body.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What time was that?

Name: Vasquez
Text: We were to meet at 5:00 for the rehearsal. So I'd say it was then.

Name: Phoenix
Text: When exactly did you and Mr. Manella arrive at the studio?

Name: Vasquez
Text: About 10 minutes before. I wasn't stuffing any bodies into costumes, mind you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Where were the other employees when you got to the studio?

Name: Vasquez
Text: They weren't there yet.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well!? Then you could have put Hammer in that costume, with Sal Manella's help!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Oh? What did I just say? Did I not just say "I wasn't stuffing any bodies into any costumes"...? You should try to listen to what people are saying, boy.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (B-boy!?)

Name: Judge
Text: The witness will continue her testimony.

Name: Vasquez
Text: The assistant was there, too. Only Powers was absent.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Powers was taking a nap, correct?

Name: Vasquez
Text: So he says.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did no one go to call him?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Remember...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Remember... what?

Name: Vasquez
Text: There was a dead body lying in front of us. Yet you expect me to be calm?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (You certainly seemed calm enough when I accused you of murder! *sigh*)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait a second! Wouldn't that be the other way around!?

Name: Vasquez
Text: The other way around?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You discovered a murdered body, and one person was missing, right? Wouldn't you normally go looking for the missing person!?

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I have to agree with the defense on this one. Well, Ms. Vasquez?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Hmph. Logically speaking, perhaps. But no one there was thinking very logically, I assure you. Also. Without his Steel Samurai costume, Powers doesn't really stand out. We often left him on the bus when shooting at location. No one noticed he was missing.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Poor Powers...)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Well, I suppose that explains that. Very well, Ms. Vasquez. You may continue.

Name: Vasquez
Text: I immediately called the police. Then Powers showed up.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What was everyone else doing at that time?

Name: Vasquez
Text: No one said a thing. It was silent. Completely silent. So we stood there until Powers finally arrived on the scene. "Sorry! Sorry I'm late!" Then... silence. Dead silence.

Name: Vasquez
Text: Silent.

Name: Maya
Text: Hey... Hey, Nick. Why's everyone so quiet? Someone should do something to lighten things up!

Name: Vasquez
Text: The security lady, Oldbag, was quite agitated. Pointing at Powers, saying "he did it!"

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oldbag... the security lady.) Why did the security lady think Powers had done it?

Name: Vasquez
Text: She said because she saw him going toward the studio.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Right... the Steel Samurai.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did the detective arrest Mr. Powers based solely on the security lady's word?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Perhaps not. She seems to have given the detective that photograph... Of course, I heard all this after the fact.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That photograph... meaning the one taken by the security camera.)

Name: Vasquez
Text: She's not known for exhibiting the best sense of judgment when it comes to Hammer.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm. I don't think there's anything in there I can use.)

Name: Vasquez
Text: I asked to be left out of the proceedings.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You "asked to be left out"?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Yes. It seems that everyone else was questioned. And I'm really not fond of that sort of thing.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But, you can't decide who the police will and won't question!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Thankfully, the studio thinks otherwise. They were nice enough to understand that, since we were in a meeting... There was no way we could be involved. Thus, they covered for us.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Covered for you... or covered it up for you? There must have been a lot riding on it, with all those bigwigs at the meeting... I'm sure her "professionals" helped convince everyone they didn't require questioning.)

Name: Vasquez
Text: I went back to the trailer to get my script and direction notes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The script and your direction notes?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Yes, they're quite valuable. It wouldn't do to have them stolen.

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, I guess not.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait a second! I thought you came to Studio One for a rehearsal! Why didn't you bring your script and notes!?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Well, I was under the impression that we wouldn't be able to rehearse anything.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why?

Name: Vasquez
Text: There was a murder, after all! Who could think of rehearsing after that!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh, yeah, I guess...)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Very well. Ms. Vasquez, please continue...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor!!! I have an objection to the witness's last statement!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Think! Ms. Vasquez said she didn't bring the script because there wouldn't be a rehearsal. Don't you see what that means? She would have had to know about the murder before going to Studio One!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Judge
Text: What you have just said... is a reasonable observation. However, I find it hard to understand why the prosecution would make such a move! Or are you thinking of a career change to defense!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I... appreciate the concern, Your Honor. I will stand by my statement, however, regardless of how the court sees my role here. Now, Ms. Vasquez... Do you have an explanation?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I can't believe Edgeworth is helping me!)

Name: Vasquez
Text: Hmph. So the prosecution is in cahoots with the defense? What kind of court is this? No matter. I think you misunderstood me. I had a perfectly good reason to believe there would be no rehearsal.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Very well, the witness will change her testimony to reflect this reason.

Name: Vasquez
Text: I knew that Hammer was injured and couldn't do any action scenes, so I left them behind.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: How did you know about the injury?

Name: Vasquez
Text: H-how did I know!? Sal. He told me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Sal the director... Hm...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You "knew that Hammer was injured"...? Don't you think that's a little funny? I mean, it was the Steel Samurai who was injured! It was Will Powers!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Wh... what!?

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! Explain yourself!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Mr. Hammer is dragging his leg in this photo. But that's because he was pretending to be Mr. Powers!

Name: Vasquez
Text: P-pretending...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: One person was inured in the run-through that morning. That person was Mr. Powers, not Mr. Hammer! Now, why did you think it was Mr. Hammer who was injured?

Name: Vasquez
Text: ...! I-I already said it was Sal who told me! Th-that's right! He must have gotten it wrong.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think not. Mr. Manella was at the run-through that morning. He would have known it was Mr. Powers who was injured. He saw it happen! Why would he tell you the wrong person? Ms. Vasquez!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Actually, you didn't hear anything from Mr. Manella. You saw Mr. Hammer limping with your own eyes!

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, but... Wasn't it Mr. Powers who was injured...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, but remember! Mr. Hammer was dragging his leg, too! He was pretending to be Mr. Powers!

Name: Judge
Text: Aah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: And when was he doing this...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well... It would have been after he put on the Steel Samurai costume... and went to Studio Two. Where he was murdered!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Exactly! Ms. Vasquez! You met him, didn't you? You saw the Steel Samurai limping! And Mr. Hammer was in that Steel Samurai suit! That's why you were confused! That's why you thought it was Mr. Hammer who had been injured that morning!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! I will have order!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Witness! Can you refute this claim?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Hrrmmmm... hmph! ... ...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yeah, let's see you sneak out of this one, Vasquez!)

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... Very well! I have a question for you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Urk... Why are the real killers always so... persistent?)

Name: Vasquez
Text: Why in the world would I want Mr. Hammer dead? Yes, he'd fallen on hard times, but he was a star! I had nothing to gain from his death! Nothing!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Yes, you would need a motive. Why would she have killed the victim? If there is a reason, it is unclear to this court. Does the defense have anything to say on the matter? In other words, can you prove she had a motive?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Okay. I have proof, and I'll show it to you! I present to the court evidence as to Ms. Vasquez's motive in this murder.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is my proof!

Name: Judge
Text: This is... the photo from before?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This photo reveals the motive in this murder!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm right, aren't I, Ms. Vasquez?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Hrrrrrrm... hmph!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Five years ago, Mr. Hammer was at the height of his fame. With Dee Vasquez's help, a terrible accident was swept under the carpet... Ladies and gentlemen, the case currently up for trial... It began on that day, five years ago!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ironically enough, that accident precipitated Mr. Hammer's fall... His fall from stardom!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: His guilt weighed him down, no doubt.

Name: Phoenix
Text: However! You, Dee Vasquez, used Mr. Hammer. You made him work for you for petty change!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Hmph!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Bringing us to the present day... and Mr. Hammer's last role as the Evil Magistrate!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes! Undoubtedly, it was a constant source of shame for the ex-star...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmm...

Name: Judge
Text: One moment, Mr. Wright. We are talking about motives, here... yet you have only talked about Mr. Hammer. It almost seems as if... As if it was Mr. Hammer who had killed Dee Vasquez, not the other way around! What motive would Ms. Vasquez have?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Y-yes, that's right. According to what you say... I would have no reason to kill Hammer. He was a good source of income for me! And I never get rid of useful men. It's a policy of mine.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright? Please explain Ms. Vasquez's motive for murder.

Name: Phoenix
Text: She had no motive, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: What's that now!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It was Mr. Hammer who was out for blood! All Ms. Vasquez did was push him off the stairs... in self defense!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What's that now!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's simple! Mr. Hammer was intending to kill Ms. Vasquez!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wha-!? WHAT!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! Jack Hammer drugged Mr. Powers with sleeping pills! Jack Hammer snuck into the dressing room and stole the Steel Samurai costume! Jack Hammer wore the costume to fool the security lady into thinking he was Powers! Then Jack Hammer made his way to the trailer! And for what purpose, you ask? To kill Dee Vasquez, who had so cruelly taken advantage of him all those years!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you did do it, didn't you?

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... Yes. I am guilty. It was me...

Name: Vasquez
Text: Congratulations, Mr. Wright. I lose... again.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth... Where's Dee Vasquez?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: In the waiting lobby, Your Honor. As calm and collected as ever...

Name: Judge
Text: I see... Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: It appears you have brought about yet another miracle.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... thank you, Your Honor.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I think not, Your Honor. Will Powers was innocent. That he should be found so is only natural... not a miracle.

Name: Judge
Text: ... Yes. Yes, you're right. Very well. This court finds the defendant, Mr. Will Powers...

Name: Judge
Text: Not Guilty

Name: Judge
Text: That is all. The court is adjourned!

Name: Will
Text: I... I dont know what to say! Thank you so much!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Im just glad youre okay.

Name: Will
Text: Yes... but... it's sad. I know now that Mr. Hammer stole my costume. It's bad enough that he wanted to kill Ms. Vasquez... But to think that he tried to frame me for the murder! It makes me sad... Tell me why, Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-huh?

Name: Will
Text: Tell me! Why did Mr. Hammer want to blame me...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, this is what I think. Mr. Hammer wanted to put the blame on you because...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's because you were the Steel Samurai.

Name: Will
Text: Because I was the Steel Samurai?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Hammer was a big star, once. But he was reduced to acting in a kids' show... and as the villain, to boot! The kids love the Steel Samurai. And so, he hated you.

Name: Will
Text: I... I think I understand. H-he could have just told me. I would have changed places with him any time!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I think youre missing the point...)

Name: Will
Text: ... Thank you. I'm just glad it's all over.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So am I... so am I...)

Name: Maya
Text: Congratulations, WP!

Name: Will
Text: Oh? Oh! Heh heh. Thanks to you, I'll be able to don the Steel Samurai outfit once more! I can't wait to get back into that sweaty costume and... ...? Is... something wrong?

Name: Maya
Text: N-no! O-of course not... Aah! N-Nick! Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Say something, Wright. I'm not good at small talk.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? What? ... Umm... that was too bad, Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You don't waste any time gloating, do you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No... I really wanted to thank you. Vasquez would have gotten away if you hadn't stepped in.

Name: Will
Text: Ah, uh, pleased to meet you. I'm Powers. *sniff*

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ah, er, Edgeworth. I'm a big fan of your work, Mr. Powers.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Liar!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Wright. I must say, I hadn't expected to meet you again after all these years.

Name: Maya
Text: Meet "again"...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: However. In retrospect, it would have been better had we not met. Thanks to you, I am saddled with unnecessary... feelings.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Unnecessary feelings?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes. Unease... and uncertainty.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Arent those kind of necessary?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: They only serve to get in my way. You listen to me, Phoenix Wright. Don't ever show your face in front of me again. That's what I came here to tell you.

Name: Will
Text: Umm... Mr. Wright? Is... this guy your friend?

Name: Maya
Text: What? Friends? As if! Theyre rivals! Rivals! Right, Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: For now we are... I guess.

Name: Maya
Text: Huh!? Why do I get the feeling I'm missing something? C'mon, Nick! Tell me! Whats the deal with you and Edgeworth?

Name: Phoenix
Text: And so the curtain closes on another trial... I caused quite a stir by revealing that accident from five years ago. It was the talk of the town. Thankfully, Global Studios rethought its programming change. They went back to making kids' shows again.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! This is it! The new show starts today! You're going to watch it with me, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'll admit, I was kind of surprised... I didn't think they'd seriously go through with it...)

Name: Maya
Text: You have to buy trading cards too, okay! We have to trade with Cody and that assistant!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Fine, fine. I'll do it.

Name: Maya
Text: Isn't it great that WP gets to play the lead again? I wonder if they'll show his real face this time...

Name: Phoenix
Text: I dunno... I don't think the world is ready for the real Will Powers...

Name: Maya
Text: Hey, hey, Nick! Do you know if there's any good waterfalls around here?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Waterfalls...? Dare I ask why?

Name: Maya
Text: Duh, Nick! Isn't it obvious? I need a waterfall to stand under! Preferably a freezing one!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Oh... Is that part of your spirit medium training?

Name: Maya
Text: Of course! Except, I've been slacking off lately... I need to brave the elements and be forged anew under the rushing spring waters!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Umm... Okay... I don't know about any falls per se, but Gourd Lake is pretty close...

Name: Maya
Text: Oh. Darn.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry, but them's the breaks. Couldn't you just take a cold shower or something?

Name: Maya
Text: ... Good idea!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So much for the rushing spring waters...)

Name: TV
Text: Next in the news... A large, unidentified animal was sighted at Gourd Lake! The town is buzzing with excitement! Locals are calling it "Gourdy" in a tip of the hat to Nessie, the Loch Ness monster. Though its namesake, Nessie, proved to be a hoax... locals are confident their Gourdy is the real deal. ...

Name: Phoenix
Text: *yawn* Bor-ing. Can't they show real news for a change?

Name: Maya
Text: Nick?

Name: Maya
Text: The water pressure's kind of low in that shower.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... You want more pressure, huh? Why don't you go down to the fire department and have them spray you with the hose?

Name: Maya
Text: ... Good idea, Nick!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Apparently, E.S.P. is no aid in detecting sarcasm...)

Name: TV
Text: We interrupt this program to bring you a special news bulletin! Strange occurrences continue at Gourd Lake... But this time, it's murder!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Gourd Lake again?)

Name: TV
Text: The body of a man was found in the lake early this morning. A suspect was apprehended. Sources inside the police department revealed... that the suspect's name is Miles Edgeworth, age 24. Edgeworth was an up-and-coming prosecution attorney, known for his skill and connections. He was guaranteed a long and rewarding career... has he thrown it all away?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (...? E-Edgeworth!?) What's going on!? Edgeworth would never do something like--

Name: Maya
Text: Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yipes! M-Maya!

Name: Maya
Text: The fireman yelled at me when I called him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: We've got bigger things to worry about than that! They arrested Edgeworth!

Name: Maya
Text: What? You mean, the prosecutor?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, he's a suspect... in a murder!

Name: Maya
Text: Whaaaaat!? When? Where? Whom? Why? How?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I-I don't know!

Name: Maya
Text: Let's go find out, Nick!

Name: Maya
Text: You know, Nick... We've all been in here one time or another, haven't we?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I guess it comes with the territory.

Name: Maya
Text: I'm not sure it's something we should mention to too many people... Aah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Hey! Edgeworth! Come back!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What are you doing here!?

Name: Maya
Text: Nick, I don't think he's in a very good mood.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, he is in detention. Were you in a good mood when you were here?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So, you've come to laugh at the fallen attorney? Then laugh, laugh! Well? Why aren't you laughing?

Name: Maya
Text: Nick... Should we be laughing?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Nah. It's a trick. Laugh and he'll get mad... or burst into tears. Edgeworth. We don't have so much free time we can spend it coming down here to laugh at you.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Yes you do.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Actually, he's right.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I hoped you wouldn't come. I didn't want you to see me. Not like this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hey, I didn't want to see you either, believe me.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth. Tell me what happened.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Why should I? What are you going to do about it?

Name: Maya
Text: Duh! We're going to help you, that's what!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ...! ... Help me? You? Don't be ridiculous.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You're a novice! You've only been in three trials!

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-hey!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Sure, you got lucky and won all three... But your luck's bound to run out some day! You need real skill, Wright. Experience!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! He's insulting you! Nick? Why am I always the one who has to get angry!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murder took place at Gourd Lake, correct?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes... late last night.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The lake is a long way away from your offices and the court... Why were you down there?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I see no need to tell you.

Name: Maya
Text: M-Mr. Edgeworth! You... you didn't really...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Gourdy.

Name: Maya
Text: Huh?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I went to see Gourdy.

Name: Maya
Text: "Gourdy"? What's that!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'll... tell you later. (Why won't Edgeworth talk to us?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your attorney's badge...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth. Let me defend you.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Hah! Hah hah! Good one, Wright. But I'm not that hard up. Not yet.

Name: Maya
Text: Wh-what do you mean by that?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Me? Trust a wet-behind-the-ears lawyer with only three trials under his belt? Never!

Name: Maya
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: My case is near hopeless, Wright. Every defense attorney I've talked to has turned me down.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Simply put, they were afraid they'd lose. It occurred to me that it might be my fault that they lack confidence. After all, I did get every single one of their clients declared "guilty."

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't believe it!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Regardless, I don't want you involved in this. You in particular I cannot ask to do this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth... this is really hard for me to ask... But... you didn't do it, right? Right?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Think what you will. I have only one request.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Stay out of this case.

Name: Maya
Text: Why!? B-but Nick is trying to help you!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I know...! I know that! But I don't want your help, okay?

Name: Maya
Text: !!! Why not?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Look, just go away, and leave me alone!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick... Mr. Edgeworth did it, didn't he.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maya! Let's go investigate elsewhere.

Name: Maya
Text: But, Nick...

Name: Maya
Text: This is where it happened?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah. Gourd Lake is in the middle of this park.

Name: Maya
Text: I can see some police walking around in there.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Questioning people, probably.

Name: Maya
Text: Hey! Isn't that Detective Gumshoe over there?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, pal!? There's enough of us here! Anyone found anything?

Name: Police
Text: S-sorry, sir... Nothing.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Idiot! The trial's tomorrow! We need clues, on the double!

Name: Police
Text: B-but, sir... There weren't any clues... that's why we arrested that attorney, Mr. Edgeworth! It's clear, sir. He's the one who--

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Shaddup! Just you try saying that again! I'll... er... I'll make you sorry if you do! I mean... just, get outta my face, pal!

Name: Police
Text: Y-yes, sir!

Name: Maya
Text: Detective Gumshoe's kinda scary today!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Recruits... peh! ... Aah!

Name: Maya
Text: Eek!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey, you're that Harry guy! Harry Butz!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wright! Phoenix Wright! (Will he ever learn my name!?)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: And just what are you doing here, pal? Investigating!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Um, well, yes. I suppose.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, I'm here to help! Ask me anything you want! Bring it!

Name: Maya
Text: He seems different than usual. I wonder what's up? Umm... Mr. Edgeworth hasn't actually asked us to defend him yet...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Huh!? Oh? Y-you don't say...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe? Do you know what happened here?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Huh? You don't know, pal?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Wow, okay, Mr. head-in-the-fluffy-pink-clouds Lawyer.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Head-in-the... huh?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Never mind, I'll tell you. It happened last night, about 15 minutes after midnight. There was a boat out on Gourd Lake. In that boat were two men. One of those men shot the other with a pistol.

Name: Maya
Text: And... the shooter was Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: A cop who arrived on the scene arrested him.

Name: Maya
Text: How did he get there so fast?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well... There was a witness. When the report came in, we raced to the lake.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A witness?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Who was this witness?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Er, sorry, pal. That's confidential. Anyway, the witness saw everything, apparently. I'm sure they'll turn up at the trial tomorrow.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Was there only that one witness?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yep. It was pretty cold out on the lake last night. And, it was Christmas Eve after all. Still, we're being thorough. You never know when you're going to turn up another witness. That's why we're here today, checking things out. So far, we're coming up empty...

Name: Maya
Text: Oh! It's Christmas today! I'd forgotten. What are you getting me for Christmas, Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Talk to Santa.

Name: Maya
Text: I-is it true? No one will take Mr. Edgeworth's case?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yeah... He's a bit of a celebrity. If you defended him, and lost, your reputation'd be sure to suffer. What's more... The case against him is... well, it's pretty solid.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I suppose it would be if they have a witness.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey! Pal! Don't tell me your going to turn your back on him too!? Remember the Steel Samurai! Mr. Edgeworth helped you get your client declared innocent!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... I know. I went to Edgeworth. I tried. He really doesn't want us to represent him. Especially not us, he said.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What!? W-well, that doesn't make any sense, pal! You should have heard him talking about you after the Steel Samurai case! He kept saying "Wright, Wright, Wright" over and over.

Name: Maya
Text: ... Nick? I'm not sure that's a good sign.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Neither am I...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Why wouldn't he want your help? I don't get it.

Name: Police
Text: Detective Gumshoe, sir!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What? Find something!?

Name: Police
Text: Um, no, sir. Not yet. But there was a call from the precinct. They want to hold an investigation briefing...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: A briefing? Right! I'm off! Oh... Sorry, pal. I guess you heard. I gotta go. Any last things you want to ask me about before I head back?

Name: Maya
Text: Well, yes. Do you have any information on the victim...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Sorry... They haven't worked up the autopsy report yet. I'm still waiting for it myself. Actually... Say, if you get the time, drop by the precinct! We can talk more there, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You're not coming back, Detective?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Erm... Probably not, pal.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, what should we do if we have something to talk to you about...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Ah, right. Here, I'll show you how to get to the precinct. Come down and see me anytime.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, hey! Detective Gumshoe!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: W-what!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, we'd like to take a look around in the park. Can we walk around?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yeah! No problem, pal. You got my permission.

Name: Maya
Text: You know, Nick. I think there's something to be said for talking to people when they're busy.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah. They don't have time to think about not giving you information...

Name: Maya
Text: Right! Now, let's get investigating!

Name: Maya
Text: Wowsers! This is "Gourd Lake"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yup. I'm not sure it warrants a "wowsers," though.

Name: Maya
Text: Hmm. Probably not. But hey, look at that snack stand!

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Samurai Dogs"...?

Name: Maya
Text: I wanna Samurai Dog! Please! I bet they're great!

Name: Phoenix
Text: With a name like Samurai Dog, how could they not be?

Name: Maya
Text: They're a little behind the times, though. The kids are all into "The Pink Princess" now. I mean, like, y'know!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Nope.)

Name: Maya
Text: Huh. Someone left one of those poppers here. You know, you pull the string...

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...and it goes "pop." Yeah, I know the ones. You see them a lot around New Year's.

Name: Maya
Text: Hey, Nick! It might be a clue! Let's take it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: C'mon, admit it. You just want to pop it, right?

Name: Maya
Text: Was it that obvious?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A popper... hmm.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: I suppose it couldn't hurt to take it. Huh? Where'd it go?

Name: Maya
Text: I already put it in my pocket.

Name: Maya
Text: I like it here, Nick. Look... someone's camping!

Name: Phoenix
Text: They've got guts, camping at the scene of a murder.

Name: Maya
Text: Hey, hey, Nick! If they were camping here last night, they might know about the murder!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's true...) Good call, Maya. Let's go talk to them.

Name: Maya
Text: Hey, Nick. Check out this camera!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah... what's with the big mic and that box on top, I wonder? It looks like some sort of automatic system for taking a photo when a noise is heard.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow! Hey, let's see if it works! *cough* "Hi, I'm Nick!" ... Maybe I'm not saying it loud enough. "YO! I'M NICK!!!" ... Huh. NIIIIIIIIII......IIIIIIIIIICK!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Will you stop that?

Name: Maya
Text: I think it's broken, Nick.

Name: Phoenix
Text: D-don't kick it! (It must not be set up to respond to voices.)

Name: Maya
Text: Well what then? I know!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The party popper...?
*BANG*
klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik klik

Name: Maya
Text: ... Yep. It responded.

Name: Lotta
Text: Yaaaaaaaaaaaaaaw! Hey, you! Git yer hands offa' that!

Name: Maya
Text: Eek!

Name: Lotta
Text: What in the Sam Hill...!? Look what ya done now! There goes a whole roll of film!

Name: Maya
Text: Ah? Wha... huh? S-sorry!

Name: Lotta
Text: Sorry's nice but it don't pay my bills! Y'all know how much a roll of film costs!?

Name: Maya
Text: I-I'll pay you back!

Name: Lotta
Text: What were ya'll thinkin' settin' off a party-popper in a place like this?

Name: Maya
Text: Uh... well...

Name: Lotta
Text: What! Don't try to play stupid with me just 'cause you think I'm some country bumpkin! Yeah, I know how y'all Yanks think! "I say, those southern folks talk with that exaggerated drawl, why they must be dumb!" Well let me tell you, just because I might be dumb don't mean we all are!

Name: Maya
Text: N-Nick, help!

Name: Lotta
Text: And who are you, now? Her chaperone?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, uh, no, rather, uhh... we're sort of... friends?

Name: Lotta
Text: Jus' figure out what y'all are gonna say and say it for bejeezum's sake! Gawd, I'd rather sit through one of papa's drawls than listen to you stutter all day.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh boy... I guess we should pay her for the film...)

Name: Lotta
Text: Watch it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes ma'am. (On second thought, I'll pay later...)

Name: Maya
Text: I'm really sorry!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ummm...

Name: Lotta
Text: What!? Can't ya see I'm changin' the film on my camera here! Someone--I'm not namin' any names--but someone used up a WHOLE ROLL.

Name: Maya
Text: Sorry...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That didn't work... I wonder if I have anything to show her that would get her attention...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: I, er, this is my badge.

Name: Lotta
Text: Huh? Aren't badges supposed t' be all shiny and impressive? You a cop or something?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Umm... I'm a lawyer.

Name: Lotta
Text: Wh-what!? Y'all ain't gonna try and pull one o' them lawsuits on me over that film now? Cause I'll have you know I'm a fighter and I wrassled meaner looking' things'n you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: N-no, that's not it at all. We're here investigating a murder that took place here, on the lake.

Name: Lotta
Text: A murder...? ... Sounds cool! Why didn't y'all say that in the first place! Go ahead, ask me anything ya like!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Finally! Some cooperation!)

Name: Lotta
Text: You too. Y'all can come out of hiding now. I won't bite. Hard.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Come to think of it, where did Maya get to?)

Name: Maya
Text: S-sorry... I-I was feeling a little overwhelmed. The culture gap and all...

Name: Lotta
Text: Never you mind, honey. I kin' talk Yank for ya if... ahem... if it pleases you?

Name: Maya
Text: Th-thanks. I think I'll be okay.

Name: Lotta
Text: Great then! I'm Lotta, Lotta Hart, but y'all can call me Lotta! I'm here photographing meteor showers for a research project. Mighty pleased ta meet ya!

Name: Lotta
Text: Oh yeah, when was that murder, anyway? I ain't seen much television lately.

Name: Phoenix
Text: It happened late in the night on Christmas Eve.

Name: Lotta
Text: That so? Christmas Eve?

Name: Phoenix
Text: A man on a boat was shot... Did you see anything?

Name: Lotta
Text: Well, lemme see. A boat, ya say? I reckon I mighta seen one... not sure though. Y'all gotta remember I've been watching this here lake for a good three days now. I seen enough boats to choke a mule. Kinda hard to remember which I seen when.

Name: Maya
Text: So, what is it you do, Lotta?

Name: Lotta
Text: Huh? Me? Hah hah. Y'all don't really want to know that, do ya? Actually, I'm a research student at Country U., right in the heart of the heartland.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow! Neat! Nick! She's a research student at a university! Country U.!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... so I hear.

Name: Maya
Text: So, when did you come up here?

Name: Lotta
Text: Hmm, lemme see... I guess it was 'bout three days ago.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What are you photographing?

Name: Lotta
Text: D-didn't I tell y'all that already? Meteors! Yep, meteor showers!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Falling stars...?)

Name: Maya
Text: That's quite a camera you have there.

Name: Lotta
Text: Y'all better know it! It's German-made. A genuine Solingen!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Isn't that where they make knives...?)

Name: Maya
Text: Umm... So, what's that device you have stuck to the camera?

Name: Lotta
Text: Huh? Device?

Name: Maya
Text: It started moving all by itself when I fired my party popper...

Name: Lotta
Text: Oh that? That triggers the shutter whenever it detects certain sounds. It's programmed to pick up loud noises right now.

Name: Maya
Text: A programmable camera! Neat!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Lotta?

Name: Lotta
Text: Yeah?

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, your camera... it triggers on loud explosion noises?

Name: Lotta
Text: Ayup.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Actually, the victim in the case we're researching--he was shot with a pistol.

Name: Lotta
Text: A pistol...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right. Now wouldn't a gunshot make a similar noise to our party popper...?

Name: Lotta
Text: I guess it would.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your camera... didn't get a picture of the murder, did it?

Name: Lotta
Text: ... Hey! Y'all are pretty bright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Lotta
Text: I see what yer sayin'... Tell ya what, I'll have a look-see at my film.

Name: Phoenix
Text: It would have been a photo taken late last night...

Name: Lotta
Text: I checked 'em once, don't remember if there was anything on 'em though. But what if I got sumtin'! I could be witness to a genuine murder! Yeehaw! I'll go check that film. Y'all come back now, y'hear?

Name: Maya
Text: She went inside her SUV. I guess we should come back later...

Name: Maya
Text: ... I guess Detective Gumshoe is still in that meeting.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey! Thanks for coming down, pal!

Name: Maya
Text: Detective Gumshoe!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: We just finished the meeting. For better or for worse...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I get the feeling we're in for some bad news...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, how did the meeting go?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I can't tell you, pal! You're a lawyer!

Name: Phoenix
Text: T-true...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... Y'know... I don't know what to believe anymore. Sure, Mr. Edgeworth's human like you or me. Still... I get the feeling that if he'd done something wrong, he wouldn't go hiding it. That's just the kind of guy he is. Why can't anyone else see that?

Name: Maya
Text: So, they think that Mr. Edgeworth did it...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, the trial's starting tomorrow, as scheduled.

Name: Maya
Text: I see...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Umm... hey, in the end you did tell us about the meeting!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... Don't go telling anyone else, pal.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes, sir!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: And... do me a favor! Stand by Mr. Edgeworth! He needs help, and you're the ones to help him! I'm sure he's got some reason why he won't talk to us.

Name: Maya
Text: Thanks, Detective Gumshoe.

Name: Maya
Text: Detective Gumshoe... How come you trust Mr. Edgeworth so much?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, I'd think that was obvious. We got a strong working relationship, us two. We trust each other, and that's how it works.

Name: Maya
Text: A "working relationship"?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: See, Mr. Edgeworth always gets his defendants declared "guilty" every time. Yeah, his methods right be a little extreme at times. But... there's a reason! He trusts our investigation, see? He trusts us to get the right man! That's why I work extra hard, pal. We've got to earn that trust he places in us.

Name: Maya
Text: I see...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Mr. Edgeworth is a man you can trust... And you have my word on that!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I was wondering, did you ever get that autopsy report?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, that? Yeah, I made a copy for you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thank you.

Name: Maya
Text: ...Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Maya
Text: Can you show me that photo of the victim? ... That face...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Someone you know?

Name: Maya
Text: I... I don't know. I just have this feeling that I met him somewhere a long time ago. ...

Name: Phoenix
Text: What is it?

Name: Maya
Text: Oh. Nothing... just, something's been bothering me. ... Could you show me that autopsy report once more? ... ... ... Hey! I-I remember now! This guy! This is a lawyer that was at that office Mia worked at! I met him once when I went there to hang out with Sis!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That office...? Wait! You mean Grossberg's office?

Name: Maya
Text: Right! That guy!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That was the last name I expected to come up... Maybe I should go talk to him... for old time's sake.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's been a while since I was here last. Mr. Grossberg is out as usual.

Name: Maya
Text: Hey, Nick. Look at the wall.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That painting is still missing... Mia must have known about the deal with Mr. Grossberg and Redd White... She kept track of all of White's extortion and blackmail rackets.)

Name: Lotta
Text: Hey y'all!

Name: Maya
Text: Lotta!

Name: Lotta
Text: Wait up a sec! We got bingo!

Name: Maya
Text: Bingo...?

Name: Lotta
Text: My automatic camera took two pictures last night!

Name: Maya
Text: Hey!

Name: Lotta
Text: This is them. Take a look!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait...!

Name: Lotta
Text: See? See? He's shooting him with that pistol!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I-it looks like that, yes.

Name: Maya
Text: But you can't really tell who that is shooting.

Name: Lotta
Text: Yeah, well there was enough fog out there last night t' strangle a bullfrog. But, y'know... Seeing these photos reminded me of something.

Name: Maya
Text: What...?

Name: Lotta
Text: I saw the murder happen. I'm a witness!

Name: Maya
Text: Whaaaaaaa!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: A-are you serious!?

Name: Lotta
Text: Course!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (How do you forget... never mind.)

Name: Lotta
Text: Y'all reckon I should tell the cops?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... reckon so!

Name: Lotta
Text: What's that? Now don't y'all go tryin' to mock my accent! I'm a sensitive lady!

Name: Lotta
Text: Hey, so, I'm off to talk to the cops. Y'all can have this photo. Later.

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-w-wait! Lotta!

Name: Lotta
Text: What? Can't y'all see I'm kinda busy?

Name: Phoenix
Text: T-tell us what you saw, too! Please?

Name: Lotta
Text: Nice try, honey, but I wasn't born yesterday. I'm a witness, and that means I'm on the side of justice, and that means the cops! I'd sooner eat the south side of a north-bound skunk than tell you!

Name: Maya
Text: L-Lotta!

Name: Lotta
Text: Don't let it get your skivvies in a bunch. Friends today, enemies tomorrow! Or was that the other way round? No matter. I'm gone! Hey! Maybe they'll let me do some testifying! Hot darn!

Name: Maya
Text: She left... ... Well, that's one more witness. What do we do now, Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, if she saw something, there's not much we can do about it. The question is: what exactly did she see...? I guess we'll find out in the trial tomorrow.)

Name: Maya
Text: Looks like the police have given up their questioning.

Name: Butz
Text: Hey!

Name: Maya
Text: Aah! N-Nick! I think Santa's mad at you!

Name: Butz
Text: Long time no see, Nick.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick... you know Santa!? Wow... Nick and St. Nick... Hey! I see the connection!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Don't be ridiculous!

Name: Butz
Text: Dude, it's me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: L... Larry! What are you doing here!?

Name: Butz
Text: Isn't it obvious? I'm working my day job! I sell Samurai Dogs! Want one? Gotta get money for dates, you know, My girl Kiyance deserves the best!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (K-Kiyance...? Not another model, I hope...)

Name: Butz
Text: Oh, Kiyance's a fine, fine woman, Nick. It was her idea that I wear this costume! She was all "You go girlfriend!" Y'know? She bought this costume for me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That... that's great, Larry.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow! A Santa costume! She must be really nice!

Name: Butz
Text: Whoa! Cute! Nick! Who's she? She's not your...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Not my... what? N-no, she's not!

Name: Maya
Text: I'm his partner, Maya Fey. I'm, uh, the little sister.

Name: Butz
Text: Sister...? ... Wow, Nick, must be tough. Working nine to five, having to take care of a little sister...

Name: Maya
Text: N-no, I'm not Nick's sister, I'm my older sister's little sister...

Name: Butz
Text: Huh. Sounds great!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Don't worry, Maya, he's not listening...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey, Larry. There was a murder here last night... You work here. Have you heard anything?

Name: Maya
Text: Nick, you're wasting your time. Last night was Christmas Eve! He was with Kiyance, obviously! He wouldn't have been standing out here in the cold!

Name: Butz
Text: Oof!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think what you just said caught him off guard, Maya.

Name: Butz
Text: N-no, it's just... Kiyance's not in town right now. She... she's in Hawaii on a photo shoot.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A model. I knew it.) Well, anyway, there was a murder here on the lake. The trial's tomorrow.

Name: Butz
Text: Huh. Neat.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defendant is Edgeworth. Miles Edgeworth.

Name: Maya
Text: Um, Nick? Why would Larry know Edgeworth...?

Name: Butz
Text: Whoa, Nick! You don't mean THAT Miles Edgeworth!? Old Edgey!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah. He's a murder suspect.

Name: Butz
Text: Wh-whoa! Murder?

Name: Maya
Text: Huh? You know Mr. Edgeworth, Larry?

Name: Butz
Text: Yeah! Of course! Edgey was in the same class as us in grade school!

Name: Maya
Text: Whaaaaaaaaat!?

Name: Maya
Text: So, Mr. Edgeworth was your classmate, Larry?

Name: Butz
Text: Yeah, Nick, him, and I used to hang out all the time.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow... I never knew.

Name: Butz
Text: Don't get me wrong. He's always been kind of a stick in the mud. Studying all the time, trying to "be like father."

Name: Maya
Text: Like his father...?

Name: Butz
Text: Yeah. Edgey's pop was a famous defense lawyer back in the day.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow. Wait... You said "defense lawyer"?

Name: Butz
Text: Yeah.

Name: Maya
Text: Wait a second! But Mr. Edgeworth is a prosecuting attorney!

Name: Butz
Text: What? Edgey's got a proboscis on his knee!?

Name: Maya
Text: No, no--he's a "prosecuting attorney." That's like the total opposite of a defense lawyer!

Name: Butz
Text: ... Huh. Go figure! He always used to talk about defending the "weak" who were "unable to defend themselves." Man, he used to go on and on about man's duty to society and all that. What a bore! I wonder that changed his mind, though? Do you know, Nick?

Name: Maya
Text: Nick...?

Name: Maya
Text: Umm... umm... tell me about the dogs!

Name: Butz
Text: Huh? Oh, you mean the Samurai Dogs?

Name: Maya
Text: W-why are they Samurai Dogs? I... I mean they kind of look gourd-shaped.

Name: Butz
Text: Oh, well originally, they were Gourd Dogs! Y'know, like "guard dogs"?

Name: Maya
Text: Ouch...

Name: Butz
Text: The Samurai thing was Kiyance's idea. Oh, she's my woman, y'know. She was all "change the name and you go girlfriend!" She made me that banner! Man, the kids can't get enough of those Samurai Dogs!

Name: Maya
Text: Err... Something about that just seems... wrong.

Name: Butz
Text: Oh, and guess what? We're getting a ton of customers here at the lake, what with the big news!

Name: Maya
Text: The "big news"...?

Name: Butz
Text: Yeah! Gourdy!

Name: Maya
Text: G-"Gourdy"...?

Name: Maya
Text: Umm... what's "Gourdy"?

Name: Butz
Text: Huh? You mean you don't know? It's here, in this very lake! A giant, mysterious monster! Gourdy!

Name: Maya
Text: A... monster?

Name: Butz
Text: Yeah. Check it out. This is an article from yesterday's newspaper. There's a photo!

Name: Maya
Text: Wow! It's r-really real! Nick! A monster! A real monster!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Umm... yeah. (It's probably just a log or something... right?) Hey... there's a quote here from the person who took the photo. Hmm? What's this? "I set the camera to automatic, and when we got into the frame... I heard a loud 'bang'! Like an explosion... followed by the sound of something slipping into the water..."

Name: Maya
Text: I wish I could have seen it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Why would there be a sound like an explosion...?) Larry. Could I borrow this article from you?

Name: Butz
Text: Sure, no problem. That'll be one million dollars!

Name: Maya
Text: O-one million...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Grow up, Larry.)

Name: Maya
Text: ... Not a Gumshoe in sight.

Name: Police
Text: If you're looking for Detective Gumshoe, he's in the questioning room. Apparently, an important witness turned up. He'll be in there for a while.

Name: Maya
Text: Lotta Hart... it has to be.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh oh...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph... Who would have thought there'd be a photo...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth... Did you shoot him?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... What do you think, Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't think you're the kind to point a gun at anyone, no.

Name: Maya
Text: So you didn't shoot him?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No, I didn't. It wasn't me.

Name: Grossberg
Text: *Ah-HHHHEM!*

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ah, that old familiar clearing of the throat!)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Ah hah! You're Mia's... something, are you not?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I was her understudy, yes. Phoenix Wright.

Name: Grossberg
Text: Ah hah! And you, you're Mia's... something too, are you not?

Name: Maya
Text: Her little sister, yes!

Name: Grossberg
Text: You've grown! You've come to look a lot like your sister, you know? It takes me back. "Ahh... the days of my youth... like the scent of fresh lemon..." you see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, Mr. Grossberg, sir?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Hmm...? Ah, yes. I beg your pardon. Of course you came here to discuss something. What is it then? Something the matter?

Name: Phoenix
Text: There was a murder last night...

Name: Grossberg
Text: A murder?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You haven't heard...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: I, er, just got up, you see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, Miles Edgeworth shot someone with a pistol.

Name: Grossberg
Text: Edgeworth!? What!? W-who!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, the identity of the victim is still unknown.

Name: Grossberg
Text: T-this is terrible news indeed!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess he hadn't heard anything...)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Hmm? Strange... I feel as though I've seen this man somewhere before! ... Aaaaaaaaaaaaah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you remember!?

Name: Grossberg
Text: He was a lawyer! Here, in my office! That's Hammond! Robert Hammond!

Name: Maya
Text: Mr. Hammond...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: And you say this is the man Miles Edgeworth shot?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Who is this Hammond guy, anyway?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Mr. Hammond... He was the defense attorney in that case...

Name: Phoenix
Text: "That case"...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Yes, the "DL-6 Incident."

Name: Phoenix
Text: "DL-6"...? (Why does that sound so familiar?)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Perhaps you remember?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'm sure someone mentioned it during the trial for Mia's murder.)

Name: Grossberg
Text: That was the incident where the police were so at a loss they used a spirit medium.

Name: Maya
Text: ...! Wait... you don't mean? Was that medium my mother?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Yes, my dear. The spirit medium, Misty Fey, your mother, contacted the spirit of the victim. But... the case was a loss. No conviction was made.

Name: Grossberg
Text: The DL-6 Incident, yes... Happened 15 years ago. A very strange case, indeed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: They never caught the criminal, right?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Correct. Misty Fey used her powers to talk to the spirit of the late victim. Her testimony led to charges being laid against one man. But Mr. Hammond won the case and the suspect was declared innocent.

Name: Maya
Text: ... And the police blamed my mother, calling her a fraud. You were the one who helped her out then, right, Mr. Grossberg?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Er... y-yes. Yes, quite.

Name: Maya
Text: Thank you!

Name: Grossberg
Text: N-no... please. D-don't mention it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (DL-6... Never thought I'd hear that name again...)

Name: Maya
Text: But wait... What does this case have anything to do with Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Grossberg
Text: It has everything to do with Mr. Edgeworth, my dear! The victim in the DL-6 Incident was none other than his father, Gregory Edgeworth!

Name: Maya
Text: Wh-what!? His father!?

Name: Grossberg
Text: ... If you want to know more, you should ask him yourself.

Name: Grossberg
Text: Show him this... I'm sure he'll talk to you.

Name: Maya
Text: Wait... This is a photograph of my mother!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What's this? I was hoping you'd gotten my message the first time.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth, what about your defense?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ...! It's no concern of yours.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Guess he hasn't found anyone yet.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Can I ask you about the murder?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wright. I'll ask you again, just leave me alone.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Please try to understand. I'm not doing this to prove I'm tough, or because I look down on you. I just don't want you anywhere near this case. Understand?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did you go to Gourd Lake?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I have no intention of telling you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Nor, apparently, would you tell Detective Gumshoe.

Name: Maya
Text: Detective Gumshoe was really worried about you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's only been a matter of hours since you last visited. Yet you've made incredible progress in your investigation. I'll admit it, I'm impressed, Wright. You were always single-minded in your work, though. Once you start on something, you always see it through, don't you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: About the "DL-6 Incident"...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Right... DL-6. I didn't want you to find out about it. That is why I refused your offer to defend me. I'm sorry if it sounded like I thought you weren't up to the job. I just wanted to keep you away from DL-6.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... do you still think it would have been better for me to stay away?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I don't know. But... I see no point in hiding anything from you now. Very well. Ask whatever you like, and I will answer to the best of my abilities.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The "DL-6 Incident"... was when my father died. Right before my eyes... He was shot and killed, and I saw it all.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: My memories from that time are... foggy. I suppose it's a self-defense mechanism. In any case, a suspect was arrested... a man. It's pretty clear he was the only one who could have killed my father. The spirit medium they used to talk to my late father said the same thing. It was an attorney by the name of Robert Hammond that cleared the suspect's name.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And Hammond... is the victim in the Gourd Lake murder?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Correct.

Name: Maya
Text: Umm... That spirit medium... that was my mom.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What? You mean you're...? ... It's strange. I thought that terrible incident was about to end, and now... this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "About to end"?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The DL-6 Incident happened 15 years ago. 15 years ago... on December 28.

Name: Maya
Text: December 28?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The statute of limitations on the case runs out in three days.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!?

Name: Maya
Text: Um, Nick? What odes that mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: When a case's statute of limitations runs out, legally, the case never happened.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Three days from now, DL-6 will be closed... forever.

Name: Maya
Text: What happened to the suspect? The one who got off innocent?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I don't know... He disappeared from public view. Nobody knows where to. If he's still alive, he'd be about 50 years old now.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess I can understand why he'd go into hiding... It'd be hard to live a normal life after being a murder suspect in such a big case.)

Name: Maya
Text: Umm... so, was your father a lawyer?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He was... Gregory Edgeworth. He was quite famous at the time, apparently.

Name: Maya
Text: So, you were sort of trying to follow in his footsteps.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I'd rather not talk about it.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Wright.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It pains me to ask you this now...

Name: Maya
Text: I know! You want us to defend you!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes... Will you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ah, who could have guessed this day would come?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Not me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is my chance to finally pay you back.

Name: Maya
Text: Pay him back...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Pay me back? For what? I don't remember ever doing anything for you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Never mind... I guess you don't really need to know.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Huh... My letter of request. Please give it to Detective Gumshoe.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, I guess we should... ... W-what's that!?

Name: Maya
Text: E-earthquake! Nick! It's a big one! Whaaaaa! I-it's calming down... ... Whew... that was scary!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...? Huh? Where's Edgeworth?

Name: Maya
Text: ... There. He's on the floor in a ball, shivering. I guess he doesn't do so well with earthquakes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I've heard of running, but curling up in a ball?)

Name: Maya
Text: Well, I guess we're done. Mr. Edgeworth doesn't seem like he's going to stand up any time soon. Let's go, Nick.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh.. right. We have to give Edgeworth's letter of request to Detective Gumshoe.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What's going on here!?

Name: Maya
Text: Eek!

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-what's wrong, Detective?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: This wild lady comes in here just a while ago... Says she came "to talk to y'all after hearing what Mr. Wright had to say"! What's this all about, pal!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Lotta Hart...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Why are you going around finding more witnesses!? You want to give Mr. Edgeworth the death sentence, pal!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: N-no, not at all... Just... I mean, she did see something. There's nothing I can do about that. I can't go around covering up evidence!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Er... You trying to say something about the way I do my job?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... what did Ms. Hart say?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: She says she saw Mr. Edgeworth fire the pistol.

Name: Maya
Text: What!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: She even had a photograph to prove it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right. I saw it too... But you really can't tell from the photo who it is shooting.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's why she said she's going to enlarge the photo. She said "it'll drop the quality a mite, but should let us see who's who!"

Name: Maya
Text: She can do that!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Okay, so there's going to be an enlarged photograph that shows Edgeworth in the act. Great. Just great.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: In any case, she's going to be the one testifying tomorrow.

Name: Maya
Text: Huh? What happened to the other witness?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well... Apparently, there was a cancellation.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A "cancellation"...!?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look what I got.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... Hey, you did it, pal! Glad I waited till the last minute to file those papers! I'll rip 'em up and start new ones for you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thanks, Detective. Well, see you in court tomorrow, then.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Good luck, pal.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey! You guys feel that earthquake a little while back? I was worried!

Name: Maya
Text: Worried? We're fine! I've lived out here my whole life. I'm pretty used to them by now.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, I wasn't worried about you two. I was worried about Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh, right...) He did seem to over-react a little, now that you mention it.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yeah, well, I'm not surprised. It was a pretty big quake. I'm going to go check on him. You two go eat and get your rest for tomorrow's trial. Later!

Name: Maya
Text: ... I wonder what it is with Mr. Edgeworth and earthquakes?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I wonder... He was never that scared of them when he was in school.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Then again, I was only in the same class as him for 4th grade. He transferred to another school after that. I wonder what happened to Edgeworth...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Karma...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That's right, Manfred von Karma. He's the best prosecutor there is. He hasn't lost a case in his 40-year career. He is a god of prosecution, Wright! A god!

Name: Maya
Text: Not a single case?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He'll do anything to get a guilty verdict, anything.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hmm. Sounds like someone else I know, Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. You don't understand. I mean he'll really do anything. Manfred von Karma is a man to be feared.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's quite a claim coming from someone who forges evidence...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He taught me what it really means to "prosecute."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Just picture a prosecutor as vicious as me... multiplied by a factor of ten.

Name: Maya
Text: Ugh... So... so was he your teacher, then, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Something like that...

Name: Maya
Text: And now he's trying to get you found guilty!? What a creep! Oh, wait... Maybe he's planning on losing on purpose to help you out.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Not a chance... He hasn't lost once in 40 years. 40 years! He's as ruthless as me, times twenty!

Name: Maya
Text: That's pretty ruthless...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Like I said. He's a god among prosecutors.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess that's something like Mia was to me. Speaking of Mia...) Um, Maya?

Name: Maya
Text: Uh huh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: We could really be using Mia's help right now... don't you think?

Name: Maya
Text: Oh...

Name: Maya
Text: I can't. Sorry. I tried, I really tried, but I couldn't reach.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You couldn't "reach"?

Name: Maya
Text: I think it's because I haven't been training. My powers are weak again...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh man, what bad timing!

Name: Maya
Text: I'm really sorry. I'll try my best!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I hope so!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What are you whispering about?

Name: Phoenix
Text: O-oh, it's nothing. Well, it's time. Let's head in...

Name: Judge
Text: Court is now in session for the trial of Mr. Miles Edgeworth.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Err, Mr. von Karma? Is the prosecution ready?

Name: Karma
Text: ... Fool... You seriously think that I would stand here were I not completely prepared?

Name: Judge
Text: R-right, my apologies!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He's even got the Judge scared!)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, your opening statement, please.

Name: Karma
Text: ... Decisive evidence... A decisive witness... What else could possibly be required?

Name: Judge
Text: Ah... er, nothing of course. That should be fine. The prosecution may call its first witness.

Name: Maya
Text: What's with this guy? Is he royalty or something?

Name: Phoenix
Text: How am I supposed to fight against this!?

Name: Karma
Text: I call the detective in charge of this case, Detective Dick Gumshoe.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Okay, Gumshoe's first... Let's see how this goes.)

Name: Karma
Text: Describe the incident. Now!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-yessir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Detective Gumshoe looks nervous...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Er, please take a look at the map. The murder happened late Christmas Eve, around midnight. There was one boat in the very middle of the lake. There were two men on the boat. Now, there happened to be a woman camping here on the edge of the lake. At 12:10 AM, she heard two pistol shots. Then the boat started to move. It went towards the boat rental shop.

Name: Karma
Text: Hmm.

Name: Karma
Text: Testify to the court about your arrest. Now!

Name: Judge
Text: W-w-wait! Mr. von Karma...

Name: Karma
Text: Yes?

Name: Judge
Text: Actually, I'm the one that's supposed to be handling these proceedings...

Name: Karma
Text: Wrong. There is only one thing you need to do here. You will slam down your gavel and say the word "guilty." That is your role!

Name: Judge
Text: Y-yes, of course. You're quite right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No he's not!!!)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: A man called into the station around 30 minutes after midnight.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You received a call from a "man"?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Er... yup.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But you said there was a woman camping there? She was the one who heard the two gunshots, right?

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: That woman and the "man" who called in the report are two different people, obviously!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Different people?

Name: Karma
Text: There were two witnesses!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Urk!)

Name: Karma
Text: Their testimonies were quite similar however. Today I've summoned the woman who was camping.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The woman who was camping... Lotta Hart.)

Name: Karma
Text: What happened next, Detective?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: We headed to the scene of the crime as fast as we could.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How long was it between receiving the report and your arrival at the lake?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Er, well... I'd say it was about three minutes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's pretty fast!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Our motto for the month is "get there quick."

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Detective! You will refrain from casually revealing department secrets!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-yessir! Sorry, sir!

Name: Karma
Text: Do that, and you'll be able to look forward to your next salary review.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: So much to look forward to, these days...

Name: Karma
Text: This is no time for daydreaming! Continue!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-yessir!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's where we found Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What was Mr. Edgeworth like when you saw him then?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well... From what I saw, he looked pretty relaxed. Not like a murderer at all, really.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Detective! The court requires the facts, NOT your opinion! How many years have you been on the force!? Facts only, Detective! Hard, cold, objective facts!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-y-yessir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Man, he's got his share of objections...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Now, I didn't suspect him of anything at all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why didn't you think he was suspicious?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You should know! We have a deep, trusting relationship with the prosecutors.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Detective! The court isn't interested in your musings! "Deep"? "Trusting"? Poppycock! I've never heard so many flippant comments from an active detective on the force!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Mmph!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Detective Gumshoe doesn't look so good...)

Name: Karma
Text: Continue! Now!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: But... the next morning, a body was found in the lake.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you find any clues on the body?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: A single bullet was recovered from the body. He was shot through the heart... fatally.

Name: Karma
Text: Judge! Here's the bullet... It didn't strike bone, so its shape is well preserved.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The court accepts this bullet into evidence.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: So we had to arrest Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-why is that?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, we found the murder weapon in the boat.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murder weapon...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: A pistol.

Name: Judge
Text: Detective Gumshoe... That is a vital piece of information. Please revise your testimony.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Right! S-sorry, Your Honor.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The murder weapon we found in the boat was decisive evidence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What about the pistol made it "decisive evidence"?

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ack! He has the same evil laugh as Edgeworth...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: There were fingerprints on the pistol found in the boat. They were clear prints from Mr. Edgeworth's right hand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! So Mr. Edgeworth's fingerprints were found on the murder weapon!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-yes, Your Honor.

Name: Karma
Text: Judge! This is the weapon in question.

Name: Judge
Text: A-accepted into evidence.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick. Doesn't it seem like Detective Gumshoe is being a little vague?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I bet von Karma is feeding him lines! His testimony's probably filled with landmines just waiting for me to press.

Name: Maya
Text: What do we do?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Grit our teeth and press, I guess. What else can we do?

Name: Maya
Text: Well said, Nick! You're the man!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: A man called into the station around 30 minutes after midnight.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: We headed to the scene of the crime as fast as we could.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's where we found Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Now, I didn't suspect him of anything at all.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: But... the next morning, a body was found in the lake.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you find any clues on the body?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: A single bullet was recovered from the body. He was shot through the heart... fatally.

Name: Karma
Text: Members of the court... We now have the pistol used in the murder, and the bullet found in the body! Detective!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-y-yessir!

Name: Karma
Text: Was the bullet found in the body fired from this pistol?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yes. The ballistic markings on the bullet match the pistol.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...

Name: Maya
Text: Hey, Nick! What does he mean, "ballistic markings"?

Name: Karma
Text: Shocking! To imagine someone here does not know something as basic as ballistic markings!

Name: Maya
Text: N-Nick! He's glaring at me!

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk... very well, I'll explain. Actually, Judge! You do it.

Name: Judge
Text: Eh? M-me? ... Erm, ahem. Ballistic markings are like the "fingerprints" of a gun. The barrel leaves distinctive marks on each bullet it fires. You can examine these "ballistic fingerprints" to see which gun fired the shot. It's quite accurate.

Name: Karma
Text: Indeed. This leads to one, inevitable conclusion: the bullet found in the victim's heart... was, without a doubt, fired from this pistol. This pistol which, as you may recall, was covered with the defendant's own fingerprints!

Name: Judge
Text: O-order! Order!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is bad... This makes it look like Edgeworth did it!)

Name: Karma
Text: Well, Judge?

Name: Judge
Text: I'd say it's almost decisive, yes. Honestly, I could declare a verdict at this point. However...

Name: Karma
Text: You wish to hear the witness speak, no doubt. Very well. I am somewhat fatigued, and so I will take a brief break. I will call my witness after the recess. Which will last ten minutes. Judge!

Name: Judge
Text: Y-yes?

Name: Karma
Text: What are you doing? A ten minute recess! Now!

Name: Judge
Text: B-but, wait, I...

Name: Karma
Text: Just bang your flimsy gavel and get on with it, man!

Name: Judge
Text: Y-yes! Ahem. This court will take a ten minute recess.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Who's running this court, anyway!?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth! What's going on here!? Your fingerprints were on the murder weapon!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Uh... hmm...

Name: Phoenix
Text: And that foggy photo makes one thing clear... The only one who could have shot that man was the person in the photo!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: True...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Was that you in the boat?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Yes. It was me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But... you must believe me. I didn't shoot him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Th-then who did!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I... don't know.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You don't know!? Weren't you right there!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I heard a gunshot from very close by. Then... the other man fell from the boat. I can't say why, but... I thought, at the time, that he had shot himself!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-you mean it was a suicide!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... That's the only explanation I can come up with.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh... (How am I going to convince anyone of that!?) Say, Maya?

Name: Maya
Text: Huh? Wh-what?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Any progress with Mia?

Name: Maya
Text: Oh... Sorry. It's no good.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ugh...

Name: Maya
Text: I know... I'm no good for anything, am I, Nick? If I can't call my sister, I might as well not be here, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, of course not, I need you here! I can see you're always trying to help out. Even if you don't actually help... it's the thought that counts, right?

Name: Maya
Text: It's okay Nick, you don't have to make me feel better.

Name: Maya
Text: I don't know anything about trials, or defense... What's more, I'm a spirit medium who can't even contact spirits...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Aww, everyone has their off days! I mean, I've just been getting lucky lately... But you never know when my luck is going to run out!

Name: Maya
Text: Really...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: W-w-whoa! Wright! Don't jinx this case any worse than it already is! It's bad for my heart...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh? Oh! S-sorry... (Whoops!)

Name: Judge
Text: Court is back in session. Mr. von Karma, call your witness.

Name: Karma
Text: Yes. Will Ms. Lotta Hart take the stand?

Name: Karma
Text: Lotta Hart, you are a research student at a university?

Name: Lotta
Text: That I am.

Name: Karma
Text: Good. Begin by telling us what you saw the night of the incident. And don't add anything trivial or subjective. Understand?

Name: Lotta
Text: ... Y'all need to learn some manners.

Name: Karma
Text: UNDERSTAND?

Name: Lotta
Text: Y-yeah, I understand, I understand!

Name: Judge
Text: Er... very well. Your testimony, please.

Name: Karma
Text: Enough.

Name: Lotta
Text: Huh?

Name: Karma
Text: Judge! She happened to take a photo of the incident! This is that photo. Accept it as evidence.

Name: Judge
Text: W-well! This is a surprise! This looks like... the very moment of the murder! O-Order! I will remove you from the court if I do not have order immediately!

Name: Karma
Text: As the witness testified, she looked at the lake when she heard the shot. There were no other boats on that lake! So, the man in the boat with the victim must have been the one who shot him... Yes. It was the defendant, Miles Edgeworth!!!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order...! I will have order!

Name: Karma
Text: ... Well, Judge?

Name: Judge
Text: The evidence is... decisive. I have very little doubt about this case. Very well, this court finds the defendant...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-wait! Your Honor! I haven't cross-examined the witness yet!

Name: Karma
Text: A cross-examination? We have photographic proof! What question can there possibly be!? This photo is worth a thousand words... and they all read "guilty"! You lose. Or... Do you claim to have found a contradiction in her testimony!?

Name: Karma
Text: Very well. If you have to, you may cross-examine the witness. You will only flounder and ask meaningless questions! You will fail to find anything! And then, I will have you held in contempt of court!

Name: Maya
Text: Uh, Nick... contempt...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Contempt of court," you know?

Name: Maya
Text: I... guess I understand. Well... what are you going to do? Do you really think there was a contradiction with the facts in her testimony?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... think I noticed one little thing...

Name: Maya
Text: Wow, I'm impressed, Nick! I didn't notice anything! Right! Let's take him on!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yeah... (I got a bad feeling about this...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: I understand... I will cross-examine the witness!

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk... Very well!

Name: Judge
Text: I pray for your sake this isn't a waste of time.

Name: Lotta
Text: It was Christmas Eve, just after midnight, I reckon.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Just after midnight," you say? In other words, it was no longer Christmas Eve... but Christmas Day!

Name: Lotta
Text: Huh? Uh, yeah, well, yes.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: I know you want to find contradictions, but really!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mmmph.

Name: Judge
Text: I hope your next contradiction is a little more relevant to the trial.

Name: Lotta
Text: I was in my car.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why were you camping there, anyway?

Name: Lotta
Text: I'm a research student at my university. I was taking pictures to use in my research.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What research? This all sounds suspicious...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Hart. Could you be more specific about your "research"?

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: What does the witness's motive in camping by the lake have to do with this case!? The answer "is nothing"! I object to this line of questioning! Objection sustained!

Name: Judge
Text: W-w-wait, now, I'm the one who says that!

Name: Karma
Text: Well, then say it already!

Name: Judge
Text: Objection sustained.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Thanks for nothing, Your Honor...)

Name: Lotta
Text: I heard this "bang" come up from the lake.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you weren't looking at the lake at that time?

Name: Lotta
Text: Nope. I looked after I heard that noise.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: She's said that already! I asked you to find "contradictions"! Not leisurely chat with the witness!

Name: Lotta
Text: When I looked out the window, I saw two gents in a boat.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could you clearly see the two men?

Name: Lotta
Text: Just look at the picture! Clear enough for you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait a second! I wasn't asking you about the photo! I was asking if YOU saw the two men!

Name: Lotta
Text: Uh, yeah, well, of course...

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: The witness has testified that she saw them! There's also a photo! You'd best look elsewhere for your precious contradictions!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He jumped in quick... He's hiding something!)

Name: Lotta
Text: Then there was another "bang"...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Were you watching the very moment the shot rang out?

Name: Lotta
Text: Well, yeah, sure...

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: You're asking meaningless questions! Meaningless! "Contradictions," Mr. Wright. Not meaningless babble!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (von Karma, I think I hate you. He's trying to keep me from talking to the witness... To what end...?)

Name: Lotta
Text: There wasn't nary a thing on the lake but that boat.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you sure about that?

Name: Lotta
Text: Yeah, sure as a country gal can be!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That sounds pretty sure.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: How come you're so sure?

Name: Lotta
Text: Well, heck, I scanned the whole lake.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ("Scanned the whole lake"? It almost sounds like she was more interested in the lake than the boat...) Ms. Hart... you--

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Mr. Wright! The witness has answered the question in full.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mmph!

Name: Karma
Text: No need for further questions! Objection sustained!

Name: Judge
Text: U-uh, that's what I'm...

Name: Karma
Text: Sustained!

Name: Judge
Text: Y-yes, of course.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh great... What am I supposed to do now?)

Name: Judge
Text: Enough! I think we've heard all we need to hear, Mr. Wright. It seems you are unable to find a contradiction in the testimony worth noting.

Name: Phoenix
Text: B-but, Your Honor!

Name: Karma
Text: You keep your promise!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. I am afraid that I will have to penalize any further outbursts... By holding you in contempt of court!

Name: Karma
Text: And if that happens, you'll have to leave the courtroom immediately! Understood...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... uh huh.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick...! Lotta's testimony is fishy, Nick! Real fishy!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... know what you mean. But... If I can't say anything, what can I do?

Name: Judge
Text: I believe we've covered the evidence sufficiently to make a decision.

Name: Karma
Text: Then, pass your judgment!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Mr. Miles Edgeworth, please take the stand.

Name: Maya
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Judge
Text: Wh-who was that!?

Name: Maya
Text: It... was me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maya!)

Name: Judge
Text: I-is something wrong? D-do you need to use the facilities?

Name: Maya
Text: No, I do not! Lotta Hart! Your testimony stinks! It's unclear whether you were actually looking at the lake! It's highly doubtful that you actually say Mr. Edgeworth! Tell us the truth! This is a matter of life or death!

Name: Maya
Text: Lotta! Did you really clearly see Mr. Edgeworth that night!? Did you see him fire that pistol!?

Name: Judge
Text: You will stand down! The court does not acknowledge the defense's outburst!

Name: Maya
Text: Answer me, Lotta!

Name: Lotta
Text: What's the big idea, treating me like some kind of criminal!? I saw him! I swear it! I saw Edgeworth...

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Enough! Judge... Declare the defense in contempt of court!

Name: Judge
