Text: ... I'm sorry... It's just, when I saw the photograph, I thought that two shots had been fired. I was so certain of it. I thought I'd won! I thought there was another person, someone else who fired the killing shot. But now... I was wrong to think it could be that simple. This case has stood unsolved for fifteen years!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick...

Name: Judge
Text: Well, it seems that we have finally cleared up this incident. Only one bullet was found at the scene of the crime. That shot was fired by Miles Edgeworth.

Name: Karma
Text: Precisely.

Name: Judge
Text: I would like to ask one thing of Miles Edgeworth before passing my verdict. Have you been paying attention to the trial so far?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Do you have any objections?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No... No, I do not.

Name: Judge
Text: So you killed your father, though that was not your intention?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Yes, I did.

Name: Maya
Text: ... Oh no... He's confessing... ...

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The statute of limitations on the murder of Gregory Edgeworth runs out today. Therefore, I must pronounce a verdict on the defendant, right here...

Name: Karma
Text: Right now!

Name: Judge
Text: Indeed. Does anyone have any objections?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I've been here before... It's just like my first day in court... There are so many things I know I should be saying... But my mind's gone blank, I can't find the words...)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! I... I object!

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk. Mr. Wright, on what grounds do you object, hmm?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oof!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I... I don't know! His case is perfect!)

Name: Maya
Text: Oh no...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Grah!

Name: Mia
Text: ...it must exist...

Name: Mia
Text: ...the second bullet...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what? What did you just say?

Name: Maya
Text: N-nothing!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The second bullet must exist? But where!?)

Name: Mia
Text: ...Someone took it...

Name: Judge
Text: ... It seems waiting is not going to produce us any answers from Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait, Your Honor!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I, uh... Th-the second bullet! It, uh, it exists!

Name: Judge
Text: What!? But we've just heard proof that it did not exist!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I-I realize that, Your Honor. (I'm really grasping here!) I-it's just, someone took it from the scene of the crime! That's what happened!

Name: Judge
Text: But... Who!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Th-th-the murderer!

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: The murderer? Then tell us, just who is this "murderer"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm... still thinking about that one.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... So the criminal took the second bullet? Why would he?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Judge
Text: First of all, how would he have found it? It's not easy to find a stray bullet, Mr. Wright! Was there some pressing need for the murderer to search for that bullet?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Why would the murderer have spent the time to look for that stray bullet...? I haven't got a clue!)

Name: Judge
Text: What's wrong, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... Um...

Name: Karma
Text: Bah! The murderer had no reason to take that bullet! You don't want to admit it, but it's true!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Urk...

Name: Mia
Text: ...had to take it...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Had to take it...? The murderer? What does that mean?)

Name: Mia
Text: ...you're thinking too normal... think crazy...

Name: Mia
Text: ...don't think why the bullet was taken...

Name: Mia
Text: ...think why the bullet HAD to be taken...

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes, Your Honor! (I have no idea what I'm doing...) U-uh, well, the murderer had no intention of taking the bullet from the scene. But... uh, the murderer HAD to take that bullet.

Name: Judge
Text: "Had to," Mr. Wright? What do you mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, for instance... (For instance WHAT!?) Uh, maybe the bullet, uh... hit the murderer?

Name: Judge
Text: The bullet... hit the murderer?

Name: Phoenix
Text: J-just saying, for instance. I mean, if it hit you, you would have to take it with you, wouldn't you? It's not like you could perform surgery right there. Y-y'know?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wait a second... I was just talking off the top of my head, but what if that's really what happened?)

Name: Judge
Text: Let me get this straight. So at the time of the murder, the murderer himself was shot? And he left with the second bullet still inside!? Thus leaving only one bullet at the scene of the crime?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh, yes... I guess that's how it would work, yes.

Name: Judge
Text: But there's a problem with that! The other two people rescued from that elevator... Miles Edgeworth and Yanni Yogi were both unharmed! So that would mean...

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murderer came from outside, yes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The two men fight inside the elevator. Trying to stop them, the boy picks up the pistol at his feet and throws it. The pistol discharges, and the bullet... The bullet goes through the elevator door and hits the murderer outside! The boy loses consciousness... Then the murderer opens the elevator door and sees the men inside...

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. Mr. Wright. You are truly the most unpredictable defense attorney I've ever known. I can tell you're grasping, yet I cannot deny the possibility of what you say.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: What are you saying! Deny it! Deny it! No one involved with the incident was wounded! There was no "murderer"!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No one was wounded at the time of the incident... He's right. I can't think of anyone...)

Name: Maya
Text: Hey, Nick.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Maya
Text: I just thought of something really crazy.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Crazy?

Name: Maya
Text: Remember what Mr. Grossberg said yesterday?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Gregory Edgeworth dealt a blow to his perfect trial record.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow.

Name: Grossberg
Text: It must have been quite a shock for von Karma. He took a vacation for several months after that, you see. Yes, an unusual event for the man. That was the first, and last vacation he's taken in his many years of prosecuting.

Name: Maya
Text: What if von Karma didn't take that vacation because of shock...

Name: Phoenix
Text: But took it because he was injured!

Name: Maya
Text: Which would mean...

Name: Phoenix
Text: It could only mean one thing!

Name: Maya
Text: He was the murderer in the DL-6 Incident!

Name: Phoenix
Text: He was the man who shot Gregory Edgeworth!

Name: Maya
Text: It was... von Karma!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh man!)

Name: Judge
Text: Something wrong, Mr. Wright? You seem... dazed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh, n-no, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Well? You have indicated the possibility that the murderer came from outside. Can you give us the name of your suspect?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh. Should I come out and say it now!?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! There is a suspect... one lone suspect!

Name: Judge
Text: Well, this is certainly interesting news. Very well, Mr. Wright. Who is your suspect?

Name: Phoenix
Text: V-V-V... (Urk! My h-hands are shaking!)

Name: Judge
Text: V-what?

Name: Phoenix
Text: von Karma!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: von Karma!?

Name: Judge
Text: You mean, THE von Karma? The prosecutor? Sitting right there?

Name: Karma
Text: Bah.

Name: Judge
Text: You... don't object?

Name: Karma
Text: Hmph. I see no need. Why honor this ridiculous outburst with my objection?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Because you took a vacation for several months starting the day after the incident! Yet you pride yourself on a perfect record! Why would you take such a long vacation without any reason!?

Name: Karma
Text: So you're claiming that I took a vacation to heal my "injury" from the incident? Fascinating! Prove it. I would have needed surgery, no? Where did I go under the knife at, Mr. Wright!? Bring the doctor that operated on me! Have him testify!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Urk...

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! Let's find out who his doctor is!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's no use.

Name: Phoenix
Text: E-Edgeworth!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I know von Karma. Perhaps too well. He's perfect. He wouldn't leave clues. He probably didn't undergo surgery. That would leave a doctor as a witness.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Grr... Nobody's that perfect!)

Name: Maya
Text: So... so what, Nick? Did von Karma pull the bullet out by himself!? That's insane!

Name: Phoenix
Text: No... he couldn't have. You can't just pull bullets out of yourself! ... (Wait... What does that mean...? That bullet has to be somewhere! But... where?)

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk... Well, Mr. Wright! Can you produce evidence to prove that I was shot?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Alright, von Karma. I'll prove it. And I'll even use evidence... I know how you like it so much.

Name: Karma
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The evidence that proves von Karma was shot is...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: von Karma is perfect... He wouldn't risk surgery, leaving an evidence trail. So then, I ask, where is that bullet now? I think it unlikely that von Karma performed surgery on himself!

Name: Judge
Text: ...! You... you don't mean!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I do. There is the possibility that the bullet is still inside von Karma!

Name: Judge
Text: I-is that even possible? For all these years!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, there's one way to find out. We could use this metal detector! Well, von Karma? I'm going to run this over you, and see what we find.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: ... I... refuse!

Name: Judge
Text: Y-you refuse...!? But, refusing this means... You acknowledge that the bullet is still inside you? Order! Order! Order!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! The defense requests that we be allowed to use the metal detector!

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Judge! I call for a suspension of this trial! This is an invasion of privacy!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The statute of limitations runs out on this case today! It was you who said we had to end it right here, right now!

Name: Karma
Text: Mm... mmmph!

Name: Judge
Text: Enough! I permit the use of the metal detector. Mr. von Karma, you will submit yourself for testing!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! What does this mean...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't know... but we have to give it a shot!

Name: Metal Detector
Text: *beep* *beep* *beeeeeep*

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It reacted! Something's inside his right shoulder! The bullet!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Mr. von Karma...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... You! It was you!

Name: Karma
Text: ... I was afraid this would happen. And so, I remained silent.

Name: Karma
Text: Indeed, there is a bullet in my shoulder. However... it has nothing to do with this incident!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!?

Name: Karma
Text: I was shot in the shoulder long before the DL-6 Incident! I claim that the bullet in my shoulder has no relation to DL-6!

Name: Judge
Text: B-but, Mr. von Karma! Can you prove that?

Name: Karma
Text: "Prove"? I have no obligation to prove anything! It is you who must prove something here, Mr. Wright! Not I.

Name: Judge
Text: M-Mr. Wright? Well? Can you prove it? Can you prove that the bullet in von Karma's shoulder was from DL-6?

Name: Karma
Text: Of course he can't! You don't have any of the DL-6 evidence!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's because you took it out of the Records Room yesterday!)

Name: Karma
Text: With no proof, you cannot convict me of any crime! So sorry, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: No... I'm the one who's sorry, Mr. von Karma.

Name: Karma
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You were close... one day away from freedom. You see... I have proof!

Name: Karma
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Who would have thought you would have dug your own grave trying to convict Edgeworth! I can link that bullet in your shoulder to the DL-6 Incident... And here's my final proof!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Judge
Text: Th-that's... A bullet?

Name: Karma
Text: Where did you get that!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is the bullet used in the DL-6 Incident. This was taken from the heart of the victim, Mr. Gregory Edgeworth. The bullet is preserved quite nicely, with all the ballistic markings intact.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ballistic markings...

Name: Phoenix
Text: You may recall the term. It came up in the first trial, two days ago.

Name: Judge
Text: Ballistic markings are the fingerprints of a weapon. All bullets fired from a gun are marked with that weapon's unique pattern. By examining the markings, you can tell which weapon fired the bullet. It's quite accurate.

Name: Phoenix
Text: We have two bullets in our possession. One, the bullet removed from Gregory Edgeworth's heart. The other, Mr. von Karma, is the bullet buried in your shoulder. We could analyze both bullets... Then, if the markings matched... We would know that both bullets had been fired from the same gun! The very same pistol... in other words, the murder weapon that killed Gregory Edgeworth!

Name: Karma
Text: Mmmph... mmmph!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. von Karma? You will let us remove the bullet from your shoulder. Then we'll compare the ballistic markings to those on this bullet... And solve this case once and for all! Well, Mr. von Karma!?

Name: Karma
Text: Mmmrrrrrrgggh! Uuaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaargh!

Name: Karma
Text: Uaaaaarrrr... aaa...oooh. Worrrrrrrggg... aaa...oooooh...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That scream... I've heard that scream before... Wait... I know!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's that scream I heard in the elevator! Fifteen years ago... von Karma! It was you who screamed!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. von Karma?

Name: Karma
Text: Wooorrrrrrroooorrgggh Eh...Edgewoooooorrth......... ...Ehh...Edgewoooooorrth...... Only...you would... dare...defy me...!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So... it was you!

Name: Karma
Text: You and your father are my curse! Your father shamed me with a penalty on my record! And you... you left a scar on my shoulder that would never fade! I... I'll bury you! I'll bury you with my bare hands! Death! Death!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Chief Prosecutor... I am sorry.

Name: Judge
Text: von Karma! It's not like you to make this kind of error... I never would have thought that Edgeworth would be the one to catch you.

Name: Karma
Text: I... was careless.

Name: Judge
Text: I'm sorry, but you will have to be penalized. I've covered for you in the past, but not this time.

Name: Karma
Text: ...! Edgeworth!!!

Name: Karma
Text: It was a shock like none I had ever known. Me? Penalized!? It took hours for me to regain my composure. Suddenly, I found myself in the darkness... I was in the court records room. I must have wandered in there without thinking where I was going. The room was pitch black. The lights must have gone out. I went out in the hall and felt my way to the elevator. I pressed the button, and nothing happened. Then... there was a noise! I was in pain! A horrible, burning pain in my shoulder! Just then, the lights came back on. The elevator door opened before my eyes. I saw three people inside, all lying unconscious from oxygen deprivation. Much to my surprise, a pistol lay at my feet. I knew then... it was destiny. In his last moments, Gregory Edgeworth was still unconscious. He died, never knowing who had shot him. Later, he spoke through a medium, blaming Mr. Yogi. He was fooled! It was the perfect crime!

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk... Who would have thought another man would have come to open that elevator door? Judge!

Name: Judge
Text: Wh-what?

Name: Karma
Text: What are you doing!? Do your job! Bring an end to this miserable charade! Now! End it!

Name: Judge
Text: V-very well.

Name: Judge
Text: It appears that we have come a very long way to the end of this maze. Fifteen years later... Mr. Miles Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: You were innocent. You are innocent.

Name: Judge
Text: As you said, it was all a "nightmare."

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: This court finds the defendant, Mr. Miles Edgeworth...

Name: Judge
Text: Not Guilty

Name: Judge
Text: That is all. The court is adjourned!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! Nick! We did it! Did you see his face!? von Karma looked even paler than usual! He's pretending to be all cool, but inside you crushed him, Nick! Crushed! I gotta say, I'm impressed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Heh... It was pretty close, though. I was sure we'd had it.

Name: Maya
Text: I know, I was on the verge of tears the whole time, myself. But now it's all just a good memory!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, it's finally over, Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I... I'm not sure how to say this.

Name: Maya
Text: I know! I know! Try "thank you."

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I... I see. ... Th-thank you, Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-you're welcome.

Name: Maya
Text: I think you could have done better than that!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Oof! S-sorry... I'm not good at this sort of thing.

Name: Maya
Text: You got a lot to learn, Edgeworth!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Dear, dear...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Whoooooooooooooop! Amazing, pal! You pulled through just like I thought you would! I'll never forget this! I owe you one, pal. And tonight, let's party! Dinner's on me! Yeah, my salary went down again a bit this month... But who cares!

Name: Maya
Text: See, Mr. Edgeworth? You should take a lesson from Detective Gumshoe! That's how you say "thank you"!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mmm. I... I see. *ahem* Whooooooooooooop! ... I... I feel foolish.

Name: Maya
Text: Don't worry. Take it a little at a time. You'll get used to it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's been fifteen years since I've seen Edgeworth this... unguarded.)

Name: Lotta
Text: Hey, y'all!

Name: Maya
Text: Lotta!

Name: Lotta
Text: Y'all were great in there!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thank you!

Name: Lotta
Text: Yo, Edgeworth! Congrats!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Er... thank y'all very much.

Name: Lotta
Text: I knew you were innocent from the start, of course. Just look at you! You wouldn't stick your hand in the cookie jar even if no one was there!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You... were the witness on the first day of the trial, weren't you.

Name: Lotta
Text: Yeah, well, let bygones be bygones, eh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Speaking of which, what are you doing now, Lotta?

Name: Lotta
Text: Who, me? Aww, I went back to college. I gave up trying to be an investigative photographer pretty quick.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Really? That's too bad.

Name: Lotta
Text: Huh?

Name: Lotta
Text: Isn't that the hotdog guy from the park?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Butz
Text: It's over, Nick! My life is over!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-why the sad face, Larry!? What happened now!?

Name: Butz
Text: Oh, Nick... I'm not long for this world.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... you don't look sick...

Name: Butz
Text: It's Kiyance! Sh-she's goin' to live in Paris! Paris, Nick! She's leaving me behind!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Larry, Larry...)

Name: Butz
Text: Yo, Edgey! There you are!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Um, yes, here I am.

Name: Butz
Text: Congrats, Edgey! Here... a little gift from me in celebration!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Celebration? That's unusual for you.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Harry Butz! You come along tonight too! My treat, pal!

Name: Butz
Text: Huh? Uh... thanks! Looking forward to it! (Yo, yo, Nick! That's the suit that questioned me! When he says treat... that's not police-talk for prison food, right? Right?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh, I think you'll be fine, Larry.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wright...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah? What's up?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That envelope that Larry gave me. It's got money in it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, yeah. That's not that strange. People give money away to celebrate sometimes.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's $38.00, Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh. What a weird amount. I mean, it's not a little, but it's not a lot either. ... $38.00 exactly?

Name: Maya
Text: N-N-Nick! Wasn't that exactly the amount of lunch money that was stolen from Mr. Edgeworth in school!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: $38...! No... No!!! Larry, it was you!!!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What are you so surprised about, Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Larry was absent that day from school, right? But that doesn't automatically rule him out as a suspect.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Think back to that day, fifteen years ago. Larry took the day off, but he was bored, he came in to school anyway. Then he saw the money lying there... and the rest is history.

Name: Butz
Text: I never was good at History! Heh...

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Edgeworth... you didn't know, did you?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I suspected. I just couldn't picture Larry protecting you like he did that day. Everyone else was saying you did it. The whole class was against you, remember?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah... too well.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wright, you may not know this, but we used to have a saying back in school. "When something smells, it's usually the Butz."

Name: Phoenix
Text: I know, I know.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Really, Wright. I'm surprised you didn't figure it out!

Name: Butz
Text: Well, this is sure an unexpected turn of events, eh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmm?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You should have told me!

Name: Maya
Text: Now, now, Nick. It was fifteen years ago! Don't you think the "statute of limitations" has run out, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'd say so, yes.

Name: Butz
Text: There you have it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Grr... Where does that leave me!? I became a defense attorney because of what you two did!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well, I'd call you a goody-two-shoes to the extreme.

Name: Butz
Text: Yeah! And you get worked up too easily, too!

Name: Phoenix
Text: D-death! The death sentence for both of you! Man, if only I had known, I'd have become a prosecutor!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The same goes for me, only the other way around... For the longest time, I thought that I might have killed my own father. I thought I might be a criminal. I became a prosecutor in part to punish myself. If I had known the truth, I might have become a defense attorney after all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Want to switch, Wright?

Name: Lotta
Text: Hey, y'all! Line up, I'll take a photo!

Name: Maya
Text: Hey, photo time! Let's go!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: And after that, dinner on me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe took us out on the town that night. We celebrated Edgeworth's new found freedom. Although, Edgeworth was still in detention.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whoa... I went a little overboard yesterday. My head hurts... Huh? It's still only 5:00. Maybe I should go back to sleep... Hmm? (What's this? A letter?)

Name: Maya
Text: Good morning, Nick. You were really impressive yesterday. Seeing you... It made me think about what I'm doing here. I'm a spirit medium... in training, of course. I wanted to help Mr. Edgeworth too. I wanted to help you. But I couldn't. I was useless. So, I've decided to go back to my training. I'll become a full-fledged spirit medium, for starters. I couldn't say it to your face, so I left this letter. Goodbye, Nick.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (G-goodbye!?) What time is it? Gah! The first trains for the mountains have already left! To the station!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... I guess I'm too late... ...

Name: Maya
Text: Hey! N-Nick!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maya!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... you're leaving?

Name: Maya
Text: Yeah. It's hard being a spirit medium who can't talk to spirits. And... I think you'll do fine without me, Nick. Be good... okay!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-wait!

Name: Maya
Text: What?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... I never could have saved Edgeworth without your help.

Name: Maya
Text: Huh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: On the last day of the trial... I heard her. I heard Mia's voice!

Name: Maya
Text: You heard my sister...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes... only her voice, but still... It was at the very end when I thought we'd lost everything.

Name: Maya
Text: Well, that's my sister for you. Detective Gumshoe helped, and Mr. Grossberg, and even Larry... I'm the only one who couldn't help. I was useless, Nick.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But you were the one who stopped von Karma, Maya!

Name: Maya
Text: Huh? I-I didn't do anything! All I did was wander around in a daze...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry, but I have evidence that you helped!

Name: Maya
Text: E-evidence?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Show Maya some evidence to cheer her up!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Maya
Text: A bullet...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: von Karma was convinced he had taken all of the evidence pertaining to DL-6! But you were the one who rescued the last piece of evidence we needed! This was the bullet that put an end to von Karma! And you were the one who gave it to me!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thanks, Maya. I couldn't have done it without you.

Name: Maya
Text: ... ... I'll be back soon.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Maya
Text: I'm going to complete my training, and come back!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Okay. I'll be waiting. ...

Name: Maya
Text: Of course you will. You can't run that office by yourself! You're hopeless!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh, I don't know about that...

Name: Maya
Text: So... bye.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Bye.

Name: Maya
Text: Thanks... Nick.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hah! Don't think you've graduated yet, amateur!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. Perhaps you'd like to rethink that claim?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Er... yes, Your Honor. (Uh oh... I got a bad feeling about this...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's been two months since Maya left the office... Two months without a single trial. I've had offers... But none I took. That is... until the day that girl showed up.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Why do I come here to the office every day? It's not like I want to work...)

Name: Ema
Text: There you are! Finally! Where have you been!? My sister's trial is tomorrow!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... ... Um... who are you?

Name: Ema
Text: It doesn't matter who I am! It only matters who YOU are! You're the famous defense attorney, Mia Fey!

Name: Ema
Text: Oh, uh... You're not Mia Fey, are you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm sorry, but Ms. Mia Fey no longer... works here.

Name: Ema
Text: So you are...? The coffee boy?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm Phoenix Wright... A defense attorney.

Name: Ema
Text: Wright... Wright... Wait! You're THE Phoenix Wright!? The Phoenix Wright from the Edgeworth murder case!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, yes, that's correct. (It wasn't Edgeworth who was murdered, though...)

Name: Ema
Text: That's a relief then! You're better than nobody!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm sorry... I'm afraid I'm not taking cases right now.

Name: Ema
Text: But, you are Phoenix Wright, right? The undefeated defense attorney?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look, I'm not accepting any new cases. I'm sorry, but you'll have to try elsewhere.

Name: Ema
Text: Please! I'm out of time!

Name: Phoenix
Text: But...

Name: Ema
Text: Please, you have to help! I-it's my sister!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maya...? Could it be...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Okay. I'll hear you out.

Name: Ema
Text: R-really!? Thank you so much! My name's Ema, Ema Skye. I'm a scientific investigator.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Scientific investigator?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ema, was it? So you're a "scientific investigator"?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes! That's right! Is... something wrong?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, it's just, you seem kind of, er, jumpy. Or maybe just... young?

Name: Ema
Text: Young? I'll be sixteen years old this year!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, I see... wait! Only sixteen!?

Name: Ema
Text: I'm set to be formally assigned to Forensics in three more years. My work is becoming quite well known... At my age, no less!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, so what exactly is your current position, then?

Name: Ema
Text: Well, legally speaking... I guess you'd call me an "Eleventh Grader." But I'm ready to do my job! At my age, no less!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Great, another future professional in training...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: So what's this about a case? You said the trial's tomorrow?

Name: Ema
Text: My sister didn't do it! She wouldn't stab someone with a knife! She wouldn't!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... it's a murder case.

Name: Ema
Text: I don't care if there's a witness who saw her do it! She didn't do it! I know she didn't do it! It's a scientific fact!

Name: Phoenix
Text: And... there's a witness.

Name: Ema
Text: J-just talk to her! You have to talk to her!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right... I suppose I will.

Name: Ema
Text: I promised her I'd bring Mia Fey, but...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's interesting... How would she know Mia?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you want to be a scientific investigator when you grow up, then?

Name: Ema
Text: E-excuse me? I'm not a child, I'll have you know!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Still, it's good to have a goal. Albeit a very unusual one.

Name: Ema
Text: I believe investigations should be done scientifically! Don't you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh, yeah. (Sure can't fault her for a lack of enthusiasm.)

Name: Ema
Text: If this case is handled scientifically, I'm sure my sister's name will be cleared!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your sister...?

Name: Ema
Text: I've been doing research, you know! I'm developing a new scientific method of case investigation! I'll show you when I'm done!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm looking forward to it. (Guess I should get down to the Detention Center and talk to her sister.)

Name: Ema
Text: My sister asked for her specifically. Mia Fey... was a few years below her in school.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So she went to the same school as Mia.)

Name: Ema
Text: She always told me to go to Mia if I ever needed a defense attorney... And, well... I need one.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, incidentally, Mia is a woman.

Name: Ema
Text: Mia... Yeah, I thought it was a little strange when I saw you, too.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, it's nice of you to help your sister out like this. You must be close.

Name: Ema
Text: Well... Actually, when she gets like she is now, I kind of hate her.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Huh?)

Name: Ema
Text: But... But she's my only family.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your only family? What about your parents?

Name: Ema
Text: They died in a car accident when I was little.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh... I'm sorry.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm, I wonder what's wrong with Ema? She got quiet all of a sudden as soon as we arrived.)

Name: Lana
Text: Guard... I thought I told you I didn't want visitors.

Name: Guard
Text: S-s-s-sorry, ma'am! It's j-j-just, your sister...

Name: Lana
Text: No excuses! Or did you not want a raise this year, hmm?

Name: Guard
Text: U-u-u-understood, ma'am!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wh-wh-wh-what was that all about?)

Name: Ema
Text: H-hi, Lana.

Name: Lana
Text: Funny. I seem to remember specifically telling you NOT to come here. Perhaps my memory is failing?

Name: Ema
Text: L-look... I didn't want to come here either, okay? But your trial's tomorrow and you still don't have a defense attorney!

Name: Lana
Text: I'll be the one in court tomorrow. This has nothing to do with you, Ema. Isn't that right, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey! How do you know me?

Name: Lana
Text: Mia mentioned you. I've heard... quite a bit.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Er, I'm sorry. What exactly is it that you do...?

Name: Lana
Text: My name is Lana, Lana Skye.

Name: Lana
Text: I'm Chief Prosecutor for this district.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-you're a prosecutor!? (Two sisters... one a lawyer. Could this be a coincidence? Ema... Lana... I mean, they're just like...)

Name: Ema
Text: Is something wrong, Mr. Wright?

Name: Lana
Text: There's something you should know from the start.

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-which is?

Name: Lana
Text: The suspect in this case has confessed to the crime.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Ema
Text: W-wait! But the suspect... The suspect is...!

Name: Lana
Text: Me. I did it. Well, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well... why don't you begin by telling me exactly what happened.

Name: Lana
Text: The crime took place yesterday, February 21, at 5:15 PM.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's quite specific.

Name: Lana
Text: It was in the witness's deposition. A witness clearly saw me committing the crime.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... My, that was a bit of bad luck, wasn't it?

Name: Lana
Text: The crime took place in the underground parking lot at the Prosecutor's Office. The body was found in the trunk of my subordinate's car.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The Prosecutor's Office, huh? (In your subordinate's car trunk? Classy...)

Name: Lana
Text: I was arrested on the spot. Caught red-handed, as it were.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (My, my...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, who was the victim?

Name: Lana
Text: An investigator with the Police Department. I suppose the correct term is "Detective."

Name: Ema
Text: A detective...?

Name: Lana
Text: Death was due to a loss of blood. He was stabbed once in the stomach.

Name: Phoenix
Text: By... you?

Name: Lana
Text: Death wasn't immediate, but the wound was fatal.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see...

Name: Lana
Text: Allow me to repeat myself, Mr. Wright. The victim was a detective. You know what that means, don't you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh oh!

Name: Ema
Text: What? Mr. Wright? What does it mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, it means...

Name: Lana
Text: The police department will consider it a matter of pride to have me found guilty. They will use any means at their disposal to do so.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This case gets worse and worse with everything I learn.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you're the Chief Prosecutor?

Name: Lana
Text: That is correct. I'm responsible for overseeing every trial handled by prosecutors in this district. I make sure the prosecutors have what they need to do the job, and manage every aspect. Those are my responsibilities, in a nutshell.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's an awfully large nutshell.)

Name: Lana
Text: Still, I'm a little surprised. I would think you'd recognize the district's Chief Prosecutor, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Lana
Text: In fact, it seems impossible you wouldn't...

Name: Ema
Text: Um... Lana? What happened to your hand?

Name: Lana
Text: Oh, this? I cut myself by accident. When I stabbed him, that is.

Name: Ema
Text: Huh?

Name: Lana
Text: I'm not very good at being a criminal, I suppose.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (How am I supposed to defend this!? Time to change the subject... Wait, she was in the class ahead of Mia, wasn't she...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, you were in school with Mia, correct? A few years above her?

Name: Lana
Text: ... Ema told you that, too, did she?

Name: Ema
Text: W-well, why not? I did drag him all the way here from his office!

Name: Lana
Text: Although it seems he has very little in common with Mia...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hey!)

Name: Lana
Text: It was in law school. I was in my third year, and she was auditing the class. She was different than the other students.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Different?

Name: Lana
Text: She was strong... She'd do anything to become a defense attorney. Anything. That... was probably why she was attracted to me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: E-excuse me!?

Name: Ema
Text: Intellectually attracted! Lana was top of her class in school.

Name: Lana
Text: I was the best there was.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh...

Name: Ema
Text: I'm doing pretty good in school too, by the way!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It sounds a bit different when Ema says it...)

Name: Lana
Text: Well, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: E-excuse me?

Name: Lana
Text: As you can plainly see, I am admitting my guilt. I think it's safe to say... there's no way you can take this case. None.

Name: Ema
Text: B-but, Lana!

Name: Ema
Text: You... you were always this way, weren't you? You never think of anyone but yourself.

Name: Ema
Text: I know you didn't do it, Lana, I know! So... So how can you say you did!?

Name: Ema
Text: If I lose you... I'll be all alone! I... I hate you, Lana!

Name: Lana
Text: ... Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes?

Name: Lana
Text: I believe our discussion here is ended. The rest... I leave to you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! Um... you mean, you're requesting my services as your defense?

Name: Lana
Text: Don't lose any sleep over it. Your client has confessed, after all. The case is over.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right... I'll do what I can to get to the bottom of this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Lana has confessed to the crime, yes... But something doesn't fit. It's that look in Ema's eyes. There's something else going on here... and I'm going to find out what!)

Name: Ema
Text: I'm sorry, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? About what?

Name: Ema
Text: My sister... She's not always like that you know.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... I just never expected to be defending another prosecutor again.

Name: Ema
Text: She's changed a lot. She used to be so gentle, always smiling. Everybody liked her.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see... (Sorry, but I'm having trouble imagining that.) What happened to her?

Name: Ema
Text: I don't know for certain myself... I think maybe she... Well, maybe not.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Sounds like there's something there that defies a simple scientific explanation.) Let's go check out this underground parking at the Prosecutor's Office, shall we?

Name: Ema
Text: O-Okay!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So this is the lot where it all happened?

Name: Ema
Text: Looks like they're still investigating...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Funny that my first visit to the Prosecutor's Office should be like this...)

Name: Ema
Text: Hey everyone! Keep up the good work!

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-hey! What are you thinking?

Name: Ema
Text: Well, they are going to be my coworkers three years from now after all. No harm in saying hello...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Actually, there is. You know attorneys aren't supposed to examine crime scenes?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm trying to not stand out too much, here, see?
Hey there! You 'specting to go unnoticed here, pardner?

Name: Ema
Text: P-Pardner?
What do we have here? Looks like a bambina got loose from the ranch and is up to no good! Folks gotta learn to keep them dogies tied down, pardner.

Name: Ema
Text: M-Mr. Marshall!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Marshall? Looks more like a sheriff to me...)
Lookie here, bambina. I know how you feel. But this is my gang's gold strike, see?

Name: Ema
Text: Strike...?

This is our claim, our territory. And the goldmine is... evidence. If you're fixin' to mess with what's ours... You'll regret it, pardner! You know what dreams the cacti out in the desert dream? You want to?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's this guy talking about!?)
You head along home now. Happy trails, bambina!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Was that uh, hombre, a friend of yours?

Name: Ema
Text: Uh... kind of... sort of... Yeah. He's a detective.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Who thinks he's a sheriff from the Wild West it seems.)

Name: Ema
Text: Ah hah! A ladder.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... That's a stepladder.

Name: Ema
Text: What's the difference? In scientific terms, please.

Name: Phoenix
Text: S-scientific, huh?

Name: Ema
Text: Look at the basic nature of things, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This all seems so horribly familiar somehow...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's this? A wallet?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, excuse me! Officer!

Name: Ema
Text: W-w-waaaait! What are you doing, Mr. Wright!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What am I doing? I just found this wallet, so I'm handing it over to the police...

Name: Ema
Text: I don't believe it! This is real basic: anything at a crime scene is evidence! Let's be scientific about this, please! Just put it in your pocket.

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-how is that scientific? (Sounds like theft to me!)

Name: Ema
Text: I'm called to duty already, and at my tender age! Here, I'll teach you the trick to examining evidence in detail, okay?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (By the way her eyes are sparkling, I can tell she's been waiting for this...)

Name: Ema
Text: Okay, okay, now. Look at the Court Record! You have to be sure to examine evidence carefully on all sides! Now. Let's start examining! From every angle!

Name: Ema
Text: Oh look! I think there might be a clue there. You should check it out! Press the Examine button.

Name: Phoenix
Text: This... This is an ID card. (Detective Bruce Goodman, ID # 5842189...)

Name: Ema
Text: See? Well? Isn't scientific investigation useful?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I guess... Though I don't see what "science" has to do with it.

Name: Ema
Text: Let's be sure to examine every piece of evidence we find!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess I've got to be on my toes from now on...)

Name: Ema
Text: Well, no time to waste! Let's get hunting for clues! Hmm... I wonder what this is?
Well, pardner. Looks like you got no intention of going home quietly.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The sheriff!)
Like I said before, this here's our claim. You'd best be moseying along. Unless you're fixing to bite the bullet.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Gah! Scary!)

Name: Ema
Text: C-could you just tell us one thing...? Who owns that car?
Well, well. The little filly's got a good nose on her! You want to know who rides that red mustang with the body in her saddle, eh?

Name: Ema
Text: Please!
No problem, pardner. 'Bout time for vittles anyway. Get yourself to the saloon up on the 12th floor of the Prospector's Office. Might just find you a cervesa you like.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Prospector's Office? Where does this guy think he is? And when, for that matter!?)

Name: Ema
Text: Note to self: look up vittles, saloon, cervesa.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maybe we should check out room 1202... the High Prosecutor's Office!)
In any case, stay away from the car. You can look around here all you like, just keep your paws off our claim.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Right... great.)

Name: Ema
Text: Great! Maybe there are some clues around here, Mr. Wright! Let's check it out!

Name: Angel
Text: Excuse me? Were you two all set?

Name: Ema
Text: Us?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's this? She couldn't be...)

Name: Ema
Text: Y-you're selling lunches? Here? This is a crime scene!

Name: Angel
Text: Hello! Half n' Half, was it?

Name: Ema
Text: Oh. Uh, thanks.

Name: Angel
Text: And you, sir?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes?

Name: Angel
Text: Some Crunchy Goodness coming at you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... thanks. (Interesting way of doing business.)

Name: Angel
Text: This area is off limits to anyone without clearance. Especially passers-by. Or are you officers?

Name: Ema
Text: Uh... no, but you... You don't exactly look like the type to have clearance.

Name: Angel
Text: Well, that's hardly a way to greet someone! Even if my days as the "Cough-up Queen" are over...

Name: Phoenix
Text: C-cough-up? Huh?

Name: Ema
Text: You know, I'm feeling kind of full. Maybe I'll pass on lunch...

Name: Angel
Text: I'm quite connected to this case, you see. The images are burned into my eyes, you might say. Yes, all the sordid secrets...

Name: Ema
Text: Secrets...?

Name: Angel
Text: Dear me. You are a slow one, aren't you? I'm referring to the murder. The stabbing of that detective.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whaaaat!?

Name: Lana
Text: A witness clearly saw me committing the crime.

Name: Ema
Text: You mean you're the witness my sister was talking about?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Please! Cough-up Queen! Tell us what happened!

Name: Angel
Text: The name is Angel Starr. Don't you go forgetting it. Or before you know it I'll have you whimpering at my heels.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-y-yes, ma'am! (Yipes! She means it!)

Name: Angel
Text: Somehow... I knew. Yesterday was a day of destiny... I knew something was going to happen... Just like I know that the Daily Special on Friday every week is salmon.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Destiny...? Was yesterday special for some reason?

Name: Angel
Text: You're a defense attorney, right? You should know then. You should know the foul misdeeds of the evil ones who haunt this den of inequity!

Name: Ema
Text: E-evil ones?

Name: Angel
Text: Prosecutors! They have no qualms at all about blackening the name of innocents! And yesterday they paid homage to the most evil one of all! They gave an award for "King of Prosecutors"... What a farce!

Name: Ema
Text: So, she's saying... There was some sort of prosecutor's convention yesterday.

Name: Angel
Text: I was almost compelled to lace their lunches with something foul...

Name: Ema
Text: Do you have a personal grievance against prosecutors, or something? Or is there some kind of scientific evidence of this, um, "evil"?

Name: Angel
Text: Young miss... Mock me at your own risk! You'll soon find out why they call me the "Cough-up Queen"!

Name: Ema
Text: Ew!

Name: Angel
Text: The most heinous of all the evil ones, the one they awarded yesterday... It was in his car that they found the body! Proof that he devours the evilest lunches of all!

Name: Ema
Text: R-really!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Really what? I'm totally confused... One thing's clear. This lunch lady has a thing against prosecutors.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, what exactly was it that you witnessed, Ms. Starr?

Name: Angel
Text: It was a fascinating spectacle, to be sure! I now feel I know what they say when they talk about a "woman's wrath." To see Lana Skye wield that knife so...

Name: Angel
Text: Her knife flashed in anger, bringing him to a sad end. It was truly a sight to see.

Name: Ema
Text: Y-you mean you saw the very moment of the crime!?

Name: Angel
Text: The sound of his silvery ties to this world being cruelly cut still rings in my ears. And the rhythmic beat of Lana Skye's knife...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait a second! You know Lana Skye?

Name: Angel
Text: Hmph. Of course. It's quite a feat... becoming Chief Prosecutor. How many lunchboxes of sin did she pack to make that journey, I wonder!

Name: Ema
Text: She... always travels light.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now why would this pretty lunch lady know the Chief Prosecutor's name?)

Name: Ema
Text: Um... Could we ask you a bit about yourself, Ms. Starr?

Name: Angel
Text: I come here every day to sell lunches. I import only the freshest and best from the Far East. For some reason, the box lunches are a hit here.

Name: Ema
Text: Why not make the lunches here rather than import them?

Name: Angel
Text: Did you say something?

Name: Ema
Text: N-no...

Name: Angel
Text: Only true connoisseurs can understand... The kind you can only tell someone who has tried General Tso's Trilobite lunch set.

Name: Ema
Text: Ah... Nevermind... You win.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I don't even want to appreciate part of a trilobite's flavor.)

Name: Angel
Text: Anyway, I come here every day to sell lunches. My boyfriend works in the security room here at the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Ema
Text: Y-your boyfriend?

Name: Angel
Text: See the security room over there?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The glass-walled booth?

Name: Angel
Text: I sell my lunches and, since I'm here anyway, I drop in to see him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Since you're here anyway... I guess selling lunches is more important than romance.)

Name: Ema
Text: So, to scientifically analyze the data available so far... You, Ms. Starr, are a lunch vendor with an ulterior motive for coming here!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Useful analysis. Not.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you have a bad experience with a prosecutor, Ms. Starr? I sense some... hostility.

Name: Angel
Text: Hostility? Hah! Perhaps. Prosecutors are all alike. And the bigger they get, the worse they smell. Kind of like 10-day old clams in the chowder.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I wonder if Ms. Starr was involved in some sort of legal trouble in the past?)

Name: Ema
Text: That'd be a sure cause of food poisoning! Scientifically speaking, of course. I mean, now you're talking "Cough-up Queen"!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I thought she was just a lunch vendor, but now I'm not so sure...)

Name: Ema
Text: This is the kind of room that just screams "I can do the job." Quite a change from your office, really.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thanks.

Name: Ema
Text: Look, look! There's a trophy or something here!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A trophy? What, that shield?)

Name: Ema
Text: It takes real nerve to display stuff like this. Whoever's office this is, he must be a real stuck-up jerk!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mr. Phoenix Wright... You never tire of prying into other people's business, do you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That voice...!) Long time, no see, Edgeworth.

Name: Ema
Text: Huh? Aaaaaaaaaaaaah! M-M-Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! You know him from somewhere?

Name: Ema
Text: O-of course! I'm his biggest fan! My sister introduced us once, and...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Right... her sister was the Chief Prosecutor, after all.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well? What brings you here? I'll warn you... I've been known to be a real stuck-up jerk...

Name: Ema
Text: N-no! Did I...? No! It was just, Mr. Wright here, he...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey! Don't blame me!

Name: Ema
Text: W-we're just here to investigate a murder case!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Murder...?

Name: Ema
Text: A body was found in this nasty, bright red sports car in the parking lot...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmm? That would be my car. What of it?

Name: Ema
Text: Whaaaaaaaaaaaa!? Y-y-y-your car!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'll say one thing, she certainly can scream.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, the body was found in your car?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Go ahead, say it, Wright. You think I did it, don't you? After you went through all that trouble to help me last year, no less.

Name: Ema
Text: N-no, we don't think you did it! I mean, it was my sister who stabbed him... Uh, wait, no, she didn't do that! I mean...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wait... So you're the Chief Prosecutor's little sister, then?

Name: Ema
Text: Y-yes sir! Ema Skye! It, uh... It's nice to meet you again!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now that didn't sound forced at all...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ah, now I remember. You've... really grown. I'll admit, it was a surprise to me, too. To think that my own car would become the scene of a murder. More surprising still... Now I'm forced to prove my superior's guilt.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I can understand... W-wait!... What did you say!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Lana Skye is the Chief Prosecutor... the top prosecutor in the district. She can't prosecute herself, so I'll be the prosecutor at the trial tomorrow.

Name: Ema
Text: You!? Mr. Edgeworth...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: To be honest... It's a bit of a miracle I'm still here at all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Rumors. You've heard the rumors about me, haven't you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Miles Edgeworth... It's hard to remember a time when there WEREN'T rumors about this guy... Forging evidence, arranging false testimony, illegal searches, you name it...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Thanks to you, my innocence was established in the trial at the end of last year. However, there are some who say I'm the one responsible for the current incident.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what? That's crazy!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. Some people need very little excuse to think ill of others. It's a fact of life. Impossible to stop.

Name: Ema
Text: But...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Some of them even go so far as to present me with toys like this... They think it's funny.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Toys? That bronze shield? There's got to be a story behind that one...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: I've been wondering... what the heck is this?

Name: Ema
Text: It has a big "K" on it.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: *mumbles* of Prosecutors...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? What's that?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's the "King of Prosecutors" trophy.

Name: Ema
Text: K-K-K... "King of Prosecutors"!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's a great honor. They send that shield to the best prosecutor each year. What! So?

Name: Phoenix
Text: So that "K"... that's...

Name: Ema
Text: "K" stands for "King"?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yeah, you got a problem with that? I didn't design the thing!

Name: Ema
Text: "King of Prosecutors"... Kind of like "Employee of the Month," only better!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, in other words, you were the best of the best this year, huh?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You can take that foolish grin elsewhere, Wright. I lost a day of work to receive that travesty.

Name: Ema
Text: Huh? Why's that?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I had to go to the Police Department ceremony to receive that broken shield.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The Police Department?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes. Right next to the Police Station downtown. You've been there, correct?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Where Detective Gumshoe works? Yeah.

Name: Ema
Text: Um, I was wondering something about your shield... Why is it broken?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What does it matter? I've got more important things to worry about.

Name: Ema
Text: Oh. Right...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He doesn't seem too concerned about his award, for better or for worse.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yesterday was a very busy day for the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Ema
Text: Maybe... we should ask him more about yesterday?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could you tell me more about yesterday... the day of the murder?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yesterday was the annual cleaning day at the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Ema
Text: Cleaning day?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Working with the Police Department, we sort and file all evidence for solved cases. We call it "evidence transferral."

Name: Ema
Text: Wiping your hands of old cases, in other words.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Oh, and another thing... A ceremony was held at the Police Department. There's an annual review and awards for outstanding police officers and prosecutors.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And that's when you got the shield?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I was at the police department yesterday afternoon... I got back here at 5:12.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's... very precise.

Name: Ema
Text: People like myself and Mr. Edgeworth pride ourselves on our precision, Mr. Wright.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No, I place little faith in my memory. The only thing I trust is solid evidence.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This is the parking stub from the underground lot.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The murder took place around 5:15...)

Name: Ema
Text: So the murder happened right after you got back.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What, Wright? I'd appreciate it if you'd direct that suspicious glare elsewhere.

Name: Meekins
Text: Um...! Excuse me! But is Mr. Edgeworth, uh... anywhere on the premises?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm Edgeworth. What is it?

Name: Meekins
Text: I'm here, sir, at the request of the Chief, sir! I've got your report, sir!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Report? What? Did you find new evidence in the case against Chief Prosecutor Skye!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I don't like the way this conversation is going at all...)

Name: Meekins
Text: Er... Skye, sir? No, sir! No name of that kind, sir! Not in this report, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I think I just heard Edgeworth's lid blow.)

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Edgeworth's lid isn't on very tight, is it?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I made a clear request to the Police Department, did I not? I need to focus on the trial tomorrow, so don't bring me anything unrelated!

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir! But, but sir! I'm just following orders, sir! They told me to bring this to you! I wasn't aware of the peculiars of your arrangement with us, sir!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Give me your name!

Name: Meekins
Text: U-uh, yes... yes, Sir! M-M-Meekins, sir. Officer Meekins!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Right. Officer Meekins? Take your report and leave. And good luck with that raise next month.

Name: Meekins
Text: *whimper* B-but, sir, I d-didn't know!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Poor guy. Looks like he was absent on the day they gave out brains and good luck.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes, sir!? (Gah! He caught me off guard!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: As you can see, I'm busy. You may leave now.

Name: Ema
Text: L-let's do as he says, Mr. Wright!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The victim was a detective from the same department as that patrolman just now. Go down to the Police Department. You can ask more there.

Name: Phoenix
Text: U-uh... Thanks. (He seems to have finally calmed down at least.)

Name: Ema
Text: Whew... We're finally here. Why would they put the detectives so far away from the Prosecutor's Office?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That took almost 30 minutes by taxi... and traffic wasn't even that bad. This is my first time to the Police Department, actually. ? Hold on, what's that?

Name: Ema
Text: Disturbing! Why does it undulate like that?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, wait I know. This is the "Blue Badger." They're trying to make him the police mascot.

Name: Ema
Text: Wow, Mr. Wright! You know a lot about the Police Department! Still, he does seem familiar, somehow...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Forget the Blue Badger! Who's that next to him!?

Name: Ema
Text: Someone appears to be... dancing with the Blue Badger... Uh oh. He noticed me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: He sure is running over here fast...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: H-h-h-hey, pal! W-w-w-what're you doin' here!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's my line, Detective Gumshoe. Specifically, why were you dancing over there?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What!? Um, well...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, at least he doesn't seem to be busy. This is our chance to get information!)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey! I'll have you know I'm a very busy man, pal.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I'll give you one word of advice, pal. You'd better not agree to defend the suspect in this case.

Name: Ema
Text: Wh... Why not?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Huh? Well... It's just that the Chief Prosecutor has confessed to the crime. She says she summoned the detective to the Prosecutor's Office and... she killed him.

Name: Ema
Text: But, what if she's not telling the truth!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yes, well... no! C'mon, pal! There's plenty of evidence against her!

Name: Ema
Text: B-but what if the evidence was faked?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey, pal. Can I speak to you for a second?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Me?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Why is this little girl so peeved at me?

Name: Phoenix
Text: She's a relative of the suspect. Lana Skye's sister.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Whoa!!! The Chief Prosecutor's little sister!?

Name: Ema
Text: Just, please investigate this case carefully, okay? Scientifically!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yessir! Oh, by the way. You might want to keep your voices down. You don't want to be overheard using words like "faked"...

Name: Ema
Text: Huh?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: It's just... it's a sensitive issue with us these days.

Name: Ema
Text: So... what are you doing here, Detective Gumshoe?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Me? Oh, well... nothing, really. They kicked me out of Criminal Affairs...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe! What did you do this time?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Whaddya mean, "this time"!?

Name: Ema
Text: Then, what happened? I know things are busy right now... I mean... with my sister's case and all...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: It's true. We've never had a Chief Prosecutor murder anyone before! Only the highest-ranked people are being let into Criminal Affairs now... The lowest ranking guy in there is our chief of detectives. They're not letting any of us rank-and-file detectives in at all.

Name: Ema
Text: None of you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I know this is an important trial, but isn't that a little odd?)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: So, anyway, I thought I'd spend the day getting the badger dance down pat.

Name: Ema
Text: Um... Isn't there anything else you could be doing?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The Chief of Police himself is directing this investigation, pal. And Officer Marshall was assigned to the underground parking lot.

Name: Ema
Text: Officer Marshall...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now that I think about it, Ema did seem to know that Marshall guy.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: A patrolman in charge of a crime scene... It's unheard of, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, Detective Gumshoe? What can you tell me about this?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Huh? Hey, pal! This is a detective's ID card! You can't just keep that! You have to turn it in to the police! It's people like you that get me into so much trouble all the time!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Meaning Detective Gumshoe must drop his card a lot.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hmm... let's see... "Bruce Goodman"... Goodman... Sounds familiar... ... Nah, my mistake.

Name: Ema
Text: But, don't you work together with him in Criminal Affairs?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Whoa!!! Now I remember! Bruce Goodman! He's the victim!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's what I thought...)

Name: Ema
Text: Can you tell us more, Detective Gumshoe?

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... this ID card belonged to the victim?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: He was a detective, like myself. Detective Bruce Goodman.

Name: Ema
Text: Hmm... Don't you think it's strange? I mean, why would the victim's ID card be lying on the ground where we found it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, Detective Goodman should have been at the Police Department yesterday. There was an evidence transferal for a case he handled two years ago.

Name: Ema
Text: Evidence transferal... Mr. Edgeworth mentioned that too. But... Detective Goodman was killed at the Prosecutor's Office...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, that's the thing... It's hard to say this, but... Word is that Chief Prosecutor Skye called him out there, to the parking lot.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (And Lana's confessing as much...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Found in Mr. Edgeworth's car, stabbed with Mr. Edgeworth's knife, huh... What would drive Chief Prosecutor Skye to do such a thing?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: W-wait, I didn't mean... I mean, sure, of course someone else really did it! Someone who must have, um... Someone who must have a grudge against Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The car and the knife do seem a little too well-organized to be a coincidence.)

Name: Ema
Text: Poor Mr. Edgeworth... What could have happened?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (We have to find out a little more about what's going on with Edgeworth...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: He's in a tough spot, again...

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Again"...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, it all started with the murder of that defense attorney, Hammond.

Name: Ema
Text: But Edgeworth was found innocent!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Listen, pal, there have always been rumors about Edgeworth. Forging evidence, making deals with witnesses... Nothing outright, but there were always whispered rumors. Ever since he was accused of murder, no one's whispering. They're practically shouting!

Name: Ema
Text: But... but there's no evidence against him!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, Mr. Edgeworth has always had unusually strong ties to the department higher-ups. It's only natural that people would be suspicious.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I had no idea he was under the gun...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Anyway, this latest case has started a new rumor. People say the only reason he took this case... is because he's aiming for the Chief Prosecutor position himself!

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-what!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: But I know the truth, pal! Nobody wants to be the one who has to prosecute the chief prosecutor! Mr. Edgeworth is biting the bullet on this one! He's doing this for all of us!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... And that's all I know about that. I'm not officially on the case, you know.

Name: Ema
Text: Thank you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why aren't you handling the case, Detective Gumshoe? We met the guy who is... what was his name? The guy in the parking lot...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That'd be Officer Marshall. He was appointed directly by the Chief of Police...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Officer Marshall... Is he some kind of Wild West sheriff or something?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: No, Jake Marshall's just a regular officer... From West LA.

Name: Phoenix
Text: For a moment there, I wasn't sure.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Look, pal, let me try to make things a little easier for you. Show them this and they'll let you examine the crime scene... maybe.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'll be surprised if this gets us anywhere...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Just act like you're supposed to be there, and nobody will look at you twice, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Looks like the investigation is still going...)

Name: Angel
Text: I have to be getting back to the shop...

Name: Marshall
Text: Sorry... Looks like I'll be stuck in this pit 'til the sun sleeps.

Name: Angel
Text: I'll see you in my dreams tonight, then, baby.

Name: Angel
Text: Oh! Still here?

Name: Ema
Text: Ah, h-hello.

Name: Angel
Text: Why the surprised looks? Didn't I mention...? I've got a boyfriend in Criminal Affairs, too.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What happened to the security guard!?)

Name: Marshall
Text: Hey! What's wrong, bambina? You're lookin' like a dogie that's lost its herd!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Jake Marshall... Strange guy to put in charge of a crime scene.)

Name: Ema
Text: There's something I wanted to ask you!

Name: Marshall
Text: The scene of the crime... a cold grave for men who've lost their dreams... And me? I watch over them as they sleep... dreaming of the desert's harsh judgment. ...

Name: Ema
Text: He's asleep.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well... should we show this hopeless case something to catch his interest?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Would you mind reading this for me?

Name: Marshall
Text: What's this? I warn you, fan letters to me go right in the spittoon!

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's a letter of introduction from Detective Gumshoe. May we investigate?

Name: Marshall
Text: Gumshoe...? Ah, that old cowdog? Hmm... He holding a birthday party or something?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Marshall
Text: Look, where it should say letter of "introduction"... It says "invitation."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ah... I think he just miswrote it. (Great, Detective Gumshoe. I owe you one...)

Name: Marshall
Text: No worries. This proves it's from Detective Gumshoe, better than a blood test. Guess I'd better let you in, then.

Name: Ema
Text: Th-thank you, Officer Marshall!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Officer Marshall isn't a "detective"... he's a "patrolman"... That reminds me of something...)

Name: Ema
Text: That is odd! Isn't a crime scene supposed to be handled by a detective or higher?

Name: Marshall
Text: Well, folks. The clues are calling! Welcome to our gold strike. Be like the settler! Strike out for lands unknown! Manifest Destiny! Let's have a hootenanny!

Name: Ema
Text: Note to self: police investigations are like settling land. Well, Mr. Wright, what do you say!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I say I won't be needing this anymore...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's this? Looks like a note of some sort.

Name: Ema
Text: Look! Something's written on it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You're right. Let's see... "6-7S12/2"...

Name: Ema
Text: There's a name printed on the paper above that... "Goodman."

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maybe it fell out of his pocket when he was killed.)

Name: Ema
Text: Well? So? What does it mean, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: How am I supposed to know?

Name: Ema
Text: Note to self: for deductive reasoning, go to Edgeworth, not Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'm sure Edgeworth wouldn't know what this means either.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Officer Marshall? Could you tell us more about the victim?

Name: Marshall
Text: ... Good men always die young. Remember that, pardner.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... could you be a little more specific?

Name: Ema
Text: Bruce Goodman... He was a detective, right?

Name: Marshall
Text: Well, well, aren't you a feisty dogie there now. Detective Goodman was stabbed here at 5:15... The smiling Madonna told me the tale...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I think he means the witness, Ms. Angel Starr.)

Name: Marshall
Text: One stab to the chest. A fine piece of work. This here's the autopsy report.

Name: Ema
Text: Was my sister involved with the victim in any way?

Name: Marshall
Text: Funny you should mention that, bambina. Chief Prospector Skye and Detective Goodman... had nothing in common at all.

Name: Ema
Text: Nothing in common...?

Name: Marshall
Text: They apparently worked together on a case a few years back.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So... there's no motive!)

Name: Marshall
Text: Goodman wasn't a particularly gifted detective. That's one reason why he didn't do much work with the Chief Prospector...

Name: Ema
Text: But, my sister called the victim here on the day of the murder, right? Here... to this parking lot?

Name: Marshall
Text: So it seems. Like calling an unarmed man to a shootout at high noon.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, I don't mean any offense, but... Officer Marshall, you're a patrolman, right? Not a detective.

Name: Marshall
Text: You callin' me out? They shoot you for that in Texas.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Marshall
Text: I was one of them fancy-shoed "Detectives" till two years ago, to tell ya the truth.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, really? (Now he tells me!)

Name: Ema
Text: But, you're a patrolman now. So how can you be in charge of a crime scene?

Name: Marshall
Text: Nothing gets by you, does it, bambina?

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, why are you in charge?

Name: Marshall
Text: No reason. We're just short on hands right now. I'm keeping an eye out in the meantime.

Name: Ema
Text: That's odd, though. Detective Gumshoe was saying he had nothing to do... nothing important, at least.

Name: Marshall
Text: He's nothing but a sad ol' cowdog, that can't find his tail. Maybe it's because he runs with that Edgeworth, eh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth...?

Name: Marshall
Text: That cowdog's been kicked out of this cattle run... by order of the Chief of Police. Just, he don't realize it yet.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Detective Gumshoe, kicked out of the investigation!?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: That looks like a cell phone.

Name: Ema
Text: Scientific analysis would suggest this belonged to the victim! I can't think of anyone else it could belong to...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's so scientific about that!?) Should we check it out?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Right! Let's check it out.)

Name: Ema
Text: Hmm. The display is still on the redial button.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Redial...?

Name: Ema
Text: Um, Mr. Wright? Most phones keep a record of all the calls you've made and received. You just press the blue button to dial the last number you called. Convenient, isn't it? I'm surprised you didn't know about it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry to disappoint you, but even I know about things like "redial."

Name: Ema
Text: Huh? Oh, I'm sorry! It's just, you never know with people from your generation.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Whatever... Let's check this phone out.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now, I wonder who the owner of this phone called last...)

Name: Ema
Text: Note to self: a defense attorney doesn't think first, he just pushes the button.

Name: Cellular
Text: *beep*

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey! That song! I know that!

Name: Marshall
Text: Hey! What's going on over there?

Name: Cellular
Text: *beep*

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ah! Oh, s-sorry.

Name: Marshall
Text: I see you, pardner! You pressed redial on that there phone, didn't you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh, well, yeah...

Name: Ema
Text: Whose phone is this, anyway? It was on the ground over there...

Name: Marshall
Text: Whose is it? That belongs to Chief Prospector Skye.

Name: Ema
Text: What? It's my sister's!?

Name: Marshall
Text: She apparently dropped it when she was taken into custody, right after the crime. Look... the last call was made right when the murder occurred! Looks like she was fixing to call someone. Except she only spoke for a few seconds, according to this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Who did she call!?

Name: Marshall
Text: No idea. Sorry, pardner. Now, I got a question for you, pardner. I heard a phone ring just now... one of those new- fangled ring-tunes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh? That? Oh... I'm sorry, that was my phone.

Name: Marshall
Text: W-w-what!? Your phone!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, uh, it's kind of strange, but... Someone called me right as we picked up the other phone, a wrong number...

Name: Marshall
Text: ... I hope you're not lying... They shoot you for that in Texas, pardner!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh, I've incited the wrath of the Lone Star patrolman...)

Name: Ema
Text: So there's no connection between Detective Goodman and my sister!

Name: Marshall
Text: That's correct, but... There's a goldmine of evidence against her...

Name: Marshall
Text: And the prospector tomorrow is none other than Edgeworth himself... I'm afraid your sister's fate is decided, bambina. Many condolences.

Name: Ema
Text: Officer Marshall!

Name: Marshall
Text: Yeah, bambina?

Name: Ema
Text: H-how can you say that! You and my sister, you were...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Is there something between this cop and her sister that I don't know about?)

Name: Marshall
Text: ...! I apologize, bambina. Something must have gotten to me. Maybe it's that dry wind that's a-blowin' through the Prospector's Office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Dry wind or ill will, someone's up to something here... but who?)

Name: Marshall
Text: Suspicions about Mr. Edgeworth have been flying around for nearly two years now.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Forged evidence... arranging testimonies, you name it.

Name: Marshall
Text: He was unbeatable because he did whatever it took to win. Unbeatable that is, until he met you.

Name: Ema
Text: But rumors are just... rumors, aren't they? These are prosecutors we're talking about! Evidence is everything to them!

Name: Marshall
Text: If you follow the rumors about Edgeworth to their source, you find one person... But... they're off limits. Untouchable, you might say.

Name: Phoenix
Text: One person? Who?

Name: Marshall
Text: Bambina...It's your sister. Chief Prospector Lana Skye.

Name: Ema
Text: What!? My sister...?

Name: Marshall
Text: Edgeworth couldn't rustle all those cattle by himself. Some people load their guns with bullets, some people load them with "deals."

Name: Phoenix
Text: What, you're saying Edgeworth was making deals to win trials?

Name: Marshall
Text: "Where there's gunshots, there's bound to be bullets." That's what the old-timers say. There's a big ol' secret hidden around here somewhere. Everyone knows it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Is that why Detective Gumshoe was taken off the case...? Did they target him because he was closest to Edgeworth?)

Name: Ema
Text: So, well, how are we doing, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I guess we got some clues... We have an autopsy report, a note from the victim, and a cell phone...

Name: Ema
Text: So... you think we'll be okay?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, the only thing still bothering me is that Lana is confessing to the crime. She says she did it!

Name: Ema
Text: No problem! I can guarantee that she's not the criminal.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh by the way, Ema?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I know that song your phone plays when it rings...

Name: Ema
Text: What...?

Name: Cellular
Text: *beep*

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's the Steel Samurai theme song, isn't it? That popular TV show... for kids?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The phone that just rang wasn't mine... it was yours. At 5:18, just after the murder took place... Your sister called you, didn't she, Ema?

Name: Ema
Text: I...I'm sorry!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Can you tell me what you talked about?

Name: Ema
Text: I... She hung up right away.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A detective is murdered, and the suspect is the top prosecutor in the district. I've got a bad feeling about this... Like... maybe I still don't know everything that went on here...)

Name: Lana
Text: How did the investigation go yesterday, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Frankly, there are still a lot of... gray areas.

Name: Ema
Text: Or rather, the whole thing is one big gray area...

Name: Lana
Text: Don't worry about me, no matter what the outcome. I'm ready to accept my fate.

Name: Ema
Text: I believe in you, sis.

Name: Lana
Text: Mr. Wright, let me offer you a word of advice.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes?

Name: Lana
Text: A defense attorney should never "believe" their client.

Name: Lana
Text: The defendant is called to trial because they are suspected of wrongdoing! Never forget that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Skye, you... You remind me a lot of Mia. But there is one decisive difference between you and her.

Name: Lana
Text: And that is?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You're not a defense attorney.

Name: Lana
Text: ... I believe it's almost time for the trial. Good luck, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (My first trial without a Fey helping me... No one's going to bail me out this time... I'll be alone in there... So I have to discover the truth all by myself!)

Name: Ema
Text: Let's do it, Mr. Wright! I'll be with you the whole way!

Name: Judge
Text: The court is now in session for the trial of Ms. Lana Skye.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution has been ready for a while, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Edgeworth... I haven't been in court since Edgeworth's trial... It's been a while now.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I hope that personal feelings will not be a part of the proceedings today, Mr. Wright.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I will choose the path I think is right, regardless of what those around me might say. The judgment to be made here is in our hands, not those of anyone else.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, Mr. Edgeworth, your opening statement please.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Chief Prosecutor Lana Skye has committed an unpardonable crime. Not only this, but she was rash enough to commit it in the Prosecutor's Office lot!

Name: Ema
Text: Wow... He's much more forceful in person. I suddenly feel like confessing to everything!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: However, she will now pay for her rashness with her life. There was a witness to her crime... A "professional" witness!

Name: Judge
Text: Well then, call your first witness, Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution calls its first witness, Ms. Angel Starr, to the stand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The "Cough-up Queen"...?)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm? Haven't I seen you somewhere...?

Name: Angel
Text: You ordered the Caviar Lunch, right?

Name: Judge
Text: Ho ho! Caviar! I've never eaten caviar before!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The judge is really wolfing it down...)

Name: Angel
Text: Ah, and for you... I have a Fiesta Bowl.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... thanks.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Will the witness state her name and profession?

Name: Angel
Text: Ah, and you, sir... Did you order "The Fingerprint" lunchbox?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It is too early for lunch. Your name and profession, please.

Name: Angel
Text: ... Well, Your Honor? How does it taste?

Name: Judge
Text: So this is why everyone raves about caviar! It's so tasty it hurts! I always thought caviar would taste like pickled tapioca.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What the heck does pickled tapioca taste like!?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Name. Profession. Now.

Name: Angel
Text: Me? The name is Angel Starr. Don't go forgetting it. I find myself running Lunchland these days. Is... that what you wanted me to say, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Very well, witness. Please describe the incident to us.

Name: Judge
Text: The prosecution will wait! I'm not finished eating...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hurry it up!)

Name: Judge
