Text: Mmmm... Very well, Mr. Edgeworth. As you know, we usually call on the police to provide a description of the crime...

Name: Angel
Text: Your Honor, as Mr. Edgeworth has said to the court... I am a... "professional."

Name: Judge
Text: Uh... Huh? What exactly does that mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Until two years ago, Ms. Angel Starr was a special investigator with the police. She was a first-rate homicide detective.

Name: Ema
Text: Wh-whaaaat!? Ms. Starr was a detective!?

Name: Judge
Text: ... Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa-hah! I-I know who you are!!! Cough-up...!?

Name: Angel
Text: Cough-up Queen Angel Starr, Your Honor. Long time no see.

Name: Judge
Text: V-v-very well! Y-you may continue with the description, Ms. Starr!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Just who is this lady!?)

Name: Angel
Text: If I might have the court's attention over here... The parking lot at the Prosecutor's Office is divided into two blocks. A Block is for the Prosecutor's Office personnel. B Block is for visitors and clients... A chain divider separates the two blocks.

Name: Judge
Text: I suppose that's to keep visitors from taking up prosecutor's spaces, yes.

Name: Angel
Text: The crime took place by a car in the back of A Block, in the car's trunk. The killer stabbed the victim with a knife and went to drive the body out. Unfortunately for her there was a witness, and an arrest was made on the spot.

Name: Judge
Text: And who was this valiant "witness"...?

Name: Angel
Text: Why, it was me, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Witness, did you see the very moment of the crime?

Name: Angel
Text: Of course, Your Honor. Immediately after that, I apprehended the Chief Prosecutor.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... It seems rather cut and dry, doesn't it? Well, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... I can't agree on principle, Your Honor.

Name: Angel
Text: It seems that some poor losers are unwilling to accept the truth, Your Honor. Shall I proceed to crush what little hope they have remaining?

Name: Judge
Text: If you can... Then give them your worst, Ms. Starr!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wait, are they talking about me...!?)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Bringing a lunchbox to your boyfriend? How touching!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. As you can see... There is no room for doubt.

Name: Judge
Text: The key "point" of your testimony seems to be nothing other than... the point of the knife which you saw being stabbed into Detective Goodman!

Name: Angel
Text: So... how does it feel to be so utterly crushed?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... I'm still thinking about that.

Name: Ema
Text: I-it's merely a flesh wound, Mr. Wright!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, Mr. Wright. You may cross-examine the witness.

Name: Angel
Text: Somehow, I always knew a day like this would come.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How did you know!?

Name: Angel
Text: I respect the prosecutors' basic abhorrence of crime. Yet their methods are ugly and twisted. Twisted methods will always lead to tragedy.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The lunchlady's uninformed opinion is duly noted.

Name: Angel
Text: Given that they are used to erasing inconvenient evidence at their whim... Killing off a detective that knew too much is merely an extension of that.

Name: Ema
Text: Ms. Starr... do you have something personal against prosecutors?

Name: Angel
Text: I felt that I had found my dream job when I became an investigator... And if I hadn't been laid off by those prosecutors over there, I'd still be one.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Laid off...? (She was fired...)

Name: Angel
Text: To me, prosecutors are nothing more than worms. That said, I am a pro, as you know. My testimony is unbiased... and flawless.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. You may continue, Ms. Starr.

Name: Angel
Text: I was on my way to deliver a lunchbox to my boyfriend...

Name: Phoenix
Text: This boyfriend... he's the detective?

Name: Angel
Text: Not that boyfriend. The security guard.

Name: Judge
Text: Th-"that" boyfriend? You have... several?

Name: Angel
Text: Yes. "This" boyfriend, "that" boyfriend, and "the other" boyfriend. Care to join? The "yet another" boyfriend position is still open for applicants.

Name: Judge
Text: ... I-I'll stick with the lunch, thanks.

Name: Ema
Text: Note to self: the judge had to think before replying.

Name: Angel
Text: The security guard room is in the lot, in A Block. It's up on the second level so you can see everything from there.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That would be the room with the "SECURITY" sign.) Incidentally, did you bring your lunchboxes by car?

Name: Angel
Text: Since I'm a visitor now, I parked in B Block.

Name: Ema
Text: So... she was in B Block when she witnessed the crime.

Name: Angel
Text: When I sensed something... perhaps it was my finely-honed detective instincts working.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You "sensed" something? So, you're saying you had a premonition of the murder?

Name: Angel
Text: It felt like... how would you say... Oh yes... It was like the feeling you get when you view a pumpkin chock full of seeds!

Name: Judge
Text: I have no idea what that means.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Speaking of a "detective's instincts"... Wasn't the victim, Mr. Bruce Goodman, also a detective?

Name: Angel
Text: Yes, well, he was like a young cheese.

Name: Judge
Text: A... young cheese?

Name: Angel
Text: A pale white cheese, not yet tangy with experience on the streets. A greenhorn.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I, of course, am hard, yellowed, sharp as a tack.

Name: Ema
Text: I bet you stink, too.

Name: Angel
Text: In any case, there, in the lot, I felt something stirring in the back of my mind...

Name: Angel
Text: Then, through a wire fence, I saw the chief prosecutor standing next to a garish car.

Name: Phoenix
Text: By "garish car," you mean...

Name: Angel
Text: Mr. Edgeworth's car, yes.

Name: Judge
Text: M-Mr. Edgeworth's!?

Name: Angel
Text: Incidentally, the knife with which the victim was stabbed was also Mr. Edgeworth's. Wasn't it?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Indeed, it was.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm! What an odd case this is. And the person you saw... you are sure it was the defendant?

Name: Angel
Text: I saw her from no further than thirty feet away. I am certain it was her.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If she's telling the truth, we're doomed!)

Name: Ema
Text: Let's just do what we can! Even if we don't have any proof, we can always complain!*

Name: Phoenix
Text: Witness! In your testimony, you clearly stated the following: Prosecutors are nothing more than worms. Ergo! You are a biased witness!

Name: Angel
Text: You might want to keep those silly opinions to YOURSELF in the future, rookie.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Rookie?

Name: Angel
Text: Unless you're willing to risk the consequences of doubting me? I'll fry you like a fritter! Crispy on the outside... chewy on the inside!!!

Name: Judge
Text: That... That was inspiring!

Name: Ema
Text: I believe I've heard that tag line elsewhere... you could cry plagiarism?

Name: Angel
Text: I may be relegated to the lowly post of lunchlady... But my instincts are honed!

Name: Judge
Text: A-a photograph! You took this!?

Name: Angel
Text: The moment I witnessed the crime, my reflexes took over and snap! I took a picture. In fact... One of my lunchboxes is rigged with a camera.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I suppose that's more exciting than just hanging it around your neck.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Er... this is my first time seeing this photograph.

Name: Angel
Text: You think I'd show it to you, a prosecutor? Think again.

Name: Angel
Text: My boyfriend works in the photography division of Criminal Affairs.

Name: Judge
Text: Well... This is most certainly the defendant!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh, that is unmistakably Lana Skye!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So, what was the defendant doing at the time?

Name: Angel
Text: The chief prosecutor was holding a knife in her right hand....

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Tell me more about this knife that the suspect was carrying.

Name: Angel
Text: Well, I'd say the blade was about 10 centimeters long. Is that right, Mr. Edgeworth? It is your knife, after all.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Er... Ahem, yes, that's about right.

Name: Angel
Text: Prosecutors are, by nature, well-versed in the location of a man's vital organs. I'm sure it was easier than boiling an egg for my egg salad surprise set.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-you can't testify as to her ability to kill an egg! I mean, a person!

Name: Angel
Text: Hmm? Perhaps a chicken salad set would have been a better metaphor?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So, the defendant was holding a knife. What then?

Name: Angel
Text: Then, she thrust the pointy tip of the knife into Detective Goodman's chest!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Tell the court why you didn't try to stop this crime! You did see her raise the knife to strike, no?

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... The defense has a point.

Name: Angel
Text: Unfortunately, by the time I realized what was going on, it was already too late.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Too late...?

Name: Angel
Text: Yes... the next moment... The chief prosecutor brought down the murder weapon!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... I see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: And you witnessed this? You saw Ms. Skye stab the victim with the knife?

Name: Angel
Text: As I've already said, yes! I swear it on my finest "Salmon Swirl" lunch!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm!!! I'm sure that is a fine lunch!

Name: Phoenix
Text: But... isn't that odd? Look at this photograph! This is the photograph you took of the very moment of the crime, is it not? Then why is Ms. Skye not holding a knife!?

Name: Judge
Text: ... Ahem. Mr. Edgeworth, your thoughts?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let's be a little more careful with our evidence, shall we?*

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It is you that needs to be more careful, Mr. Wright!*

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This photograph was not taken the moment before the stabbing... This was taken the moment AFTER the stabbing!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-how can you tell that!?

Name: Angel
Text: Blood splatter.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Angel
Text: See the dark crimson stain on the Chief Prosecutor's coat?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's a black-and-white photograph!)

Name: Judge
Text: Ah... yes, it's hard to tell, but this could be blood.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well, Mr. Wright? I see no problem here. No problem... except you.

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! Are you going to just sit there and take that kind of abuse!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Argh... You got a better idea?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait! That contradicts what the witness said in her testimony! Namely, that she took the picture the "moment" she witnessed the crime!

Name: Angel
Text: Well, it seems I was slightly unclear. My apologies.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Th-that's it!?

Name: Angel
Text: If you run out of lunch, you order seconds. Problem solved! If you don't like it, try ordering the jumbo sized lunch from the get-go!

Name: Ema
Text: Good advice. I'm not sure I understood it, but... good advice.

Name: Angel
Text: I didn't have time to stop her. Prosecutor Skye was cold, calculating, like a robot. She killed without pain or remorse! It was a premeditated murder!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: P-premeditated!? How do you know!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Look at the chief prosecutor's hands in that photograph.

Name: Judge
Text: Well...! Are those... gloves?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Surgical gloves made of thin rubber, most likely. Why would she have those on?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If it was not premeditated, she would not be wearing those gloves!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Waaaaaargh!

Name: Judge
Text: These gloves do seem to tell a tale of premeditation!

Name: Angel
Text: Premeditated murder... a serious offense.

Name: Judge
Text: Witness! Add this to your testimony!

Name: Angel
Text: The murder was planned! The rubber gloves prove it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: What if she was just in the habit of wearing gloves? Like, driving gloves?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The gloves were admitted as evidence when the defendant was arrested! They were rubber gloves, of the kind used for autopsies!

Name: Angel
Text: In other words, when the chief prosecutor came to the crime scene... She came to do murder! It's the only possible conclusion one can make. Everything was planned, it was a premeditated crime!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Arrrrgh!

Name: Judge
Text: Impressive! I'm sorry they took you off the force, Ms. Starr!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is bad... She's got them thinking this was all planned... If she can prove this claim, the trial's already over! I've got to think of a way to show that this wasn't premeditated!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Witness, do you know what this is?

Name: Angel
Text: Are you trying to test me? I sell box lunches for a living, you know. That's a knife. THE knife. The knife that was in Mr. Edgeworth's trunk!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Indeed, it is my knife.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense has a request. We ask that the witness provide an ACCURATE testimony.

Name: Angel
Text: What's that, Rookie?

Name: Phoenix
Text: In your testimony... You stated that Lana Skye planned this murder. And that's why she was wearing those special gloves.

Name: Judge
Text: Seems like a natural conclusion to me! The gloves do indicate planning...

Name: Phoenix
Text: However! Why would she not also prepare the most important thing... the murder weapon!?

Name: Angel
Text: Oh.

Name: Phoenix
Text: This knife just happened to be in the trunk of that car. Ladies and gentlemen, if you're going to plan a murder, you don't forget the weapon!

Name: Angel
Text: Ugh... Woooooooorrrgh!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Great! Now the tide is turning in our favor!)

Name: Ema
Text: Great show, Mr. Wright! My sister's as good as free!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wright. I believe the next lunch you'll be eating is... humble pie!

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-what!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I hope you weren't deluding yourself into thinking that the "tide has turned." Not over such a trifling detail!

Name: Phoenix
Text: B-but this shoots a hole in the whole premeditated theory!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Bah! The prosecution could care less if it was premeditated or not. The only one who seems to care is that lunchlady over there.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The defendant, Lana Skye, murdered a detective with a knife. That is the only thing the prosecution need prove. Nothing else.

Name: Angel
Text: Very good, Mr. Prosecutor... I suppose you think you're clever now? But you know as well as I do that she planned on killing him! It was planned! If it wasn't, why would she have been wearing...

Name: Judge
Text: I believe I'd like to hear your testimony again.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Witness, please tell us only what you "saw," not what you "thought."

Name: Angel
Text: How dare you! My powers of deduction are not to be underestimated!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Really now...)

Name: Judge
Text: The victim was summoned from the Police Department to the Prosecutor's Office.. It does sound a lot like premeditation, doesn't it!?

Name: Ema
Text: So, if I order pizza, does that mean I'm planning to kill the delivery boy?

Name: Judge
Text: In any case, the defense may now cross-examine the witness.

Name: Angel
Text: Lana Skye intended to murder Detective Goodman!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You've said that, but you haven't told us how you know!

Name: Angel
Text: That's what I'm about to tell you, Rookie!

Name: Judge
Text: I believe what she just said was a mere prelude to the story she is about to tell. Try not to interrupt her again.

Name: Angel
Text: Rookie... Never interrupt a storyteller! It's like pulling a bun out of the oven half-baked!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Something's half-baked here alright, and it's you!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Try not to confuse the defense, witness. They're not very quick on their feet. Now, why did you believe the suspect had intentions to murder the victim?

Name: Angel
Text: Her actions speak for themselves!

Name: Angel
Text: That's why she called the victim all the way to the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You have no proof that Ms. Skye called him there!

Name: Angel
Text: You have no proof that she didn't!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Mr. Edgeworth, thoughts?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There is no record of a call made on the defendant, Ms. Lana Skye's phone.

Name: Angel
Text: She might have written him a letter!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (C'mon! You could have tried "public phone" first, at least!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: In any case, the victim came to the Prosecutor's Office, where he was murdered.

Name: Judge
Text: I'm sure he had a reason to be there. Witness? Why do you think it was the suspect who summoned the victim that day?

Name: Angel
Text: I'm sure the Chief Prosecutor had a grudge against the victim.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What kind of "grudge"!?

Name: Angel
Text: Well, I wouldn't know that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course you don't! That's because she didn't have a grudge!

Name: Angel
Text: Rookie... I have a lunchbox here. Now... what's inside?

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-how am I supposed to know!?

Name: Angel
Text: See? We agree there is a lunchbox here, but we don't know what's inside! A person's life is like a lunchbox with pretzels. Don't you agree?

Name: Judge
Text: I-I get it! That's why my lunch was so salty!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This judge isn't very good with metaphors...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The suspect had a grudge against Detective Goodman. Will you tell us your basis for thinking this?

Name: Angel
Text: It's simple...

Name: Angel
Text: Nothing else could drive that human machine to plunge the knife in again and again...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: A "human machine"!? That's a contradiction!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Please... Can't you find fault with something of substance, Mr. Wright?

Name: Ema
Text: Note to self: Mr. Edgeworth's sighs smell like citrus fruit.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Umm... You say "again and again"... how many times did she stab him, exactly?

Name: Angel
Text: We often say "chop into a thousand pieces," but we don't actually mean 1,000 pieces. What difference does it make if the deed is done!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (How come she's getting mad at me!?)

Name: Judge
Text: Let's just say she stabbed him several times and leave it at that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Leave it at that!? This is a murder case, people!)

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright, you should speak up if you have an objection, you know!

Name: Angel
Text: Her red muffler looked like blood to me... that's how ghastly the whole scene was.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Her red muffler?

Name: Angel
Text: Yes, like a scarf. The Chief Prosecutor always wears one around her neck. So she can be easily hanged at a moment's notice, I suppose...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (She's right... Ms. Skye was wearing a red scarf... wasn't she?) But wait... Isn't it odd that you mistook that for splattered blood?

Name: Judge
Text: Well, people often mistake my beard... For a bib.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A judge with a bib. That's why this place feels so much like kindergarten sometimes.)

Name: Angel
Text: Actually... I do think I saw some traces of blood on her chest...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: However, the autopsy report is clear on this matter. There was only one knife wound.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Apparently, Ms. Starr isn't entirely sure of her own testimony.)

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! This is our chance!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chance for what, I wonder...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Starr! I demand an explanation...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The witness is clearly not suited for detective work.

Name: Angel
Text: W-what!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The suspect was not wearing a scarf or muffler of any kind when she stabbed the victim. And you've proved it yourself! With this photograph!

Name: Angel
Text: Huh? B-but that... That can't be!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Only a true professional could be so clueless. I'm sure you'll make a good lunchlady, have no fear.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm! Harsh words! But good!

Name: Ema
Text: In the end, Mr. Edgeworth prevails!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What was my objection, chopped liver!?)

Name: Angel
Text: B-but it was there, a scarf, no, not that, but something red! Really!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well now, where were we? The witness has given us an entertaining interlude, now back to business.

Name: Angel
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, witness, continue your testimony. You saw the crime, and apprehended the suspect... Tell us about that.

Name: Angel
Text: ...... Very well. I do remember some things accurately, at least.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ultimately, we couldn't shake the most important part of her testimony.)

Name: Ema
Text: The most important part...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The part where your sister stabs the victim! (This next testimony might just be the moment of truth!)

Name: Judge
Text: You are quite determined about this scarf, aren't you?

Name: Angel
Text: I strike like a snake and bite like a cobra! That's me. Angel Starr.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That wasn't a very good metaphor. First of all, a cobra is a kind of snake.

Name: Angel
Text: Don't bother me with details, unless you want to get bitten!

Name: Phoenix
Text: N-no thanks!

Name: Ema
Text: Note to self: Attorney Wright gets bitten by snake.

Name: Angel
Text: The chief prosecutor tried to resist, but her efforts were in vain. She knocked my hands aside, kicked over an oil drum...

Name: Phoenix
Text: O-oil drum? (Hard to imagine...)

Name: Angel
Text: Oh, she's beautiful, but deadly! A predator, this one! A leopard woman! Rowr!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, Mr. Wright. Your cross-examination, if you will.

Name: Angel
Text: After the murder, the suspect attempted to run behind a partition off to her side.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So where is this "partition" on the floor plans?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm sure she means this wall next to the car.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's right... There was a wall there... about 6 feet high.)

Name: Angel
Text: She was obviously trying to hide herself. Quite a natural thing for a criminal to do!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And what did you do then?

Name: Angel
Text: I quickly caught her, explained her rights to her, and arrested her on the spot.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You say "quickly"... were you close to the suspect?

Name: Angel
Text: As I just said! I was only 30 feet away from her the whole time.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... maybe I should press her for more details?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'd like to see this on the floor plans, just to be safe. The Lunchland car was...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: She was a "visitor," thus, she was parked in B Block.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you witnessed the murder from... here?

Name: Judge
Text: That would make it about 30 feet from the car, yes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Is that correct, Ms. Starr?

Name: Angel
Text: Y-yes, that's right.

Name: Judge
Text: But, there was a chain link fence in front of you...?

Name: Angel
Text: I went over it, of course.

Name: Judge
Text: Amazing! The Cough-up Queen, lunchlady athlete, indeed.

Name: Ema
Text: It would have taken her a little time to climb over the fence. So she couldn't have gotten to my sister THAT fast...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yeah, that fence was about nine feet high, too. How come Ms. Skye didn't get away?)

Name: Angel
Text: Ah, yes. When I arrested her, she mentioned the muffler!

Name: Phoenix
Text: She mentioned the muffler? What exactly did she say?

Name: Angel
Text: If I remembered exactly I would have told you in my testimony!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Cheeky!)

Name: Angel
Text: Anyway, all I heard her say was the word "muffler."

Name: Judge
Text: Just that one word?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So... what you heard wasn't the suspect talking to you, but to someone else?

Name: Angel
Text: Yes. The chief prospector was talking on her phone!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Her phone? You mean... this cell phone?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: By phone... do you mean this cell phone, discovered at the crime scene?

Name: Angel
Text: Yes, ultimately.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ultimately?

Name: Angel
Text: My memory... it's like a salmon, heading upstream, you see.

Name: Judge
Text: N-no, the court doesn't see, Ms. Starr.

Name: Angel
Text: The chief prosecutor first attempted to use the phone hanging on the wall.

Name: Judge
Text: On the wall?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's right! Near the car... there was an emergency phone on the wall!)

Name: Angel
Text: Apparently, it was out of order.

Name: Judge
Text: And so she used her cell phone?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Indeed, the emergency phone was out of order that day.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. Good witnessing, witness!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Good witnessing? What ever happened to good testifying?)

Name: Judge
Text: You should of course add this to your testimony.

Name: Angel
Text: The things I do to please this rookie defense attorney.

Name: Angel
Text: She gave up trying to use the phone on the wall and just used her cell phone!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... do you think you could restate your testimony for the court?

Name: Judge
Text: Ah hah! I was going to ask the same thing!

Name: Angel
Text: I'll only say this one time, so listen close, Rookies. The chief prosecutor stabbed the victim, and ran behind the partition. Then she picked up the emergency phone on the wall, but it was out of order. So she pulled her own cell phone out of her pocket.

Name: Judge
Text: And during that time, you climbed over the chain link fence...

Name: Angel
Text: Then, when I boldly grabbed her arm... The chief prosecutor hung up her phone!

Name: Phoenix
Text: And you saw her doing this?

Name: Ema
Text: ...? What is it, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: I have to conclude that you have a personal grudge against Ms. Lana Skye.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The witness is a former detective. Her testimony is unmarred by personal bias.

Name: Angel
Text: Well, who would have thought you would be my knight in shining armor, prosecutor? You who, together with the chief prosecutor, kicked me out two years ago!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, Ms. Starr... This is a fatal contradiction with your testimony... How do you explain this?

Name: Angel
Text: Hmph! I don't know what you're talking about. Mess with me... and I'll make you cough it ALL up!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ahem. Let's look at the floor plans. You said you witnessed the crime from this point. However, if that's true... You couldn't possibly have seen Ms. Skye making that phone call!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I believe you see what I'm getting at. That emergency phone was on the back side of this partition. If, indeed, you were in B Block... You couldn't have seen it!

Name: Angel
Text: Wha... Waaaaaaaaaaarrrgh!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! What is the meaning of this?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's simple, Your Honor. She's not coughing up lunch...  she's coughing up lies!!!

Name: Angel
Text: Grrr!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That's quite a claim, Mr. Wright... perhaps you will allow me a question? Tell us exactly what lie this witness has told the court!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Here's where the counterattack begins! I can't afford to get this wrong!) The witness lied about...

Name: Phoenix
Text: She tried to use the emergency phone... but it was out of order. What is significant about this fact? Nothing. It would be pointless for her to lie about it!

Name: Judge
Text: Pointless to lie... I see!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The witness did actually see Ms. Skye using the emergency phone. In other words... Ms. Starr witnessed the crime from a different location!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: A different location!? Now that's a pointless lie if I ever heard one!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Before you call my lie pointless... at least let me tell it!

Name: Judge
Text: Let me ask a question to our clever wordsmith, Mr. Wright. Just where was the witness when she saw the crime!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (All the testimony we've heard until now points in one direction...) The place from where Ms. Starr witnessed this crime was... here!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is the only place where she could have been.

Name: Judge
Text: The security guard room?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Indeed, the security room in the underground parking lot is well positioned... It's built on the second level, so you can see the entire lot.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... She would have been able to see the emergency phone from there. But why there? There are many other places where she could have seen the phone.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Not in this case, Your Honor. The witness, not being part of the Prosecutor's Office, couldn't park in A Block. The only place where she could have seen the crime and the back of the partition is here. I remember in your testimony, you said... You brought a lunch to your "boyfriend" in the security guard room, yes? Well, Ms. Starr?

Name: Angel
Text: ... How many years have I been getting the better of men...? To think that the tables could be turned... Today, a man has got the better of Angel Starr!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Witness! What have you done!? You used to be a detective! You should know better!

Name: Angel
Text: I'm not turning back. The guilty will be punished. And I'll do what I must to make sure justice prevails.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The guilty... is she talking about Ms. Skye...?)

Name: Ema
Text: Um, Mr. Wright? Doesn't this strike you as odd? Why did Ms. Starr lie? It doesn't make sense!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Ema
Text: She could have just said she saw the crime from the security guard station. It wouldn't change anything!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Exactly! This photograph tells all! It was the defendant who stabbed the victim! That truth still stands!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: It "still stands"? I disagree, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If a witness is found to be lying, they're guilty of perjury. She knows this. She wouldn't risk that without a good reason!

Name: Judge
Text: So, tell us what her reason was, Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Huh? M-me?

Name: Judge
Text: Who else!?

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! Let's review what we know!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ms. Starr witnessed the crime from the security guard station... But she lied and said she saw it from B Block... It must make a vital difference... but what? What would change...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: It changes the distance between her and the scene of the crime!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: My condolences, Mr. Wright... But one look at the floor plans and it's quite clear. The distance between the scene of the crime and the guard station is 30 feet. I don't see how that would change what she could see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: What she saw is not in question here. What matters is the time it would take her to reach the scene of the crime!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Starr! You witnessed the crime from the security guard station! Now, how long did it take you to go from there... to the scene of the crime, where you arrested Ms. Skye!?

Name: Judge
Text: Well, witness?

Name: Angel
Text: You...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes...?

Name: Angel
Text: You ordered the Squid Wheels, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The quality of my lunches has gone from low to inedible.)

Name: Angel
Text: I was bringing a PB&J lunch with fresh boysenberry jam to my boyfriend.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Boysenberry for the boyfriend!

Name: Angel
Text: He wasn't in the station, so I waited. I witnessed the crime from the glass-walled station... and before I knew what I was doing, I found myself running towards the scene. But... the door was locked. I couldn't open it. That's why I had to go through the visitor's parking in B Block.

Name: Judge
Text: That's quite a detour.

Name: Angel
Text: It probably took me at least five minutes to get to the scene of the crime.

Name: Judge
Text: F-f-f-five minutes!? Hmm... This changes things considerably!

Name: Angel
Text: But, it was that woman over there in the defendant's chair who stabbed him! I know it! I have photographic evidence! I swear it... I swear it on my finest plastic spork!

Name: Judge
Text: You have a point. And the spork is a wonderful invention.

Name: Angel
Text: Would you like another Caviar Lunch...?

Name: Judge
Text: Absolutely!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh...)

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! You have to do something!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Do I have any evidence to stop this...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Five minutes between the witnessing of the murder and the arrest! Think about it! You could make pasta in that amount of time! If you like it al dente!

Name: Angel
Text: I've got lunchboxes that tie pasta into knots, Rookie!

Name: Phoenix
Text: A five minute "blank"... Isn't that strange!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Strange...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If you were a criminal... What would you do with five minutes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: Well, um... I guess I'd flee the scene. Hey! D-don't get the wrong idea! I didn't kill anyone...

Name: Phoenix
Text: But you have the instincts of a killer! You would run! But this time was different! Ms. Skye dawdled at the scene of the crime... she even had her picture taken! No true criminal would act this way! It's inconceivable!

Name: Angel
Text: Y- yeeeaaargh!

Name: Judge
Text: Well then. It seems we've come to the end of this testimony. She has a grudge against the defendant, and there is a blank in her testimony.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth, is the next witness ready to go?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Unfortunately... I appear to have overestimated this witness on account of her professional history...

Name: Ema
Text: We did it! We screwed that can shut, Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Th-that was too close!)

Name: Judge
Text: I'm afraid that the Cough-up Queen has been dethroned. And with that, court is adjourned!

Name: Angel
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Angel
Text: Mr. Edgeworth, you ordered the Squid Wheels, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's the one she tried to foist off on me!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I prefer to not take the defense team's leftovers. Anything else to say?

Name: Angel
Text: I... might be able to save you. I have decisive evidence.

Name: Judge
Text: Wh-what was that!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Is this another one of her trick lunchboxes!?)

Name: Judge
Text: My apologies, but we have no further questions to ask of you, Ms. Starr.

Name: Angel
Text: Ah... Is this your jumbo lunchbox?

Name: Judge
Text: Whoo hoo! A triple-decker! Out of deference to the witness's determination, I'll allow one more testimony! Let's hear about this decisive evidence.

Name: Angel
Text: Like the Lunchland motto says, you won't be disappointed!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's she going to pull out of her lunchbox this time!?)

Name: Judge
Text: Wh-what!? There was blood found on that shoe!?

Name: Angel
Text: Try Lunchland, for all your lunch and decisive evidence needs!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Witness, what's the meaning of this? Why is this the first time I've heard of this evidence?

Name: Angel
Text: Simple. As I've already said... I don't trust you with evidence, Mr. Edgeworth! That's why I took the liberty of investigating this myself.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And... you had blood tests performed?

Name: Angel
Text: Didn't I mention? I have three boyfriends in forensics.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: In any case, Your Honor, I can't accept this as evidence!

Name: Angel
Text: What...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You should know the two rules of evidence law, Ms. Starr! Rule 1: no evidence shall be shown without the approval of the Police Department! In other words, this shoe is illegal evidence! At least, for the time being!

Name: Ema
Text: I-is that right, Mr. Wright!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It seems so. Edgeworth sure is celebrating.

Name: Angel
Text: Not so fast, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Angel
Text: Don't forget... I used to be a detective! As I mentioned previously... This shoe has already been tested by a member of the forensics department! As you can see, it was approved by the Police Department as of... today. Even the general public can produce official evidence, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Nuh... Ungh!

Name: Ema
Text: I-is that right, Mr. Wright!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It seems so. Edgeworth is looking pretty sullen.

Name: Ema
Text: You could at least study some evidence law! Really!

Name: Judge
Text: The prosecution's complaints notwithstanding... It appears that this evidence satisfies the first rule of evidence law. Well... It seems you have yet another count against you, witness.

Name: Angel
Text: Anything to ensure that the guilty are properly judged.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, Mr. Wright, you may cross-examine the witness!

Name: Angel
Text: I should have mentioned those five minutes when I wasn't looking at the crime scene.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did you lie about those five minutes?

Name: Angel
Text: I guess you could say, I just wanted people to look at the results.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The... results?

Name: Angel
Text: How many times do I have to say this? I saw the chief prosecutor stab the victim before my very own eyes! Compared to that... A five minute "blank" means nothing!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Then why didn't you just tell the truth!

Name: Angel
Text: Don't make me laugh! We're dealing with the most untrustworthy of the vile lot known as prosecutors! Falsified evidence, arranged testimonies, erasing and manipulating evidence... When you fight monsters, you need to use every trick in the book!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This when the suspect is admitting she did it?)

Name: Judge
Text: False testimony is the most despicable crime of all, Ms. Starr. Let's just get this over with.

Name: Angel
Text: And now, to the matter of the victim's shoe... Did I not bring this up...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: And, you found this shoe at the scene of the crime?

Name: Angel
Text: I detained the chief prosecutor, and notified the Police Department... I wanted to make myself useful while I was waiting for the police to arrive.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So, like an ill-trained pooch, you snuck off with a shoe!

Name: Angel
Text: I was afraid someone would erase the chief prosecutor's crime. This shoe was my secret weapon if that should happen. See this fashionable basket I have here...? It carries more than lunchboxes, gentlemen!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'm happy for you and your lunchbox bag, really.)

Name: Judge
Text: In any case, you removed valuable evidence from the scene of the crime.Now, tell us what you did next.

Name: Angel
Text: Two types of blood were found on this shoe! One was of course the victim's.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you brought it to the forensics department?

Name: Angel
Text: If you're going to submit something as evidence in court, you need it approved. To do that, evidence must be analyzed... by a forensics expert.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (And she got away with her little coup because she used to be a detective...)

Name: Judge
Text: The shoe does appear to have bloodstains on it.

Name: Angel
Text: Makes sense. After all, a man was stabbed here.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And that blood belonged to the victim, Detective Goodman?

Name: Angel
Text: As I said, there were two types of blood found on the shoe.

Name: Angel
Text: And the other was...! The defendant, Ms. Lana Skye's blood!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You can't say for sure the blood belonged to the victim with a blood test!

Name: Angel
Text: You claim to know something about blood tests, Rookie?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh...

Name: Angel
Text: Well, speak up!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh, well... Blood comes in four types... A, B, O, and AB... However! You can't tell from a blood test whether a murder was performed... in cold blood!

Name: Judge
Text: ... That's just a figure of speech, Mr. Wright.

Name: Ema
Text: Actually, if you combine all the various blood tests, there are millions of types! It's practically impossible to narrow a blood sample down to one person! Or so I hear.

Name: Phoenix
Text: M-millions of types?

Name: Angel
Text: If I had a little more time, I would have gotten DNA test results... But they said there's very little doubt it could be anyone's but Ms. Lana Skye's.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... So the suspect's blood was found on the victim's shoe...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That ties her directly to the death of Detective Goodman!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I was afraid he was going to say that...)

Name: Angel
Text: This shoe proves it! It's flawless, decisive evidence!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I can't let this evidence go through without a fight!)

Name: Angel
Text: You ordered the peppered fish guts, right?

Name: Angel
Text: Some like it hot, Mr. Wright. Some, like your client. She's in enough hot water to make a whole batch of soup.

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! Do you or don't you have a problem with this shoe!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: A problem...? (This is critical! What's wrong with the victim's shoe?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: If I'm not imagining things... I'd say there is one critical problem with this evidence... A clear contradiction!

Name: Angel
Text: That gleam in your eyes... You're still young, Rookie. I'd give you a peppered fish gut now, but you couldn't take the heat, could you!

Name: Judge
Text: Let's hear what Mr. Wright has to say! What is contradictory about the victim's shoe? Show us the problem with this evidence!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: I wonder if you noticed... there's blood on the bottom of this shoe!

Name: Angel
Text: Don't mess with me, Rookie... Or it'll be your blood on the bottom of my shoe!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Indeed, there is quite a bit of blood on the bottom of the shoe.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It makes sense. The victim was stabbed with a knife! What could possibly be contradictory about blood on the bottom of his shoe!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The problem lies... in the footprint.

Name: Angel
Text: The... footprint?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Note that the bottom of the victim's shoe is covered in blood. Then... isn't it strange? Why weren't any bloody footprints found by the scene of the crime!?

Name: Judge
Text: Ah hah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: As you can see... There were no traces of any such footprints at the scene of the crime! That contradicts your claim about this shoe!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This picture only shows part of the floor, so there could have been bloody footprints.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: If there were bloody prints they would have been found. We checked the scene and found nothing of the sort!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order! Well, witness!?

Name: Angel
Text: What!? Huh? I, uh...

Name: Ema
Text: Great going, Mr. Wright! But... It's true that the lack of a footprint is a contradiction... But then we have to ask why there wasn't a footprint!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh!

Name: Judge
Text: That's true! There has to be a reason why there wasn't a footprint!

Name: Ema
Text: Think, Mr. Wright, think!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Hey, I don't know why it's not there. I'm just good at finding contradictions.

Name: Ema
Text: What!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I see... Now I get it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Get what!?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Our witness is more devious than I gave her credit for! We were hoodwinked to the very end! But she slipped! There is one vital hint to the truth in her testimony...

Name: Judge
Text: Wh-what are you talking about?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Think back to when she told us about apprehending the suspect...

Name: Angel
Text: The chief prosecutor tried to resist, but her efforts were in vain. She knocked my hands aside, kicked over an oil drum... Oh, she's beautiful, but deadly! A predator, this one! A leopard woman! Rowr!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I thought that was a strange thing for the normally cool-headed chief to do.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No kidding!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Now, witness. Allow me to ask a very simple question. This "oil drum"... was it empty?

Name: Angel
Text: ... Oh, that, hmm? I'm not sure I like your attitude, Mr. Edgeworth. Though apparently you're not the slowest conveyor belt in the lunchbox factory.

Name: Judge
Text: Witness! W-well? Was the oil drum empty...?

Name: Angel
Text: The oil drum kicked over by the chief prosecutor... was brimming with water.

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-water? (What does that mean?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Still don't get it, Mr. Wright? Do you want to know the reason she knocked it over? The REAL reason?

Name: Judge
Text: Aaaa haaaaah! You don't mean...!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, the suspect knocked over that oil drum for one reason and one reason alone! To erase the blood stains that would become evidence against her!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whaaaaaaaaargh!

Name: Judge
Text: That ties things up quite nicely! The blood stains left on the victim's shoes tie her quite clearly to this murder! Then, after the deed was done, she knocked over the oil drum to erase the telltale signs!

Name: Angel
Text: Why, that's a prosecutor's specialty... erasing evidence!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That reminds me... Ms. Skye's right hand was hurt... Didn't she say she'd cut herself when she stabbed him...?)

Name: Ema
Text: So my sister's blood on the shoe... That's when it happened?

Name: Judge
Text: Well... I see no reason to prolong this trial.

Name: Ema
Text: M-Mr. Wright! Do something! Please!

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-what!? What can I do? Your sister has confessed to the crime, and she tried to conceal it!

Name: Ema
Text: B-but...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Enough. There is no need for further debate. The verdict, Your Honor!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well...

Name: Ema
Text: But Angel Starr is on the prosecution's side! She could have been lying about the water!

Name: Judge
Text: This court finds the defendant, Ms. Lana Skye...

Name: Angel
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Angel
Text: Little girl... What did you just say?

Name: Ema
Text: Huh...? M-me?

Name: Angel
Text: Did you say that I, Angel Starr... was on the prosecution's side?

Name: Ema
Text: W-well, yeah, you are! You're saying my sister hid evidence by erasing the bloody footprints!

Name: Angel
Text: Well. I thought you'd had your fill, but here you are, demanding a second helping! Another lunchbox... A lunchbox called "evidence"!

Name: Judge
Text: W-wait... Witness, don't tell me you have something else?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You've reached your verdict, Your Honor! Any further comments will be held in contempt of court!

Name: Angel
Text: Your threats don't scare the Cough-up Queen! Look at this!!!

Name: Judge
Text: A photograph...?

Name: Angel
Text: I had this just in case anyone had the gall to suggest... that the white shoe didn't belong to the victim!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I see no room for error in this evidence.

Name: Ema
Text: M-Mr. Wright, wait! Look at the asphalt in this photo!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey! It's clearly wet!

Name: Judge
Text: Erasing the last trace of doubt from the court's mind. Immediately after the murder, the crime scene was washed with water!

Name: Ema
Text: I-I'm sorry, Mr. Wright. I guess I... I couldn't help after all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's not your fault... I knew I couldn't win this case from the beginning. And... it seems this is what your sister wanted anyway! ... I'm sorry, Mia...) ... ... ...

Name: Mia
Text: Wright... wet or not... Don't be so quick to throw in the towel...

Name: Mia
Text: Get yourself up off the asphalt... take another good look... Don't give up... Not until the bitter end.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is the last piece of evidence...)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well! This time I'd like to declare a verdict for good!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, wait!

Name: Judge
Text: What is it with you people!? Can't I hand down my verdicts in peace anymore!? Whatever it is, can it wait?

Name: Phoenix
Text: N-no it can't. Then it will be too late! Look at this photograph, the last one submitted... This trial isn't over... until we give each piece of evidence proper consideration!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So, Wright... Are you saying there's a problem with this latest piece of evidence?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah! (I'll think later!) Yeah, there's a problem! (Right or wrong, I've got to go ahead with this!)

Name: Judge
Text: I suppose since we've come this far, we should give every claim a fair shake. Very well, Mr. Wright. Show the court the problem in this photograph!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The problem in this photograph... is here!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What's this...? There's something poking out of the car's muffler!

Name: Judge
Text: Wait just a moment, Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: You just said "muffler"... However I see no trace of a muffler or scarf of any kind in this photograph!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... A muffler is also a part on a car or motorcycle, Your Honor. Just think of it as... part of the exhaust system. A pipe...

Name: Judge
Text: I see! And... I see! What's that suspicious-looking cloth sticking out of the car's muffler?

Name: Angel
Text: Hmph! So what if there is something sticking out of the muffler! What does that have to do with this case? Nothing! Absolutely nothing!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry, Ms. Starr... But it's not going to be that easy! In fact, you've already told us why this is important to the case... You said as much in your testimony!!!

Name: Angel
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Judge
Text: Let's hear what Mr. Wright has on his mind! Tell us why you think this piece of cloth in the muffler is related to this case.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Starr! Recall your testimony for the court...

Name: Angel
Text: Ah yes. When I arrested her, she mentioned the muffler! That's what had me confused in my earlier testimony!

Name: Angel
Text: Muffler! argh! Yeearrrrgh!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could it be that the "muffler" you heard mentioned... Was actually this exhaust pipe!? If so! That means this piece of cloth is vital evidence!

Name: Angel
Text: Oh... Whooooooooooo ooooooooooooragh!

Name: Judge
Text: Well... It seems we will have to suspend the proceedings.

Name: Angel
Text: Sus... Suspend!?

Name: Judge
Text: I find myself wondering about that piece of cloth. If we leave any question unanswered here we do a disservice to the law! Have the car at the crime scene inspected at once, and bring me that cloth! The verdict will wait until after we've seen all the evidence. Agreed...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I suppose so.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Whew... that was close. But... we made it... at least for now!)

Name: Judge
Text: The court will adjourn for a thirty minute recess! It's lunchtime after all!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He's still hungry!?)

Name: Ema
Text: Um... Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? What?

Name: Ema
Text: Are trials... always like this with you? Like you're swimming up from the bottom of a lake, about to reach the surface... But no matter how hard you paddle you never seem to get there...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Pretty much. Except today we're swimming in quicksand. So what happened to your sister, anyway?

Name: Ema
Text: Apparently she got called off to the judge's chambers.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hmm... Probably something to do with that piece of cloth.

Name: Ema
Text: So! This is where we turn this trial around, right? Our only weapon, a tiny, insignificant piece of cloth!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm the one who's starting to feel tiny and insignificant to tell the truth.
Hola, Pardner!

Name: Marshall
Text: They say you show a red cloth to a bull, it'll fire up its temper! That's what they told me when I was a young'un, at least.

Name: Ema
Text: Officer Marshall!

Name: Marshall
Text: Thought I'd come take a look-see at how the trial's going. Looks like I'm late. They've got the place locked down tighter than a fort in enemy territory!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What is going on over there, anyway? All the police I've seen these last two days have been really on edge.

Name: Marshall
Text: Don't you got enough on your plate without worrying about other people, compadre? You could be worrying about the chief prosecutor's taste in mufflers, for example.

Name: Ema
Text: Um... Officer Marshall? The whole "muffler" thing didn't have anything to do with scarves... She wasn't even wearing a scarf!

Name: Marshall
Text: You don't say? Now don't that just beat all.

Name: Marshall
Text: I've seen the red breeze blow at her slender neck many a time... I saw it that day, too. She was wearing a red muffler.

Name: Ema
Text: What!?

Name: Marshall
Text: At the awards ceremony that afternoon. Edgeworth's seen it too, I'd reckon.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What does that mean!? In the photograph taken at the crime scene... she wasn't wearing a scarf!)

Name: Ema
Text: So, Ms. Starr wasn't mistaken...

Name: Marshall
Text: Well, it's about time. Remember, pardner, sometimes you gotta grab the bull by the horns... and sometimes you just gotta let that bull go where it will. Time will tell!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ugh... I have a bad feeling about this.)

Name: Ema
Text: So... what are we swimming in now, Mr. Wright?

Name: Marshall
Text: If it's steak sauce, I can hook you up with some fine ribs! Ooh-wee!

Name: Judge
Text: I'd... like to... resume...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's up? The judge keeps looking over at the prosecution...)

Name: Judge
Text: Is something wrong, Mr. Edgeworth? Your face is blue, your lips are purple, you're sweating bullets... That furrowed brow, those grinding teeth, those watery eyes... What's more your eyes are unfocused, you're doubled over, your back is bent...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It... can't... be!! This... can't... happen!

Name: Ema
Text: I wonder what happened to Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Judge
Text: Well then, I believe it is time we continued on with this trial. During our recess I had requested that the prosecution conduct an investigation...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Th-this is unacceptable!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... It seems our prosecutor is quite beside himself.

Name: Gant
Text: Ah, er, excuse me. Knock knock?

Name: Judge
Text: ...? Who's there?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's with this guy? A strange, stuffy aura seems to be filling the courtroom.)

Name: Ema
Text: Hey! The temperature rose 5.7 degrees when that man came in!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Who on earth is he...?)

Name: Judge
Text: Ah, it's you...

Name: Gant
Text: Oh! Oh, heh heh. Sorry I'm late, Udgey! The roads were packed. It's just me! Long time no see, eh, Udgey? How ya been? Swim much these days!

Name: Judge
Text: Ah! Hello, hello. No, I've been so busy...

Name: Gant
Text: Busy! Busy-smizzy, Udgey, my boy! You have to make time to relax!

Name: Judge
Text: Y-yes, indeed.

Name: Ema
Text: Udgey... seems to be his nickname for the judge...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm afraid you're right. Very afraid. Um... sorry, but... who are you?

Name: Gant
Text: Ah hah! So you're Wrighto! The attorney! I've heard good things about you, son!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Eh? Uh, th-thanks...?

Name: Gant
Text: So sorry about our little Worthy giving you all that trouble, eh? You know, we should all go swimming together sometime! Jolly!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Little... Little Worthy...?

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! You don't know the district Chief of Police!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chuh....? Chief of Police...!?

Name: Judge
Text: He's the top ranking police officer in the entire district!

Name: Gant
Text: Name's Gant, Damon Gant. Pleased to meet you, everyone!

Name: Judge
Text: So, uh, to what do we owe this honor today? It's been over... two years since you last came to this courtroom, hasn't it?

Name: Gant
Text: Well, it's Worthy, here. Look at the poor fellow! I just thought I'd help out... by bringing this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey! Th-that's...!

Name: Ema
Text: My sister's muffler!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So Ms. Starr wasn't just seeing things! When the crime occurred, Ms. Skye really was wearing that muffler!)

Name: Gant
Text: But to think that it was stuffed into that exhaust pipe... On little Worthy's car, no less! It's really quite embarrassing, even for us.

Name: Judge
Text: Wh-what's this!?

Name: Gant
Text: It's what you'd call a switchblade knife. Quite perplexing, this.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Chief! What kind of outfit are you running!?

Name: Judge
Text: M-Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: How could they miss such a vital piece of evidence!? If your investigators are this lax, how do you expect us to do our job?

Name: Gant
Text: N-now wait a minute, Worthy!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I've no desire to hear your excuses!

Name: Gant
Text: I'm telling you to wait! Or didn't you hear me?

Name: Gant
Text: Have a look at this document, where it says "person in charge of investigation"... There's no mistaking that signature... Miles Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Th-that's no fair! The day of the crime, I-I had...

Name: Gant
Text: Your head in the clouds because you got that award! I know how you feel... But you're the person in charge. I'll expect a written apology.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What? Are you serious!?

Name: Gant
Text: Don't be too upset, we'll find a way to clean up this mess... that you made.

Name: Ema
Text: This is the first time I've seen Mr. Edgeworth at a loss for words...

Name: Judge
Text: This kind of major blunder is unlike you Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Gah...!

Name: Judge
Text: The court accepts this new evidence. But, I'd like to ask the defense a favor first.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes?

Name: Judge
Text: Just to be sure... I'd like to take a look at the blade of this knife.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The b-blade, Your Honor? Well, I don't see why not...

Name: Judge
Text: Could you open it up for me, I wonder?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, well. I think all you have to do is push that switch, and...

Name: Judge
Text: If I cut my finger Mr. Wright, I wouldn't be able to pound my gavel anymore.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yeah. But if I cut my finger, I wouldn't be able to point it at people anymore...)

Name: Ema
Text: Come on! Just hurry up and open it!

Name: Ema
Text: There's a small tag on this knife.

Name: Phoenix
Text: It seems to say "SL-9 2"...

Name: Ema
Text: What does that mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well... (I've heard something similar... "DL-6"... of "DL-6 Incident" fame...)

Name: Ema
Text: But... it's strange.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? What is?

Name: Ema
Text: I'm not certain... But I get the feeling I've seen this somewhere before! Letters like this... or letters that looked a lot like this... somehow.

Name: Ema
Text: Waaaah! D-don't scare me like that!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm the one who's scared!

Name: Ema
Text: Look at this knife blade... the tip is broken off.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (And this dark red stain... blood?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This does not excuse the actions of the Police Department! I would like to hear an explanation from the Chief of Police himself!

Name: Judge
Text: I'm terribly sorry, but could I ask you to testify for us? About the split between the prosecutors and the police... and this knife.

Name: Gant
Text: Sure! Sure thing. Not a problem, not even a little one! Really!

Name: Judge
Text: There... There was a murder at the Police Department!? A detective!?

Name: Gant
Text: That's hush-hush information, Udgey! We haven't exactly announced it yet.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: W-wait a second! You said "5:15"... That's the exact time that Detective Goodman was killed at the Prosecutor's Office!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order!

Name: Gant
Text: Anyway, we at the Department were all a-flustered, as you might well assume. We're in the middle of a top-top-secret investigation. Don't tell anyone, okay?

Name: Judge
Text: I think we understand the Police Department's situation... Well, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Two detectives killed at the same time in two different places...)

Name: Ema
Text: The chances of that are really slim. Scientifically speaking, of course.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'd... like to exercise my right to cross-examine the witness.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well... however! Keep your questions focused on the case at hand!

Name: Gant
Text: This knife is special... but I can't say how here.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Excuse me... "special"?

Name: Gant
Text: Mmhmm. Hard to come by this particular knife anywhere else.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... Might that special thing... be this little tag?

Name: Gant
Text: Oh! Sorry, Wrighto! But I can't say that now. Not that!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: We've established that the knife in Goodman's chest... was this knife. Now why was there another knife at the scene of the crime?

Name: Judge
Text: That's quite a mystery!

Name: Gant
Text: And like a mystery, it's wrapped in something... a muffler!

Name: Gant
Text: Unless there's evidence to prove a connection between this knife and Goodman...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This knife was found on the scene of our crime! I think that makes it connected to the case, don't you!?

Name: Gant
Text: See, there's a lot of things that go on at the Department I can't explain... It's... delicate, okay? Sorry, Wrighto!

Name: Ema
Text: Maybe there's something about the knife that will give us a clue! Let's examine that knife while we can, Wrighto!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmmm... evidence that links this knife to Detective Goodman... I think perhaps the pieces are falling into place... I should try presenting the piece of evidence that's had me stumped all this time!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So, how were things down at the Department...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait a second!

Name: Gant
Text: Ah, at last! An honest to goodness "objection"!

Name: Phoenix
Text: This knife... This has to have something to do with Detective Goodman!

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean!?

Name: Gant
Text: Ah hah! An honest-to-goodness what do you mean from the judge! This is great!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look at the tag on this knife! It reads "SL-9 2"...

Name: Judge
Text: And this is important... why?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Over here we also have... A memo that was on the body of the victim!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... what's this? 6 minus 7S... 12/2...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor... It's upside-down.

Name: Judge
Text: Upside...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The printed name on the memo makes it look like it's right-side up... But turn it around and what do you get!?

Name: Judge
Text: Ah... Ah haaaaah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: When he wrote this note, he was holding the paper upside down!

Name: Judge
Text: SL-9... That's the same thing that is written on the knife's tag! Order! Order! Well, Chief?

Name: Gant
Text: ... Ah, well. I guess the cat's out of the bag... You win, Wrighto!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... win? Ah... (What game is this guy playing!?)

Name: Gant
Text: That was a bad day for the Department. We weren't in any shape to do an investigation.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Something didn't happen at the Police Department too, did it...?

Name: Gant
Text: You got a good look in your eyes, there, Wrighto my boy. Sharp! Hungry!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Chief... did something happen? And why haven't I heard?

Name: Gant
Text: Why haven't you heard? Or why didn't you ask?

Name: Gant
Text: No matter, I understand. You were busy, what with Lana's case and all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, what happened!? What happened at the Police Department that day?

Name: Gant
Text: The time of the crime? 5:15. Scary coincidence, eh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Five... 5:15...!? B-but that's... That's when Detective Goodman was killed in the Prosecutor's Office!

Name: Judge
Text: What!?

Name: Gant
Text: Funny, isn't it? A murder at the Prosecutor's place, and a murder at our place at the very same time! What are the chances!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Coincidence!?)

Name: Ema
Text: This is just my gut feeling... but I'd say there's a 0.001% chance of that happening!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chief Gant, please tell us more about the incident!

Name: Gant
Text: It's not officially linked to this here case, so I can't talk much about it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: How can you say there's no connection!?

Name: Gant
Text: How? Because I'm the Chief of Police! I can't just say anything I please, Wrighto. You understand!

Name: Judge
Text: Try to understand, Wrighto.

Name: Gant
Text: Well, if you can prove there is a connection, more power to you. Maybe there is something that ties the two murders together?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Whatever it is, I'd better find it and get to the bottom of this!)

Name: Gant
Text: This knife is special... but I can't say how here.

Name: Gant
Text: This knife was evidence in a case. It was stolen from the Department's evidence room.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So this knife... was stolen?

Name: Gant
Text: Yes, but on the day of the murder.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It was evidence, you say. Was it, in fact, a murder weapon?

Name: Gant
Text: Nice! Nice! Nice! Good show, little Worthy! It was a murder weapon, as it happens. It was evidence from a case long-since solved...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So this knife was stolen on the day of the murder... And it was found in the exhaust pipe of Edgeworth's car...)

Name: Ema
Text: Hard to think there isn't a connection there!

Name: Gant
Text: That was a bad day for the Department. We weren't in any shape to do an investigation.

Name: Gant
Text: A detective was killed at the Police Department, see... what a mess!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: On the same day that a detective was killed in the Prosecutor's parking lot... Another detective... was killed at the Police Department!?

Name: Gant
Text: That's a fact. Surprising, isn't it, Udgey?

Name: Judge
Text: I'm at a loss for words.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And the perpetrator? Do you have a suspect?

Name: Gant
Text: Well, there was a suspect. Just arrested 'em, in fact.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Just arrested! That was quick...)

Name: Gant
Text: But... there's still a lot of unanswered questions. Maybe you could help, Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I suppose I could help... if you help me by giving me data on your case?

Name: Gant
Text: Oooh, good one! This kid's sharp! Okay, here's the deal. I'll tell you one thing and one thing only...

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, tell me... where was the victim found?

Name: Gant
Text: ... Well, I can't speak on where the corpse was found. But I can say the crime took place in the evidence room at the Police Department.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The evidence room!?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (W-wait a second... I have heard of that!)

Name: Ema
Text: The evidence room... Didn't he mention that in his testimony just now?

Name: Gant
Text: This knife was evidence in a case. It was stolen from the Department's evidence room.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (There's the connection between the two cases!)

Name: Ema
Text: You seem happy, Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Happy? We just got handed our ticket to go to town on this case! (With the link between the two cases established, we finally have some leverage. Now we can get Gant to testify about the details!)

Name: Gant
Text: The time of the crime? 5:15. Scary coincidence, eh?

Name: Gant
Text: It's not officially linked to this here case, so I can't talk much about it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chief... The defense's position is simply this: The connection between these two cases has already been proven!

Name: Gant
Text: Heh, you don't say? Well, out with it Wrighto! What's your connection?

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, out with it, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The connection is a place, mentioned in the testimony we just heard. The knife found in the lot was stolen... from the Police Department's evidence room.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Not to mention the victim had written down the numbers on the knife's evidence tag.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And we also know that the detective murdered at the Police Department... was killed in that very same evidence room!

Name: Judge
Text: Indeed... There do seem to be too many connections for it to be a coincidence.

Name: Gant
Text: You two make a good pair. It took my men two days to find out what you deduced right here.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Chief! I request that you release your information on the victim at the Police Department!

Name: Gant
Text: See, that's the tricky part. It hasn't been announced yet, and all...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Can we get the information... unofficially?

Name: Gant
Text: Hmmmmm... Sure! Why not? It's unofficial, after all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What? Really!?)

Name: Ema
Text: Who would have guessed?

Name: Gant
Text: I'll cooperate, but I can't reveal the name of the victim at the Department, okay?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: If you're going to tell us a little, why not tell us everything?

Name: Gant
Text: Ah, well, case information is sticky stuff. You have to do everything properly.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh well... I guess I might as well try to get what I can out of him...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Okay... How about you tell me the victim's ID number?

Name: Gant
Text: Hmm? Sure, why not. It's not like you'll be able to tell who it is from that!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course not. You won't tell me their name, after all.

Name: Gant
Text: We keep a tight lid on ID numbers, so don't go getting your hopes up. The number is... 5842189.

Name: Judge
Text: Well! That's quite... long!

Name: Gant
Text: And we have to remember these! It drives me nuts!

Name: Judge
Text: 8... 2... I can't do it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (You didn't even get the first number right!)

Name: Judge
Text: Well, Mr. Wright? Does this tell you anything?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The ID number of the victim at the Police Department... 5842189...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Actually, it does, Your Honor. It does...! I think!

Name: Judge
Text: Meaning?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It has to be what I think it is... But what does this mean?)

Name: Judge
Text: Well, let's hear what the defense has to say. You say the ID number of the detective who was murdered at the Police Department... tells you something? What does it tell you!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Witness! ...

Name: Judge
Text: ... What is it, Mr. Wright!? You're grinning like a schoolgirl on prom night!

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, I... it's just, I got confused...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And this is news?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Just come out with both guns blazing... like you always do.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The Police Department... the Prosecutor's Office... Two places, two detectives murdered... at one time.) Actually, I happen to have a police ID number here.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh hoh! Is it yours?

Name: Phoenix
Text: N-no, Your Honor. I'm a defense attorney... remember? This is the ID number of our victim, Detective Goodman.

Name: Gant
Text: Shame on you, Wrighto! Personnel IDs are top secret!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Goodman's ID number is... "5842189."

Name: Judge
Text: ... And...? This means... what, exactly?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Judge
Text: Wait... That ID number we heard from the Chief earlier.. That started with "82..." Hmm. I've forgotten.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (You even got the first number wrong!) The number the Chief of Police gave us was... 5842189.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: W-wait a second, Wright! What does this...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mean? That's what I want to know! The two ID numbers are identical! In other words... The detective killed in the Police Department's evidence room was Bruce Goodman!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What does our witness think about that!?

Name: Gant
Text: ... Oh! Ho ho ho, sharp as a tack, Wrighto! Sharp as a tack!

Name: Judge
Text: B-but wait! Detective Goodman is OUR victim! He was killed at 5:15 in the underground parking lot!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yet, a Detective Bruce Goodman was also killed at the Police Department... In the evidence room... at the exact same time!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Th-that's impossible! So, what we're saying is... The same person was killed at the same time!? And in a completely different location!?

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order! Chief! What does this mean!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No... what I want to know is... why didn't I hear about this!? Yes, it's top-secret, fine! But I'm the prosecutor in charge of the case!!!

Name: Gant
Text: Now, just wait a second, Worthy. No need to get all flustered.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor! The Police Department has made a grave error in this case...

Name: Gant
Text: Wait. I said "wait." Or didn't you hear me?

Name: Gant
Text: The oversight... the grave error...? Mr. Edgeworth... They're yours.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wh-what!? How... how dare...

Name: Gant
Text: We informed you yesterday. I believe it was our Officer Meekins who brought you the news?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: O-officer... Meekins?

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! Where have we heard that name before? Wait... Ah hah!

Name: Officer
Text: Erm...! Excuse me! But is Mr. Edgeworth, uh... anywhere on the premises? I'm here, sir, at the request of the chief, sir! I've got your report, sir!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You don't mean... him!?

Name: Gant
Text: According to Meekins, you didn't accept the report?

Name: Gant
Text: Hard to believe.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: B-but your officer, he told me! He said that report had nothing to do with the Lana Skye incident!

Name: Gant
Text: [Detective Bruce Goodman murdered in the Police Department evidence room...] Mr. Edgeworth. The victim's name is written right on the top of the report.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Gaaaaaaah! Wh-why didn't your officer tell me!?

Name: Ema
Text: Honestly, I'm not sure if that officer was capable of making the connection... He did seem... challenged.

Name: Gant
Text: In any case, this is a serious error, a gross negligence of duty on your part, Worthy.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: B-But, sir!!! You could have submitted that report this morning to the court, as evidence! Then, I...

Name: Gant
Text: No such luck this time, Worthy... or should I say, un-Worthy?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What!?

Name: Gant
Text: Now what was the second rule of evidence law, hmm?

Name: Ema
Text: Well, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Oh, well, it's, uh...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Rule 2: New evidence may only be submitted if it concerns the case on trial. And how is this relevant!?

Name: Gant
Text: Normally, you submit a list of evidence to be used in court before the trial. This report wasn't on that list...

Name: Judge
Text: So... What does this mean?

Name: Gant
Text: I couldn't submit this evidence until a connection was proven in court.

Name: Gant
Text: That connection was just proven by Wrighto over here. Good job, Wrighto, my boy!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Uh... I... I was just doing my job.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No... Noooooooooooooo!!!

Name: Judge
Text: It seems... we have come to the end of this trial.

Name: Gant
Text: You are becoming a thorn in my side, Worthy... There've been rumors... After all, you were in the defendant's chair just last year...!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ...! I apologize for this terrible lack of due diligence on my part...

Name: Judge
Text: M-Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Please... Just give me one day. I'll get to the bottom of what happened... If it's the last thing I do!

Name: Gant
Text: You'd better get results this time. Really.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm sorry! I'm so sorry!

Name: Ema
Text: Poor Mr. Edgeworth...

Name: Judge
Text: I don't think there's ever been an error this serious in the history of this court. We will grant one further day as the prosecution has requested. Will this be sufficient, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, Your Honor. Thank you.

Name: Judge
Text: Whatever your punishment for this is, for your sake I hope it's not... decisive. Very well! Court is adjourned!

Name: Ema
Text: Uh... um, Mr. Wright! So... What's going on with the case, anyway!? I... I'm a little confused.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh!? W-well, um... let's see. (What is going on?) The victim, Detective Bruce Goodman, was stabbed to death after 5:00 PM on the 21st. He died in the Prosecutor's parking lot... and the Police Department's evidence room.

Name: Ema
Text: What's this "and the evidence room" part!? The Prosecutor's Office and the Police Department are 30 minutes apart by car.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Well... that's what we're going to find out. (Or try to, at least...)

Name: Ema
Text: ... Alright! Let's do it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Glad she's in good spirits, but I'm not sure she's going to be much help with this...)

Name: Ema
Text: Don't be so sure, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Ema
Text: Would you mind coming with me? I'll prove that these thick- rimmed glasses of mine aren't just for show! Let's go! Science awaits us!

Name: Ema
Text: You know, I really don't think we should worry about the Police Department murder! There wasn't even a body found there! Who cares?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Of course it was our victim who was killed at the Department...)

Name: Ema
Text: And my sister would Never do such a thing! I know it...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That oil drum... Was it empty?

Name: Angel
Text: The oil drum kicked over by the Chief Prosecutor... was brimming with water!

Name: Ema
Text: My sister, erasing evidence at the crime scene? Never!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Even though she says they don't get along, Ema really likes her sister...)

Name: Ema
Text: That's not it at all! It's just... We're both professionals at what we do... and I trust her!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Big words for a high school student.) Well, whether there was blood stains or not... The water in that oil drum washed it all away.

Name: Ema
Text: He he heh. Ignore the strength of my science at your own peril, Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? What's that grin for?

Name: Ema
Text: This situation calls for one thing, and that is... Luminol testing fluid!

Name: Phoenix
Text: L-luminol?

Name: Ema
Text: Blood is sticky stuff, you know. You can't just wash it away with a little water. Even if you can't see it, it's still there...

Name: Phoenix
Text: But wouldn't the police have already done those tests?

Name: Ema
Text: Never trust anyone's eyes but your own, Mr. Wright! Just give it a try!

Name: Phoenix
Text: M-me? Why do I have to do it!?

Name: Ema
Text: I'm a minor! I can't even drink yet!

Name: Phoenix
