Text: (We're testing blood stains with this stuff, not drinking it...)

Name: Ema
Text: Here, look, I'll lend you these glasses.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? You had an extra pair of those things?

Name: Ema
Text: To test for a blood reaction, just spray the luminol on it. Like this, see? Touch the screen to spray it on. Okay! Let's find us some bloodstains!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I can see her eyes shining behind those glasses...) So, is this a bloodstain?

Name: Ema
Text: Uhhhh... It's so... ugh!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ema, you're shaking.

Name: Ema
Text: It's just... this is my first time seeing real blood!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Scientific investigation in action...)

Name: Ema
Text: O-okay, well, we definitely know that this is a bloodstain. But, doesn't something strike you as odd? Scientifically speaking, of course?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's odd about this... scientifically?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: The perpetrator and Detective Goodman fought here, right? Don't you think there'd be a little more blood?

Name: Ema
Text: I definitely think so! I mean... Look at all the blood on the sole of the victim's shoe!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's strange! If they fought here, there'd have to be more bloodstains than this.)

Name: Ema
Text: Uh, h-hey, Mr. Wright! See how I'm marking up the floor plans when we find a blood stain? See... I'm pretty handy to have around, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh, yeah. That's very... useful information to have.

Name: Ema
Text: I saved up my allowance to buy this!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Luminol Testing Fluid information received from Ema.

Name: Ema
Text: We can't be sure that the police will reveal all their evidence in court. Sometimes they fail to mention evidence that doesn't fit with their view of the case.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And we'll drag that "hidden evidence" out into the light of day!

Name: Ema
Text: Yeah! It feels like we're really investigating a crime now, doesn't it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This luminol stuff is going to come in handy.)

Name: Angel
Text: Hah!

Name: Angel
Text: I wonder how that fluid of yours would react to a nice Deli Box?

Name: Ema
Text: Ms. Starr!

Name: Angel
Text: You only trust your own eyes, hm? Not bad, you two... This day-old Deli Box is on the house...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry, it's just, that kind of lead in doesn't really get my mouth watering.

Name: Angel
Text: You certainly put me in a tight spot today.

Name: Phoenix
Text: My apologies, Ms. Starr, but...

Name: Angel
Text: No, no, it's okay. It was my fault.

Name: Ema
Text: Oh, we know.

Name: Angel
Text: I witnessed everything from that security room right there. But... I was afraid that wouldn't wound convincing enough, you see... I was wrong to think that. I'm sorry.

Name: Ema
Text: Sorry? You lied on the witness stand! That's unforgivable!

Name: Angel
Text: ... Little girl, don't forget what's important here. Even if the place I witnessed the events from was different, I still saw what I saw. I saw Chief Prosecutor Skye stab a man in cold blood, and that testimony still stands!

Name: Ema
Text: Ah...

Name: Angel
Text: I swear it on my honor as a detective! She stabbed Goodman!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I know this photograph has something important to tell us... but what?)

Name: Angel
Text: If you think about it, I could have taken that picture from the guard room. But... even I get flustered sometimes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, you went straight to the scene of the crime?

Name: Angel
Text: And climbed the chain link fence in an effort to stop the murder? That's when I took this photo, yes.

Name: Ema
Text: In other words... five minutes after the crime?

Name: Angel
Text: Those five minutes are the whole problem... The hole in my testimony, as it were.

Name: Ema
Text: The five minutes weren't the problem, Ms. Starr, you lying was the problem!

Name: Angel
Text: Listen, little girl. I've had my testimony "disregarded" before... And I wasn't going to have it disregarded again! Just like that time...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That time...?)

Name: Ema
Text: Um... What do you think about this?

Name: Angel
Text: "SL-9 Incident"... On that knife... And on that note... Goodman... Goodman was the head detective on that case, you know.

Name: Ema
Text: Really?

Name: Angel
Text: That knife was evidence from that case... the murder weapon. It was due for transferal the very day that Goodman was killed. As I suspected... SL-9 isn't over! Not yet!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Do you think you could tell us more about the SL-9 Incident?

Name: Ema
Text: So... you were a detective, weren't you, Ms. Starr?

Name: Angel
Text: Yes... It was a long time ago. Well, two years ago. No matter how hardened the criminal, when they faced me... They coughed it up.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Coughed it... up?

Name: Angel
Text: They confessed. They babbled like babies. You know, I may seem like a demon sometimes... But I can be an angel, too.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I wouldn't doubt it.

Name: Angel
Text: Every day, I dragged the dirt out of the mouths of suspect after suspect... And before long, they called me... The Cough-up Queen!

Name: Ema
Text: Oh, and here I had thought someone had gotten food poisoning from your lunches.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And... you were "let go"? Er... fired?

Name: Angel
Text: I felt that I had found my dream job when I became an investigator... And if these prim and proper prosecutors hadn't let me go, I'd still be one today.

Name: Angel
Text: It's all because of that case... The SL-9 Incident.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ess... el..? (Wait! She doesn't mean...!)

Name: Angel
Text: That's when I learned the truth. We're nothing to them. Disposable.

Name: Ema
Text: Disposable?

Name: Angel
Text: Two years ago... it was the biggest case I'd ever handled. The police and the prosecutors were desperate for decisive evidence.

Name: Ema
Text: So... they didn't solve it?

Name: Angel
Text: On the contrary. It was solved quite cleanly. The criminal was caught and executed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (E-executed...?)

Name: Angel
Text: Yes, the criminal got what was coming to him. It doesn't get any cleaner than that. The only problem was... they never did find decisive evidence. Not even a little.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!? But the criminal was executed, right?

Name: Angel
Text: Evidence... of a sort. Made up evidence.

Name: Ema
Text: Wh-what? You mean they executed someone with fabricated evidence!?

Name: Angel
Text: ... The best part came several months after the trial. Every detective involved with the case was dealt with. Some were demoted to patrolmen, others found themselves out of a job...

Name: Ema
Text: And... you were one of those?

Name: Angel
Text: Myself, and one other person you know well.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wait, could it be...?)

Name: Angel
Text: Exactly. Officer Jake Marshall. He's on security detail in the Police Department, isn't he?

Name: Angel
Text: As professional detectives, we investigated that case from every angle. Jake was particularly determined. And then... it was over. And he was demoted. However... He hasn't forgotten. And neither have I!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You haven't forgotten SL-9?

Name: Angel
Text: There was another side to that case, a hidden side. That's what we're after now. And no one up in their fancy offices can stop us.

Name: Ema
Text: Wait! Th-those lunches you sell...

Name: Angel
Text: There is only one reason I come to sell lunches in this accursed office. I come here to meet old friends... boyfriends that can help me investigate.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ms. Starr's old boyfriends... How many does she have, anyway?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Just when the detectives on this case have disappeared, we find new evidence...)

Name: Ema
Text: There has to be a connection!

Name: Angel
Text: So, Rookie...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what!

Name: Angel
Text: It seems like you're serious about investigating this case...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes.

Name: Angel
Text: Then you should take this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A... Salisbury Steak Lunch?

Name: Angel
Text: I know a certain guy who might help you if you tempt him with this treat...

Name: Ema
Text: Um, Ms. Starr...? Officer Marshall... is he your... uh, are you his...? Are you g-g-g-going out!?

Name: Angel
Text: Why do you want to know?

Name: Ema
Text: I was just wondering what happened to him? A long time ago, when he was helping my sister do cases, he was so nice. He got along so well with my sister, it made me jealous. And... he was nice to me too, back then.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This would be when Officer Marshall was a detective.)

Name: Ema
Text: But now... now he's so cold!

Name: Angel
Text: ... Jake and I are merely cooperating on this investigation. We're putting the past to rest, as it were. Nothing more than that.

Name: Ema
Text: I... I see. Thank you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Officer Jake Marshall... Hmm...)

Name: Ema
Text: Still, I do feel better about things. A little. I mean, they caught the person who stabbed Detective Goodman, didn't they?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh, yeah, I guess they did. (Best to not go too far down that road right now. Things will just get confusing.)
*WHEEEEEEEEEEEEN*

Name: Ema
Text: Wh-what was that!?

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir! That's what I'm saying! Me, a perpetrator? I-I-I'd say I-I-I was the perpetrated against, sir! That's what I'd say! Ah, oh, uh. Hi. Greetings, sir!

Name: Ema
Text: Wait, I know who you are...

Name: Meekins
Text: Excuse me! But is Mr. Edgeworth, uh... anywhere on the premises? I'm here, sir, at the request of the Chief, sir! I've got your report, sir!

Name: Ema
Text: Officer Meekins! So you're a guard here at the detention center?

Name: Meekins
Text: No, sir! I'm not, sir! I'm a little lost patrolman, like a little lost lamb, sir!

Name: Ema
Text: Oh, I get it. You're here to deliver a report?

Name: Meekins
Text: No, sir, I, uh, how should I say this...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wait... he isn't... is he?) You... Officer Meekins... You didn't... did you?

Name: Meekins
Text: Perpetrator Officer Meekins reporting, sir!!!

Name: Ema
Text: What...!? Whaaaaaaaaat!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now this is an unexpected turn of events...)

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir! I'm a patrolman with General Affairs, sir! SIR!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ow. I can hear you fine, Officer Meekins.

Name: Meekins
Text: I had some business that day, sir, and so I went to the evidence room, sir... The guard office in front of the room was empty, sir!

Name: Ema
Text: So, normally there's a guard at the evidence room?

Name: Meekins
Text: That's right, sir! Because evidence is kept in the evidence room, sir! Now, the security officer... was none other than Officer Marshall!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (M-Marshall!?)

Name: Meekins
Text: Then, sir, I happened to glance at the security room monitor! That's when I saw him, sir! A suspicious person in the evidence room! A suspicious person, sir! A suspicious person! Yowwowowowowowow!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What the heck is this guy doing?)

Name: Ema
Text: So what happened then?

Name: Meekins
Text: After that, sir, I... I... everything went white! I saw red! I blacked out! And... when I came to, I was here. In the detention center.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (How long were you out!? Days!?)

Name: Ema
Text: Um, might I ask... what happened to your hand?

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir! There was no one to bandage me, sir! So I did what I could to wrap it up, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A bandage on his hand... just like Ms. Skye.)

Name: Ema
Text: Yet another similarity between this case and the one at the Prosecutor's Office...

Name: Phoenix
Text: First things first... tell us how you hurt your hand!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, I don't mean to pry, but you are the perpetrator, correct? You killed Detective Bruce Goodman in the evidence room... right?

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir... Please don't look at me with those sad puppy dog eyes, sir! If you have to label me as persecutor or victim, sir... Then label me victim!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, I would, but you happen to be in detention. And alive and well at that.

Name: Meekins
Text: Ah, yes, well, that's true, sir. I suppose you could say that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you know the victim, Detective Goodman?

Name: Meekins
Text: Well, sir, if I had to label him as a "stranger" or a "total stranger"... Then I'd say he leans heavily on the "total stranger" side!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... you didn't know him?

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir! I work in a tiny department, devoid of light or other creature comforts! I don't know any detectives!

Name: Ema
Text: So, if he was a total stranger, why did you stab him?

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir! I had n-no intention of killing him, sir! None! N-nor do I have any recollection of k-killing him, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (At least someone around here is more confused than I am.)

Name: Ema
Text: Um... do you think you could take a look at this?

Name: Meekins
Text: ... Hey! That's it, sir! That's it! That's it!!!

Name: Ema
Text: That's what!?

Name: Meekins
Text: My head was a blank until this very moment! But, sir, now I remember! I remember, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You mean you remember what happened?

Name: Meekins
Text: Correct! That card, that card was the cause of it all!

Name: Ema
Text: This... ID card?

Name: Meekins
Text: Exactly, sir! That's exactly it! Nothing could be more exact, sir! Nothing!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'd better pry into this one a little deeper.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Can you tell me what it is you do "remember"?

Name: Meekins
Text: Well sir, you might say I'm a lost little patrolman. A lost little lamb, if you will! I didn't know Mr. Detective Goodman who was in the evidence room.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And that's why you thought he looked suspicious...

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir, I entered the evidence room, and asked the man to display his ID card!

Name: Ema
Text: Well, that sounds pretty much by the book so far.

Name: Meekins
Text: Th-that's right, sir! That's what I've been trying to tell you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you asked Detective Goodman to show his ID card. What did he do?

Name: Meekins
Text: That's the thing! Suddenly he pointed a knife at me!

Name: Ema
Text: What...!?

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir, I assure you I was as flustered as you are right now! So I whooped and leapt at him!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Detective Goodman pointed a knife at him?)

Name: Meekins
Text: "Do unto others before they do unto you"! My father's own words, sir!

Name: Ema
Text: Wh-what happened then?

Name: Meekins
Text: Well... My eyes, sir... everything went white. When I awoke, I was here.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Right...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: And your hand... that happened when Detective Goodman was stabbed?

Name: Meekins
Text: Well! You see, sir, I, er...

Name: Ema
Text: Don't you think you should just confess?

Name: Meekins
Text: But, sir! Sir! But! There was nothing I could do!

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Nothing you could do"...?

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir, to tell the truth, sir, when it happened... When the detective pointed that knife at me, I just hollered, sir! And the next thing I knew, I was unconscious!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The next thing you knew you were... huh?

Name: Meekins
Text: Then, when I opened my eyes... I was alone in the evidence room, sir! All alone! Alone, because... Because Detective Goodman had disappeared!!!

Name: Ema
Text: What!?

Name: Meekins
Text: Then when I looked down, I was gushing blood from my hand, sir! Oh, the shock! Oh, the sorrow, sir! Can you imagine how I felt?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The victim's body... disappeared...?)

Name: Ema
Text: Hmm... That's some story.

Name: Ema
Text: So, Officer Meekins, why was it that they arrested you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean, Ema?

Name: Ema
Text: Let's look at what we know. Now, Officer Meekins didn't know Detective Goodman... And the "victim" whom he met at the scene of the crime didn't show his ID card.

Name: Phoenix
Text: In other words, we have no way of knowing if the victim was really the victim!

Name: Ema
Text: And if this "body" just "disappeared" from the evidence room... We don't even know if anyone actually died!

Name: Meekins
Text: That's it, sir! That! That's what I wanted to say! That is... I did say something along those lines.

Name: Ema
Text: Huh? But you still ended up here...?

Name: Meekins
Text: They told me that it had to be him, sir. "On that day, at that time..." Detective Goodman was definitely in the evidence room." That's what they said.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But... you don't remember the events clearly?

Name: Meekins
Text: No... but the video tape is quite clear.

Name: Ema
Text: Huh? Video tape...?

Name: Meekins
Text: From the security camera. The crime, my crime, the crime I swore to stamp out! It's there! It's me! It's on tape!

Name: Ema
Text: And you wait until now to tell us this!?

Name: Meekins
Text: I'm sorry, really sorry, sir! I'll hand over my badge! I don't deserve it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: N-no thanks, I have my own. (Well, guess we'd better go check out the crime scene.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This place is charge with frantic energy, as always.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Please!!!

Name: Ema
Text: Huh? Wasn't that...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: One steak lunch, please! Oh, it's you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Now's no time for chit-chat, pal. I'm a busy man! What I really need is a steak lunch from Lunchland.

Name: Ema
Text: Oh... you mean one of these? Actually, it's not for sale...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I think I just heard the sound of his heart breaking.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Now's no time for despair! We've caught our criminal! Now we just need evidence!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The criminal... you mean...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You heard about the stabbing in the Police Department evidence room, pal?

Name: Phoenix
Text: On the same day that a detective was killed in the Prosecutor's parking lot... Another detective... was killed at the Police Department!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And the perpetrator? Do you have a suspect?

Name: Gant
Text: Well, there was a suspect. Just arrested 'em, in fact.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: It's the biggest scandal to hit the station in ages! Everything's topsy-turvy.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But, Detective Gumshoe, who was it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Listen, pal, all I know is I need me a steak lunch, pronto! Standing around here talking isn't going to fill my belly!

Name: Ema
Text: W-wait! Don't leave!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: If you want to know more, head on down to the detention center, pal. Questioning should be over, so I figure he's down there having a good cry. Later!

Name: Ema
Text: He ran off to the evidence room...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, this investigation is off to a running start.

Name: Ema
Text: Ooh, a real crime scene! Let's go take a look!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wow, everyone looks deadly serious here...

Name: Ema
Text: Well, there was a vicious murder of a detective in this department, after all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, but the same detective was also killed at the same time in the Prosecutor's lot.

Name: Ema
Text: Ugh... It makes my head hurt.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, first things first. I want to check out the crime scene here.

Name: Ema
Text: Yes, you sound "dead"-set on investigating! But don't mess up, or we could wind up... dead!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I doubt anyone wants more mysteries or dead bodies around here right now. (But... it doesn't look like anyone's going to help us much, either.)

Name: Ema
Text: H-hey, Mr. Wright! Look who's standing at the Head Detective's desk!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's Chief Gant!)

Name: Gant
Text: Are you sure this is all, hmm? You know what it means if there is anything missing!

Name: Chief
Text: Sir! I'm sure it's most likely totally perfect! We checked the drawers, the lockers, the garbage cans, the coat pockets... the pillowcases, behind the computer monitors, the coffee machine...

Name: Gant
Text: I see. Well, if anything does turn up, you call me right away, deal?

Name: Chief
Text: Y-y-y-yessir!!! We'll scour the place again, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The Head Detective looks a little flustered...)

Name: Gant
Text: Ah hah! Wrighto, my boy! How ya been? Swim much?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh ho ho, Chief Gant! Reporting for duty, sir!

Name: Ema
Text: Why are you saluting him, Mr. Wright!?

Name: Chief
Text: Ooh, sorry you had to see that.

Name: Ema
Text: Uh... what exactly did the Chief of Police want you to do?

Name: Chief
Text: Well, see over there? That's Goodman's desk. He wanted me to check it for anything that might be a clue... They took away every last piece of garbage in the trash can.

Name: Ema
Text: So, nothing belonging to Detective Goodman is still here?

Name: Chief
Text: Of course not! Well, except for this.

Name: Ema
Text: What!? You kept something!?

Name: Chief
Text: Sure, why not? It's not important. He didn't even finish writing it! It's a lost item report but it's only half complete.

Name: Ema
Text: A lost item? Did Detective Goodman lose something?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The date on it is February 21. (I'll make a note of that just in case.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I should probably get a quick look around the crime scene...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... is Edgeworth going to be okay?

Name: Gant
Text: Oh, Worthy? Oh, you know, they're doing a little inquiry committee with him.

Name: Ema
Text: Sounds like an inquisition...!

Name: Gant
Text: Yep, well, we've had no end of trouble with the boy since last year...

Name: Phoenix
Text: You mean... the incident on Gourd Lake?

Name: Gant
Text: It doesn't look good having one of our top people sitting in the defendant's seat. Now, you got someone else found guilty in that case, right, Wrighto?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (von Karma...)

Name: Gant
Text: A legend he was, undefeated in his forty year career! But in court you fixed it so he was caught for forging evidence...

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-wait! I didn't do anything wrong! He did forge evidence.

Name: Gant
Text: In any case, the Prosecutor's Office is in a bit of turmoil, you might say. Why, they'd do just about anything to restore their reputation. Now, depending on what that inquiry committee decides... It could be bad for Worthy.

Name: Ema
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Gant
Text: It's downright odd, I tell you. I mean, it happened at exactly the same time!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The murder at the Prosecutor's Office...)

Name: Ema
Text: Scientifically speaking, it's impossible!

Name: Gant
Text: Yes, but that's what the evidence is saying. "Goodman was stabbed in two locations at the same time!" That's what it says.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What evidence is this...?

Name: Gant
Text: Now, now, Wrighto, I can't give away all our secrets just like that! And this in particular, well it's a little sensitive... and I can't talk about it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I wasn't expecting much anyway.)

Name: Gant
Text: You know, one thing I hate most of all is hiding stuff. Secrets. Can't stand 'em! But you know... It's a full time job just keeping the Head Detective's trap shut!

Name: Ema
Text: Ah, he was the one you were picking on earlier?

Name: Gant
Text: Huh? You saw that? Whoops!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I wonder what it was that he wanted the Head Detective to do?)

Name: Ema
Text: Let's see if we can kind of discreetly ask him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Actually, I was wondering if I could ask you a favor?

Name: Gant
Text: Hmm? Well, I never thought the day would come when Wrighto asked me for help!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I was wondering if we could investigate the evidence room?

Name: Gant
Text: Now, Wrighto...

Name: Phoenix
Text: A-actually, I'm sorry, I d-don't need to investigate after all!

Name: Gant
Text: Wrighto, please, do I look like a selfish man?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Gant
Text: Heck, if anyone asked me "sir, can I borrow $50?" I'd give them $50, no problem. So, go ahead! Investigate that room to your heart's content! Knock yourself out!

Name: Ema
Text: It just goes to show, you never know until you ask!

Name: Gant
Text: And for you, here, you can borrow this.

Name: Ema
Text: Huh... hey! This is a detective's ID card, isn't it?

Name: Gant
Text: That's a special card for guests, so don't lose it.

Name: Ema
Text: Y-yessir! It's an honor!

Name: Gant
Text: You just run along and do your best, now. Later, folks!

Name: Ema
Text: Heh heh! It looks pretty cool on my lapel, doesn't it? Just think, a real ID!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You seem... happy.

Name: Ema
Text: Yes, sir! Because, sir, we get to go into the evidence room now, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I think this place is a bad influence on the girl.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's with the decor in this place? It's very... eccentric.

Name: Ema
Text: According to the pamphlet, this is the guard station for the evidence room.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, beyond that door is the evidence room... the scene of the crime?

Name: Ema
Text: It sure seems that way... Oh. Ohhh...

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's wrong?

Name: Ema
Text: It's those cacti! They're so prickly... so imposing! It's hard to think straight.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If you can't handle the cacti, stay out of the desert...) What I want to know is, if this is a guard station, where is the guard?

Name: Ema
Text: I have a feeling I know who this guard is already...

Name: Phoenix
Text: The evidence room is beyond that door.

Name: Ema
Text: And we have the ID card from Chief Gant! Let's just walk in! ... It won't open.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ah hah! The card reader is turned off, see?

Name: Ema
Text: What is that security guard thinking?

Name: Marshall
Text: Howdy, pardners. Well, well, what's made my bambina's skies so gray?

Name: Phoenix
Text: O-Officer Marshall! (Somehow, I knew...)

Name: Marshall
Text: What's that "somehow I knew" look for? As you may have surmised, this here's my saloon.

Name: Ema
Text: Um... we're here to investigate the crime scene.

Name: Marshall
Text: ... Yeehaw! That card you got there on your chest. That's better than a sheriff's badge in these parts.

Name: Ema
Text: Y-yeehaw?

Name: Marshall
Text: Well, what ya standin' there for? Get along, little dogies. The crime scene's a waiting!
*beep*

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Looks like the card reader's on again.) While we're here, I was wondering if we could ask you some questions?

Name: Marshall
Text: Sorry, cowboy, but I got no mind to tangle with you hombres.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You're... busy, then?

Name: Marshall
Text: Did I say that? I only said I didn't wish to speak with you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Actually, you said you had "no mind to tangle with us hombres.")

Name: Ema
Text: Um, I was wondering if we could talk to you...

Name: Marshall
Text: Sorry, bambina. But I'm off to roam the lands, like a tumbleweed on the wide prairie. Like a gunslinger loading his six-shooter, I say a little prayer. GRROOOOORRK

Name: Ema
Text: What was that all about, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think he was just too hungry to talk.

Name: Ema
Text: You're just saying that because his stomach was growling! You have no idea what he was talking about either!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, in any case, we need to get cracking on this investigation, pronto!)

Name: Marshall
Text: ......... That smell... Ah! Reminds me of Texas!

Name: Ema
Text: So, Officer Marshall... You're from Texas?

Name: Marshall
Text: No, I just saw a special on television the other day. Is this from my baby?

Name: Ema
Text: Uh, yeah, Ms. Starr...

Name: Marshall
Text: Wh-what's this!?

Name: Ema
Text: What? What's wrong?

Name: Marshall
Text: A filet steak lunch! I see... I see!

Name: Ema
Text: I don't see. I wonder what it means?

Name: Marshall
Text: Alright, bambina. You win. Ask mmph mmph munch munch Anything mmph munch snack.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Finally, it seems like...)

Name: Ema
Text: He's willing to talk!

Name: Ema
Text: Officer Marshall, you're in charge of security for the evidence room, right?

Name: Marshall
Text: You got good eyes, pardner. It's an easy job, and I'm grateful for it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Actually, Officer Meekins at the detention center told us.

Name: Marshall
Text: Ah, that poor little dogie? Poor guy, I keep getting his name wrong and calling him "Meekly."

Name: Phoenix
Text: He told us something. He said that, when the stabbing occurred... you weren't at your station.

Name: Marshall
Text: ... Well, maybe I shouldn't be telling you this... But since I got demoted from detective two years ago... Well, it might not look it, but I lost my fire for the job, you know?

Name: Ema
Text: So... what were you doing around 5:15 when the murder took place?

Name: Marshall
Text: Well... I reckon I was galloping down the highway on the back of my steed, Zippy.

Name: Ema
Text: Note: he was riding down the highway on his horse named "Zippy."

Name: Marshall
Text: There's no need for people here, anyhow. These newfangled machines do a bang-up job of keeping an eye on the place.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You mean the security camera system?

Name: Marshall
Text: I don't take to machines much. Kinda like that stewed broccoli they sneak in next to your steak, you know?

Name: Ema
Text: Ms. Starr told us something... She said that you were a detective until two years ago.

Name: Marshall
Text: It was always my dream to be a rawhide wrangler on the scene of the crime... That's all gone now... Like a drinking hole in a prairie fire.

Name: Ema
Text: You're still investigating the SL-9 Incident with Ms. Starr, aren't you?

Name: Marshall
Text: That was my case... It's all "solved" on the record books. But it smells like a bad game of poker. I can't let it go... That's all there is to it.

Name: Ema
Text: What kind of case was it, anyway? We've heard the name so many times, but no one tells us what actually happened.

Name: Marshall
Text: ... There are some things you're better off not knowing, Bambina. Anyway, that case is officially dead as of two days ago.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Two days ago... the day of our case!

Name: Marshall
Text: That's right... The evidence transferals.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Edgeworth was talking about the transferals, too.)

Name: Marshall
Text: I know what maybe two of the machines in here do.

Name: Ema
Text: O-only two of them? There must be a dozen!

Name: Marshall
Text: Like I said, bambina, Me and machines, well... I like them about as much as I like stewed cauliflower with my steaks. The easiest ones to understand are these here security cameras.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Those are the ones that Officer Meekins mentioned.)

Name: Marshall
Text: If nothing happens, the tapes are automatically erased every few hours.

Name: Ema
Text: And Officer Meekins and Detective Goodman, are they on one of those tapes?

Name: Marshall
Text: I reckon they might be.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (You're the security guard and you "reckon"!?)

Name: Marshall
Text: One more thing. When you go into the evidence room... You need an ID card.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Thus the card reader by the door.)

Name: Marshall
Text: The card reader leaves a record of every ID card passed through.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So this is the ID card record...)

Name: Ema
Text: Hey! I've seen that somewhere before!

Name: Marshall
Text: Sorry, Bambina. I can't show you more than that.

Name: Ema
Text: Huh?

Name: Marshall
Text: I haven't heard whether this is related to the case, yet.

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! I saw a number on that record just now! I've seen that number before!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maybe there's some way I can prove that record is tied to the stabbing.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry, but could you explain what this whole "transferal" thing is about?

Name: Marshall
Text: We keep only evidence from solved cases in this room. They're kept here under the presiding detective's supervision for two years. So we can re-investigate them if it turns out there was a mistake, see?

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, what happens to the evidence after two years?

Name: Marshall
Text: It goes to sleep forever in the underground vault at the Police Station. That's what we call "transferal." We do it every February.

Name: Ema
Text: I see now...

Name: Marshall
Text: "Transferal" is like a funeral for old cases. Two years after a case is solved... it's closed forever. Dead. Never to be reopened again. Never to be reinvestigated.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (And that happened to SL-9 two days ago...)

Name: Ema
Text: See this? This is the victim's ID card.

Name: Marshall
Text: Ah, the one that was on the ground in the parking lot?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The number on this is... "5842189."

Name: Ema
Text: Officer Marshall! Show us the ID number on that ID card record! Look, the fourth number! It's a perfect match!

Name: Phoenix
Text: It was used at... 5:14. Right before the stabbing!

Name: Marshall
Text: What's more, there's only one of them cards in the world!

Name: Ema
Text: So, when the incident occurred, Detective Goodman was in the evidence room!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (But wait, what did Officer Meekins say?)

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir, I entered the evidence room, and asked the man to display his ID card!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you asked Detective Goodman to show his ID card. What did he do?

Name: Meekins
Text: That's the thing! Suddenly he pointed a knife at me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If he had his ID card then... Why would he have pointed a knife at Officer Meekins?)

Name: Marshall
Text: Alright, compadre, you win. I guess I can give you this ID card record.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I've got an idea... Maybe I should show this list to other people with IDs here...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's quiet... the investigation must be over here.)

Name: Ema
Text: So this is the evidence room? It really is kind of like a graveyard.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Graveyards are supposed to have grass and trees. This feels more like a morgue.

Name: Ema
Text: N-nice try, M-Mr. Wright. Y-you can't scare me! Eeeeeeek!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Whoooooah!

Name: Ema
Text: S-sorry, I thought you were a ghost!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I wouldn't recommend going around smacking ghosts on the head, pal. So, is it true what I heard?

Name: Gant
Text: Wrighto, please, do I look like a selfish man? Heck, if anyone asked me "sir, can I borrow $50?" I'd give them $50, no problem. So, go ahead! Investigate that room to your heart's desire! Knock yourself out!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, it's true.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: So, Chief of Police Gant... will loan anyone 50 bucks? Even me!?

Name: Ema
Text: Oh, so that's what you were talking about...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Actually, I was put in charge of the investigation for today.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Just for today?

Name: Ema
Text: Boss for a day...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: But guess what!? You got permission from the Chief... So now you're boss for a day!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Gee, thanks...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: First of all, you'll want to have this.

Name: Ema
Text: So, Detective Gumshoe, you're boss for the day?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's right! It's an honor! After all, the murder took place right here, in the Police Department!

Name: Ema
Text: But, if you're boss... why are you all alone!? Where are your underlings?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... They're using our findings from yesterday's investigation to prepare for the trial.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (In other words, Detective Gumshoe got kicked out of the investigation again...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I'm adamant, though! I'm going to take control and put this case to rest! And in my own evidence locker, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You have a locker in here, too, Detective Gumshoe?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hah hah, of course! I am a detective, after all. They gave me a locker that only I can open, pal!

Name: Ema
Text: "Only you can open"...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: This place is more high-tech than you might think. Every locker is fixed so that only one detective can open it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Using this ID card?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, that's the thing, pal. ID cards can be lost. Why, I'm on my third card since entering the force already.

Name: Ema
Text: That sounds like a lot.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yes, but even I can't lose my own right hand!

Name: Ema
Text: "Right hand"...? Oh! You mean, your fingerprint?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Exactly, pal! The lock for each locker is coded with a fingerprint! And that's the only locker we can open.

Name: Ema
Text: Funny, they look like normal lockers...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: These are the latest model! There's a trick to the handles, see?

Name: Ema
Text: The handles?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: On the other side of the handles is a sensor, and if the wrong person touches it...

Name: Ema
Text: Bzzzap! You get a shock!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: If that's what happened, my hand would be black and smoking every day! In any case, the locks aren't that obvious. There's even some people in the force that don't know about the fingerprint locks!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I'll always believe in Mr. Edgeworth, no matter what happens.

Name: Ema
Text: So... Mr. Edgeworth is with the inquiry committee now, right?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: They're trying to figure out who's responsible for the mess-up in court today.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I guess this is what you call "fate." Mr. Edgeworth just can't get away from that case...

Name: Phoenix
Text: That case...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yeah, that case! The SL-9 Incident, of course! That was the beginning of the end for Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maybe we can get him to tell us more about the case...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Detective Goodman's note... and that switchblade knife. I bet Edgeworth was the most surprised of anyone.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Because of the SL-9 connection?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That was Mr. Edgeworth's first big case you know, two years ago. That was the first time the world knew Edgeworth was a man to be feared!

Name: Phoenix
Text: But, why would evidence from that case turn up now?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I guess it's not over, pal. Maybe there are some loose ends left on that case...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Now that was a bloody, violent case.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Violent... so it was a murder?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: A serial killing!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A serial killing... Maybe I don't want to get involved in this after all.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: But the killer made a mistake, and Mr. Edgeworth built his case around that to nab him.

Name: Ema
Text: And this was two years ago?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That put Mr. Edgeworth right in the spotlight... and started the rumor mill.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Rumors... (About forged evidence?)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: It was supposed to be all cleaned up with the "transferal" the other day. It was the last job he ever did... Detective Goodman, that is.

Name: Ema
Text: Huh? What do you mean?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Detective Goodman was the detective in charge of the SL-9 Incident, see.

Name: Ema
Text: So, so... That switchblade knife...

Name: Phoenix
Text: The victim took the knife out of the evidence locker himself?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could you take a look at this? This is the ID card of the person who came here on the day of the stabbing.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Ah, I heard the rumors. So it was Goodman who came in here at the time of the murder... Whoooooooooah!!!

Name: Ema
Text: Wh-what is it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Th-th-th-th-th-th! That second number...

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's not your ID number is it, Detective Gumshoe?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Ema
Text: What...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The second number on this list... belongs to Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Ema
Text: What... Whaaaaaaaaat!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Why would Edgeworth have come to the evidence room!?)

Name: Ema
Text: Someone left a glove here... but only one.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe, maybe?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: There you go, pal, making me out to be some kind of absent-minded detective! That's evidence from "the" case, you know.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You mean SL-9? (It does have a tag on it...)

Name: Ema
Text: Wow, someone must have broken something big to make all these pieces.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe, perhaps?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: There you go, pal, making me out to be some kind of hooligan! That's apparently from "the" case.

Name: Ema
Text: "The" case?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The SL-9 Incident, pal. See the sticker on one of the pieces there?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Another piece of SL-9 evidence...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: I wonder what shape these pieces were in before whatever it was broke?

Name: Ema
Text: You want to try to put it back together?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hah! Good luck, pal. That's no job for amateurs. Why, I spent a good three hours on that before I had to give up!

Name: Ema
Text: That's why I always carry around a tube of glue!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, this piece looks like the bottom. Let's try putting the rest in place!)

Name: Ema
Text: H-huh? Well, I think we did it. But some of the pieces are missing.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That only took me two minutes to do! The problem is finishing it!

Name: Ema
Text: Were some pieces stolen?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I bet they were missing to begin with.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Still... It doesn't look like the most stable kind of jar.

Name: Ema
Text: I kind of understand how it got broken.

Name: Ema
Text: ...! Why am I getting a reaction here?

Name: Phoenix
Text: There's no reason for the murderer to touch this spot if he fled out the door. (This just might be something significant!)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey... That's some pretty amazing stuff you got there, pal!

Name: Ema
Text: What, this? It's called "Luminol Testing Fluid"!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Where'd you get your hands on that!?

Name: Ema
Text: Huh?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I'd like to get some too! I'll just borrow 50 bucks from the Chief!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Where do you get this, Ema?

Name: Ema
Text: I always buy it by mail order.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, I'd better jot this down on the floor plans.)

Name: Ema
Text: I knew it! This is someone's right handprint!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: WHAAAAAAT!!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's the matter, Detective? Th-this locker... It's mine!

Name: Ema
Text: It's yours?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Please! You have to help me... When they come to take me away... Promise you'll testify that I wouldn't harm a fly! You'll do that for me, won't you, pals!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is an important clue! I'll jot it down on the floor plans...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I'm counting on you guys! Believe me, you can't trust the police!

Name: Ema
Text: What? But you're a detective!

Name: Phoenix
Text: There must have been a massive amount of blood here. (I've never seen so much before...) I'm not a professional. What's your opinion, Detective?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hmm... Pale blue blood... Maybe Detective Goodman... was actually an alien?

Name: Ema
Text: This proves that something really happened in front of this locker.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'll make a note of it on the floor plans.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey! If you didn't want my opinion, you shouldn't have asked!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey, pal, look at the time!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Was there something you needed to be going to?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: It's just that Mr. Edgeworth's inquiry committee should be letting out soon. I'm going to go give them my report for the day. It might help, you know...

Name: Ema
Text: R-report? You mean the note written on the back of that flyer?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The one that says nothing but "No problems"!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey, it's Mr. Edgeworth we're talking about! I'm sure he can use a report like this. I believe in him!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Who needs enemies when you've got friends like Detective Gumshoe..)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I'm off, pal! Later!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I should probably see what Edgeworth has to say, too.)

Name: Bellboy
Text: Ah, guests! My apologies.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh! It's you!

Name: Bellboy
Text: Have we met somewhere...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh!?

Name: Bellboy
Text: Mr. Edgeworth! I beg your leave. So long!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Is Edgeworth here...?)

Name: Ema
Text: There, standing by the window, a teacup in his hand!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ah, it's you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He has the hotel bring him tea service!?)

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Edgeworth... you're back from the District Prosecutor's Office inquiry?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Precisely.

Name: Phoenix
Text: By the way, Detective Gumshoe was looking for you.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Oh yes... He brought me some information, it seems.

Name: Ema
Text: Really? Was it helpful?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Apparently, a new French restaurant is opening near here. I think he was trying to console me, somehow.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Er, I think the report is on the other side, Edgeworth...)

Name: Ema
Text: Poor Mr. Edgeworth... I think this whole thing is really taking a toll on him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, how did the inquiry committee go?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Actually, they decided to treat this not as a case of concealing evidence... But as a communications error during the investigation.

Name: Ema
Text: "Concealing evidence"...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes. Apparently, there are some who believe... that I concealed evidence. They gave me a warning. "You were lucky this time... again."

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Again"...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I've heard them say that so many times. Ever since that case two years ago...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you okay for the trial tomorrow?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well, I'm still the presiding prosecuting attorney. However...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Something happened?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: They gave control of the investigation over to the Police Department.

Name: Ema
Text: The Police Department!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes. Any further investigation for this case will be directed by the Chief of Police Gant. I can do nothing but wait for his results...

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... see.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Why, I ask you? Why!? All along, I've done only what I believe is right. I have nothing to be ashamed of! But still...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wow, I've never seen him this out of sorts...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I know you. You've probably got a hold of some information already, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It all has to do with that case you were on... the SL-9 Incident. And some "dark suspicion" you were wrapped up in.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You are the man who revived the worst memory of my life, as I recall. I figured I'd be telling you about this sooner or later.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A bad memory... he's talking about the murder in the elevator...) Okay, Edgeworth. Why don't you tell me about it. Tell me the truth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The SL-9 Incident was a heinous serial killing case. The head of investigation was the Deputy Chief of Police at the time... Damon Gant.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That wacky old coot was involved in the case two years ago too then...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He was the best we had, and it was my first time working with him... I was nervous.

Name: Ema
Text: Wow, you get nervous, too, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What I want to know is why was a Deputy Chief of Police on the investigation?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: In truth, I used slightly more... extreme methods than normal. We were dealing with a vicious murderer. If I let him go, the blood would be on my hands. We won our guilty verdict, and the killer was executed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait, you didn't...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Of course not! I didn't touch the evidence. Yes, I will do anything in my power to win a trial. However... I do have a code, and I follow it faithfully.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, right! I'd better check this now...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: As I was saying, I... ! What's this? A record of ID card usage?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth, you went into the evidence room that day, didn't you? Just before the incident occurred, no less.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, that's true.

Name: Ema
Text: W-why, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Please don't look at me like that. I was asked to go. By Chief Gant no less.

Name: Ema
Text: The Chief of Police...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He wanted evidence for a case that wrapped up half a year ago. He told me he wanted me to keep it here in the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But... it was solved, right? It would have to be if the evidence was already filed...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The Chief is never one to explain himself. In any case, on the day of the stabbings, I brought this back here.

Name: Ema
Text: Can I ask what kind of case it was?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I... can't say. It really has nothing to do with the current case.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now I'm curious about this other case. I'd better make a note of it.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Stubborn as always. I told you this has nothing to do with the current case.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: By the way, Ema. The Chief Prosecutor wanted to know something...

Name: Ema
Text: M-my sister? What?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You still working on that scientific investigation?

Name: Ema
Text: Huh? Y-yes! Of course! Why, just today Mr. Wright and I were using this...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Luminol testing fluid... Hm? Well then... You might have use for this.

Name: Ema
Text: Aluminum powder for taking fingerprints!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's been chemically treated for better adhesion.

Name: Ema
Text: F-for me? Are you sure? We are the "enemy" you know.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I've no say in today's investigation... do as you will.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth... I'm really--

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No need to thank me. Here, take your powder and these fingerprint files for everyone involved.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I, uh, th-thanks! (How about giving these to Detective Gumshoe as well!?)

Name: Ema
Text: Well, let's get going! One last investigation!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right! (I do seem to remember seeing a suspicious handprint somewhere...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Our investigation turned up a suspicious handprint.)

Name: Ema
Text: Here, in this blood on the detective's evidence locker.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let's use the secret weapon we just borrowed!

Name: Ema
Text: Right. Let's get started! First... choose a finger.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A finger...?

Name: Ema
Text: Each finger leaves behind a slightly different imprint. So let's choose the finger that will have left behind the clearest print!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I really can't tell the difference at a glance...

Name: Ema
Text: Quit procrastinating and choose a finger!

Name: Ema
Text: Okay. Now it's time to check for prints! Let me show you how it's done.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ema's starting to get that sparkle in her eyes...)

Name: Ema
Text: First, we sprinkle the aluminum powder around.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? How do you do that?

Name: Ema
Text: Just touch the screen... See?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ah... it looks like that did the trick.

Name: Ema
Text: The aluminum powder adheres completely to the print. Once the powder is well spread... just blow away the excess.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? How do I do that?

Name: Ema
Text: You just blow With your breath. Imagine you're blowing out the candles on a birthday cake. See?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wow... that looks like fun! (It might take some getting used to though...)

Name: Ema
Text: It's fine! It won't go up your nose or anything. You just pour the powder on thick, and blow away the extra! Those are the basics of fingerprinting, Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess I'd better give it a try...)

Name: Ema
Text: Aha! You did it! You found one!

Name: Phoenix
Text: But... this looks nothing like a fingerprint.

Name: Ema
Text: Hmm... now that you mention it, I guess it doesn't...

Name: Phoenix
Text: What does it mean?

Name: Ema
Text: It think it means... we're out of luck.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Out of luck...?

Name: Ema
Text: The person who left this handprint must have worn gloves.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Don't tell me we've been wasting out time here!

Name: Ema
Text: Hey, calm down. That's just the way it goes sometimes with scientific investigations. But... it does seem a shame. While we're at it, why don't we look for other prints?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Other prints...?

Name: Ema
Text: Looking at the locker door again closely...

Name: Ema
Text: it seems like there are fingerprints outside the bloody handprint as well. Let's see if we can find a clear print!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... fingerprints outside the blood...)

Name: Ema
Text: Yay! A print so clear it's dazzling!

Name: Phoenix
Text: D-dazzling...?

Name: Ema
Text: Anyway, this print took a lot of effort to find. Let's match it up right away!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So we're not over yet? This is quite a process...

Name: Ema
Text: Well, there's no point in finding a fingerprint... and not knowing who the owner is, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess she's right...)

Name: Ema
Text: Look at the fingerprint data we got from Mr. Edgeworth... and point out the person you think left these prints!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? How am I supposed to know who it was?

Name: Ema
Text: I could make a pretty good guess. The bloody handprint and the fingerprints are in different places right? That means that the prints probably don't have anything to do with our case. So, whose fingerprints would we most likely find on this evidence locker?
Comparing... Comparison complete. Match found.

Name: Ema
Text: Ah hah! So these prints belonged to Detective Gumshoe!

Name: Ema
Text: Something wrong, Mr. Wright? You gave me this "so what?" look.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I guess that's probably because I was thinking "so what?"

Name: Ema
Text: Okay, so we came up with nothing this time, but there's always next time! Sometimes you hit, sometimes you miss! You gotta roll with the punches, Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thanks for the sympathy. (Wait... If I remember correctly... there was one other handprint in this room. Let's check it out!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is where we got a luminol fluid reaction, right?

Name: Ema
Text: Right! There was a handprint here! Okay! Want to try using this?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (There go her eyes sparkling again...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Okay, let's check for prints!

Name: Ema
Text: That's the spirit! Oh! But I have to warn you about something first.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What?

Name: Ema
Text: The area with the blood was wiped away, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: We only ended up finding it using chemical means.

Name: Ema
Text: Any prints in that area will have been wiped away too.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh... right. So... that means no prints.

Name: Ema
Text: Would you say the probability of your hypothesis is high?

Name: Phoenix
Text: D-don't ask me!

Name: Ema
Text: Anyway... We must try to find prints that weren't wiped away.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Prints other than the ones left by the bloody hand...)
Comparing... Comparison complete. Match found.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey, these fingerprints, they...

Name: Ema
Text: Whose are they? Whose!? Is it someone I know?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's Officer Marshall!!!

Name: Ema
Text: Huh? O-Officer Jake Marshall!?

Name: Ema
Text: Th-that's got to be a coincidence! He's not involved in the crime!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ema. These are decidedly different from Detective Gumshoe's prints.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The luminol reaction. The blood and the fingerprints are in the same place.

Name: Ema
Text: Oh... Oh!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So, we have Jake Marshall's fingerprints... on a wiped bloodstain!)

Name: Ema
Text: But why would Officer Marshall...

Name: Phoenix
Text: It looks like our investigation is finally turning up some results!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I guess this is what you'd call "decisive evidence"!

Name: Ema
Text: I... I don't believe it!

Name: Ema
Text: So, what do you think, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think the prosecution is as confused as we are. After all...

Name: Lana
Text: the victim was murdered in two different places at the same time, and a different suspect was arrested at the other crime scene.

Name: Ema
Text: Lana!

Name: Lana
Text: Good morning, Mr. Wright. I apologize for yesterday. I was... indisposed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I hope they didn't hold you too long for questioning.

Name: Lana
Text: We just finished, actually. I'm used to all-nighters, though.

Name: Ema
Text: So, how'd it go?

Name: Lana
Text: It's as Mr. Wright suspects. The police are clueless. I figured as much, so I struck a plea bargain.

Name: Ema
Text: A plea bargain? What do you mean by that?

Name: Lana
Text: We agreed that if I told them the truth behind this "simultaneous murder," they wouldn't seek capital punishment. That's what I mean, Ema.

Name: Ema
Text: But Lana! Don't tell me you...

Name: Lana
Text: Much to my regret, I'm as much in the dark about this as they are.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Skye.

Name: Lana
Text: Hmm?

Name: Phoenix
Text: We discovered traces left by a certain person in the Police Department's evidence room. They belonged to Officer Jake Marshall.

Name: Lana
Text: You found Officer Marshall's... traces?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Blood-stained fingerprints, to be exact.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's the trump card I have up my sleeve today. You do understand what this means, don't you?

Name: Ema
Text: In order to defend my sister, you're going to accuse Mr. Marshall?

Name: Phoenix
Text: We have to play the cards we're dealt. Isn't that right, Ms. Skye?

Name: Lana
Text: ... Do what you have to do, Mr. Wright.

Name: Judge
Text: Court is now in session for the trial of Ms. Lana Skye.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution is... Hmph.

Name: Judge
Text: ... Hmph? I'm afraid you'll have to clarify.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It takes 30 minutes by car to reach criminal affairs from the Prosecutor's Office. The victim, Bruce Goodman, was slain at both places at the same time.

Name: Judge
Text: But, that's not physically possible, is it? What's more, I hear the victim from the evidence room just "disappeared"!

Name: Ema
Text: Yes, and the body eventually reappeared in the trunk of Mr. Edgeworth's car.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wow... this is one messed up trial...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: One of my duties as prosecutor is to present impartial evidence. Today I will present evidence relating to the murder at the Police Department. In so doing, I believe the way in which we should proceed will reveal itself.

Name: Ema
Text: Now that's what sets Mr. Edgeworth apart. He sounds so on top of things... even though he doesn't know what's going on himself!

Name: Phoenix
Text: And that's supposed to be an admirable trait?

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, let the trial resume. On the day of the crime, what exactly transpired at the Police Department? Mr. Edgeworth, you may call your first witness of the day to the stand.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: For its first witness, the prosecution calls... the suspect of the murder that occurred at the Police Department!

Name: Judge
Text: The suspect!? You mean, the so-called murderer!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hoo boy. Things are getting wild from the get-go.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Will the witness please state his name and occupation.

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! I am Officer Mike Meekins, sir! My occupation is, um... that would be murderer, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: ... Er... So you're telling us you're a "professional killer"...

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir. It was me, sir! I'm the one who did it! I'll never kill anyone again, sir! You've got to believe me, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: Uh... Actually, what we'd like to hear from you is...

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir! I'm what you would call part of the "younger generation," sir! A person whose actions adults can't possibly comprehend!

Name: Judge
Text: Please, Mr. Edgeworth, sir! Help me, sir!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Officer Meekins.

Name: Meekins
Text: Y-yes, sir!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Give us your report of the crime. Consider that an order.

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! As you wish! After all, I am part of a generation that must be told what to do, sir!

Name: Ema
Text: You can't fault him for a lack of enthusiasm.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. So the victim, Detective Goodman, attacked you?

Name: Meekins
Text: "Do unto others before they do unto you"! That's the Meekins family motto, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: I see. Then you fainted, and a colleague helped you regain consciousness.

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! He knocked me upside the head, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The defense may begin its cross-examination.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What I need here is more info to work with!)

Name: Meekins
Text: Although it's not my normal duty, I was assigned to guard the evidence room that day!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Meekins. You work in the General Affairs Department, do you not?

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! I am in charge of hiring new recruits, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yikes! Now there's a scary thought.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Evidence transferal was taking place on the day of the crime, which meant many officers were given special tasks not ordinarily performed.

Name: Meekins
Text: I was in charge of guarding the Blue Badger, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: The Blue Badger?

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir. The lovely police mascot created by the Head Detective, sir! I was to ensure it wasn't broken during the transferal process. That was my sole mission for the day, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: I see. Sounds like a very... uh, important mission.

Name: Meekins
Text: After the awards ceremony finished that day, there were so many people running around that I relocated the Blue Badger to the evidence room!

Name: Judge
Text: Oh... So that's why you went to the evidence room.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Tell us... what did you see when you got there?

Name: Meekins
Text: I spotted a suspicious man on the security screen, and rushed into the room!

Name: Phoenix
Text: In order to enter the evidence room... you need an ID card, am I correct?

Name: Meekins
Text: Precisely, sir! I have one right here around my neck!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So then... your ID number should be listed in here, right?

Name: Meekins
Text: ... There it is! I found it! This is the one right here.

Name: Judge
Text: Could you please read us the number?

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! It's "4989596." That's my number, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see... Huh? But the number 4989596... is shown as being used twice!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Please explain, witness.

Name: Meekins
Text: It's n-no real mystery, sir! The first time is when I relocated Blue Badger to the evidence room, and the second time is when I went to go get him after everything settled down.

Name: Judge
Text: I see. So it was during that second time when?

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! That was when I spotted the man on the security screen!

Name: Meekins
Text: I was only doing what I was trained to do, sir! I was suddenly attacked!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you were attacked... Can you please tell us exactly what happened to you?

Name: Meekins
Text: It was a knife, sir! A knife!

Name: Judge
Text: Detective Goodman pulled a knife on you? What happened then?

Name: Meekins
Text: Well, with me charging in on him like that, he looked as surprised as I was!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (You aren't exactly the kind of person someone would want to run into...)

Name: Meekins
Text: That's when I reacted, sir! I swung my arms like an octopus, struggling to detain him! That's how I got this gash on my hand.

Name: Ema
Text: Maybe if you'd just kept your cool your hand wouldn't be...

Name: Meekins
Text: When I saw the blood trickling down my arm, I panicked! I grabbed the man by his collar!

Name: Meekins
Text: I fought for my life! Then I... I did it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What exactly do you mean when you say you, "did it"?

Name: Meekins
Text: I know I don't look the type, but I'm really into kung fu films, sir! The man let his guard down for just an instant, so I snatched his knife from him!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You took his knife?

Name: Meekins
Text: I spun him around and performed a disarming maneuver! I made sure to close my eyes like a man!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I, uh, see... (He must have been desperate.)

Name: Meekins
Text: The next thing I knew, his white coat was drenched in a sea of my blood, and then... Then, the next thing I knew...

Name: Judge
Text: Yes?

Name: Meekins
Text: He punched me right in my face, sir!

Name: Meekins
Text: After that I passed out... until another officer smacked me awake!

Name: Phoenix
Text: About what time did you regain consciousness?

Name: Meekins
Text: No offense, sir, but how am I supposed to know that? I was unconscious!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh... right.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: According to the report from the officer that woke up the witness, it was about 5:30.

Name: Meekins
Text: He hit me right in the head too! I woke up crying tears of pain!

Name: Judge
Text: That's nice... Er, I mean... it's nice that you recovered, that is...

Name: Meekins
Text: When I came around though, I made sure to finish my mission, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your "mission"...?

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! The Blue Badger, sir! I returned him to the entrance before things got out of hand!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, we can all rest easy now...)

Name: Judge
Text: I believe we now have a fairly accurate picture of what happened.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, Your Honor. Only one thing remains unclear. Was the man this officer "murdered," really the victim?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He's got a point...)

Name: Meekins
Text: Um...

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, Officer Meekins?

Name: Meekins
Text: With regard to that, sir... Take a look at this. It was sent to my cell. Chief Gant delivered it to me just this morning sir!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The Chief?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Delivered it...?

Name: Judge
Text: What is that? A... videotape?

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! That's absolutely right, sir! A videotape, sir! It contains footage from the security camera in the evidence room.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What!? But I specifically asked if there was such a tape, and was told it had been mistakenly erased!

Name: Judge
Text: That's quite a mistake.

Name: Meekins
Text: I just do what I'm told, sir. It's the only thing I'm really good at.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Looks like communication with the Police Department is as good as ever...)

Name: Judge
Text: Well then, let's have a look! Show us the video of you murdering the victim!

Name: Meekins
Text: Oh... Please stop using that word, "murder," sir! It scares me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A video of a real murder... Just what are we getting ourselves into...?) ...

Name: Judge
Text: Well, I believe we're all thinking the same thing. How can we deal with these unsettling feelings stirred within us...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What the hell was that wriggling piece of plywood!?

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir! That is the pride and joy of the entire Criminal Affairs Department, sir! It's the Blue Badger, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Why am I not surprised this isn't going smoothly?)

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, well anyway... this tape seems to prove that that the witness did indeed encounter... er, "someone" in the evidence room, and some sort of... er, "activity" did take place...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor... instead of relying on clearly incomplete footage, the witness's testimony will suffice. Is that alright with you, Officer Meekins?

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! As you wish, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: What's this about a fingerprint?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Each detective has been given a locker, equipped with a fingerprint-activated lock. These locks ensure that each locker can only be opened by the detective it belongs to.

Name: Judge
Text: Intriguing... That would mean... the victim at the crime scene would have to have been Detective Goodman. Very well! The defense may begin its cross-examination!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I don't know where this cross-examination will lead, but everything begins with contradictions. That's where I have to start!)

Name: Meekins
Text: His face can't be clearly seen in the video,

Name: Phoenix
Text: Tell me, were you able to get a good look at him? At the face of the man who attacked you with a knife?

Name: Meekins
Text: S-sir! If you must label people as having "seen" or "not seen" the man's face... I believe I would be classified as... the latter?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The latter? But you were standing right in front of him, were you not?

Name: Judge
Text: More to the point, you are the person who fought him, aren't you?

Name: Meekins
Text: Oh, yes sir! But... I didn't get a clear look at his face, sir. I'm not the kind of guy who looks directly at people when talking with them, you see...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yeah, that's a good trait for a police officer...)

Name: Meekins
Text: Still, I'm sure it was him! I'd bet my badge on it!

Name: Meekins
Text: but there's no question that the other person was Detective Goodman, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: But you don't know that for sure, do you? You never actually saw Detective Goodman's face.

Name: Meekins
Text: Well... I suppose you might say that. That is, if you must label people as having "seen" or "not seen" it.

Name: Judge
Text: Since his face can't be identified in the video, only you can verify it.

Name: Meekins
Text: ! W-w-why is everyone l-looking at me? If I had to label your stares as "disturbing" or...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Meekins!

Name: Meekins
Text: Eek!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Having been shown a questionable video at best, we are not in the best of moods. Now please be more certain when you testify!

Name: Meekins
Text: Y-y-yes, sir!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You claimed the man who brandished a knife on you was Bruce Goodman. Tell us why you are positive it was him!

Name: Meekins
Text: I mean, he opened the locker, which required Detective Goodman's fingerprint to do!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: About these lockers... Is there no other way to open them?

Name: Meekins
Text: No, sir! I myself tried all kinds of methods in the past! They only respond to registered fingerprints, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I wonder what kind of methods he's tried...?)

Name: Judge
Text: If the man opened the locker's lock, which only responds to its registered fingerprints, then he must be the person the locker was assigned to.

Name: Meekins
Text: Exactly my point, sir! And this too!

Name: Meekins
Text: The locker he opened is unquestionably Detective Goodman's locker, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: How do you know that information?

Name: Meekins
Text: I've heard rumors, sir! From people in the know, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: "People in the know"?

Name: Meekins
Text: The workers in the department cafeteria, sir! They keep me informed! They also listen to my... romantic troubles, sir!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: For the record... the opened locker did indeed belong to Detective Goodman. I verified this information through a more... reliable source.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... So the victim opened the locker with his own fingerprint.

Name: Meekins
Text: So it must be him! No one else could have unlocked it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: However, the most important detail is not shown in this video... the man's face!

Name: Meekins
Text: S-sir! If I may say something, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: Please do. After all, you are the one being examined.

Name: Meekins
Text: I don't understand why the man's face is so important in this case, sir! I mean, it was his hand that opened the fingerprint lock... and it was his hand that tried to thrust his knife into my body, sir! My unsettled state can testify enough to this, sir! Yes, you have a point. The footage doesn't lie.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That is... unless the defense can find a problem with it?

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! Let's check the Court Record again!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Is there a problem with the security video?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Regarding the video contained on this tape, there is one thing in particular that seems rather strange.

Name: Judge
Text: Strange?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This contradiction leads to the possibility that... the man may not be Detective Goodman.

Name: Judge
Text: What? This video contains such a contradiction?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Interesting... Your Honor, I have a proposal.

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I propose we have the defense... point out to us this alleged "contradiction" in the video.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He would want me to point it out...)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, proposal accepted. Let us further inspect this piece of evidence. I will now play the security tape. Mr. Wright. Please show us this contradiction you speak of.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I have to point out a problem in the video? This is the first time I've ever had to do that.)

Name: Ema
Text: You can do it, Mr. Wright! It's set up so you can Fast Forward, Rewind or Pause the video. Just take a good look and be sure to point out the right thing!

Name: Meekins
Text: Please don't play it too many times. I-I can't stand watching this video!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (How did this guy ever become a police officer?)

Name: Judge
Text: Now then, Mr. Wright. Please enlighten us! Where is the contradiction that indicates the man may not be Detective Goodman?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The thing that's strange about this video... has got to be this! Officer Meekins.

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir! D-do you mean me, sir?

Name: Phoenix
Text: As I understand it, the locker apparatus works like this: When you grab the handle, a sensor reads your fingerprint. If the print matches the registered data, the light turns on and the lock is released.

Name: Meekins
Text: A-according to my very limited experience, that's the way I understand it, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: If so, then something is seriously wrong with this picture! When the victim reaches for the handle to open the locker... Let's rewind to a little earlier... Here! Notice the light?

Name: Judge
Text: What's this!? It's... already lit!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Precisely my point, Your Honor. The locker was already open before the victim grabbed the handle!

Name: Meekins
Text: AAAAAAAAHHHHH!!!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! What's the meaning of this!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's very simple, Your Honor. The locker wasn't locked on the day of the crime!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But the locker locks are controlled by an electronic system. When a door is shut, a sensor is triggered... and the locker is automatically locked!

Name: Judge
Text: Oh, I know! It must have broken down! Of course, I'm not an expert in this...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That's not likely, Your Honor. The sensor would detect and report any malfunction.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh well. It just goes to show novices should keep their mouths shut. So then, Mr. Wright. Do you have an explanation?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Me, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: Yes. Why wasn't the locker locked?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Me, Your Honor? ... Yes, well. You see... This isn't exactly my field... What do you think, Miss "Scientific Investigator"?

Name: Ema
Text: Huh? Oh, um... Maybe something, like, jammed the electronic system?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Something... jammed the sensor? Say... There's something else that seems out of place in this video.)

Name: Ema
Text: Yeah, I thought so too! There's got to be another clue somewhere in this footage!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Let's inspect the video once more. The locker wasn't locked... Mr. Wright. Please point out the cause for this!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Please watch closely. This is the continuation of the part I showed you earlier.

Name: Judge
Text: What's this? Something white fell out of the locker!

Name: Meekins
Text: But sir! It's been my experience that things fall out when doors are opened! I often fall out and roll great distances when I open my car door, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: We can't be sure that item was in the locker to begin with.

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The sensor triggers the lock when the door is shut... What if something was inserted, say, between the sensor and the door?

Name: Judge
Text: In... Inserted...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This white thing wasn't inside the locker... It was stuck between the door and the sensor!

Name: Meekins
Text: Oh, I understand now, sir! It's just like my tie! Two out of three times it gets stuck in the door when I get out of my patrol vehicle, sir! Instead of the door closing, My tie chokes me!

Name: Judge
Text: But the object would have to be extremely thin to fit in the door.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Not only that, it would also have to block electrical currents... It would need to be an insulator.

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, an insulator! But at the crime scene...

Name: Phoenix
Text: there just might have been something that fits the description.

Name: Meekins
Text: But s-sir! By "insulator," you don't mean...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I think I've finally got this figured out.)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well! Will the defense please present the relevant evidence! What was this insulator that was stuck in the door?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: I found this near the locker: a thin rubber glove.

Name: Judge
Text: But we can't be sure that was in the victim's locker.

Name: Phoenix
Text: It has a tag that says, "SL-9 Incident."

Name: Phoenix
Text: The video seems to depict the victim opening the locker, but that isn't the case! The lit lamp attests to this. On the day of the crime, even I could have opened that locker! Is this not so, Officer Meekins!?

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir... It would appear so, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order! So are we to believe then, that the "victim" whom this witness stabbed in the evidence room... was not Detective Goodman?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Do not be misled, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The defense has merely demonstrated that possibility, and nothing more. The "victim" in the video was indeed Bruce Goodman. The prosecution will offer one more testimony to prove this!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Officer Meekins, please testify about this.

Name: Meekins
Text: Sir! M-me, sir!? I'm not sure what you're referring too, sir...

Name: Meekins
Text: O-oh! You mean that, sir! Of course, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Is this a joke...?)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, begin your testimony!

Name: Judge
Text: An ID card record. I see...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I have the ID card record right here, Your Honor. The ID used at 5:14... is that of the victim.

Name: Judge
Text: Just before the crime, hmm? Yes, without a doubt this is the victim's ID! However, one thing does strike me as unusual... Several hundred cases should have been due for transferal. Why were there so few people using this room?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This particular evidence room is only used for storing certain special cases.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Special" cases...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Extremely violent cases involving police staff.

Name: Ema
Text: Just hearing that makes my hair stand on end!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Me too, although it doesn't make much of a difference...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There were only a few cases up for transferal there, and most were cleared up by noon.

Name: Judge
