Text: Right... I see. Now, Let us move on to the cross-examination.

Name: Meekins
Text: There's one other thing that proves the man was Detective Goodman, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, unlike your earlier testimony, you believe this to be rock solid, do you?

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! Solid as stone, sir! If my hand wasn't wrapped in bandages... I'd even give the 'V for Victory' sign, sir!

Name: Ema
Text: Couldn't he just use his right hand for that...?

Name: Judge
Text: Let's hear him out. The witness can't afford to make any more mistakes.

Name: Meekins
Text: To enter the evidence room, one must use their ID card!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Is that card hanging from your neck one of these ID cards?

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! This card right next to my cuffs, sir! I keep it here so I won't ever forget it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: But what if someone were to steal it from you, keeping it out in the open like that?

Name: Meekins
Text: ... Maybe I shouldn't wear it around my neck... Remember when I said two out of three times my tie gets stuck in my car door when I get out? Well, the remaining time my ID card gets stuck. Instead of the door closing, my ID card chokes me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maybe I should just leave this one alone...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: At any rate, each police officer has only one ID card. Both the Police Department and the Prosecutor's Office can attest to this.

Name: Judge
Text: Please proceed with your testimony.

Name: Meekins
Text: When an ID card is used, there's a record of it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let it be noted that this is the record the witness referred to.

Name: Judge
Text: Let me see... yes, that would be it. Detective Goodman...

Name: Phoenix
Text: ? (What's the matter?)

Name: Judge
Text: A-according to this... Mr. Edgeworth! Your name is on here!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So it is, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (You've got the wrong color, kid.)

Name: Judge
Text: It would seem... the inquiry committee will want to speak with you again today.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I have nothing to be ashamed of regarding my actions, or their consequences. For now, let us continue with the cross-examination.

Name: Ema
Text: Poor Mr. Edgeworth... It must be so difficult for him...

Name: Meekins
Text: At the time of the crime, the detective had used his card!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Earlier I believe you testified that when you asked the man to show his ID card, he pulled a knife on you.

Name: Meekins
Text: Yes, sir! He didn't show me any ID card, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Don't you think that's odd? I mean, if he had his ID card, all he had to do was show it to you. There wouldn't be any reason to draw a knife!

Name: Meekins
Text: ... M-maybe he just panicked?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Everything stems from contradictions. Let's point them out...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait one moment, Officer Meekins.

Name: Meekins
Text: I-I'm not good at waiting, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I have the victim's ID card right here. I found it at the crime scene.

Name: Judge
Text: That makes sense.

Name: Phoenix
Text: When I say, "crime scene," I'm not referring to the evidence room at the Police Department. I mean the "other" crime scene... The underground parking lot at the Prosecutor's Office!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor... I have one more piece of evidence to present. It's a very important clue regarding the victim's ID card.

Name: Judge
Text: A... Lost Item Report? It's only half completed,

Name: Phoenix
Text: but it shows that Detective Goodman had lost "something" on the day of the crime. Something important enough to fill out this report.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Let me guess. You believe this "something" to be his ID card, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I can't say for sure... but there is a high probability! On the day of the crime, Detective Goodman was not carrying his card!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! So now... what does this all mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It can only mean one thing. It doesn't require much thought! The man Officer Meekins encountered in the evidence room... was not Detective Goodman, but rather the man who stole his ID card!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order! Does the prosecution have a response?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I have only one thing to say to the defense.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Bravo, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: B-bravo...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Allow me to summarize the defense's argument. At 5:15 PM on the day of the crime, the man Officer Meekins encountered in the evidence room was not Detective Goodman. There are two grounds to support this. First, the locker in the evidence room was already unlocked. Second, the victim lost his ID card. Am I correct so far, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes... (What's he up to?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That being the case, we must inevitably arrive at a single conclusion: If the "victim" in this video is a fake... then the murder in the evidence room is also fake! In other words, the security camera does not show the instant of the murder.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... Th-that is... Well, I guess that's right...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Is something wrong, Mr. Wright? Only moments ago you seemed content to be pointing your finger around.

Name: Phoenix
Text: This isn't good...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well, well... It seems you've finally realized... exactly what you've gone to such lengths to prove!

Name: Judge
Text: Explain yourself, Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The defense has already done the explaining for me. The victim in this video is a fake... which means a murder did not take place at the Police Department at 5:15 on the day of the crime.

Name: Judge
Text: So...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So the real crime could only take place at one location: the underground parking lot at the Prosecutor's Office! The murderer being Ms. Lana Skye, the defendant! The evidence is compelling! A trustworthy witness... observed moment the defendant used the murder weapon!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Aaaah! (I knew that testimony was way too shabby. It was all a trap from the beginning!)

Name: Judge
Text: The activity in the evidence room still leaves many questions unanswered: Who exactly was the "victim" Officer Meekins encountered? And where did this person disappear to...? However... This trial's purpose is to examine only the murder of Detective Goodman.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Just so, Your Honor.

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! You have to do something, or else Lana...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What do I do? How am I supposed to get myself out of this mess?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: One moment, Your Honor!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What now, Mr. Wright? Don't tell me you're objecting to what you've just proven.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course not. But I almost walked right into the prosecution's trap!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What are you talking about?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This cross-examination has proven one thing and one thing only. The security video did not show the actual murder. However! It cannot be said that it is unrelated to the murder in the parking lot. Specifically, large amounts of blood traces were found in the evidence room!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense demands further examination into the truth of the matter!

Name: Judge
Text: ...Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: If this court were to examine this further, other witnesses will be necessary. Is the prosecution prepared?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm sorry, Your Honor... The prosecution considered the incident at the Police Department to be unrelated. We have not prepared any other witnesses for this incident.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This just might be my chance. Time to call a certain Texas ranger to the stand!)

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright... Do you mean...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor. The defense would like to request a specific witness.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh? Whom do you have in mind?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Someone we have reason to believe knows the truth... The truth behind the activities that took place in the evidence room.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution requests to hear this person's name before deciding whether or not to comply.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, then. Mr. Wright! This person whom you would have testify... What is his or her name?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Officer... Jake Marshall.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Why him?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I can't let him know everything just yet...) He's in charge of the evidence room. I feel we should hear what he has to say.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution agrees to the defense's request. Since he was responsible for guarding the room, we should hear his testimony. Fortunately he works in the Police Department. We shouldn't need longer than 20 minutes to prepare.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The court will take a 30 minute recess while the witness is subpoenaed. Will the prosecution please prepare the witness during this time?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: We will, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Court in recess!

Name: Lana
Text: ... There's no stopping you is there, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? What do you mean?

Name: Lana
Text: You called for Jake Marshall. It seems you've figured everything out.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... (I haven't figured anything out...)

Name: Ema
Text: Lana... You're the one who knows everything!

Name: Lana
Text: Ema...

Name: Ema
Text: You always know everything! Why don't you just tell us!? Mr. Wright is trying his hardest to protect you!

Name: Lana
Text: I... I don't recall ever asking for his "protection."

Name: Ema
Text: How can you be so cold... Don't you trust us? Don't you trust... me?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hope I'm not interrupting anything, pals.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh... Guess I am. I'll come back later.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, Detective Gumshoe! What is it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You've got a lot of nerve, pal! Making a detective run all around while on duty, and to top it off you call me here... I've seen happier people at funerals!

Name: Lana
Text: Sorry, Detective.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You better be, pal...Hey... Hey! Hey!! Hey!!! Hey!!!! I didn't see you there, Ms. Skye!

Name: Lana
Text: That's ok. So... Have you brought what I asked?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh... Oh ho! Oh ho ho! Oh ho ho ho! Oh ho ho ho ho ho ho! You mean this, right!?

Name: Lana
Text: My apologies, Detective. Due to my present circumstances, I was forced to use Mr. Wright's name when making my request.

Name: Phoenix
Text: My name!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Never in a million years would I have thought it was you who asked me, "Could I bother you to bring me the SL-9 Incident files?" "I'll need them by noon." Talk about crazy...

Name: Phoenix
Text: The "SL-9 Incident"?

Name: Ema
Text: But Lana! That's...

Name: Lana
Text: I thought Mr. Wright might need them, so I had them brought here. Here. You might do well to read them.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I can't believe you, the Chief Prosecutor, were a witness in that case!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Skye... was a witness?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Take it from me, you don't want anything to do with serial murders.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, what? Now that I've brought you your stuff, you're just gonna ignore me?

Name: Phoenix
Text: E-Ema! But why... Why is your name in here?

Name: Ema
Text: What? My name's in there!? I don't know... Unless... No, it couldn't be... Lana! This "SL-9 Incident"... Is that...

Name: Lana
Text: ... That's the classification number the police filed it under. Two years ago, the rest of the world knew it as... the "Joe Darke Killings."

Name: Ema
Text: The... Joe Darke... No... No, Lana! That's over with! No!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ema, wait! (She ran away...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Uh, ya know what? I just remembered... I gotta be somewhere. Sorry pal, but I'm outta here!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Jake Marshall, Angel Starr, Damon Gant, Miles Edgeworth... Not to mention Lana and Ema...) Everyone involved in this case is connected to those killings two years ago... This can't be just a "coincidence."

Name: Lana
Text: Knowing you, you just might be able to figure it out. Time to get back to the trial, Mr. Wright. Best of luck.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'd better take a good look at this file...)

Name: Judge
Text: The court will now reconvene for the trial of Ms. Lana Skye.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ema didn't come back...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Allow me to call the next witness to the stand: the officer in charge of guarding the evidence room on the day of the crime.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Witness, please state your name and occupation.

Name: Marshall
Text: Me, pardner? Oh, I'm just a man, same as you, wanderin' the trails of civilization,

Name: Edgeworth
Text: occasionally helping the elderly cross intersections when needed.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh, I know! You're a "patrolman"!

Name: Marshall
Text: As for my name, if you listen hard 'nuff, you can hear the howling wind calling it out.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: To be exact, it's Jake Marshall... Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ("Howling wind"...? I've never heard Edgeworth described that way before...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Now, Mr. Marshall. Let me ask you something. You were in charge of guarding the evidence room on the day the crime took place. Is this correct?

Name: Marshall
Text: According to the papers, pardner.

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Marshall
Text: A desperado's soul is as boundless as the desert sands. No "paper" can sum it up.

Name: Judge
Text: Maybe it's best we get on with this quickly. Please share with us your testimony of the day of the crime... in English!

Name: Judge
Text: I can't say I particularly care for your attitude...

Name: Marshall
Text: I can't say I care for your beard, but you don't see me complainin'.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait a minute... What do you mean by "two security systems"?

Name: Marshall
Text: I mean the security cameras and the ID card reader. I reckon even a cowpoke like you knows about those.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, well, what about the fingerprint activated locks inside the evidence room?

Name: Marshall
Text: Fingerprint activated locks? What kind of new-fangled doohickeys are those?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He's not being very helpful...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He's not that good with machines... or with following orders.

Name: Marshall
Text: Everyone's got their weaknesses, now don't they, Mr. Prosecutor?

Name: Judge
Text: This one seems like trouble. Okay Mr. Wright, he's all yours.

Name: Marshall
Text: My job was to keep a wary eye on that bone orchard.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How exactly did you "keep an eye" on the evidence room?

Name: Marshall
Text: I just made sure nothing moved in the security camera monitor. That room's so still, even time dies in there. I was just a caretaker who interred the recordings.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You "interred" them?

Name: Marshall
Text: Videos of nothing aren't that useful. When the time would come, I'd erase the tape.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If nothing unusual is recorded, tapes are to be erased every six hours.

Name: Marshall
Text: Each time I'd erase a tape, it felt like I was erasing a part of my life.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This guy has a flare for the dramatic, but it isn't going to do him any good.) So, in actuality you don't physically enter the evidence room?

Name: Marshall
Text: They said I was supposed to make rounds three times a day, but that ain't my style.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But you made your rounds on the day of the crime, right?

Name: Marshall
Text: Ain't you heard a word I said, pardner? I told you that ain't my style.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Um, I'm afraid I don't understand.

Name: Marshall
Text: No desperado I know lets "rules" get in his way.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No desperados I know join the police force...)

Name: Judge
Text: So, Officer Marshall. On the day of the crime...?

Name: Marshall
Text: Just between you and me, I didn't set foot in the evidence room that day.

Name: Judge
Text: There was a rubber glove stuck in the victim's locker. Do you know anything about that?

Name: Marshall
Text: Sorry pardner, can't say I do. I haven't been in that crypt in weeks.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (How does this guy avoid being fired...?)

Name: Marshall
Text: Besides, the room's protected by two security systems, anyway.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You used to be a detective, so you've used the evidence room in the past, correct?

Name: Marshall
Text: Of course. Back in the day my locker was a goldmine of evidence!

Name: Phoenix
Text: And yet... you didn't know about the fingerprint locking mechanism?

Name: Marshall
Text: Sorry, pardner. I ain't good with machines. I couldn't even tell you how a bike works.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's quite, uh... incredible.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The sensors on the locker handles cannot be seen. It's well known that some detectives are unaware of their presence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now that he mentions it, Detective Gumshoe said something like that too...)

Name: Judge
Text: At any rate, it doesn't seem that this is relevant to the crime. Can you tell us what you were doing when the crime took place?

Name: Marshall
Text: If I remember right, I was at a street-side saloon at the time it went down.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What were you doing in a place like that?

Name: Marshall
Text: I was eating spaghetti. Not even Angel's steak lunches can beat that parlor's vongole sepia pasta.

Name: Judge
Text: Do you mean to tell us... you abandoned your police duties to eat some noodles?

Name: Marshall
Text: Not all desperados eat tacos, pardner.

Name: Judge
Text: That's not what I meant... I hope this has at least taught you a lesson!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's strange... This is usually where Edgeworth says, "Did you not want a raise this year?"...)

Name: Marshall
Text: I'm just an innocent travelin' man, so if you're out of ammo it's time I hit the trail.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Out of "ammo," officer Marshall?

Name: Marshall
Text: That's right, pardner. Or as you'd call it, "evidence." If you plan to pin me to this crime, then you'd better draw. Otherwise, you're just wastin' my time. My steel horse is waitin' to carry me back west into the sunset.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... One thing seems clear. Despite being responsible for guarding the evidence room, the witness doesn't appear to have seen anything.

Name: Marshall
Text: Texans don't take orders from anyone. Everyone knows that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Apparently your superiors don't...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Officer Marshall. Doesn't it strike you as odd? That is, you being called in to testify like this?

Name: Phoenix
Text: After all, you weren't in the security room at the time of the crime.

Name: Marshall
Text: And yet you dragged me down here. Explain yourself, pardner.

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's quite simple. You left a very large trail behind at the scene. Or, to be exact... a handprint.

Name: Marshall
Text: Hmph! Listen real good, pardner. Like I said, I'm the caretaker of that crypt. I pay my respects... that is, make my rounds, about once a month. It's only natural my fingerprints would be in there.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I only wish it were, Officer, but you see... your fingerprints were covered in blood!

Name: Judge
Text: Witness! What's the meaning of this!? Your bloodstained fingerprints were at the crime scene...!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The blood was wiped away. However! A luminol test clearly revealed this! Well, Officer Marshall?

Name: Marshall
Text: ... It seems to me... there ain't a person in this room with a head on his shoulders.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I take it you have an explanation then, Officer Marshall? About the "bloodstained" fingerprints?

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, you may begin your testimony about your fingerprints, found at the scene of the crime!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... The witness's explanation appears valid, although there's room for doubt.

Name: Marshall
Text: Life wouldn't be any fun without any doubt, pardner.

Name: Judge
Text: The defense may now cross- examine the witness.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This guy's hiding something, I can feel it! Now's my chance to prove it.)

Name: Marshall
Text: Like I said, it's only natural for my fingerprints to be in that evidence room.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's because you... how did you put it... "pay your respects," once a month?

Name: Marshall
Text: Yeah, that's right. That, and one more thing... That locker happens to be mine.

Name: Judge
Text: What!? What do you mean?

Name: Marshall
Text: I mean what I said. That's the locker I used when I was a detective... the locker I still use. All that's in there now though is a heap of broken dreams.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see...

Name: Marshall
Text: It'd be strange if my prints WEREN'T all over that locker.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Apparently his fingerprint data was never changed. He must have been using the fingerprint lock without even knowing it.)

Name: Marshall
Text: One of them just happened to be at the same place as the bloodstained handprint.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So then... What about the bloody handprint?

Name: Marshall
Text: Wasn't mine. It's no mystery.

Name: Judge
Text: Please explain.

Name: Marshall
Text: My locker is covered with my fingerprints. It just so happened...

Name: Marshall
Text: The murderer touched the locker where my fingerprint was by chance.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The chances of that happening are a million to one!

Name: Marshall
Text: On the contrary, one could argue just the opposite. The chances of that not happening are a million to one! Get one thing straight, pardner. You ain't gonna get no reward for me with a mere fingerprint. You wanna know why?

Name: Marshall
Text: The bloodstain and the fingerprint are completely unrelated.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Unrelated?

Name: Marshall
Text: They're as different as night and day. Kinda like "cereal" an' "serial." One's got to do with breakfast while the other's a type of murder.

Name: Judge
Text: He's right... although seemingly alike, they're totally different.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I don't see what homonyms have to do with this...)

Name: Marshall
Text: Or didn't you know the murderer was wearing gloves?

Name: Phoenix
Text: How do you know that!?

Name: Marshall
Text: I may be a loner, but I still do my job. I keep up on the reports.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There was a bloodstain at the scene, thought to be left by the murderer.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's right, it was found on Detective Gumshoe's locker.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: However, no fingerprints were detected on that handprint.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh yeah, I think we tried that too.)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...So that would mean... the murderer, wearing gloves, happened to place his hand on top of Officer Marshall's fingerprint.

Name: Marshall
Text: That's the only logical conclusion.

Name: Marshall
Text: Too bad it wasn't me in that video, right, pardner?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean by that?

Name: Marshall
Text: You want to tie me to this crime, isn't that right, pardner?

Name: Marshall
Text: If so, that video is the only direct evidence you have.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: But that video is next to useless! It's full of blind spots!

Name: Judge
Text: Blind spots?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Places you can't see! The camera's panning back and forth, the floor isn't shown... If someone was familiar with the camera's position, he could leave the room without being caught on tape!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: We don't have time for your speculations, Mr. Wright.

Name: Judge
Text: Well, Mr. Wright. If you can show us evidence in this video that indicates Officer Marshall was present, please do so now.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Very well. Allow me to point out your mistake, Officer Marshall!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Tread carefully, Mr. Wright, or you might wind up being the one making the mistake.

Name: Judge
Text: Now then, let's have another look at the video. Show us this incriminating evidence of the witness... Officer Jake Marshall!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Bringing our attention back to the security camera... is a mistake I'm afraid you'll soon not forget, Officer Marshall.

Name: Marshall
Text: ... The days are short in Texas... and so are our tempers. Could you sum up what you have to say in eight words or less?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Very well. You can clearly be seen in this video!

Name: Marshall
Text: Exactly eight words... Not bad, pardner.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The key... lies in a certain locker shown in the video.

Name: Judge
Text: See this locker that has a white cloth sticking out? This is the witness's locker.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Now then, let's rewind the video a bit.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh! The white cloth... it's gone! What's the meaning of this, Officer Marshall!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: When the crime took place... The white cloth wasn't there. Then... it suddenly appeared! There's only one explanation: Officer Marshall! You were in the evidence room at the time of the crime! What's more, you opened your locker when the camera was turned away!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! It would seem that's the only-

Name: Marshall
Text: Hold your horses! Sorry, pardner... but you got the wrong man.

Name: Marshall
Text: So what if my locker was opened? That doesn't mean I'm the one who opened it!

Name: Marshall
Text: The murderer needed to hide something, so he opened a locker and stuck it in. It's not my fault he happened to choose mine!

Name: Marshall
Text: ... Why's everyone staring at me like I'm a wanted man?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This guy isn't just playing dumb... He really doesn't know!) Uh, I hate to rain on your parade, but you're the only person who can open that particular locker.

Name: Marshall
Text: Oh yeah? I call your bluff. You say I opened that locker... Now prove it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Marshall
Text: A... "fingerprint" sensor?

Name: Phoenix
Text: We talked about this earlier today. The lockers can only be opened by the detectives they belong to.

Name: Marshall
Text: W-what kinda crazy talk is this!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, Detective Gumshoe did mention something about this...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: In any case, the locks aren't that obvious. There's even some people in the force that don't know about the fingerprint locks!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, sheriff! What do you have to say... in eight words or less?

Name: Marshall
Text: I only got one word for you, pardner. NOOOOOO!!!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order! Witness! Explain yourself!

Name: Marshall
Text: If this is a joke, it's the worst I've ever heard...

Name: Phoenix
Text: I assure you this is no joke, Officer Marshall. Now then, please tell us what you were doing in the evidence room at the time of the crime?

Name: Judge
Text: Ol! Please answer the question!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What is he now, a bullfighter?) That's alright, Officer Marshall. I believe we can figure the rest out from here.

Name: Judge
Text: We can?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Have a look at these floor plans. There is no place for someone to hide in the evidence room. Yet, Officer Meekins didn't see Officer Marshall.

Name: Judge
Text: If that's so, then... where was the witness?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It seems Mr. Wright has an answer.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's right. The only possible conclusion!)

Name: Judge
Text: Well then? Let's hear it. Where was Officer Marshall at the time of the crime?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Officer Marshall was standing right here!

Name: Judge
Text: There? But that's... That's where the victim, Detective Goodman, was!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Correct... unless the man wasn't Detective Goodman. I believe the "victim" in the video is... Officer Marshall! It was you, dressed up like Detective Goodman!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But that's preposterous! Officer Meekins witnessed the detective at the crime scene! Once he saw the man's face, he'd know for sure!

Name: Phoenix
Text: May I point out though, that Officer Meekins did not know Detective Goodman. He also testified about the man's reaction when confronted.

Name: Meekins
Text: When I entered the evidence room, I asked him to show his card, sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes? And how did Detective Goodman respond?

Name: Meekins
Text: He suddenly pulled a knife on me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Something about the Officer's story puzzled me. If the man had his ID card, why didn't he just show it?

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, he would have needed it to enter the evidence room, so he must have been carrying it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The answer is simple. He couldn't show it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: As you can see, Detective Goodman's picture is on his ID card.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh, I get it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: If he showed that, his cover would have been blown! Officer Meekins would have realized the man wasn't Detective Goodman. Do you have anything to say to this, Officer Marshall?

Name: Marshall
Text: ... You've got quite an imagination, pardner. We got a term for that. It's called "circumstantial evidence."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Circumstantial evidence...? (He's still denying it!)

Name: Marshall
Text: You're gonna have to do better than that to break a detective. Unless you have hard evidence proving I dressed up as the victim...

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I can't say I particularly care for your uncooperative disposition...

Name: Marshall
Text: I can't say I care for your beard, but you don't see me complainin'.

Name: Judge
Text: Well, Mr. Wright? Do you have any evidence? Any evidence proving beyond the shadow of a doubt that Officer Marshall dressed up as the victim?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well... (Who am I kidding? I don't have anything like that...)

Name: Marshall
Text: I can see the fear in your eyes, pardner. Seems you're the one who couldn't take the desert heat!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ack! (This can't be happening! It's so obvious he's the one! What can I do...?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Hmph. It looks like your lack of experience has finally been exposed.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'll pass onto you what someone told me when I was just starting out. When you've run into a wall with no place to go, return to the basics.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The basics... (For me, that would be what Mia used to tell me!)

Name: Mia
Text: Nick! Try thinking outside of the box!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I shouldn't look for proof that Officer Marshall was in disguise... but rather I should look for evidence that came about because he was in disguise!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Why do you think this locker was opened in the first place?

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There's no reason for Officer Marshall to open his locker at the time of the crime. Yet he did, despite the chance that it might be discovered later as it has been.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Which means he didn't originally plan to open his locker...!)

Name: Judge
Text: According to the defense's argument, Officer Jake Marshall dressed up as Detective Goodman at the time of the crime. Then, after the crime was "committed," he opened his own locker for some unknown reason.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The fact that a white "cloth" is sticking out of the locker seems to indicate that he opened it in order to put the cloth inside.

Name: Judge
Text: So... just what exactly is this piece of cloth?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Perhaps... Perhaps the video is the key to all our unanswered questions. (I don't have any evidence, so this video's my only shot!)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Let's take yet another look at the security tape. After commiting the crime, the witness opened the locker to put away the white cloth. Please show us why the witness had to open his locker!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: For some reason, you disguised yourself as Detective Goodman, and entered the evidence room. I don't know what that reason was... yet.

Name: Marshall
Text: "Yet"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: However, something unexpected happened. Officer Meekins barged in on you. When asked to show your ID card, you pulled a knife on him. However! Officer Meekins panicked, and the white coat you were wearing was soiled with blood!

Name: Judge
Text: A bloody white coat...

Name: Phoenix
Text: You couldn't just walk out like that, so you hid the coat in your locker.

Name: Marshall
Text: ... Not bad, huh "pardner"?

Name: Judge
Text: Now then, Officer Marshall. Are you ready to tell us the truth?

Name: Marshall
Text: Looks like I underestimated y'all. I hope you're happy now, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Marshall
Text: Two years ago... if you were only half as persistent then as you are today, we all wouldn't have to be here, now would we?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Officer Marshall! Tell the court what you did... all of it.

Name: Marshall
Text: Alright. It seems the time has come.

Name: Judge
Text: So the supposed "victim" was really you...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But there's one thing I still don't understand. Large quantities of blood traces were found on the floor of the evidence room. If no one was murdered, then how could that be?

Name: Marshall
Text: Officer Meekins managed to cut his own hand. My guess is he's the donor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It looked like too much blood for that...)

Name: Marshall
Text: I had to do it that day. I couldn't just stand by and let it die.

Name: Phoenix
Text: When you say "it," you mean...

Name: Marshall
Text: Do you even have to ask, pardner?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The SL-9 Incident...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Two years have passed since that case was closed. It was going to completely end with the transferal that day.

Name: Marshall
Text: Not if I have anything to do with it. That incident's not over!

Name: Phoenix
Text: But what did you hope to accomplish by sneaking into the evidence room?

Name: Marshall
Text: When a case is closed, only the detective who was in charge of it can look through the evidence. I wanted to have a look at it myself one more time... no matter what the cost. I don't care what anyone says, pardner. That case is mine.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (But Officer Marshall wasn't in charge of that investigation. Why does he care so much about it?)

Name: Marshall
Text: That day was my last chance. That's why I...

Name: Marshall
Text: I stole the detective's ID and dressed like him. I planned to take out the evidence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did you disguise yourself as Detective Goodman?

Name: Marshall
Text: If I didn't make it look like Goodman was carrying out the evidence transferal... I'd be arrested for stealing evidence, which wouldn't get me anywhere.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So you did it to fool the security camera.

Name: Judge
Text: And the detective's ID card?

Name: Marshall
Text: I stole that the morning of the incident.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So that really was why Goodman started filling out that lost item report.)

Name: Marshall
Text: I returned his ID card. I left it on the floor in the Prosecutor's Office parking lot.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The ID card I found was left there by Officer Marshall!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So essentially... You managed to succeed despite your lack of foresight.

Name: Marshall
Text: What do you mean... pardner?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I mean the fingerprint- activated lock, of course. No matter how well you disguise yourself, you can't change your fingerprints. Normally, that locker shouldn't have opened.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So it opened because a rubber glove was stuck in the door by chance...? Then Detective Goodman must have opened the locker before Officer Marshall!)

Name: Marshall
Text: I wasn't expecting Officer Meekins. I knocked him out...

Name: Phoenix
Text: You pulled a knife on Officer Meekins and tried to drive him off?

Name: Marshall
Text: Let's just say I was a little surprised. I only planned on being in the evidence room for no more than five minutes. I didn't think anyone would actually come in during that short time.

Name: Judge
Text: Officer Meekins... certainly is a one-in-a- million type of person. Mistaking a detective for an intruder and demanding to be shown his ID...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'll have to think a little more about his raise this year...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (When did Edgeworth get so much influence...?)

Name: Marshall
Text: Anyway, he threw himself at me, and I ended up cutting him slightly. I'm sorry it had to turn out that way... with me knocking him out and everything.

Name: Phoenix
Text: By the way, what happened to your knife?

Name: Marshall
Text: Oh, you mean this one?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (I don't know what to say...)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... So, what happened next?

Name: Marshall
Text: and managed to escape. I knew which areas wouldn't be caught on the camera.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you did your research beforehand.

Name: Marshall
Text: Those who go into the desert unprepared don't live long, pardner. I didn't think it would make a difference though. The security tape is erased every six hours. If all had gone as planned, no footage would have been left.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: However... You bloodied your coat in your struggle with Officer Meekins.

Name: Marshall
Text: If someone was in the security room when I came out, the jig would have been up. I opened my locker and stashed it in there.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What was Officer Meekins doing during that time?

Name: Marshall
Text: What else? He was sleeping like a baby.

Name: Judge
Text: So what you're saying is, on that day...

Name: Marshall
Text: There wasn't any murder in the evidence room at 5:15.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But the blood found at the scene certainly indicates a crime took place!

Name: Marshall
Text: What are you, blind? The "victim" shown on that tape is me, and I'm not dead yet, pardner.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So, you stole the evidence from the locker?

Name: Marshall
Text: Actually... no, I didn't.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Why not?

Name: Marshall
Text: When I opened the locker, the evidence was already gone.

Name: Judge
Text: What!? Mr. Edgeworth. Where is that evidence?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's still missing, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Detective Goodman's locker was already empty... Someone else stole the evidence!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Officer Marshall. May I ask you one thing?

Name: Marshall
Text: Fire away, pardner. It's a free country. Just remember, I'm also free to decide whether or not to answer.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did you do this? Stealing a detective's ID, injuring a police officer... This is no small offense!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Moreover, you're an officer yourself. This will have serious consequences. It can't just be forgiven with a simple cut in salary.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Not that salary cuts are ever a valid solution...)

Name: Marshall
Text: ... Like I said. This isn't your case. This one is mine. And I'll do anything it takes to get an answer I'm satisfied with.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... The witness has an unusual amount of zeal. Let's hear more.

Name: Marshall
Text: I can't just forget the SL-9 Incident... You know why?

Name: Phoenix
Text: But that case was solved two years ago, wasn't it?

Name: Judge
Text: That's the reason the evidence was stored in the evidence room.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Joe Darke was convicted for those crimes. One thing I can say for sure, he deserved his sentence.

Name: Judge
Text: I remember the Joe Darke case... It involved serial murders, didn't it?

Name: Marshall
Text: I don't intend to complain about how it turned out, but there's something that still bothers me. Something went down at that trial. Something no one will talk about.

Name: Judge
Text: What happened?

Name: Marshall
Text: I don't know. That's what I'm trying to find out.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Why is he so concerned with that incident? Maybe I should present him with what I think his real reason is...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Officer Marshall, I think I understand. I think I know why you care so much about the SL-9 Incident.

Name: Marshall
Text: Sounds like you've been sipping too much cactus juice, pardner.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I have the SL-9 Incident file here. The name "Marshall" is mentioned in here...

Name: Phoenix
Text: in a list of murder victims. "Neil Marshall"... Are you related to this man?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Neil Marshall...?

Name: Marshall
Text: Yeah, I'm sure you've heard the name. Two years ago... he received the same lousy prosecutor award you got.

Name: Judge
Text: What!? A prosecutor...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He must be talking about the King of Prosecutors award.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Now I remember... Prosecutor Neil Marshall. He handled the SL-9 case before I did.

Name: Marshall
Text: That's right. He was killed... and the case fell into your hands.

Name: Judge
Text: But what's his relation to you...?

Name: Marshall
Text: He was my brother. He was investigating the murders with Damon Gant, Chief Detective at the time. The group of detectives I was part of worked under them. We were desperate to prosecute the killer. Joe Darke... My brother fought Darke and was killed. That was the first time Darke left behind any evidence. That was all we needed. He was arraigned and incarcerated. The case was finally closed... at least, according to the public records.

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Marshall
Text: My brother couldn't have been killed by Joe Darke. I knew my brother better than anyone... No one could have beaten him in a fight.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And that's it? That's your reason for your insane actions?

Name: Marshall
Text: There's more to my brother's death than what the records say. No matter how much you try to hide it, you can't fool me.

Name: Judge
Text: Well... at least one thing's for certain. Now we know what happened at the Police Department on the day of the crime.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That was the last day the SL-9 case could be reopened. Not satisfied with its resolution, Officer Marshall planned to steal the evidence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Disguising himself as Detective Goodman, he entered the evidence room. Officer Meekins confronted him, so he rendered him unconscious and fled.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, this mystery has finally been cleared up. No murder took place at the Police Department that day!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The things that happen by chance never cease to amaze... At exactly the same time as the murder at the Prosecutor's Office... this fake murder was going on at the Police Department.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Chance...? It's got to be more than just that...)

Name: Judge
Text: So if no one was murdered at the Police Department on the day of the crime, that means the murder in the Prosecutor's Office's parking lot was the real one.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Which, in turn, means... only one person could have committed the crime: Chief Prosecutor Lana Skye.

Name: Phoenix
Text: B-but wait! A verdict wasn't reached in yesterday's trial!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Which is why we examined the incident at the Police Department today.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But...!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There's only one reason the defendant was not convicted yesterday: there yet remained the mystery of the simultaneous murder at the Police Department.

Name: Marshall
Text: It seems to me... this boy's got the draw on you, pardner.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: All the mysteries at the Police Department have been uncovered. No contradictions remain. The murder took place at the Prosecutor's Office! The only suspect is Lana Skye. There were no errors in the testimony of the witness, Angel Starr! If you have a response... make it one word or less.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... ARRRGHHHH!!!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I rest my case.

Name: Judge
Text: It seems this trial has reached its conclusion. There's no room for doubt.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well done, Mr. Wright. Thanks to you, I didn't need to waste my time... disproving the alleged "murder" at the Police Department.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (There's no doubt what I proved today is true... The apparent murder on the security camera's tape really was fake! But I didn't realize... that would end up proving Lana guilty!)

Name: Judge
Text: Now then, the time for the verdict has arrived. This court finds the defendant...

Name: Ema
Text: Y-your Honor! Wait!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ema!

Name: Ema
Text: The defense has an objection. A scientific objection! Right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean, "right?"

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. Are you this girl's guardian?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! Oh, uh... in a sense...

Name: Ema
Text: Please, Your Honor. All I'm asking is for a minute of your time! Please hear me out! Mr. Edgeworth, please...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I don't want to leave any loose ends. You want a minute? I'll give you three.

Name: Ema
Text: I... I was kind of in shock. I mean, finding out that the SL-9 incident referred to the Joe Darke Killings!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now that she mentions it... the names of both Skye sisters were in that file.)

Name: Ema
Text: But that's when I figured it out. I mean, what Officer Marshall was trying to do that day... So I knew his fingerprint had nothing to do with the crime. That left only one thing... the other handprint!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You mean the traces of blood found on Detective Gumshoe's locker...

Name: Judge
Text: But no fingerprints were found on it, right?

Name: Ema
Text: No, but I figured if I examined it scientifically... I'd be sure to find a clue! So I ran over there and looked at it again!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ! So did you find something?

Name: Ema
Text: Um... No!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Ema
Text: Sorry. I guess I'm not much of a scientific investigator after all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um... Is that all?

Name: Ema
Text: Please don't be mad. I'm just a high school student!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (And I'm just an attorney...)

Name: Ema
Text: But Mr. Wright! Those traces of blood are the only clue we have! If we can't find something wrong with them... Please, Mr. Wright. You're a professional. If anyone can save Lana, it's you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Me? Oh boy...

Name: Judge
Text: Time's up. Now then, Mr. Wright. With regard to the incident at the Police Department... Does any reasonable doubt remain?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It appears the defense is troubled by the other blood mark. Looking at the floor plans, a handprint was discovered around here. Is there a problem with this?

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! I'm sorry I can't be of more use... But still! If you can't find anything wrong with that blood mark, Lana will be...

Name: Judge
Text: Please answer my question, Mr. Wright. We don't have all day.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes, Your Honor. (If ever I've needed to concentrate, it's now! What could be wrong with that handprint on Detective Gumshoe's locker? Could there be something I'm missing...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This handprint left at the crime scene... clearly shows a contradiction!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The only thing that seems clear is you're grasping, Mr. Wright.

Name: Judge
Text: You've been staring pretty intently at those floor plans. Tell me... is there a problem with them?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (Yes, this is strange...!) Take a good look at these floor plans. Something is missing.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: "Missing"...? You mean, something hasn't been drawn on there?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. Something that, when drawn, will completely change the meaning of the blood mark!

Name: Judge
Text: Let us pray the defense isn't simply trying to buy time. Very well, Mr. Wright!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (With all this evidence here... there's got to be something I can use!)

Name: Judge
Text: The question is... which item can prove something is missing in the floor plans?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Marshall
Text: What about that piece of plywood?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The Blue Badger! Mascot of the police force! Defender of truth, guardian of proof!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Explain yourself, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Please look at the floor plans of the crime scene. The Blue Badger is not here.

Name: Marshall
Text: So?

Name: Phoenix
Text: So watch what happens when we put him in. This is where he was dancing at the time of the crime. Well...?

Name: Judge
Text: Well... what?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ! *gasp!*

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's right. So long as the Blue Badger is dancing here... it would be impossible... to place a handprint at this spot on the locker!

Name: Marshall
Text: Whaaaaat!?

Name: Judge
Text: So that means... Uh... just exactly what does that mean!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It means it can't be done!

Name: Judge
Text: What are you saying? Blood traces were undeniably found on that locker!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Don't look at me, I didn't put it there!

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! Think it through scientifically!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ema!

Name: Ema
Text: On that afternoon... Officer Meekins was the one who brought the Blue Badger to the evidence room, right? After he put it down, it would be impossible to leave a handprint on that locker.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! So that must mean this blood mark... was left there before the Blue Badger was brought in...?

Name: Judge
Text: Just one moment! I will not allow such farfetched balderdash in my courtroom!

Name: Phoenix
Text: It may sound farfetched, Your Honor... but it's the only possible explanation! On February 21st... in the Police Department's evidence room... blood was spilled not once, but twice!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: B-but how...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: One time was captured on this tape, taken by the security camera. Officer Meekins cut his hand, from which a trivial amount of blood fell. The problem is... the "other" time. Someone bled prior to the struggle shown on this tape. It had to have been... Detective Goodman, when he was really murdered!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That's ridiculous! I refute you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murder portrayed in the security tape has been proven to be a fake. However! That does not explain the blood mark found on the locker!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So then... assuming this "murder" you purport really happened. When did it take place!? I demand you show evidence that proves it occurred!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (When did the first incident occur...)

Name: Judge
Text: To surmise, the defense claims that... prior to Officer Meekins being cut by Jake Marshall, who was disguised as Detective Goodman, another "incident" took place in that evidence room.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The blood mark on the locker proves this.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Then tell us... When did this "first" incident occur? Proof must be presented.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Proof that shows when the murder took place... There's only one piece of evidence that can show that!)

Name: Judge
Text: Now then. Will the defense please present its evidence? What shows when the "first" crime took place?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: If the crime took place inside the evidence room, then the perpetrator would had to have entered the room. In order to do so, an ID card is required.

Name: Judge
Text: An ID card... Oh! The ID Card Record!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Officer Meekins brought the Blue Badger panel into the evidence room at...

Name: Judge
Text: Let's see here... 4:50 PM. If the crime took place before that time, then it would be... 4:40 PM... Ah! AAAAAAAHHH! M-M-M-M-M-M-M-M-M-M-M-M-M-M-M-Miles Edgeworth! Just what have you done!?

Name: Marshall
Text: I never figured you had nerve, boy.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Put off the act, witness. It doesn't take a lot of thought to figure out it couldn't have been me.

Name: Marshall
Text: Hmm... Nope, I ain't gettin' it...

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I'm afraid I don't understand either.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's clear from the luminol test that blood was there. However, when the "second" crime took place... both Officer Meekins and Officer Marshall failed to notice the blood.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That means... the blood from the first crime was wiped away... by the real murderer.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I would have had just ten minutes to murder the victim, carry his body away, and clean up the blood... Unfortunately that's physically impossible.

Name: Judge
Text: That would mean... the crime must have taken place before Mr. Edgeworth entered the evidence room.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let's look at the chart again. There's only one other card number remaining: "7777777"!

Name: Marshall
Text: Talk about a lucky number...

Name: Judge
Text: But wait... That doesn't make sense! How could Officer Goodman have entered the evidence room?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Since there's no record of his card being used beforehand... he must have entered along with the real murderer. That's the only plausible explanation. He went in with "7777777"!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth! Please look into this ASAP! Find out whose ID number is "sevensevensevensevensevensevensevenseven"!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That's one "seven" too many, Your Honor. Unfortunately... I'm unable to look up the owner of that ID card. At least, at present.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!?

Name: Marshall
Text: Explain yourself, son.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The ID number "7777777" belongs to someone with a rank of Captain or higher... Someone who is a so-called "executive officer." We don't have the authority to inquire into such a person's identity.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: But that's ridiculous! Just how...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm not finished talking, Mr. Wright. There is one situation in which we can be granted such authority.

Name: Judge
Text: If an official charge filed against an executive is accepted.

Name: Phoenix
Text: An "official charge"...

Name: Marshall
Text: You're all alike, aren't you? With your "cover-ups" and your "forgeries"... That's how the Prosecutor's Office operates!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I take pride in my work, Officer Marshall. I would appreciate it if you would keep your slander to yourself.

Name: Marshall
Text: "Slander," is it? Okay. Let me ask a question.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes?

Name: Marshall
Text: No, not to you. To her, the defendant sitting over there. Your own little "executive."

Name: Phoenix
Text: (L-Lana?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Don't be stupid. She's been charged with murder. Of course we've looked up her ID number... and it's not "7777777."

Name: Marshall
Text: Don't play me for a fool, pardner. That's not what I want to ask. All I want to know is one thing... about that incident.

Name: Judge
Text: The SL-9 Incident?

Name: Marshall
Text: Answer me this, Chief Prosecutor! In that trial two years ago... Did you really only use legitimate evidence!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Do you need the witness to repeat his question, Chief Prosecutor?

Name: Lana
Text: I heard him fine, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Two years ago... I was in charge of the prosecution for that trial. At the time, we...

Name: Lana
Text: Occasionally... we felt the powerlessness of the law. At least... I did.

Name: Ema
Text: L-Lana...

Name: Lana
Text: I became a prosecutor in order to suppress crime with the law. But before I realized it, we were the ones being suppressed by the law.

Name: Judge
Text: Defendant! Just what are you saying!?

Name: Marshall
Text: I'll ask you again, Chief Prosecutor. During that trial two years ago... did you really present all the evidence in court? Can you look me, an investigator in that crime, in the eye and say that you did?

Name: Judge
Text: Chief Prosecutor! You didn't...

Name: Lana
Text: ... I don't have to, Officer Marshall.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ! Why don't you answer him!?

Name: Lana
Text: Drastic crimes require drastic measures... That's just the way it is. We did what we had to... in order for him to get the verdict he deserved.

Name: Ema
Text: But Lana!

Name: Lana
Text: Even if it involved "forging" evidence.

Name: Marshall
Text: See? That's what I'm talking about.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No... NNNNOOOOOOO!!!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order! ORDERRRRR!!!

Name: Ema
Text: I'm so sorry, Mr. Wright. I'm sorry for what my sister said...

Name: Lana
Text: Drastic crimes require drastic measures... That's just the way it is. We did what we had to... in order for him to get the verdict he deserved.

Name: Ema
Text: I... didn't know. I never knew that the "SL-9 Incident" was just another name for... the "Joe Darke Killings."

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Sounds like everyone's heard about these killings but me...)

Name: Ema
Text: Lana wanted Darke convicted so badly! That's why she used me... That's why she used what happened to me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean, "what happened" to you?

Name: Ema
Text: It's all there in the file... Joe Darke's last victim was Prosecutor Neil Marshall. When he murdered Officer Marshall's brother, he left behind an incriminating piece of evidence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But what did you have to do with those killings, Ema?

Name: Ema
Text: On the night Prosecutor Neil Marshall was murdered, Joe Darke... tried to kill me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What? He tried to kill you!?

Name: Ema
Text: Officer Marshall's brother... Neil... was only trying to save me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So that means you...

Name: Ema
Text: Yes. I was a witness in the Joe Darke trial.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I didn't see that one coming!)

Name: Ema
Text: It happened two years ago... It was right about this time of the year, too. There was a terrible thunder storm that day... Unusual for the season. I was alone in my sister's office. We were planning to eat dinner together once she finished her work. Then suddenly... This terrifying man came bursting into the office!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Joe Darke...

Name: Ema
Text: It seemed like he was running from someone. He pulled out a knife and screamed at me. I didn't know what was going on. Just then, Prosecutor Marshall showed up.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Jake Marshall's brother...)

Name: Ema
Text: Joe Darke tried to take me hostage, but before he could... Mr. Marshall tackled him. Then...

Name: Phoenix
Text: What happened?

Name: Ema
Text: I-I'll never forget it! Lightning struck, and the lights went out. Suddenly... a bolt of lightning flashed outside the window, lighting up the office for an instant. What I saw then burned a permanent picture in my mind. I... I can still see it now...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A permanent picture...?)

Name: Ema
Text: I don't remember the moment when Darke stabbed Mr. Marshall.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you weren't able to testify about that? No, I was only asked about when I was attacked. That must be why Lana... why she "made up" the crime.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Made it up? You mean, provided bogus evidence?

Name: Ema
Text: The Prosecutor's Office wanted that guilty verdict so badly. Lana forged the evidence, and Mr. Edgeworth used it...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth!?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes. But I'm sure he didn't know anything about it! He couldn't have known he was being given false evidence. Even so... that's when it all started. The rumors about Mr. Edgeworth, I mean. It's all my fault... If I could have just testified properly, none of this would have happened!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So it's true. Even though he may not have known it... Edgeworth really was involved in falsifying evidence!)

Name: Ema
Text: After that case ended, Lana was never the same. She became cold, like she is today.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (She must not have been able to face up to what she did... Especially not to Ema.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: What did you see in the instant that crime occurred?

Name: Ema
Text: ... Darke knocked down Mr. Marshall and raised his knife.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Neil Marshall was stabbed right in front of this poor girl!)

Name: Ema
Text: I don't remember what happened after that. Apparently I passed out. When I came to, Lana was cradling me in her arms.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Poor Ema... You've been through so much.

Name: Ema
Text: I-I couldn't bring myself to testify about that instant. I tried, but the words just wouldn't come out. I drew a picture, but it wasn't any good.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Two years ago... You must have been 14. That's understandable.

Name: Ema
Text: Once it was all over... I made up my mind. I decided that when I grew up, I'd become a scientific investigator. I want to be able to fight crime with my testimonies! And find the evidence to make an airtight case... That way, Lana would never have to forge any.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see... (I think I'm finally starting to understand what makes Ema tick. But there's still something that bothers me about that crime.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: There's something that's puzzling me, Ema.

Name: Ema
Text: What is it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You said you were in Lana's office at that time, right?

Name: Ema
Text: That's right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why then would a serial killer come running in there?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Not only that, but he was being chased by a prosecutor?

Name: Ema
Text: Oh, there's no mystery there. Joe Darke had been taken in for questioning that day.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Taken in for questioning? You mean by the police?

Name: Ema
Text: Of course. This happened at the Police Department. He tried to run away halfway through the interview, and fled into my sister's office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But why did he run all the way over to your sister's office?

Name: Ema
Text: Because the detective offices and the questioning room are right across from the elevator.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Across from the elevator? But Lana was the Chief Prosecutor, wasn't she?

Name: Ema
Text: No, silly! Didn't I tell you? Two years ago... Lana was a detective. She was the best in the entire force!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whaaaaat!? (That's news to me!)

Name: Ema
Text: After the Joe Darke case, she was transferred to the Prosecutor's Office and made Chief Prosecutor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Lana used to be... a detective? I'd better have another talk with her!)

Name: Marshall
Text: Howdy, Bambina.

Name: Ema
Text: Oh, Mr. Marshall!

Name: Marshall
Text: I never thought things'd turn out this way when I woke up this morning. Que ser ser. You never know where life'll lead you, eh Bambina? I should've known my luck had run out when ol' Billy dried up this morning.

Name: Ema
Text: Billy...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Must be his pet cactus. Say, where are you headed?

Name: Marshall
Text: Just over to the Prosecutor's Office for a little interrogation. It's a "voluntary" appearance, but we all know I won't be coming back. Sorry, but you can't go in the evidence room today, pardner.

Name: Ema
Text: But Mr. Marshall... Why did you do it?

Name: Marshall
Text: Why do prospectors head west? If ever there was a case I needed to know the truth about, it was that one.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Before you turn yourself in, Mr. Marshall... would you mind telling us exactly what happened?

Name: Marshall
Text: Hmph... Looks like I won't be getting a steak lunch today.

Name: Marshall
Text: Something was fishy about that trial from the beginning. It wasn't just me either. All the detectives thought so.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean, "fishy"?

Name: Marshall
Text: Some of the facts reported were inconsistent with the evidence we found. For example... the murder weapon.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murder weapon? You mean... that switchblade knife with the broken tip?

Name: Marshall
Text: That was Joe Darke's, all right. But... in the initial autopsy report, a question was raised.

Name: Ema
Text: A question...?

Name: Marshall
Text: The blade of the knife was not a perfect match with the wound the victim sustained.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What does that mean?

Name: Marshall
Text: It means there is a good chance that knife was not the murder weapon.

Name: Marshall
Text: However, in the report that was finally submitted, that possibility had been erased.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Could the facts have been concealed with forged evidence...?)

Name: Marshall
Text: That case left behind scars on all of us.

Name: Ema
Text: The "scars" that the SL-9 Incident left behind...

Name: Marshall
Text: I got the looks, but he got the brains. He was one of the best prosecutors around. I had just made detective when it went down. It was our first case together...

Name: Ema
Text: How old was he... your brother?

Name: Marshall
Text: He was 27 at the time. He was awarded the highest honor that very day.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The... "highest honor"? You don't mean...

Name: Marshall
Text: King of Prosecutors.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Not that again...)

Name: Marshall
Text: What are you looking at me like that for? That's an honor for a prosecutor!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Mr. Marshall must have really been close with his brother.)

Name: Ema
Text: The day the SL-9 Incident took place, that wasn't the same day as...

Name: Marshall
Text: That's right. It was the day of the evidence transferal.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! Interesting...

Name: Marshall
Text: It was drizzling that morning, and by nightfall there was thunder. I can't believe two years have gone by already. I tried to steal the evidence so the case wouldn't die.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Apparently someone tried to stop you. Detective Goodman was murdered... and the evidence locker was empty.)

Name: Marshall
Text: There was something going on behind the scenes in that case. We all knew that later. Every detective involved in that investigation, save one, was... taken care of. Ms. Starr was fired and I was demoted and boxed away in a tiny room.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What about Detective Goodman?

Name: Marshall
Text: If they did something to him too, the commissioners would get suspicious. No, they were careful enough not to be too obvious.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "They"...?

Name: Ema
Text: Who are you talking about!?

Name: Marshall
Text: Don't get upset, Bambina. I mean Damon Gant... and Lana Skye.

Name: Marshall
Text: Chief Detective Damon Gant and his second-in-command, Lana Skye... There wasn't a person on the force who hadn't heard of that duo. That case was the biggest step in both of their careers.

Name: Phoenix
Text: After the case ended, Lana transferred to the Prosecutor's Office, right?

Name: Marshall
Text: Yeah. Damon Gant, the new Chief of Police, arranged for that to happen. She's never been the same since she left.

Name: Marshall
Text: Everyone who knew her said so. "Chief Prosecutor Skye was totally different when she was a detective."

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now that he mentions it, Ema said something like that too...)

Name: Ema
Text: Tell me... what happened to my sister!

Name: Marshall
Text: Sorry, Bambina, but her secret is too well guarded. I never found out.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Lana's "secret"... It all started two years ago.)

Name: Marshall
Text: So there you have it. That's my story. Did you enjoy it, pardner?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It was certainly... enlightening.

Name: Marshall
Text: There's one thing for sure I found out in court today. That boy Edgeworth isn't my enemy. He was the one who used falsified evidence to get a guilty verdict, but someone else was the one who gave him that evidence and planned everything. That someone is Damon Gant. Don't believe me? Well I don't blame you. I won't even be a patrolman after today. Too bad I won't be around to work with you... when you become a real scientific investigator. Adios Bambina!

Name: Ema
Text: L-Lana...

Name: Lana
Text: Mr. Wright. It seems I keep causing you trouble.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Falsifying evidence... I didn't think you were the type.

Name: Lana
Text: Criminals don't mind playing foul, why should we?

Name: Ema
Text: But Lana! If you're wrong... an innocent person might be found guilty!

Name: Lana
Text: Believe me... I understand the risks.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Lana. Ema told me about you.

Name: Lana
Text: Oh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: About how you were a detective two years ago, and how the SL-9 Incident was the reason for your transfer to the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Lana
Text: That's right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could you fill me in on the details? Especially about that unusual change of jobs.

Name: Lana
Text: ... I suppose you have a right to know, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A lot of revelations were uncovered at the trial today, not the least of which was the fact that this case is largely connected to another one, two years ago.

Name: Lana
Text: Evidence from that case was stolen... I expected as much. I know how obsessive Officer Marshall can be.

Name: Ema
Text: That trial... it really wasn't "fair," was it?

Name: Ema
Text: I believed in you, Lana! I believed that no matter what happened, you'd always stick to the truth!

Name: Lana
Text: It couldn't be helped, Ema. At that trial two years ago... I sold my soul.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, all drama aside, the fact of the matter is at 5:15, there was no murder at the Police Department.

Name: Ema
Text: Tell me it's not true, Lana! What the witness... Ms. Starr said! About you stabbing Mr. Goodman with a knife!

Name: Ema
Text: Lana! I don't understand! Why won't you tell us?

Name: Lana
Text: Ema... This doesn't involve just me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I don't think I've ever seen Lana look so fazed before...)

Name: Lana
Text: It's true. I was a member of the police force two years ago.

Name: Ema
Text: She was amazing! They still talk about all the cases she and Chief Gant cracked together!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chief Gant?

Name: Lana
Text: Then he was the Vice-Head of Criminal Affairs, but he still worked the crime scenes. Damon Gant... he was everything I aspired to be.

Name: Ema
Text: They were the best team ever! They solved crimes before the reports could even be filed!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ema really idolizes her big sister.) But now you're Chief Prosecutor... What happened?

Name: Lana
Text: I always planned on becoming a prosecutor. The reason I became a detective was...

Name: Ema
Text: to gain experience investigating crime scenes, so you could later use that experience in court.

Name: Lana
Text: Gant's help in the SL-9 case was critical in its resolution. After that, he became Chief of Police, and arranged my transfer to the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maybe I should ask more about this "investigation" of theirs two years ago.)

Name: Lana
Text: Two years ago I was second-in- command of the detectives investigating Darke.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Second-in-command"? That means the Chief Detective was, no doubt, Damon Gant?

Name: Lana
Text: Yes. Detective Gant and I shared the same office, and the same investigations.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (They even had the same office...!)

Name: Lana
Text: We led a team of the best detectives on the force: Detective Goodman, whose case it was, Jake Marshall and Angel Starr. It was the first time Marshall worked with his brother. He was quite... "gung ho." Without a doubt, Joe Darke was the serial killer. We asked him to come in for questioning. We were desperate for evidence. That was when the last murder took place.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (When he tried to murder Ema...)

Name: Ema
Text: Prosecutor Marshall was trying to save me from Darke...

Name: Lana
Text: You see, the first person who happened upon the scene of the crime... was me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! (Now you tell us...)

Name: Lana
Text: Detective Gant and Prosecutor Marshall were the ones questioning Darke that day. The investigation was in its final stages, when Darke must have panicked. He waited until Gant and Marshall let their guards down, then fled the room. From there, he ran straight to... the office shared by Detective Gant and myself.

Name: Ema
Text: That's where he found me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you were the first person to run to the scene, Lana?

Name: Lana
Text: It appears so. I was filing some papers while Gant and Marshall were questioning Darke. When I returned to my office, I saw three bodies on the floor and smelled blood.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Three bodies? Prosecutor Marshall, the victim, Ema, who had passed out,

Name: Lana
Text: and the suspect, Joe Darke. During the struggle, it seems Mr. Marshall stuck a final blow before he died. Joe Darke had incurred a minor concussion, and lay unconscious.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What did you do?

Name: Lana
Text: To be honest, I panicked. I picked up Ema, carried her out of the room and just held her.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Can't blame her, after all her sister must have gone through.)

Name: Lana
Text: After that, I placed Darke under immediate arrest.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let me get this straight. You were all involved in the SL-9 Incident?

Name: Lana
Text: That's right. Quite a coincidence, hmm?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't buy it.

Name: Ema
Text: W-what are you saying?

Name: Phoenix
Text: There's no way everyone involved in this trial was also involved in that incident just by "chance."

Name: Ema
Text: But that case was solved two years ago!

Name: Phoenix
Text: At least one person went to extremes because they didn't believe it was truly solved.

Name: Lana
Text: Officer Marshall... Yes, his actions came as a surprise to me as well. Ever since his brother died, he's changed completely.

Name: Ema
Text: I guess he wasn't convinced with the ruling against Joe Darke.

Name: Lana
Text: ... Life doesn't end with the closing of a case. Everyone has to live the rest of their lives with their memories.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That "case" just might not be over yet.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ema was assaulted by Darke at the Police Department, right?

Name: Lana
Text: Yes, in the office that Damon Gant and I shared. The office that Mr. Gant now occupies by himself: the Chief's office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maybe we should have a look at the Chief's office - the site of the final SL-9 murder!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: This place is always pretty empty, but today it's deserted.

Name: Ema
Text: That must mean everyone's busy solving crimes.

Name: Chief
Text: Oh, if you're looking for the others, they're all in the conference room.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... thanks. (Wow, he actually talked to us!)

Name: Chief
Text: With the Chief Prosecutor saying what she did and the decision about what to do about Mr. Edgeworth, not to mention our statement to the media and tomorrow's trial... there's more chaos going on than Thanksgiving and Christmas put together!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I think "festive" is the word usually used for those...)

Name: Ema
Text: Um, sir? We'd like to have a look around for Chief Gant's office.

Name: Chief
Text: Just head across the hall to the other building and take the elevator to the top floor.

Name: Ema
Text: Really? You mean, it's okay for us to go in there? I mean, we aren't police officers or anything.

Name: Chief
Text: Hey, you're right! You can't go in there! It's off limits!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now I see where Detective Gumshoe gets his unique charm...)

Name: Ema
Text: Well, what are wating for? Let's head to the Chief's office!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whoa... Where am I?

Name: Ema
Text: In the Chief's office, silly! At least, that's what it said on the door.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Check out that pipe organ. That's real, isn't it?

Name: Ema
Text: Hey, I used to take organ lessons in kindergarten! They used to call me "Little Miss Bach." I thought I was a genius until they tried teaching me notes. I never could remember where C was...

Name: Gant
Text: Hm? Oh, it's you two.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chief Gant! (He put that paper he was reading in his desk.)

Name: Gant
Text: So, Mr. Wright. Have you been swimming lately?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... no, I haven't. I've been kind of busy lately.

Name: Gant
Text: I can appreciate that. I've had my hands full too, with Mr. Marshall's misconduct and Lana's provocative statement.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Provocative statement"... oh, you mean about the forged evidence.

Name: Gant
Text: Two years have passed since that incident. My, how time flies! See that big picture on the wall over there? That's a picture of Lana, Neil and me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So this is Mr. Marshall's brother... Prosecutor Neil Marshall...)

Name: Gant
Text: We took it to commemorate our work together.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (Something's not right with this picture. I can't quite seem to put my finger on it though...)

Name: Gant
Text: Anyway, I'd like to reminisce all day, but there are matters that need my attention. I'm going to lock up here, so let's go out together.

Name: Ema
Text: Oh... But this office... it was a crime scene two years ago, wasn't it?

Name: Gant
Text: That case has long since been over. There's no need to investigate it any more.

Name: Phoenix
Text: All the same, we'd still like to have a look around.

Name: Gant
Text: Perhaps you didn't hear me. I said there's no need to investigate it any more.

Name: Gant
Text: Now hurry up and get out. I have a meeting to attend.

Name: Ema
Text: Looks like we aren't welcome.

Name: Phoenix
Text: It seems that case isn't over with yet, after all.

Name: Ema
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chief Gant denied our request to search the "crime scene." That means there must be a reason he doesn't want us looking around in there.

Name: Ema
Text: You mean like, a clue!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (There's got to be a way we can get inside the Chief's office...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe! Were you in a meeting?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I was uh... just taking a breather. My feet hurt.

Name: Ema
Text: From sitting so long in the meeting?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Actually... I had to serve everyone coffee.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Sounds like Detective Gumshoe's still out of the loop...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Say, have either of you seen Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth? No. Why do you ask?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: He's under fire from both the Police Department and the Prosecutor's Office. It's almost like the battles between you two in court!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That sounds serious...

Name: Ema
Text: Is it because of what my sister said?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's basically what it all boils down to. That falsified evidence two years ago. Now Mr. Edgeworth has the whole world after his blood!

Name: Ema
Text: Yikes...

Name: Phoenix
Text: But why would Edgeworth be blamed? It's not like he knew the evidence was forged! Lana Skye is the guilty party here, isn't she?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Regardless, the prosecutor is responsible for the evidence he presents in court. Not only that, but as you know there've been a lot of rumors going around about Mr. Edgeworth. Those who don't like him haven't been able to do anything because of his amazing talent as a prosecutor. But now with this...

Name: Ema
Text: Are there really so many people who hate him?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: In our world, only those with talent rise to the top. Mr. Edgeworth not only had that, but he's young. There's no better recipe I know of for making enemies.

Name: Police
Text: Hey, Dick! Keep up the good work!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yes sir!

Name: Police
Text: Let's go out for lunch again sometime, my treat!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yes sir!

Name: Police
Text: You gotta take me back to that joint sometime, okay Dick?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yes sir!

Name: Phoenix
