Text: It seems you don't have any problem with enemies.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yeah, well... I'm careful not to stick out. Anyway, I'm a bit worried about him. Under all this pressure, I'm afraid Mr. Edgeworth just might crack.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Actually, I took a look at the file earlier, while the coffee was brewing.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He seems geniunely concerned for Edgeworth...) Well? Did you find out anything?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The only evidence Darke left behind was during his final attack.

Name: Phoenix
Text: His final attack? You mean...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: When he killed Prosecutor Marshall, who was trying to protect some girl.

Name: Ema
Text: Me...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It seems Detective Gumshoe never realized Ema was the girl...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's when he left the most incriminating evidence of all.

Name: Ema
Text: Well? What was it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, um, let's see... I think it had something to do with the murder weapon... ... Oh, I forget. Look, it's all written somewhere in here, okay?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (His powers of recollection never fail to impress.)

Name: Ema
Text: Maybe we should show him the murder weapon. It might jog his memory!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Joe Darke was 42 at the time of the crime. He was just your run-of-the-mill businessman.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A businessman? What made him take to serial killing?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: One day on his way home from work, he hit someone with his car.

Name: Ema
Text: With his car? So... it was an accident?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: An accident, yes. But it transformed him into an animal!

Name: Ema
Text: An animal...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: He killed a man that witnessed the accident. Then he killed a lady who saw the second crime. A kid walked by just then, so he killed him too. Then, when he was burying the bodies, a jogger came upon the scene and was killed as well! Finally he turned himself in.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Seems he was a pretty careless animal.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Of course, this is all conjecture. There wasn't a single shred of evidence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, he turned himself in...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yes, but in the middle of his questioning, he fled and murdered his final victim... Prosecutor Marshall. That crime was witnessed by someone too, but fortunately he was arrested on the spot. It's a good thing that last witness wasn't killed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That last "witness"... He must mean Ema...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, about this...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey! Don't tell me that's...

Name: Phoenix
Text: It has a tag attached to it, with the label "SL-9 Incident" on it. I believe this would be the broken "murder weapon" you were speaking of?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What are you doing with that!? Ever since that case was closed, that knife's been locked away in a locker.

Name: Ema
Text: On the day Detective Goodman was murdered, this suddenly disappeared from the locker, and was found in Mr. Edgeworth's car muffler.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... That's it! Now I remember what that incriminating piece of evidence was! When you showed me that knife, it all came back to me!

Name: Ema
Text: Well, what is it, Detective? Quick! Before you forget again!

Name: Phoenix
Text: This knife... it was Joe Darke's, wasn't it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's right. We traced it back to the store he bought it at, and it had his fingerprints on it too.

Name: Ema
Text: But no one actually witnessed him using it to murder anyone, right?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's where his luck ran out. When you take a good look at the knife... you'll see it's broken!

Name: Ema
Text: You don't have to take a good look to notice that.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... Yeah, well anyway! Take a guess where the broken- off tip of the knife was found. That's what did him in!

Name: Ema
Text: Where was it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The victim, Neil Marshall was carrying it... inside his own body!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: It was found deep inside the stab wound.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did it match Darke's knife?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You bet. Down to the last fiber.

Name: Ema
Text: That's pretty... conclusive.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, there you have it in a nutshell. That's all I know.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Can I ask you one more thing?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What is it? If it's money you need, you should ask Chief Gant.

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's not money, but it does concern the Chief. His office is a "crime scene," right? It's where Prosecutor Neil Marshall was murdered...

Name: Ema
Text: The Chief's out now, and his office is locked, but we'd like to have a look around if that's okay.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... Well, any Detective's ID card can unlock the door.

Name: Ema
Text: What? Really!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: But if I let a civilian in there, I'd be charged with breach of trust.

Name: Ema
Text: Breach of trust...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Simply put, I'd be canned.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Sorry, pal. I don't plan on getting fired because of you.

Name: Ema
Text: How about this ID card? It was Detective Goodman's...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That won't work either. The data was deleted the day he died.

Name: Ema
Text: Oh.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So in other words, Gumshoe is our only chance of getting into that office.)

Name: Ema
Text: I wonder if there's something we could show him that would make him change his mind...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I wonder if Edgeworth is back yet.)

Name: Ema
Text: There he is! It looks like he's writing something.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Huh? What are you doing here?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He sure was quick to throw that paper on the floor...) Tough day in court, huh?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. I've had to live the past two years with rumors flying around. What's another allegation to me?

Name: Ema
Text: Cheer up, Mr. Edgeworth! I'm rooting for you!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's Edgeworth for you... Always trying to hide his real feelings.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So, what do you want? Unlike some people, I don't have all day.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There's no excuse for what I've done. Two years ago, I used false evidence to obtain a guilty verdict. That's what it all breaks down to, and nothing I do can erase that fact.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But you didn't know, did you? I mean, that the evidence was falsified.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The Police Department and the Prosecutor's Office share a bond of trust. If that bond is broken, we stand to lose everything. The Police Department's error is my error, my responsibility as the prosecutor in charge. That fact remains the same no matter what excuses I might have.

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Edgeworth...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I take pride in my work. So tell me why! Why has it all come to this...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Even Edgeworth can't keep this kind of emotion bottled up...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you up for the trial tomorrow?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. First last year's trial, and now this one. It seems all you do is worry about me. To be honest, you're getting on my nerves.

Name: Ema
Text: But Mr. Edgeworth! You can't just walk out on the trial...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Tomorrow is the last day. It's too late to change prosecutors. I'll bet that's what my superiors are banking on. I never thought that case would come back to haunt me like this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That list of evidence. It seems too short. Most lists... run twice as long.

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's only half as long as most lists? (That is odd...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: After Neil Marshall was murdered, I became prosecutor for that case. I may not have been part of the investigation, but at the time there was only one thing on my mind: I'd use the evidence I was given to prove the suspect guilty!

Name: Ema
Text: Say, we just saw a picture taken around that time.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That picture... Something seemed strange about it...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could you tell us again about what happened that day? The day Detective Goodman was murdered? You were participating in a ceremony over at the station, right?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I've never cared for ceremonies, but I had to attend that one.

Name: Ema
Text: Because you were awarded this?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Those receiving awards can't exactly skip out on the ceremony. I finished up at the office in the morning, then drove over to the Police Department.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You, "finished up" at the office?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes. Just odds and ends- clerical stuff. I didn't plan on returning to the office that day. That is, until I was asked to take something back.

Name: Ema
Text: Take something back?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This.

Name: Ema
Text: Oh yeah. Chief Gant asked you to hold onto that, didn't he?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes. It was a piece of evidence in a case that was closed half a year ago. He asked me to bring it back to the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's the story we heard yesterday...) So you came back here to the Prosecutor's Office because the Chief asked you to?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That's right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: This picture was hanging on the wall in Chief Gant's office.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Prosecutor Neil Marshall... He had just started making a name for himself. Looks like this was taken when he received the King of Prosecutors trophy.

Name: Ema
Text: Speaking of that, there's something that bothers me.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes?

Name: Ema
Text: The trophy Mr. Marshall is holding... it's a little different than yours.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, you're right. ... I remember now.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Remember what?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That was the official prosecutor trophy used until that time. There's a story behind it.

Name: Ema
Text: A story?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Sounds interesting.) Would you mind telling it to us?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's simple, really. "Contradiction." That's what the award's based on.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This award originates from an ancient Chinese tale. In Chinese, the word "contradiction" is written with two characters: the first means "halberd," and the second means "shield." Have you heard this story?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Me? Oh, uh... sure. Everyone knows that! Why don't you tell it though... for Ema's sake.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Very well. Long ago in the kingdom of Chu, there was an arms merchant. One day, he presented the king with two items. The first was a halberd he claimed could slice through any shield or armor. The second was a shield he claimed could withstand any weapon.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hmm... Wait a minute.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Those claims contradict each other!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Very perceptive. But then again, you've heard this story before, right? Anyway, as you mentioned, the very descriptions of these items discredit them both. When the king pointed this out, the merchant was left speechless. And thus, the Chinese word for "contradiction" was born.

Name: Ema
Text: Oh, I see! So the "chipped shield" and the "broken knife" symbolize...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Precisely so. They symbolize the merchant's items. The ancient tale ends with the merchant at a loss for words, but it's in our nature to pursue matters to their conclusion... even if it results in something as ugly as this.

Name: Ema
Text: Wow. Thanks, Mr. Edgeworth! I learned something new today!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's funny... If that's so, then why were you only given a shield?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... You'll have to ask Chief Gant. Two years ago, he had the "halberd" part of the award abolished.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Chief Gant...)

Name: Angel
Text: Excuse me...

Name: Angel
Text: Would either of you care for a quarter pound of roast beef?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Starr! (I guess she's out of lunches.)

Name: Angel
Text: You certainly are the curious sort, aren't you? Kind of like the first person who sucked a cow's nipple to discover milk. Still, I never thought you'd go digging up that case from two years ago.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Everyone in this trial was involved in the SL-9 Incident. Not only that, but the murder occurred on the very day the evidence from that case was due for transferal. This can't all be attributed to mere "coincidence."

Name: Angel
Text: ... Aren't you forgetting something? You know, that little scene I happened to witness?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The instant Lana stabbed Detective Goodman with a knife.)

Name: Angel
Text: No matter how much of the past you dig up, it won't change what I saw. Roast beef is meant to be savored when eaten.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ms. Starr's hatred toward Lana... It all dates back to two years ago!)

Name: Angel
Text: Joe Darke... That's a name I'll not soon forget! We trailed him for half a year. Oh, the pressure! Still, I don't think I was ever more alive than I was then. Those days were steamier than a bowl of hot gravy! Poor old Jake Marshall, though, must have been going through hell.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You mean, because of his brother's death?

Name: Angel
Text: They were close, those two. After Neil died, something took over Jake. He became obsessed. Seeing Jake like that made her all the more desperate.

Name: Angel
Text: Lana Skye.

Name: Ema
Text: My sister...?

Name: Angel
Text: The best of the best were put on that SL-9 case. Of course they were lead by that legendary duo.

Name: Ema
Text: Lana... and Chief Gant!

Name: Angel
Text: That legendary pair was the reason we were able to keep up our investigation. That's why we're so shocked over how it turned out...

Name: Phoenix
Text: You mean, with the forging of the evidence?

Name: Angel
Text: Don't get me wrong. Joe Darke got what he deserved. Still, it was obvious the evidence produced in court was being manipulated. Items our team never found would suddenly appear, while other items were kept secret.

Name: Ema
Text: But you didn't have proof anything illegal was done...

Name: Angel
Text: I'm proof enough of what happened.

Name: Angel
Text: After that case, all of us save Goodman were relieved of our duties... most without even so much as an explanation. Then Lana Skye transferred to the Prosecutor's Office and became Chief Prosecutor.

Name: Ema
Text: Lana always wanted to be a prosecutor.

Name: Angel
Text: Nothing's quite as simple as it appears.

Name: Ema
Text: Huh?

Name: Angel
Text: Lana Skye was merely being used as a pawn. That's my take on the matter.

Name: Phoenix
Text: She was being used?

Name: Angel
Text: Damon Gant and Lana Skye... Two years ago Gant was Chief Detective, and Lana second in command. They were the best.

Name: Ema
Text: They solved all kinds of cases together, didn't they?

Name: Angel
Text: Damon Gant's magnetism in particular was almost unreal.

Name: Phoenix
Text: His "magnetism"?

Name: Angel
Text: By that I mean his ability to attract evidence. He'd produce the most incredible evidence in the cases he handled.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ("Incredible evidence"? You mean...)

Name: Angel
Text: Oh, yes. There were rumors about him even back then. No one dared confront him, though.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I take it she's talking about forged evidence.)

Name: Angel
Text: Back then, everyone looked up to Lana. All the detectives wanted to be like her.

Name: Ema
Text: ! Really?

Name: Angel
Text: Oh yes... myself included. I was a fool, really. She hated anything crooked, and always watched out for the other detectives. That's why she was so concerned for Jake.

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Marshall...

Name: Angel
Text: When Jake's brother was murdered, she felt as if she had lost her own brother. If it wasn't for her, I don't think Jake would ever have recovered from his shock. That's what makes it all the more infuriating.

Name: Ema
Text: Ms. Starr...

Name: Angel
Text: That's why... I'll never be able to forgive her. Why did she have to turn so cold after that...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Lana transferred to the Prosecutor's Office two years ago, didn't she?

Name: Angel
Text: Yes, thanks to "Chief" Gant's powerful influence.

Name: Ema
Text: Chief...

Name: Angel
Text: That's right. Having solved the SL-9 case, his position as chief was secured. There was only one thing left for him to control, and then no one could stand in his way: the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What? You mean... That's why Lana was transferred!?

Name: Angel
Text: If he could control the Chief Prosecutor, he could control the Prosecutor's Office. That must have been his goal all along.

Name: Ema
Text: B-but how could he control Lana?

Name: Angel
Text: I don't know, but one thing's for sure. Ever since that case ended, she's never been the same. It's only logical to conclude... there must have been a reason for her change.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (At last... I'm finally getting close to the bottom of this ugly mess.) Thank you, Ms. Starr.

Name: Angel
Text: You listen to me, Rookie. It takes more than just ingredients to create fine cuisine. I hope you turn out to be a better chef than I've been...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, you're back.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You're still here?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I gotta make 150 copies of these files. Brewing coffee, copying files... I'm turning into a regular DJ!

Name: Ema
Text: You're a "DJ" as well?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If I'm not mistaken, I think he means "Desk Jockey."

Name: Ema
Text: ... Oh, that DJ...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I gotta admire your persistency, but my answer's still no.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I'm not letting you in the Chief's office, period. It'd be my neck on the line.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That office is the last crime scene in the SL-9 Incident. I have to take a look in there!)

Name: Ema
Text: There's got to be something we can do to make the Detective change his mind.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What's this crumpled up piece of paper? ...... N--no way! Mr. Edgeworth can't be serious!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Is he ever not serious?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I can't believe they've pushed him this far...

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Edgeworth really feels responsible.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: At first I thought he was as cold as ice, but now I know different! He trusted us detectives to provide him with sound evidence, but we just... we betrayed him!

Name: Ema
Text: Detective...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ......... That's it. I've made up my mind!

Name: Ema
Text: But...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Here, take my ID card.

Name: Phoenix
Text: We can't do that. If someone found out...

Name: Ema
Text: they wouldn't let you off the hook with another lost item report!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Look at me. It's no secret I'm already out of the loop. After all, I'm friends with Mr. Edgeworth. Depending on how this case turns out, I may already be as good as terminated...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What...?)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: So at least let me do this... for Mr. Edgeworth's sake!

Name: Phoenix
Text: All right, Detective. Thank you.

Name: Ema
Text: Here goes, Mr. Wright.
*click* *beep*

Name: Ema
Text: Open sesame. If anyone finds us now,

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe's a goner.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: If that happens, I'm counting on you to bail me out!

Name: Ema
Text: EEEEEEEEK!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: GAAAAAAAAH!

Name: Ema
Text: Sorry, I thought you were a ghost.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I didn't even know you could slap a ghost.

Name: Phoenix
Text: AAAAH! Detective Gumshoe! What are you doing sneaking up on us like that!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I-I-I wasn't "sneaking." I was just worried something might go wrong... so I came too.

Name: Phoenix
Text: If you're here, then what's the point in giving us your ID card!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey, don't do that to my card!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I hardly ever get a chance to come in here, so I figured I'd have a look around myself! Besides, we're all in this together now.

Name: Ema
Text: You really do want to get fired, don't you?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Not if we're lucky. Now come on, let's see what we can find out!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I've got a bad feeling about this...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: That desk on the other side of the room... Was that your sister's?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes. That's where I was waiting for Lana... on that day two years ago.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Is anyone using it now?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: No sir. This is entirely Chief Gant's office now.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: He practices a strict policy of "preserving the crime scene."

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's a strange reason to leave it there...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: He leaves it as a warning to everyone else. He wants us to always be alert. He told us so himself at our New Year's party. Of course, he was pretty intoxicated at the time.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see.

Name: Ema
Text: So ever since Lana left, no one ever touches that desk?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: No one except Chief Gant... and the cleaning lady who's in here each morning.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Still, two years have passed since that incident. There can't possibly be any clues remaining.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Can I ask you something?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sure.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You only came here to look around, right? Because it's one of the SL-9 crime scenes. I mean, that's your only reason for coming here, isn't it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Why do you ask?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You don't think... Nah! You wouldn't be... No. ... No, there's no way. Never mind. Don't worry about it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Okay. Now then, let's look around a bit more.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey, hold on! Not so fast, buddy!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? What is it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: When someone tells you "don't worry about it," it's supposed to start bothering you, pal! You don't just let it go at that!

Name: Phoenix
Text: S-sorry. (This guy's starting to get on my nerves.) Okay, so what's bothering you?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You two don't think... Chief Gant... might be a suspect, do you?

Name: Ema
Text: What!? Yeah, Mr. Wright! What do we think of him?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Chief Gant... So it's finally come to this. What do I think of him? Perhaps it's best I don't divulge my feelings... yet.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: There he goes, ignoring me again.

Name: Ema
Text: Wow! Look at the size of Chief Gant's desk!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Speaking of that, when we were here earlier...)

Name: Gant
Text: Oh, it's you two.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chief Gant! (He put that paper he was reading in his desk.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: I wonder what he was reading?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: This looks like a list of evidence... used in a case.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A list of evidence?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: In most cases the list runs twice as long as this.

Name: Ema
Text: Hey, look at the case name!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Huh? "SL-9 Incident"! I wonder what this is doing here...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hold on, Detective! What did you just say?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I said, "I wonder what..."

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, about evidence lists. Normally they're twice as long?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's right. I guess there wasn't a lot of evidence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A half-sized list of evidence...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That list of evidence. It seems too short. Most lists... run twice as long.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What would the other half of the list be doing here?)

Name: Ema
Text: I knew it! The Chief must be hiding something about that case!

Name: Phoenix
Text: It would appear so.

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is a safe, isn't it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: "Safe"... that word is ripe with intrigue!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh, okay. If you say so...

Name: Ema
Text: It looks like a code needs to be entered in this panel to open it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A seven-digit number. I think I just might know what it is...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Do you know what it is?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I have a hunch...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, I know! You want to try my birth date? It's...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I have a better idea. Here goes nothing.)
Code confirmed. Access granted.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Bingo.

Name: Ema
Text: What number did you enter!?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Whose birthday was that, pal?

Name: Phoenix
Text: "7777777." The final ID card number on that record.

Name: Ema
Text: What?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The number of the mysterious "executive officer" who entered the room that day.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You mean, "Sevensevensevensevensevenseven"? That ID number!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think you're one "seven" shy this time. This can only mean one thing: That's Chief Gant's ID number!

Name: Ema
Text: Say... Anyone care to look inside?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Is there any money in there? How much does he have stashed away!?

Name: Ema
Text: Look! It's a... a...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: a shard from a broken cup.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This somehow looks familiar. Where have I seen this before...?)

Name: Ema
Text: There's something else in here too.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's this? It looks like a piece of leather cloth...

Name: Ema
Text: This is a handprint, isn't it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey! I saw someone wearing a shirt like that once! You think the Chief made up the design?

Name: Ema
Text: Uh... I don't think so.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh. Well, it was just a thought.

Name: Ema
Text: Is that it? This is all that was in the safe?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Apparently so. It's empty now.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: A piece of cloth with a handprint on it, and a broken shard from a cup.

Name: Phoenix
Text: They look like pieces of evidence,

Name: Gumshoe
Text: but unless you can prove they have something to do with this case, I'm afraid I can't just let you take them. After all, it's my neck on the line here!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Great. Now I have to prove their "relevancy" to get them. How are these two items related to the SL-9 Incident?)

Name: Ema
Text: Come on! There's got to be something we can show the detective!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe. I'd like you to have a look at this.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey, I know what that is! So, you want to take some fingerprints?

Name: Ema
Text: That's a great idea, Detective!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: All right, go to town. Sheesh! ...

Name: Phoenix
Text: What are you doing? Why are you sticking out your hand like that?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Go ahead. Take my fingerprints.

Name: Ema
Text: ... Um, it's not your fingerprints we want to take.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Huh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Come on, this isn't the time for jokes. We're talking about that cloth we found in the safe!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh! Heh heh! I knew that. The one with the hand print on it, right? Sheesh, where's your sense of humor?

Name: Ema
Text: Okay, Mr. Wright. Let's check for prints! Sprinkle the powder on the cloth, then, once they've been absorbed into the prints, blow the rest away!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What are you, my mom? I don't have to be told a million times.) All right, let's get this over with!
Comparing... Comparison complete. Match found.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No... How can this be!? What are Ema's fingerprints doing here!?)

Name: Ema
Text: Hey, you found a match? Whose fingerprints were they!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Oh, uh... it seems the prints are too old. They aren't clear enough to get a match.

Name: Ema
Text: Oh... That's too bad. I thought they'd be Darke's prints.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Psst! Hey you. Over here. What's going on here? What are that kid's prints doing inside the Chief's safe?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Don't ask me! Let's just keep this information from Ema for now.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... Here. Maybe you should hold onto this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe. Could you have another look at this jar?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: All of us put that back together. Oh, those were the days...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's kind of early to be nostalgic.)

Name: Ema
Text: Wasn't this jar a piece of evidence from that case?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's right. One of the shards had an "SL-9 Incident" sticker on it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Doesn't this ring any bells? You know, that fragment we just found?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You mean this one, that was in the safe?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes, that one... that was in the safe.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... ! Now that you mention it, it's ringing a lot of bells! Let's see if it fits!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Here, let me see that shard. I'll take a crack at this.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Go ahead, pal. Show us what a rookie can do!

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! Here's some glue!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If I can piece this together again... it'll prove Chief Gant was knowingly hiding evidence! Here goes...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: There! It fits like a charm. That of course means... Chief Gant willingly and knowingly hid a piece of this jar in his safe.

Name: Phoenix
Text: In other words, he concealed a piece of evidence from the SL-9 Incident.

Name: Ema
Text: But...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey guys! Get a load of this!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What is it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: This piece you just attached... it's different from the others!

Name: Ema
Text: There's a reddish line on it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A reddish line... That's blood!)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I don't get it! Why would Chief Gant hide this in his safe?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well? Was I any help?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course! Thanks to your ID card, we were able to get some hard evidence.

Name: Gant
Text: Now that's not very kind, is it? In other words, if it wasn't for his ID card, he would have been useless...

Name: Gant
Text: Isn't that right, you in the coat?

Name: Ema
Text: EEEEEEEK!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: C-Chief Gant!

Name: Phoenix
Text: We didn't think you'd be back so soon.

Name: Gant
Text: Fortunately I'm a man who believes in signs. As I was walking to my meeting, I happened to look out a window and saw a stray dog run right into a pole. Just then I thought of a certain detective.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Do you mean... m-me, sir?

Name: Gant
Text: Now then, I'm afraid I'm going to have to ask you all to leave.

Name: Ema
Text: Y-yes sir! Sorry...

Name: Gant
Text: Oh, you in the coat.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Me, sir!?

Name: Gant
Text: Drop off your ID on the way out. You won't be needing it anymore.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: But sir...

Name: Gant
Text: Now get out!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Y-y-yes sir!

Name: Phoenix
Text: We'll be on our way too, then.

Name: Gant
Text: Wait. You, the one without the spiky hair. Don't go yet.

Name: Ema
Text: M-me, sir!?

Name: Gant
Text: I'd like a word with you.

Name: Ema
Text: But sir! I'm not a licensed scientific investigator yet!

Name: Gant
Text: You with the spiky hair. You're free to go.

Name: Ema
Text: M-Mr. Wright!!!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Look, pal! If I've told you once I've told you a thousand times...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The Chief's office is off limits! But no, you just had to go sneaking in there like that, didn't you!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I thought you said you didn't care anymore if you were fired.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yeah, but if I knew it'd be like this, I never would've said it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now that I've seen the evidence Chief Gant was hiding in his office... I think I'm finally starting to get the picture... It's hard to believe anyone could keep quiet about it all this time...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Anyway, you listenin' to me!? I'm gonna try to smooth things over with the Chief again! Later, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: After that, I heard from Ema. She said the police want to ask her some questions, so she'll be busy for the rest of the day...

Name: Lana
Text: I see. So the Chief asked Ema to come in for questioning...

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's no use thinking about it. Tomorrow's the final day in court. I'm committed to doing everything I can to defend you, which is why I'm here.

Name: Lana
Text: But I've already told you all I can...

Name: Phoenix
Text: What you've told me over these past couple of days... is absolutely nothing. Not a single, useful thing.

Name: Lana
Text: Really? I believe I did mention something quite important. Something I told you right at the beginning. I said that I was the one who stabbed Detective Goodman.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You know, I think I've finally figured it out... Who it is you're hiding behind those words.

Name: Lana
Text: ... Mia did a good job mentoring you. I'm rather jealous...

Name: Lana
Text: It seems Edgeworth was right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth...?

Name: Lana
Text: Once you're convinced you know something, no one can persuade you otherwise. "Thick headed" is the term he used, I believe.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now's my chance to get her to tell me the rest of the story!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: I have to admit I was more than a little perplexed at first. You insisted you "did it," yet there was no incriminating evidence. That's when it hit me. It's not that you're unwilling to tell the truth, it's that you're incapable of doing so, because of a certain individual.

Name: Lana
Text: What an intriguing notion. A certain, "individual," you say? So you think I'm... protecting this person?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Protecting? No. I think "afraid of" is more like it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: If I'm not mistaken, the person in question may have persuaded you to silence.

Name: Lana
Text: ... For argument's sake, Mr. Wright, whom may I ask is this person you're speaking of? The one I am supposedly so "frightened" of? What is this person's name?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, Ms. Skye?

Name: Lana
Text: ... Mr. Wright. You are addressing the Chief Prosecutor. Do not forget your place.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I take it she's still not ready to spill the beans.)

Name: Lana
Text: My apologies. Could you please tell me a bit more about the circumstances?

Name: Lana
Text: We were partners until two years ago. I respected him as a detective.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Assuming he is respectable, then tell me something... Why would he try to hide his crimes?

Name: Lana
Text: His "crimes"...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Both you and Edgeworth will be brought before a board of inquiry for what you did. Specifically, hiding and forging evidence.

Name: Lana
Text: Of course, these are serious offenses...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why is it, though, that Chief Gant's name was never mentioned?

Name: Lana
Text: Chief Gant...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth didn't know the truth behind the forgery. The only party who could have possibly investigated that evidence was...

Name: Lana
Text: Me. I had access because I was second in command of that investigation.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes you, but also one other: Damon Gant.

Name: Lana
Text: ... If you intend to accuse Chief Gant, you'll need more than just words. Show me proof that Chief Gant falsified evidence in that case!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: I just found this in a safe in the Chief's office. This jar piece, and this strip of cloth. Do you know what these are? They're pieces of evidence from the SL-9 Incident!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The person concealing evidence was none other than Chief Gant himself. Now tell me! Why are you taking all the blame for him!?

Name: Lana
Text: ... Touch, Mr. Wright. It's as you surmised. I cannot disobey the Chief's orders... even if it means being found guilty for murder.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why not?

Name: Lana
Text: Come now, Mr. Wright. You can't possibly expect me to be able to tell you that. Three days ago... I had no choice but to cooperate.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (In the murder of Detective Goodman!)

Name: Lana
Text: Or perhaps I should say, "follow orders." Yes, that's more accurate than "cooperate."

Name: Lana
Text: Although I can't tell you the details, I can say that I was given an order that day.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Just as I suspected. Despite what everyone believes... you were not the one who murdered Detective Goodman!

Name: Lana
Text: Correct. I was trying to take the body out of Edgeworth's car. The trunk was broken. I discovered that murder weapon while inspecting the body.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murder weapon... You mean, Edgeworth's knife?

Name: Lana
Text: No. When I found the body, this was the knife stuck in it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The knife from the SL-9 Incident... serial killer Joe Darke's knife!)

Name: Lana
Text: I couldn't just leave that knife in him, so I took it out and stabbed him with another knife.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That would be Edgeworth's knife?

Name: Lana
Text: That's right. Even though he was already dead, my hands were shaking at the thought of stabbing him. That's why I ended up cutting my hand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And that is the reason for the bandage on your right hand?

Name: Lana
Text: Yes. It seems that I got blood on the victim's shoes as well. And then... she saw me just as I plunged the knife in.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ms. Starr...) Why did you need to hide Darke's knife so badly?

Name: Lana
Text: It took a lot of work to finally close the Darke case two years ago. It was over with. I didn't ever want it to be opened again. My intent was to prevent that by whatever means possible.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... you hid Darke's knife?

Name: Lana
Text: The weapon used to stab the detective was evidence in the Joe Darke case... If word got out, which it would, the reporters would have a field day with that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you wrapped the knife in your scarf, and hid it. In Edgeworth's exhaust pipe...

Name: Lana
Text: Right. Then I called my sister, to tell her what happened, and to ask her to hide the knife that was inside my muffler.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You asked Ema?

Name: Lana
Text: I didn't want anyone on the force to know about this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That would explain why Ema is so confident... about Lana's innocence!)

Name: Lana
Text: Speaking of phone calls, I had a bad feeling about one of them that day.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A bad feeling?

Name: Lana
Text: The truth is, after I received those orders from Chief Gant. The first thing I did was make a phone call. A phone call to Patrolman Jake Marshall.

Name: Phoenix
Text: To Marshall? Why on earth would you call him?

Name: Lana
Text: The lead investigator for the SL-9 Incident had been murdered. I wanted that fact to be kept hidden, and I needed help. He was the only other person I could trust. Or at least, I thought I could trust him at the time. However, it seems that after I spoke to him he went off on an escapade of his own...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh! You mean...

Name: Lana
Text: Not wanting the case to die, he decided to take things into his own hands.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He disguised himself as Officer Goodman and tried to steal the evidence!)

Name: Lana
Text: He had already stolen the ID card... but it seems he still hadn't made up his mind to break into the evidence room. After my phone call, any remaining doubts he had must have disappeared.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So your phone call caused the incident in the evidence room!?

Name: Lana
Text: I'm afraid that's all I can tell you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But Lana...

Name: Lana
Text: You've earned my respect, Mr. Wright. Both as a defense attorney and an investigator. Now please... Don't pursue this any further in court tomorrow!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Tomorrow's trial... There's only one way to drive off Lana's demons...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I've got to get to the bottom of everything! Detective Goodman's real murderer... and what went down in the Chief's office two years ago...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is the Defendant Lobby all right... but there's no defendant. I've been trying to reach Lana all morning. Where could she be? And where's Ema, for that matter? It almost seems as if...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Something's been happening behind the scenes...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Knowing you, you've already figured it out... Who the owner of the "7777777" ID number is.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well... I have a pretty strong hunch. (Looks like I'm not the only one who's figured it out.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You know, the only reason this trial didn't reach a verdict yesterday... is because there was still room for doubt on this ID record. If that number does belong to whom you suspect, then no doubt will remain. After all, he hasn't been officially charged with anything.

Name: Phoenix
Text: True... Not yet.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: In any event, once all doubt has been removed from that list, I can call for a ruling on the defendant. Five minutes after the trial starts... Lana will be found guilty.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But she didn't do it!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I figured you'd say as much. That's why I came here... to hear what you have to say.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is the first time he's ever done something like this...) Lana's hiding something, and the only way we'll ever know the truth... is to draw it out of her.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The "truth"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Everything goes back to the SL-9 Incident.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Don't be stupid! Today's the last day of the trial. We don't have time to reminisce about the past!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That depends on you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: If she's found guilty, you'll lose your only chance to find out what really happened.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I'll think about it. See you in court, Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is it. If I'm ever going to find out what Chief Gant has on her, it's now!)

Name: Judge
Text: Court is now in session for the trial of Ms. Lana Skye.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Normally this is when the prosecution puts forth its opening statement,

Name: Judge
Text: but before that, the police chief has a proposal to make.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Chief Gant...!)

Name: Gant
Text: Mornin' folks. How's everyone doing? Hey, Udgey. Been back to the pool yet?

Name: Judge
Text: No, I've been drowning enough as it is in my work.

Name: Gant
Text: Ho! That's a good one! Don't think I can top that!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If you don't mind me asking, Chief, exactly what is this "proposal" of yours?

Name: Gant
Text: Lana... that is to say, the defendant, has asked me if she could speak directly to the court.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (She wants to do what!?)

Name: Gant
Text: Having heard what she intends to say, I feel she should be granted her request. In the end, it should save everyone a lot of time and trouble.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What's this all about, defendant?

Name: Lana
Text: I'd just like to make one simple request, and I'll be finished.

Name: Judge
Text: Well then? What's your request?

Name: Lana
Text: Your Honor, I'd like you to put an immediate end to this trial.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh!?

Name: Lana
Text: I confess to all charges against me. On February 21 of this year, I murdered Detective Bruce Goodman... in the underground parking lot of the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, Lana!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You can't! Your Honor. The defendant's claim does not change the defense's plea!

Name: Lana
Text: In that case, Mr. Wright, I no longer require your services.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But Lana!

Name: Lana
Text: Your Honor. I hereby forfeit my right to an attorney. The prosecution may lack direct evidence against me, but it has sufficiently proven its case through testimony and circumstantial evidence. I would like you to render your verdict now, if you please.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Well, the defendant certainly has the right to self representation... Her request is legally valid, although this is an unprecedented situation. Indeed, it appears there's no need to continue this trial... even if Mr. Wright may feel otherwise.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This can't be happening!)

Name: Judge
Text: It appears the time for the verdict has arrived. This court finds the defendant...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: One moment, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: M-Mr. Edgeworth!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution has not yet proven the defendant guilty beyond reasonable doubt. Any ruling at this stage would certainly be premature.

Name: Gant
Text: Come now, Worthy. I understand this is a difficult time for you, but why don't you just be a good little boy and keep your mouth shut, hmm?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. I don't think I care for your tone... Chief Gant.

Name: Gant
Text: What?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Creating another fabrication to cover up your past mistakes... Sorry, but I'm no longer the naive little "boy" you would have me be.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: With this sudden confession from the defendant... It's obvious to me some kind of deal was struck behind the scenes.

Name: Gant
Text: Some kind of "deal," hm? Not everyone operates as you do... Worthy.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Hmph. I thought so. Your Honor. The prosecution would like to change its first witness.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh? To whom...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: As its first witness, the prosecution would like to call... Ms. Ema Skye! I request the court hears her tesimony!

Name: Lana
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Lana
Text: Mr. Edgeworth! I am exercising my right to self representation. I don't think we need to contin-

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I don't care what you think, Ms. Skye.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The exposure of truth sometimes results in tragedy... However! No matter how tragic the truth may be, it would be an even greater tragedy... to avert one's eyes from it.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The court shall grant the prosecution's request. That's okay with you, right Chief Gant?

Name: Gant
Text: Worthy... You'll live to regret this. Mark my words.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ms. Ema Skye. Please take the stand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Looks like Edgeworth has decided to take the horse by the reins!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Now then, witness. Please state your name and occupation.

Name: Ema
Text: Um... M-my name is Ema. Ema Skye. My occupation? I'm Lana's little sister, and I want to be a scientific investigator!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Two years ago... you encountered the serial killer Joe Darke, of the "Joe Darke Killings." Is this correct?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes. I'm trying my hardest to forget about that, though...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm sorry, but I'm afraid I'm going to have to ask you to recall those events one more time.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth. Please remember this trial concerns the murder of Detective Goodman. Is an incident that was resolved two years ago really all that relevant?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes. It most certainly is.

Name: Judge
Text: W-well okay then!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He sure gave in fast...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Now... please testify about what happened to you two years ago.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The trip to yesteryear has finally begun... It's bound to lead to the truth behind this trial!)

Name: Judge
Text: It's a good thing you weren't harmed.

Name: Ema
Text: I passed out... I don't remember much.

Name: Judge
Text: That's understandable. However... please tell me, Mr. Edgeworth. What does this testimony have to do with Detective Goodman's murder?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... That will soon become apparent, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (You've got to admire him for his courage, considering he has no evidence...)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well! The defense may begin its cross examination.

Name: Ema
Text: I was waiting in my sister's office that day.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Two years ago, the defendant was a detective at the Police Department, correct?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes. She was second in command under Chief Detective Gant. My sister... She was the best detective ever!

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, I remember. Chief Detective Gant and Ms. Skye used to be quite the pair.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I believe they shared the same office.

Name: Ema
Text: That's right. I'd always sit at my sister's desk, and dream about playing that organ. I wanted to play it that day, too...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The Police Department and the Prosecutor's Office held a ceremony that day.

Name: Ema
Text: Lana promised to take me to dinner after she finished her work.

Name: Ema
Text: A man came running in, and took me hostage.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A "man"...?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes, Joe Darke. He was a... a serial killer.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Joe Darke was brought in for questioning on the day of that ceremony. We were desperate to get anything on him that would lead to an arrest.

Name: Judge
Text: When he saw his chance... he fled the room, right?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Upon fleeing the room, Darke proceeded to take the elevator. He must have been in a panic because the elevator was going up. Then he ran into Skye and Gant's office.

Name: Ema
Text: There was a lot of noise coming from outside, so I... opened up the door to have a look. That's when I saw... Him.

Name: Ema
Text: Neil Marshall rescued me,

Name: Phoenix
Text: What was the prosecutor doing there?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That day, there were two people present during Darke's questioning: Detective Damon Gant, and Prosecutor Neil Marshall.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Gant was there too...?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Neil Marshall had just received the King of Prosecutors award. Young and dedicated, he went straight to the questioning room after the ceremony.

Name: Judge
Text: I assume that would also be why he was the first to run after Darke.

Name: Ema
Text: When Darke grabbed me, I... I thought I was as good as dead.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And that's when Prosecutor Marshall came running in?

Name: Ema
Text: I... I don't clearly remember what happened then. But...

Name: Ema
Text: but I'll never forget what I saw that instant!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Can you tell us about that?

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Marshall jumped on Darke. Just then... the lights went out.

Name: Judge
Text: The lights?

Name: Ema
Text: It was just about this time of year... There was a terrible storm going on, and lightning struck nearby.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So the electricity went out?

Name: Judge
Text: Wait a minute... If it was pitch dark in that room... you shouldn't have been able to see anything, right?

Name: Ema
Text: Right, but just then lightning flashed again outside. That sudden flash left an unforgettable image of the scene in my mind...

Name: Judge
Text: I see...

Name: Ema
Text: I told the detective about what I saw then.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The detective?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes. Detective Goodman. He was in charge of the case.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Detective Bruce Goodman... The victim...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you spoke with Detective Goodman about this... two years ago.

Name: Ema
Text: Yes. That's what's so scary about this trial.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And you told Detective Goodman about what you saw?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes, but... at the time, the words just wouldn't come out. That's why I drew a picture.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A picture... Yes, I think she mentioned that before.)

Name: Judge
Text: Well, Mr. Wright? Have you heard enough?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The picture the witness drew... I believe it has a very important meaning.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But the list of evidence I was given two years ago didn't contain a picture...

Name: Judge
Text: Witness. Would you mind if we added this statement to your testimony?

Name: Ema
Text: Y-yes, Your Honor.

Name: Ema
Text: I drew a picture of that scene once... but it seems to have been lost.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You drew a picture of the scene you witnessed, right?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes. I wanted to do everything I could to help the investigation. I can still see it now... Whenever I close my eyes...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That's strange... I took over the case after Prosecutor Marshall died, yet I never received any picture. Perhaps the witness is mistaken?

Name: Ema
Text: B-but I did draw it! I swear! I'm not just imagining it...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This picture that Ema drew... that reminds me! I guess I should check the evidence again...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well anyway. Let's continue. This scene that imprinted an image in your mind... Can you please describe it to us?

Name: Ema
Text: The man...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Edgeworth. This little girl put all her heart into drawing that picture... and yet you still insist on denying its existence?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Huh!? Hey, I'm not the bad guy! All I'm saying is that as the prosecutor for that case, I wasn't handed such a picture!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That may well be... but that doesn't mean it doesn't exist. Behold!

Name: Judge
Text: This is... the evidence list for the SL-9 Incident?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Please turn it over, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Turn it over...? Turn... it... AAAAAAAHHHH! What's this!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, what is that?

Name: Ema
Text: Hey! That's it! That's the picture I drew!

Name: Judge
Text: Indeed... Two men appear to be wrestling here.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What's the meaning of this!? What are you doing with that list!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Only the prosecutor in charge should have access to that list!

Name: Judge
Text: Huh...? These lists... They're... They're different from each other.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What?

Name: Judge
Text: It would appear, Mr. Edgeworth, that the evidence list you were handed two years ago... was incomplete. These two lists... fit together to form one. You can see the marks here, where they were torn apart from each other.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you see, Mr. Edgeworth. It's quite obvious what happened. Two years ago... only half of the evidence in that case ever reached you.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What... WWWHHAAAAAATTTTTT!!!!????

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Who'd have thought the picture would have been drawn on the back of the list...

Name: Ema
Text: That was handed to Detective Goodman in the questioning room?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wait a minute... If this list was torn in half, then that means...) Your Honor!

Name: Judge
Text: Are you all right, Mr. Wright? Your eyes are bulging from your head...

Name: Phoenix
Text: If the evidence list was torn in half... then there might be more of the drawing on the back of Mr. Edgeworth's list!

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, that's quite conceivable. Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's possible. Let's see... MM! MMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!

Name: Judge
Text: Is something wrong?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Do you even have to ask?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Sorry, Your Honor. There is something drawn on the back of my list. This is that... thing!

Name: Judge
Text: ... That's that... that thing! That thing that was dancing in the evidence room!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Apparently the Head of Criminal Affairs used this for his blueprint.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess he was out of scrap paper...)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Witness. Will you please testify about this picture you drew two years ago?

Name: Ema
Text: ...Huh? Oh, Y-yes sir, Your Honor!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's wrong with Ema? She seemed to be thinking about something when she saw the picture.)

Name: Judge
Text: To think a flash of lightning could burn such an image in your mind...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Thanks to that though, she was able to show us exactly what she saw!)

Name: Judge
Text: Well, I don't see any contradictions here. This clearly shows Joe Darke about to murder Prosecutor Neil Marshall.

Name: Judge
Text: The defense may now begin its cross-examination.

Name: Ema
Text: This is the picture I drew two years ago.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you draw this picture right after the incident?

Name: Ema
Text: Um... I think I drew it two or three days later. At first I was in such a state of shock that I couldn't do anything...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: During that time the detective team was reorganized. Detective Goodman was placed in charge... under the direction of Damon Gant and Lana Skye.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Two or three days later... The memory should still have been fresh in her mind.)

Name: Judge
Text: Excuse me, witness, but can you please tell us why this picture is painted all black?

Name: Ema
Text: The flash of lightning was so bright all I could see were shadows.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So at the time you didn't even know it was Mr. Marshall who had come to your rescue?

Name: Ema
Text: No... I couldn't see him clearly. The lightning was so bright... and I was knocked to the floor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You were knocked to the floor?

Name: Ema
Text: Darke had a tight grip on me, but when Mr. Marshall jumped on him, I was knocked away. I turned around, and that's when the lightning flashed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Poor Ema... I'm just glad she wasn't hurt.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What happened after the lightning flashed?

Name: Ema
Text: After that I must have fainted.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You mean, you didn't see the actual murder take place?

Name: Ema
Text: No. I-I'm sorry...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The flash of lightning only drove off the darkness for a split second. Not only that, but the trauma of the situation understandably caused the witness to faint. Do you really need to torture this girl any further!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!? Hey, I'm not the bad guy here!

Name: Ema
Text: Anyway, this picture...

Name: Ema
Text: This picture shows exactly what I saw that instant!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry for asking so many times, but are you sure you drew exactly what you saw?

Name: Ema
Text: Of course! This is the exact scene!

Name: Phoenix
Text: It wasn't influenced in any way from your talks with the detectives?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Are you insinuating we somehow manipulated her memory, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, no. Of course not. (I'd better watch out, or he might find some way to cut my salary!)

Name: Ema
Text: I drew this picture before I heard anything from the detectives, so I don't think anyone's story would have influenced me...

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. Is there something that's bothering you about this picture?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Oh, well...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but this picture the witness drew... contains a blatant contradiction!

Name: Ema
Text: What? B-but, I still remember it just like it was yesterday!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. Perhaps it would be faster if you simply pointed out this contradiction for us. What part of this picture... contradicts the autopsy report?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The contradiction of course lies here! Take a look at the knife the man is holding. If you look closely, you can see its tip is broken!

Name: Judge
Text: In fact, you don't even have to look closely to see that.

Name: Ema
Text: But Mr. Wright, look at the evidence! See the murder weapon? Its tip is broken too!

Name: Judge
Text: If I recall... the tip of the knife was found broken off in the victim's body.

Name: Ema
Text: It was the conclusive piece of evidence that proved Joe Darke was the murderer!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm afraid it's not so simple, Ema.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Huh? Where could you possibly see a problem!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's obvious, really. The victim "suffered a single stab wound in the back." If the victim was only stabbed once, then the murder weapon should not yet be broken!

Name: Judge
Text: AAAAAAAHHHHHH! What's the meaning of this?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Perhaps the knife was broken beforehand!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry, but I'm afraid that's not possible. The tip of the knife was found inside the victim's body. If it was broken beforehand, it couldn't possibly wind up there!

Name: Judge
Text: That's right! But what does this mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The tip of the knife was undeniably discovered within the victim's body! The only possible explanation is the witness's memory is mistaken!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's why I asked her so many times if she was sure she remembered correctly. I believe you were annoyed at the time. But she was sure she remembered correctly!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But... there's no other way to explain this inconsistency!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Not so fast, Mr. Edgeworth. There is another explanation. Have you forgotten already? About a little something called... "falsified evidence"?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You're treading on thin ice, Wright...

Name: Phoenix
Text: All I'm saying, is that this broken knife might be the piece of evidence that was forged! You can't deny the possibility!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No... Aaaaaagh!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order! Are you saying the investigation really was corrupted?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor... Please allow me to once again go over the events that took place the day of the murder. The Police Department and the Prosecutor's Office were holding a ceremony that day. After receiving the King of Prosecutors award at the ceremony. Neil Marshall questioned Joe Darke along with Damon Gant. During his questioning, Joe Darke fled the room. Prosecutor Marshall chased after him... and was killed by Darke. It is my belief that somewhere in this story... there is a lie.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...

Name: Ema
Text: I... I'm not lying... The man really was holding up a broken knife!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... If that's true... then there's no other way around it. This could not have been the actual murder weapon.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There must have been another broken knife!

Name: Judge
Text: What are the chances of there being two broken knives?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Another broken knife besides Joe Darke's... Could there have been one?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: If the witness is this adamant about the accuracy of what she saw... it can't just be explained away by a simple observational error.

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright...

Name: Phoenix
Text: In that instant... Ema really did see a broken knife!

Name: Judge
Text: I assume then, that you have some information about this "other" broken knife? If so, please feel free to enlighten us.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The murder weapon was already broken prior to the murder... There's only one way!) Take a look at this. Here's the real murder weapon!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The answer lies in the past... Two years in the past. Right here inside this picture!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This is a picture of the awards ceremony. A-AAAAHH!

Name: Judge
Text: What is it, Mr. Edgeworth!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's the... the broken murder weapon!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Notice the award Prosecutor Marshall is holding.

Name: Ema
Text: That's... a broken knife!

Name: Phoenix
Text: As we earlier concluded, the knife in the picture was not Joe Darke's knife. That being the case... the knife the witness saw, was in all likelihood this award!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Neil Marshall was awarded King of Prosecutors that day. As an award, he was given this broken shield and a broken knife. When he chased after Joe Darke, he pulled out this knife. Being a prosecutor, he did not carry a pistol. This broken knife was the only weapon he had in this dangerous situation.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But that... That can't be!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh? And why not, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Because if the King of Prosecutors award knife was the murder weapon... then the murderer and the victim would be reversed!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I mean... This man raising a knife... would have been Prosecutor Neil Marshall!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh... OOOOOHHHHH!!!

Name: Judge
Text: But the prosecutor was the one who actually died!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's true... (What's going on here?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It seems Mr. Wright has been a bit too eager to jump to conclusions...

Name: Ema
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Ema
Text: Wait! I... I remember now... I remember everything!

Name: Judge
Text: Witness...?

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What is it?

Name: Ema
Text: Could you show me your evidence list again, please?

Name: Judge
Text: His list? The one with that... picture scribbled on the back?

Name: Ema
Text: ... I knew it... This picture... I'm the one who drew it.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You drew that?

Name: Ema
Text: That's right. The list wasn't torn in half at the time I drew this picture. All this time I've been trying so hard to forget... I must have locked this part away deep inside me...

Name: Judge
Text: Perhaps it would be best... if we added this to the witness's testimony. Would you please tell us what you've recalled, Ms. Skye?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (First the knife mix-up, and now... the Blue Badger? This should be interesting...)

Name: Judge
Text: This is certainly most unusual...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Try impossible! The Head Detective of Criminal Affairs didn't even design him until this year!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That would mean he didn't even exist two years ago...)

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, well. The defense may now begin its cross-examination.

Name: Lana
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Lana
Text: Stop! Please! Don't pursue this any further!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Lana!

Name: Judge
Text: What's the meaning of this!? Please remain seated in the defendant's chair!

Name: Lana
Text: But you can't do this! I've already confessed to the crime! Why can't you just leave it at that!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Chief Prosecutor Skye.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: We've already come this far. It's too late to turn back.

Name: Judge
Text: Silence! The defense will now begin its cross-examination. Bailiff. Please detain the defendant.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It seems we're finally getting to the core of the matter.)

Name: Ema
Text: When I saw that man raise his knife...

Name: Phoenix
Text: When you say, "that man," I assume you refer to Joe Darke?

Name: Ema
Text: Yes... at least, I think it was him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You... "think"?

Name: Ema
Text: All I could really see were shadows.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The power outage that immediately preceded the incident, is also documented in the Prosecutor's Office reports.

Name: Judge
Text: So then you...

Name: Ema
Text: I panicked, and rushed toward both of them.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why would you do something so dangerous!?

Name: Ema
Text: What else could I have done!? He was about to stab Mr. Marshall!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (She seems so convinced that Darke was the one holding the knife...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But as we've just theorized, Mr. Marshall was the one holding the knife.

Name: Ema
Text: Well, I didn't know that at the time! When that Darke guy knocked me down, all I could think was, "I've got to help Mr. Marshall!"

Name: Ema
Text: I think I... I knocked away the man with the knife.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean, you "think"?

Name: Ema
Text: It... it all happened so fast... And I was in shock! I don't remember everything clearly. What I did... it's all kind of a blur...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: In a matter of just a few seconds Ms. Skye was almost killed, then she witnessed a murder about to take place. A little disorientation is only natural.

Name: Ema
Text: I saw the man about to stab the other person, who I thought was Mr. Marshall. I knew I had to stop the man with the knife.

Name: Judge
Text: What you did was very brave, young girl. So then, what happened next?

Name: Ema
Text: Just then there was another flash of lightning, and that's when I saw... the Blue Badger!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you sure about this?

Name: Ema
Text: Of course! See? I even drew a picture of him here!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But... the Head Detective of Criminal Affairs thought up this hideous beast. And that was just this year... The Blue Badger didn't exist two years ago. This is all quite verifiable.

Name: Ema
Text: I know it sounds strange. I was surprised too when I saw him at the Police Department. I had this nagging feeling that I'd seen him before somewhere. Now I finally remember!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh, brother. Just when you thought that thing had caused enough commotion...)

Name: Judge
Text: Tell us... Where in the room did you see him dancing?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The mysterious "Blue Badger" was in fact... this!

Name: Judge
Text: But that's... Er, what exactly is that?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I believe it's some sort of jar.

Name: Ema
Text: But Mr. Wright! That doesn't look anything like the Blue Badger!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Indeed it doesn't. As it stands now, it's just a plain jar. However... What if we were to change our viewpoint?

Name: Judge
Text: Our viewpoint...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I've got to show them the correct angle to look at this from!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well...? Is this a miracle or what? No one can possibly deny this jar's resemblance to the Blue Badger!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No... It can't be!!!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! The defense has proven its claim. The mysterious "Blue Badger" witnessed on the day of the crime was actually this...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Although we all enjoyed Mr. Wright's dramatic performance, one question remains... What's your point!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So that Badger thing was actually just a jar. That doesn't change anything!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm afraid that's where you're wrong, Mr. Edgeworth. You see... this changes everything!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Indeed? Very well, then. Please tell us... What's different now that we know the witness saw this jar?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Allow me to take these in turn. At the moment of the murder, the witness saw this jar.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Not only that, but she saw it at a very specific angle.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Knowing this, where could she have seen this jar?

Name: Judge
Text: Where...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The location of the jar is shown in a picture taken on the day of the crime. It's on a shelf in the office of Damon Gant.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But the body was found lying near Lana Skye's desk! The witness testified so herself!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes! And it is these two facts that reveal what actually transpired! You see... The struggle between Darke and Marshall did not take place in Lana Skye's office! It happened on the other side of the room, in Chief Gant's office!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Are you implying the murderer moved the victim's body? From Damon Gant's office to Lana Skye's office?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Why would he do that!? There's no reason!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Exactly.

Name: Phoenix
Text: If there wasn't a "reason"... he wouldn't have gone through the trouble. The only logical conclusion... is that there was a "reason."

Name: Judge
Text: Do you know what that reason was, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I've finally figured it out... So this is why Lana tried to stop the trial! It's too late to quit now, though.) Please recall the witness's testimony. She said she knocked away the man who was holding up the knife. In the next instant, the jar was hit and flew threw the air. Now tell me... What could have sent the jar flying?

Name: Judge
Text: That would have to have been... the impact the man made when he was knocked into the wall?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ladies and gentlemen... if I may draw your attention to this picture once more. If the man was knocked in the direction of the shelf the jar was sitting on... what would he have hit?

Name: Ema
Text: A-AHHHHHH...

Name: Judge
Text: The suit of armor! Holding... a very sharp and dangerous-looking sword...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. And since the man who was knocked into the armor was carrying a broken knife... he would have had to have been Neil Marshall, wielding the Prosecutor's Award.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No... Mr. Wright... You can't be thinking...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. There is another possibility of what actually transpired in that room.

Name: Judge
Text: Another possibility?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course the perpetrator would have had no idea, but nevertheless! ... (I... I don't know if I can go through with this...)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright? What's the matter?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If events took place as the defense theorizes... Then the outcome is obvious. In that moment... assuming the man Ema Skye knocked away was actually Prosecutor Neil Marshall...

Name: Ema
Text: You mean... Mr. Marshall died... because of... me...? NOOOOOOOOOO!!!
*thud*

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I never imagined her testimony would lead to this...

Name: Judge
Text: So it was the witness who took the victim's life... and then proved so with her own testimony! This is unprecedented!

Name: Lana
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Lana
Text: What... What are you saying!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm sorry, Ms. Skye, but given the circumstances...

Name: Lana
Text: Joe Darke murdered Prosecutor Marshall! How can you think it was Ema!? How dare you try to pin the crime on her!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Imagine that, coming from you.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If you recall, it was you who admitted to forging evidence two years ago. The reason you moved Prosecutor Marshall's body... was to keep anyone else from finding out about what Ema did, wasn't it?

Name: Lana
Text: I assure you, Mr. Edgeworth, I have no idea what you're talking about. If you hope to have anyone believe your insane allegations, I'm afraid you're going to have to have proof. Tell me... Do you have any conclusive evidence that proves my sister killed Neil Marshall?

Name: Phoenix
Text: E-evidence?

Name: Lana
Text: I'm willing to bet you don't.

Name: Judge
Text: Yes... it certainly would be difficult to prove this with evidence.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If we don't have evidence, then we'll have to rely on testimony.

Name: Lana
Text: I'm afraid that won't work in this case. Both parties involved in the incident are dead.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! (We certainly can't get dead people to testify. This has all been a wild goose chase from the beginning!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. Touche, Ms. Skye. Of course... That only leaves us with one possibility.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! (You mean, there's still another possibility?)

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I mean, the possibility that the victim left us a message. For better or for worse, Mr. Marshall did not die instantly. He may have left behind the name of the person who took his life... somehow.

Name: Lana
Text: That's... That's impossible!

Name: Judge
Text: Well, Mr. Wright? This is the only possibility left to you. A message from the deceased... Does such a message exist?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I've got to think back to the Court Record!) The real murderer's name that the victim may have left behind...

Name: Phoenix
Text: This "message" from the deceased... is already in our possession.

Name: Lana
Text: Mr. Wright! Will you stop at nothing to prove my sister a murderer?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Do not be mistaken, Ms. Skye.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Our purpose is not to accuse Ema of any crime. There is only one thing we seek: the truth. No matter how painful it may be.

Name: Judge
Text: Now then, Mr. Wright. Please show us the piece of evidence... that conveys a message from the deceased!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is the message left by the deceased.

Name: Judge
Text: This is that "Blue Badger" from before, right?

Name: Lana
Text: Oh, is he going to just speak the killer's name?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If that thing could, I'm sure it would.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Looks like everyone's forgotten this is just a jar.) A message was left here... on the surface of this jar.

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If you look closely, you can see a faint trail of blood on this jar.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It looks like someone wiped the blood away.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, but notice: for some reason... the blood on some of the fragments was not wiped away.

Name: Judge
Text: Yes... there is a line here... drawn in blood!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So what you're saying, is these "dots"... were once lines!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Prosecutor Marshall did not die instantly. He used the few precious moments left to him to leave behind a message!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: One that someone apparently wiped away... But blood must have seeped into the jar where the lines change directions.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Precisely so! All we need to do is connect these points... and the victim's message will become apparent!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! What kind of message did the victim leave for us!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor... I believe these blood stains will reveal to us the answer! (I've got to connect these dots to make letters. There's only one thing the victim would have written, given the circumstances: The murderer's name!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's a defense attorney's duty to prove his client's innocence. That's why all I've been thinking about is saving Lana. After all my efforts, I never thought it would turn out like this!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So this is the final message Prosecutor Marshall left behind.

Name: Judge
Text: Of all people... She may not have meant it... but in the end, the one who took the victim's life...

Name: Phoenix
Text: was Ema Skye.

Name: Gant
Text: See, Worthy? Can't say I didn't warn you.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Chief Gant...

Name: Gant
Text: Do you understand the implications of what you've done?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What...? What are you talking about?

Name: Gant
Text: Two years ago, Joe Darke was sentenced to death. He was convicted because of his final murder. I believe you were the prosecutor in the case, were you not?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ack!

Name: Gant
Text: Yes, Worthy. Because of you... an innocent man was sentenced to death. Not only that... but you used forged evidence to ensure his conviction!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: K-kkckck! KKCKRRAAAAHHHH!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: But Joe Darke really was a serial murderer! That's undeniable!

Name: Gant
Text: I'm afraid that's not important. Didn't you know? We aren't defenders of justice.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What?

Name: Gant
Text: We're merely keepers of the law. Sentencing a man to death... is no light matter. Even if there wasn't any cover-up or evidence forgery... ultimately the responsibility falls on the prosecutor in charge.

Name: Gant
Text: Despite what anyone may say, this fact cannot be denied.

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order! ORDEEEEERRRRRR!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The gavel's pounding fell on deaf ears... Unable to settle the crowd, the judge declared a recess. Where this trial is headed, no one knows...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry, Edgeworth. I didn't mean to get you in trouble...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. Don't worry about it. This is my problem, not yours.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hope I'm not interrupting anything, pals.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh... Guess I am. I'll come back later.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, Detective Gumshoe! What is it?

Name: Gumshoe
