Text: You've got a lot of nerve, pal! Making a detective run all around while on duty, and to top it off you call me here... I've seen happier people at funerals!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I take it Lana's having you run errands again.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Let me tell you, this is the last time, pal! Here. She asked me to give this to you if there was a break in today's trial.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Evidence Law"? (Edgeworth was talking about this just the other day...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm sure you know the two rules of evidence law, don't you Wright? Rule 1: no evidence shall be shown without the approval of the Police Department!

Name: Ema
Text: I-is that right, Mr. Wright!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It seems so.

Name: Ema
Text: You could at least study some evidence law! Really!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The Chief Prosecutor also wanted me to give you a message.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A message?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: She said, "If you're planning to take HIM on, you're going to need this book."

Name: Phoenix
Text: ("Him"... I guess I'll need to give this book a thorough read...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Doesn't look like that book'll do you any good now though. All that's left now is the Chief Prosecutor's sentence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's where you're wrong, Detective.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Huh?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Haven't you figured it out yet? Why I'm still sitting in that prosecutor's seat... despite all these allegations being thrown at me?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Mr. Edgeworth...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The real trial today... hasn't begun yet.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What!? What else is there left to do? Your credibility's been all but ruined with this forged evidence you were unaware of, Ema Skye found out she unwittingly caused a man's death... And now you're telling me you want to do more!? You've gotta be kidding me, pal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You're missing the point, Detective. Lana didn't murder Detective Goodman.

Name: Phoenix
Text: She merely stuck a knife into his dead body. That means the real killer...is still out there.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (And we're going to expose him... No matter what it takes! This case has hurt too many people. It's time to bring it to an end!)

Name: Judge
Text: The court will now reconvene for the trial of Ms. Lana Skye. Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: The inquiry committee is planning to impose harsh penalties for your actions.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Thank you for the news, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, well... *a-hem* Normally, this is where the prosecution calls forth a witness... but, er... *a-hem* *cough* *cough* This isn't easy to say... You see, there is some concern that Mr. Edgeworth may have, ah...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Struck a bargain?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You think I may have manipulated the witnesses.

Name: Judge
Text: I didn't say that! It's just, you see... Everyone has been talking, and...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Very well, Your Honor. I have a solution.

Name: Judge
Text: A solution?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That being the case, the prosecution will allow the defense to call forth all further witnesses.

Name: Judge
Text: What!? But there's never been a case example...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Undeniably this is an unusual arrangement... but a very effective one. It would prove that I haven't struck any "deals" with the witnesses.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Well, Mr. Wright? What do you say?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (Unbelievable. Edgeworth has found a way to continue the trial!) Very well. The defense accepts the prosecution's proposal.

Name: Judge
Text: Then it's settled. The, uh... defense... may now call forth the next witness!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mr. Wright.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You do realize this is your last chance? If you call the wrong witness... this trial is as good as over.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense calls... (The time's finally come to bring out the real murderer!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Damon Gant. The defense calls Damon Gant to the stand!

Name: Judge
Text: D-Damon Gant...? What does he have to do with anything!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... As the defendant's partner two years ago, Mr. Gant has first-hand knowledge of the crime. I feel we should hear what he has to say about it.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: As luck would have it, he should still be in the courthouse. He would also be the least likely to have been manipulated by me in any way. Wouldn't you agree, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: True... All right. Bailiff! Please escort Mr. Gant to the stand!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Witness. Please state your name and occupation.

Name: Gant
Text: What is this, some kind of practical joke? I was just on my way to lunch!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your name and occupation, sir.

Name: Gant
Text: Worthy... Are you sure you want to do this?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your name and occupation!

Name: Gant
Text: So... You want to play hardball, eh?

Name: Judge
Text: P-please, Mr. Gant.

Name: Gant
Text: ... Fine. My name is Damon Gant. I'm the acting Chief of Police.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Now then, Chief Gant. The court requests to hear your testimony.

Name: Gant
Text: Oh, Wrighto. What's with the grim face?

Name: Phoenix
Text: First, let's clear up this SL-9 Incident.

Name: Gant
Text: Oh, you mean that time when Lana's sister murdered that prosecutor? Personally, I think it's been made pretty clear already.

Name: Phoenix
Text: There are still some things unaccounted for.

Name: Gant
Text: Oh? Like what?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Like the role you played in all of this.

Name: Gant
Text: ... Son... Either you're very brave... or very foolish.

Name: Gant
Text: You are aware of course that a police chief has all kinds of weapons at his disposal?

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Weapons"...?

Name: Gant
Text: Sure. Take my testimony, for example. I don't have to give it if I don't want to.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What? Is that true?

Name: Judge
Text: I'm afraid so... The Chief of Police has the right to refuse to testify.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Of course, such an action carries with it certain risks...

Name: Gant
Text: ... Don't worry. I'm not here to hinder your trial. Just remember... If this turns out to be a big waste of time, don't say I didn't warn you.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The witness may now begin his testimony.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Is that when Darke was arrested?

Name: Gant
Text: Him? He was lying on the floor unconscious. When Ema sent Neil flying... it seems Darke bumped his head.

Name: Judge
Text: I see... Everything seems pretty clear-cut.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If the police chief has the right to refuse to testify... Then I'd better hit him hard and fast!)

Name: Gant
Text: As I recall, Neil and I were questioning him that day.

Name: Phoenix
Text: As I recall... a ceremony was held at the Police Department that day...

Name: Gant
Text: Yes, that's right. I guess you could say I'm a workaholic... After winning his award, Neil was all fired up too. That's probably what spooked Darke, and made him run away like that.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Was the defendant, Lana Skye, also present in the room?

Name: Gant
Text: I don't quite remember... At the very least, she wasn't there when Darke ran for it.

Name: Gant
Text: To make a long story short, we slipped up. That power outage didn't help either.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So the two of you ran immediately after him, right?

Name: Gant
Text: That's right, but Darke made it to the elevator first, so Neil and I split up. He went upstairs and I went downstairs. I guess you could say... he got "lucky."

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What's this about a power outage?

Name: Gant
Text: Oh, that. The elevator stopped all of a sudden, and I got the shock of my life. Well... Probably not as shocked as Neil was when that knife went into his heart, though.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's not funny...)

Name: Gant
Text: When I went to my office, I found Lana there.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could you tell us what you saw?

Name: Gant
Text: It was a shocking sight... Neil and that serial killer were lying in a heap on the floor, all tangled together.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Darke was also lying collapsed on the floor?

Name: Gant
Text: Yes, apparently he hit his head and was knocked out. Next to them were those two poor girls.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Lana and Ema...)

Name: Gant
Text: Lana was cradling Ema in her arms. Looking back at it now... She must have already known what her sister had done.

Name: Gant
Text: Apparently she had already... "arranged" the crime scene.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How can you know that!?

Name: Gant
Text: Because of the victim's body. It had already been moved.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So that means... You found the body near Lana's desk?

Name: Gant
Text: That's right. I think you said earlier, it was my suit of armor... that really stabbed the prosecutor?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes...

Name: Gant
Text: Anyway...

Name: Gant
Text: As you can see, I had nothing to do with the "forgery."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you're saying... that the forgery had already taken place by the time you arrived at your office?

Name: Gant
Text: That's exactly what I'm saying. I can understand how Lana must have felt, but moving a body and hiding evidence are inexcusable no matter what the circumstances.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Is that how it really went down?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Staring at the witness won't do you any good, Mr. Wright.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If you're going to stare at anything... you'd be better off staring at the Court Record.

Name: Gant
Text: Worthy, Worthy... Always the smooth talker.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (But which piece of evidence ties Gant to the forgery...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You claim you had nothing to do with the forgery... but I'm afraid that is a claim you cannot back up.

Name: Gant
Text: Explain yourself.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Several pieces of evidence were found in your office. Take this jar, for example.

Name: Judge
Text: That's the Blue Badger you showed us earlier.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A piece of this jar was discovered in your safe.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Not only that, but the evidence list I presented earlier... was actually found inside your desk!

Name: Judge
Text: It was found where!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You see, Chief Gant. These articles of evidence uncovered in your office... are both concrete proof... that you also played a part in the illegal investigation!

Name: Judge
Text: Chief Gant! What's the meaning of this!?

Name: Gant
Text: Ho! Here's a defense attorney who may even rival Worthy!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you admit to it, then? That you were involved in the forgery?

Name: Gant
Text: Who, me? Or do you mean... you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Me? Why would I have anything to do with that!?

Name: Gant
Text: Well... You were the one who snuck into my office when you "found" this evidence.

Name: Gant
Text: Prosecutors aren't the only ones capable of forging evidence, you know. Defense attorneys can do so too. Isn't that right, Wrighto?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: However! Detective Gumshoe was present during the investigation!

Name: Gant
Text: Worthy, my boy. Not even detectives are exempt from the law. Rest assured Dick will receive his due punishment.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wh...

Name: Phoenix
Text: WHAAAAT!? (If Detective Gumshoe's salary drops any further, he'll end up paying to work!)

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, well. In light of the Detective's presence... please give us your testimony regarding these pieces of evidence found in your office, and their relation to the forgery that took place at the crime scene.

Name: Gant
Text: My, my... Kids these days no longer know how to put two and two together...

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: When investigating the crime scene... you should have been more careful to observe protocol.

Name: Gant
Text: You do understand that I am the Chief of Police, right? There will be consequences...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ooh...

Name: Gant
Text: Indeed, I believe I will press charges... so you won't make the same mistake again.

Name: Judge
Text: My apologies, Chief, but would you mind waiting until tomorrow for that? Today is... well, you know...

Name: Gant
Text: All right, Udgey. In return, though...

Name: Judge
Text: I know! I know! That place, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Huh? What are these guys, telepathic?)

Name: Gant
Text: For all I know, you could have planted them in my office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'd appreciate it if you'd stop making these ridiculous allegations.

Name: Gant
Text: Yes, you do have a point... You wouldn't have the guts to do something like that...

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!? I'll have you know, back in the day I once broke into a cattle ranch, and tipped-

Name: Judge
Text: M-Mr. Wright! What are you saying!?

Name: Gant
Text: Anyway, you can't prove you didn't carry in the evidence, can you? If you have proof to the contrary, you're going to need it later.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Later? What are you talking about?

Name: Gant
Text: What else? I'm talking about when your fingerprints are found. Yes. If they're found inside my safe, they would prove your investigation was illegal.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Grrr... (I've never faced anyone as slimy as this guy!)

Name: Gant
Text: Anyway, you can't prove "when" those pieces of evidence were discovered.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean by that?

Name: Gant
Text: This is all purely hypothetical, of course... but suppose I did place those items in my safe. Such an act... wouldn't necessarily constitute forgery.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: If concealing evidence found at a crime scene isn't forgery...

Name: Gant
Text: I'm not through speaking yet, Mr. Wright. It all depends on "when" the evidence was discovered.

Name: Gant
Text: If they were found after Darke was convicted, then they're worthless.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you saying this jar fragment... wasn't discovered in the initial investigation?

Name: Gant
Text: It would appear not. After all, it wasn't listed in the evidence list. For all we know, it could have suddenly materialized the day after Darke was sentenced.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh, and wouldn't that be convenient...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wright.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The Chief is talking about a "possibility." So long as you can't rule that out... your remarks, however clever they may be, will only succeed in wasting time.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Tell me something I don't know...)

Name: Gant
Text: Come now, Mr. Wright. Think about it.

Name: Gant
Text: There's no reason I'd participate in a forgery.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How can you look me in the eye and say that!?

Name: Gant
Text: Because I'm innocent.

Name: Gant
Text: Remember? Who was it that murdered Neil?

Name: Judge
Text: I'm not sure I care for the word "murder" here... but in the end the person responsible for Mr. Marshall's unfortunate demise... was Ema Skye.

Name: Gant
Text: Well? Now do you see?

Name: Gant
Text: Rearranging the crime scene wouldn't help me out in any way.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Really, Chief Gant? At the very least, there is one very large benefit you've reaped from all this.

Name: Gant
Text: Oh? I wasn't aware. What is this "benefit"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That would of course be the position you have- Chief of Police.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh...

Name: Phoenix
Text: The resolution of the SL-9 Incident secured your promotion to Chief. That in itself is sufficient motive!

Name: Gant
Text: ... Ho! Ho! Ho! Oh, that's a good one!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Gant
Text: Do you really think I'm that incompetent?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Gant
Text: Even without that case, I was already in line to become the next chief. The resolution of SL-9 merely sped up the inevitable a little.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Is that true, Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes... He was going to be made Chief anyway.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Gah!

Name: Gant
Text: Be careful when pointing that finger... or you might wind up being the one pointed at!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So that means... there's only one possible motivation for you to commit forgery. If you didn't do it for yourself... then you did it for someone else.

Name: Gant
Text: Don't be silly, Worthy. You know me better than that. There are only three people I look out for: Me, Myself and I. ... There, it's out in the open now. Udgey, would you mind if I changed my testimony a little?

Name: Judge
Text: By all means, please do!

Name: Gant
Text: I wouldn't be anyone's "accomplice" if there was nothing in it for me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Nothing in it" for you?

Name: Gant
Text: Sorry, but the only person I care about is Yours Truly. That girl... Lana's little sister, was it? If you think I felt sorry for her, you'd better think again.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You're right... You don't feel sorry for anyone.

Name: Gant
Text: Be tough on crime and tough on people. That's how I was raised.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You seem to be lax enough on yourself, though.

Name: Gant
Text: Ho! Ho! Ho! Oh, that's a good one, Worthy!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... Could there have been something in it for him? Given his selfishness, would he have helped someone out?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: True, you might not help out anyone for their sake. But if it would benefit you... you might decide to assist someone.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. It appears you're positively determined to portray the Chief... as a nice man who likes to lend people a hand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's not what I mean...)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, I'll ask. Who is this person you believe Chief Gant may have helped forge evidence?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Judge
Text: Chief Prosecutor Lana Skye... Th-the defendant!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I believe it's quite obvious in light of the circumstances. Ema Skye fell victim to an unfortunate series of events. Who would want to help her more than her own sister, Lana? And as for Chief Gant... he would also have a reason to help Lana if she asked him to. That reason, of course, is... self profit.

Name: Judge
Text: Self profit...? What do you mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: After the SL-9 Incident was resolved... Lana Skye was appointed Chief Prosecutor at the Prosecutor's Office. The person who arranged this job change...was you, Chief Gant.

Name: Judge
Text: B-but... how would he profit from all of this?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He would be able to use the Chief Prosecutor as his puppet! Essentially... he would acquire unchecked authority over all investigations!

Name: Judge
Text: Do you mean to tell me... that despite the Chief's formidable appearance, he plays with puppets!? Oh, wait. You must mean "puppet" as in someone forced to do his bidding... Never mind!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Admit it, Chief! You assisted Lana Skye in forging evidence! Your motive: to appoint her as Chief Prosecutor so you could control her!

Name: Gant
Text: Wrighto, my boy. You have quite an imagination. Let me ask you something.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What?

Name: Gant
Text: Do you have any proof of this? That I "controlled" Lana? For example, is Lana testifying that I've done such a thing?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Lana... (She's keeping quiet to protect Ema. There's no way she'd testify against Gant!)

Name: Judge
Text: I'm afraid without any proof, this all amounts to nothing more than mere conjecture.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Unless... that is also what happened in this incident...

Name: Judge
Text: "This" incident...? Er... which one would that be?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Of course I'm talking about... the murder of Detective Bruce Goodman. The Chief Prosecutor has been acting strange throughout this entire trial. Almost as if... someone has been "controlling" her!

Name: Gant
Text: Worthy... You'd better watch your tongue... I wouldn't want you to get hurt.

Name: Judge
Text: Just what do you mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What he means, Your Honor, is that Chief Gant is involved in the murder of Detective Goodman. Not only that... but the Chief is now making Lana take the rap to cover up his involvement!

Name: Judge
Text: Wha... wha... wha... WWWHHHHAAAAAAAAATTTTT!!!? Order! Order! Order! I SAID... ORDEEEEERRRR!!! Mr. Wright! You... You can't be serious!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Judge
Text: This... This is an affront to the highest ranking officer in our law enforcement agency! To accuse the Chief of Police of blackmail... and murder!!!? That's i.... i... i-i-i-i-i-i-i-IMPOSSIBLE!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Your Honor, I was merely reiterating... what Mr. Edgeworth said, in easier-to-understand language.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's too late, Mr. Wright.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There's no turning back for us now.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It looks like he's the one who's decided to go through with this.)

Name: Judge
Text: Can you prove this, Mr. Wright? That the Chief, a high-ranking officer of the law, is involved in this murder!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (Good question...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Regardless of his rank or title, Chief Gant is just a man. The question is, is he a criminal? I believe the evidence will tell.

Name: Judge
Text: I see. Alright, then. Show us the evidence that ties Chief Gant to the murder of Detective Goodman. Just remember... It better be good!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Judge
Text: This is the ID card list...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, the one that shows who entered the evidence room on the day of the crime. There was one ID on the list we couldn't determine the owner of yesterday... 7777777.

Name: Gant
Text: Sorry, but there's no way you can prove that's my card number.

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's your number.

Name: Judge
Text: What!? How do you know that!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The safe in Chief Gant's Office requires a code to open. A seven-digit code...

Name: Judge
Text: Seven digits... You don't mean...

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm afraid so, Your Honor. The code was "7777777"... The same as the remaining ID card number on that list! Chief Gant! You entered the evidence room on the day of the crime!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Chief Gant! What do you have to say!?

Name: Gant
Text: ... Nothing. The defense's search of my office was in violation of regulations.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And I will demand Mr. Wright be punished to the maximum extent of the law. But right now, this court demands an explanation from you... about the use of this ID card!

Name: Judge
Text: Chief Gant! So you admit it? You entered the evidence room... on the day of the crime!?

Name: Gant
Text: ... What about it? I'm Chief of Police. Whether it's the evidence room or the bathroom, what's the difference? I can go anywhere I want.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Tell me. When you entered the room... were you alone?

Name: Gant
Text: I always go to the bathroom alone... as I do with the evidence room.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Goodman wouldn't have happened to be with you that day... would he?

Name: Gant
Text: O-of course not! Why would he be? I hadn't seen him in days!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You hadn't seen him... "in days"? Chief Gant... I'm afraid you've just undone yourself. On that day, you had to have met with Detective Goodman!

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean!? This trial's purpose is to determine Lana Skye's guilt!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No it isn't, Your Honor. This trial's purpose is to determine the truth. If Chief Gant met the victim on the day of the crime, then we need to determine one thing: what transpired during that meeting!

Name: Judge
Text: In that case, Mr. Wright! I'm going to have to ask you for evidence! Show us proof that the victim went to meet Chief Gant on the day of the crime!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Goodman lost his ID card on the day of the crime.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Or to be more accurate, Jake Marshall stole it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So Detective Goodman filled out a lost item report. He would have had to give that report... to the Chief of Police!

Name: Gant
Text: Yet you are in possession of the report... which means you can't be sure if he filed it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: He filed it. How do I know, you ask? Because he needed to enter the evidence room that day.

Name: Judge
Text: He needed to?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. To transfer the evidence out.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Goodman took the form to you, Chief Gant. Then... you accompanied the detective to the evidence room!

Name: Gant
Text: I "accompanied" him?

Name: Phoenix
Text: There's no other way the murderer and Detective Goodman could have entered the room!

Name: Gant
Text: Hold on. Let me guess what you're going to say next. I, the Chief of Police, murdered poor Goodman!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Exactly.

Name: Judge
Text: But wait! The Chief didn't necessarily need to accompany him to the evidence room. He could have just lent him his ID card.

Name: Gant
Text: Yes... Now that you mention it, I believe I might have done something of the sort.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Sorry, but that's not possible.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: According to the record, your card was only used once. But you showed us your ID card earlier. If you had really "lent" it to Detective Goodman, it would have been found on his body!

Name: Gant
Text: N... NNNNNOOOOOOOOOO!!!

Name: Judge
Text: Chief Gant! Y-you didn't...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murder was most likely committed on the spur of the moment. No one in their right mind would choose the Police Department as a place to commit murder. After the murder, you contacted Lana at the Prosecutor's Office. Why else? To dispose of Detective Goodman's body.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: However, the victim's body was discovered in the Prosecutor's Office's parking lot. How did he manage to move it there?

Name: Gant
Text: I was at the Police Department the entire day, you know.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And everyone's aware that Lana stayed at the Prosecutor's Office after the ceremony.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Everyone except me, it seems... Still, you're the Chief of Police. You have an entire police force at your disposal.

Name: Gant
Text: Oh, so you think I just ordered an officer to do it? "Hey you. Take this here dead body over to the Prosecutor's Office." I don't think so...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chief Gant. You left all the evidence we need... to prove how you moved the body to the Prosecutor's Office. (And all this time I thought it was a useless clue just taking up space...)

Name: Judge
Text: How could the Chief have moved the body!? Mr. Wright! Show us this evidence!

Name: Phoenix
Text: To move the victim's body... Chief Gant used this!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is how he moved Detective Goodman's body!

Name: Judge
Text: A parking stub? "Miles Edgeworth"...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You mean...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The body was found in the trunk of Mr. Edgeworth's car. I think it's obvious what happened. The body was moved by that car!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You mean I... I... I carried the victim's body!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Precisely so.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But wait! Even you know... I didn't plan on returning to my office... after the ceremony finished that day.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But you did return! Tell me, why?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... A-AAAHHHH...!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I... was asked to go. By Chief Gant no less. He told me he wanted me to keep a screwdriver at the Prosecutor's Office. In any case, on the day of the incident, I brought this to the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you see... what you really took to the Prosecutor's Office wasn't the screwdriver... but the victim's body in your trunk!

Name: Judge
Text: Detective Goodman's body... was carried in the trunk of Mr. Edgeworth's car!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. Unless, of course, you have another explanation, Chief? Why else would you have asked Mr. Edgeworth to carry evidence from a closed case?

Name: Phoenix
Text: There's only one plausible explanation: to transport the body to your accomplice... Ms. Lana Skye!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order! What's going on here!? Is there no room for rebuttal to the defense's outrageous accusations!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Think back to the photograph Ms. Starr took at the Prosecutor's Office. This was not a photo of the body being stuffed in the trunk to be taken away. It was exactly the opposite...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It is a photo of the body being taken from the trunk!

Name: Judge
Text: Chief Gant! Please, say something!

Name: Gant
Text: I believe... your time's up.

Name: Judge
Text: My "time's up"?

Name: Gant
Text: Sorry, Wrighto, but I'm having lunch with the District Attorney General after this. We have to get going if we're going to make it in time for the early bird special.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: B-but... The cross-examination isn't finished yet!

Name: Gant
Text: Remember what I told you earlier? A police chief... has all kinds of weapons at his disposal.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ..."Weapons"...?

Name: Gant
Text: Like the right to refuse to testify. I'm invoking that right now.

Name: Judge
Text: What!? That is not a right to be casually invoked. There are certain risks to be considered!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So you're going to just run away after all this!?

Name: Gant
Text: "Run away"? Don't make me laugh, Worthy.

Name: Gant
Text: "I stabbed ol' Goodman." That's what you're saying, right? But if you had any conclusive evidence, you would have presented it by now.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well I...

Name: Gant
Text: You think I had Lana dispose of the body? If so, then show your proof and get it over with!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I'll say it again, Mr. Wright. Damon Gant is the current Chief of Police. This court will not tolerate any accusations against him without concrete proof. Well, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: Do you have any concrete proof? Proof that Chief Gant murdered Detective Goodman and made Ms. Skye dispose of his body?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Do I have any concrete "proof"...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's no use showing evidence I'm not even sure of myself...) No, Your Honor. At present I have no conclusive evidence.

Name: Gant
Text: Hmph! See, Udgey?

Name: Judge
Text: In that case... This court is forced to penalize you for your allegations against the Chief.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What?

Name: Gant
Text: I don't gamble unless the stakes are high! It seems that Lady Luck was on my side again today. Okay Udgey, I'll leave the rest to you!

Name: Judge
Text: I warned you earlier, Mr. Wright. This...is an affront to a senior officer in our nation's law law enforcement agency.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... WAAAAAHHHHHH!!!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: "Lady Luck," hm? Maybe we should have a word with her.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth? What do you mean!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There's one "Lady" who knows the real truth behind this trial... We haven't yet had the honor of hearing her testimony.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A lady who knows the truth... Another witness!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: In the absence of conclusive evidence, the only other method of proof is testimony.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But Chief Gant has invoked his right to refuse to testify!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There's still someone else. One more witness who can answer all the questions raised in this trial. Someone right in this very room!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth! Who is this person!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph... Why are you asking me, Your Honor? Have you forgotten? The defense is the one calling witnesses today.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. Does such a witness exist?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (She may not be willing to tell the truth... But we can't just stop now!) Yes, Your Honor! The defense calls forth...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Judge
Text: The defendant... Ms. Lana Skye!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: She was in the underground parking lot at 5:15 PM on February 21. Her task: to dispose of the victim's body... in accordance with a certain someone's orders!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Mr. Edgeworth...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution has no objections, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The court will now take its final recess for the day. In 15 minutes, we will reconvene to hear the defendant's testimony. This court is now in re-

Name: Gant
Text: Hold on!

Name: Judge
Text: Huh? Chief Gant! I thought you were going to eat.

Name: Gant
Text: Listen good, Lana!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He's talking to Lana!)

Name: Gant
Text: I don't think you need me to tell you this, but if you accept Mr. Wright's claim... there will be terrible consequences.

Name: Gant
Text: That's right... Your sister will be found guilty... for Neil Marshall's murder!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ah! (This isn't good!)

Name: Gant
Text: Of course, you'd never support such outrageous claims anyway... right? Just something to think about... All right, then. I've got a lunch date to meet.

Name: Judge
Text: ... Okay. If there aren't any further objections... this court is now in recess!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Looks like we managed to stay in the game.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah. Thanks to your help, Edgeworth.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That Chief... He's something else, eh pals?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Ha ha ha. I'm not a "detective" anymore.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh yeah. Sorry about that...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Ah, don't worry. I've already decided where to work now! At your office!

Name: Phoenix
Text: My office...?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Sure! I'll take the place of that top-knotted girl you used to work with!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Could he mean... Maya?)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Still... Looks like we're all out of moves now. Chief Gant's done it again. How is it he always gets the upper hand!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's not fair he has the right to refuse to testify!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph. Settle down, Wright. Remember what the judge said?

Name: Judge
Text: But Chief! That is not a right to be casually invoked. There are certain risks to be considered!

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Risks"... What did he mean by that?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's simple. If the Chief refuses to testify... the opposite also holds true.

Name: Ema
Text: You mean, he forfeits his right to say anything too!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ema! Are you okay?

Name: Ema
Text: Yeah. When I came to, I was in the medical office. I've been listening to the trial from the gallery.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So she heard everything that's been going on.) Um, Ema... I'm sorry for what I said before.

Name: Ema
Text: No, don't be. It was the truth. You know, it's funny. I almost feel somehow... relieved.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Relieved"?

Name: Ema
Text: Yeah... Now I finally know what really happened. To think that all this time... my sister was being blackmailed by that terrible man! And she did it all... just to protect me.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ever since her appointment as Chief Prosecutor, everyone who knew her... said she changed. Perhaps... it was easier that way for her.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What do you think I mean? To follow Chief Gant's orders. She must have shut herself up deep inside... to force herself to do anything and everything the Chief told her to do.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That must be why she became so cold...)

Name: Ema
Text: It was all my fault. It's all because I... I murdered Mr. Marshall.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey. Don't go blaming yourself, now. If you want to blame anyone, blame society, pal!

Name: Ema
Text: Chief Gant may be able to fool everyone else with his "forgery," but he can't fool my memory. I remember now. I knocked Mr. Marshall into that armor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... I see.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, we'd better get back. It's time for the final act!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ema, why don't you wait h-

Name: Ema
Text: No. I'm going with you.

Name: Ema
Text: I want to be there... when Lana tells the truth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Let's go, Wright. It's time to end this.

Name: Judge
Text: Now then... Will the defendant, Ms. Lana Skye, please take the stand?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ms. Lana Skye. You are the Chief Prosecutor. I'm sure you're aware of what is required of you.

Name: Lana
Text: But Mr. Edgeworth... you already know everything... You know all that I've done these past two years.

Name: Judge
Text: Please provide the court with your testimony, Ms. Skye. And remember... you are under oath. We want to hear the truth.

Name: Lana
Text: Of course... The truth...

Name: Ema
Text: Lana! No matter what happens, I'll always be your sister!

Name: Judge
Text: Now then, your testimony, if you will. First, tell us about your relationship with Gant.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Everything hinges on your testimony. You're the only chance we have to get Gant!)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Are you sure about this testimony?

Name: Lana
Text: Your Honor. I'm confessing to a capital offense. Of course I'm sure.

Name: Ema
Text: But Lana...!

Name: Judge
Text: If this is true, then that means Chief Gant has nothing to do with this.

Name: Lana
Text: That's what I've been telling you from the beginning.

Name: Ema
Text: Please, Mr. Wright. You've got to help her! She's sacrificing herself because of me...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (But what if she's telling the truth?)

Name: Ema
Text: She's not. I know my own sister. Whenever she speaks stiffly like that, she's hiding something inside. Deep down, she's really screaming in agony!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! (Yeah... This is no time to to start second-guessing myself!)

Name: Judge
Text: The defense may now begin its cross-examination.

Name: Lana
Text: I worked alongside Gant for years...

Name: Phoenix
Text: How many years, exactly?

Name: Lana
Text: Ever since I made senior detective. Let's see, I was 24 then... so that would be five years.

Name: Judge
Text: Detective Gant and Detective Skye were legendary partners. I personally saw them testify in numerous cases.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (She must have been good, coming from the same school as Mia...)

Name: Lana
Text: Damon Gant was a respectable detective. That's why...

Name: Lana
Text: There's no truth to this "blackmail" theory.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But think about it, Ms. Skye! You didn't murder Detective Goodman! You told me as much yesterday in jail!

Name: Lana
Text: You still don't get it, do you Mr. Wright? Any testimony you cannot present in court is as useless as idle gossip.

Name: Lana
Text: I stabbed Detective Goodman with a knife. And...

Name: Lana
Text: I fabricated the evidence two years ago all by myself.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you do so to help your sister?

Name: Lana
Text: Joe Darke was a serial killer. My sister almost became his last victim that day. I didn't want that incident to ruin her life.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But what she did was justifiable self-defense! She wouldn't have been charged with anything...

Name: Lana
Text: That's not the point. She was traumatized that day, all because of that creep! That's why I couldn't forgive him.

Name: Ema
Text: Lana...

Name: Judge
Text: So that's why you fabricated the evidence two years ago?

Name: Lana
Text: When I found Prosecutor Marshall's body, I rearranged the crime scene.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You say you did this all by yourself?

Name: Lana
Text: Yes.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Would you mind telling us what you found when you arrived at the crime scene?

Name: Lana
Text: ... It seems I was the first person to discover the scene. The broken prosecutor award knife was stuck in the victim's body.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!? But Prosecutor Marshall died from an unfortunate "accident"!

Name: Lana
Text: That's only a situation you dreamed was "possible."

Name: Lana
Text: The reality is, it wasn't my sister who took the prosecutor's life! Fantasize all you want, Mr. Wright, but I'll never change this statement!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You mean, Prosecutor Marshall wound up being killed by Darke?

Name: Lana
Text: Something like that...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If that is so, what happened to the other murder weapon? Darke was carrying a switchblade knife.

Name: Lana
Text: Oh, that was lying on the floor a little distance away. It was probably knocked away in the struggle.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's not how it went down! She's trying to cover up her lies with more lies!)

Name: Ema
Text: All just to protect me...

Name: Judge
Text: So when you found the scene like this, what did you do? After all, this is what everything boils down to!

Name: Lana
Text: Yes...

Name: Lana
Text: I broke off the tip of Darke's knife, planted it inside the wound, then moved the body.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You planted the tip of Darke's knife in the victim's wound?

Name: Judge
Text: And then you moved the body?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But why!? Why would you do that...?

Name: Lana
Text: You of all people should know, Edgeworth. You've always had a good head on your shoulders.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (My head isn't that bad... but maybe I ought to ask for the sake of the others...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: When you showed up on the scene, where exactly was the victim's body?

Name: Lana
Text: It was where you deduced it was - by Chief Gant's desk.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But the body was found by your desk. Why did you move it there?

Name: Lana
Text: The reason for that is simple...

Name: Judge
Text: Let's have the witness explain this in more detail. The reason Ms. Skye moved the body!

Name: Lana
Text: The pieces of the jar that shattered during the events threatened my plan.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Pieces of the jar..." You mean...?

Name: Lana
Text: Yes. That wretched jar Mr. Wright showed us earlier. In order to show that Darke committed the crime... I felt it would be more expedient to move the body.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So... when you first found the body, the jar was already...

Name: Lana
Text: Of course. It had been shattered to pieces. If you looked at the crime scene, it would be clear right away what happened. Neil Marshall was dead, and Darke was lying unconscious... In other words, the jar must have been broken during their struggle.

Name: Judge
Text: I see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's the matter, Ema?

Name: Ema
Text: Apparently the jar shattered at the time the crime was committed. But I have a feeling there is more to it than that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (There must be a contradiction here somewhere!)

Name: Lana
Text: Anyway, I committed this fabrication completely alone.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Skye, I understand how you feel. You committed that "crime" two years ago to protect your sister.

Name: Judge
Text: You mean the forgery at the scene where Neil Marshall was murdered?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If that truth were to be exposed now, the past two years of your life will have been useless. Even so, I am compelled to bring to everyone's attention a significant contradiction within your testimony!

Name: Lana
Text: A contradiction... in my testimony?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You testified, and I quote, "The pieces of the jar that shattered during the events threatened my plan."

Name: Lana
Text: That's right...

Name: Judge
Text: Do you have a problem with that?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's a simple oversight, really. You see, a message was written on this jar with the victim's blood.

Name: Lana
Text: Yes. The prosecutor must have written it in his final moments.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Exactly so. And this is where the contradiction lies.

Name: Phoenix
Text: In order for the victim to be able to write his message on the jar, it must not yet have been broken before he died!

Name: Lana
Text: Ah...

Name: Phoenix
Text: He couldn't have written Ema's name on a shattered jar!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor. It would appear... more information is needed in regard to this jar, and its bloody message! We may be missing something critical here!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Something critical...?)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Chief Prosecutor. It seems you're as in the dark as we are... about the truth towards which we're headed.

Name: Lana
Text: What...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Just tell us exactly what you saw. We'll piece together the information to arrive at the truth.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well! The witness may now continue her testimony!

Name: Judge
Text: You mean you were the one who wiped away this message in blood!?

Name: Lana
Text: I wasn't Chief Prosecutor at the time.

Name: Ema
Text: She didn't think Darke was the real murderer. That's why she tried to erase the "real evidence."

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The defense may now begin its cross-examination.

Name: Lana
Text: I immediately noticed the blood traces on the jar,

Name: Phoenix
Text: So the jar was already broken?

Name: Lana
Text: It's a miracle that thing hadn't broken earlier.

Name: Judge
Text: It certainly looks as feeble as the defense's case...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (But not as feeble as the judge's judgment...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You were an ace detective who never missed a detail. Do you really expect us to believe you didn't investigate what was written on the jar pieces?

Name: Lana
Text: Normally I would have,

Name: Lana
Text: but it was dark in the room and I didn't have time to check it out.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you didn't know your sister's name was written on the jar?

Name: Lana
Text: No. If I had known... I would have gathered all the pieces and ground them to dust.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, that helps my case...)

Name: Ema
Text: Lana... you'd do that for me?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It seems you two might make up yet.

Name: Lana
Text: Anyway, I just barely had enough time to move the body as it was.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If someone happened upon the scene, you'd lose your chance to erase the evidence. You must have been in a hurry.

Name: Lana
Text: I was. I knew I had to destroy the evidence before anyone came.

Name: Judge
Text: This is rather shocking...

Name: Lana
Text: To be safe, I wiped away the blood.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm afraid this action of yours reveals what really happened.

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If you really thought Darke killed Prosecutor Marshall, you wouldn't have wiped away the blood.

Name: Lana
Text: ... What else could I have done in that situation?

Name: Ema
Text: Lana...

Name: Lana
Text: I only had a few moments. There wasn't enough time for me to do anything else but gather up the pieces.

Name: Lana
Text: The fragments were large, so I'm sure I got them all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: But how could you see with the power out? It should have been pitch black in that office.

Name: Lana
Text: A detective is always prepared, Mr. Wright. Even now I always carry a pocket light and a camera with me.

Name: Ema
Text: Even I carry my a bottle of emergency Luminol wherever I go!

Name: Lana
Text: I never miss anything. I got every last piece.

Name: Lana
Text: All I could think about was wiping them clean before they were discovered.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you illegally rearranged the crime scene?

Name: Lana
Text: Yes. I don't have any excuse for my actions.

Name: Ema
Text: I'm so sorry, Lana. I didn't know... I've treated you so badly all this time...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's not too late. There's still plenty of time to make up... After we've gotten to the bottom of this incident!)

Name: Judge
Text: No doubt this day will leave a permanent stain on the history of the Prosecutor's Office.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Skye. I believe this jar conceals a truth even you were unaware of.

Name: Lana
Text: What?

Name: Phoenix
Text: We found the final piece of this jar in Chief Gant's safe.

Name: Lana
Text: In the Chief's safe? But how...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I knew it! She really didn't know!) There's something even more disturbing about that final piece: There was still blood on it.

Name: Judge
Text: But the witness just testified... that she gathered every last piece and wiped the blood off of them!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, which leaves us with only one explanation. On the night Prosecutor Marshall was murdered... you were not the first one to show up on the scene! Chief Gant got there before you!

Name: Judge
Text: But couldn't the defendant have simply missed a piece?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm afraid that's unlikely. The pieces are too big for anyone to miss, let alone an ace detective!

Name: Judge
Text: That may well be, but everyone makes mistakes. Even I once wasted an entire day looking for my dentures. They were in my mouth all along! Ha! Can you believe that!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Have you forgotten, Your Honor? When this witness arrived at the scene, the jar was already broken.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh, that...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There's no way a name could have been written on a shattered jar. Another person discovered the scene prior to the witness!

Name: Judge
Text: I hope you're not implying this "person" was Chief Gant. At the time, he was looking for Darke downstairs. Besides, even if he was there first, why would he break the jar?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The question is, if he did arrive there first, why did he hide that fact for two years!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, Your Honor? Can you answer us that!?

Name: Judge
Text: Nnnnn... NNNNGHAAAAAAA! Noooooooooooo!

Name: Judge
Text: Wait, I'm not the one on trial here!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Damon Gant arrived at the crime scene prior to the witness. He proceeded to break the jar, and purposefully hid one of the broken pieces. Question: What is this action called?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Fabrication...

Name: Judge
Text: B-but why would Chief Gant do that!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: In light of what happened afterwards, isn't it clear?

Name: Judge
Text: What happened afterwards...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Discovering the scene, Lana Skye believed her sister Ema killed the victim. Determined to help her sister, she sought Gant's aid. Lending her his "aid," Gant helped her create evidence that incriminated Darke, sparing Ema. And here is the reason! The reason why Ms. Skye became the Chief's puppet!

Name: Lana
Text: ...!! N-no... I... I did it on my own...

Name: Ema
Text: Please, Sis! Stop trying to protect the Chief! I... I can't watch you suffer any more for my sake...

Name: Lana
Text: No, you didn't! It wasn't you, Ema! You didn't kill anyone! Don't believe anything Mr. Wright says! Defense attorneys make up the he most foul lies to defend their clients!

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Foul lies"...? (Imagine that, coming from my own client!)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I guess you do seem the type who likes to twist the truth.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! (Wait a minute... What if... we're still smack dab in the middle of Gant's trap!?)

Name: Judge
Text: Is something wrong, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Lana... may be right after all.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ! What do you mean, Wright?

Name: Ema
Text: So you do tell foul lies then, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Skye! Please testify once more!

Name: Lana
Text: But...

Name: Phoenix
Text: If evidence was "fabricated" behind your back... then Ema's accidental killing of Prosecutor Marshall... might also be a lie!

Name: Ema
Text: B-but, I do remember knocking over Mr. Marshall...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Skye! If you will!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There's nothing to be afraid of anymore.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This cross-examination may not change a thing. However, there is a possibility that it will, if you tell the truth!

Name: Lana
Text: ... Very well. I'll testify... about what I really saw.

Name: Judge
Text: All right. The witness may testify once more, for the final time!

Name: Judge
Text: Unbelievable! The body was impaled on the armor's sword?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You were the only one who saw that. If only you had proof...

Name: Lana
Text: ... Actually, I do have proof.

Name: Lana
Text: I gave it to Mr. Wright just this morning.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What? To me!?

Name: Lana
Text: It's a picture I took of the crime scene as I encountered it. I thought it might be needed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But I don't remember receiving a picture like that...

Name: Ema
Text: Lana must have known... See. Mr. Wright? She really does have faith in you!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, Mr. Wright. Please present this "picture"!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I don't remember receiving any pictures from Lana...)

Name: Ema
Text: Lana said she gave it to you this morning, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I seem to remember getting something from her then...

Name: Ema
Text: Let's check that evidence again! There must be a picture in there somewhere!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey... There's a picture here!

Name: Ema
Text: Oh... Oh my... This is... the actual crime scene...!

Name: Lana
Text: No other detective saw the crime scene like this. That's because I contacted Criminal Affairs only after I rearranged the scene.

Name: Ema
Text: *gasp* Mr. Wright! That piece cut out from his vest! Could that be...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The cloth we found inside Chief Gant's safe!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's this?

Name: Ema
Text: It's... a handprint.

Name: Ema
Text: That cloth... It had fingerprints on it! Whosever fingerprints those are must be the real murderer!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What!? But those fingerprints... They're yours, Ema!)

Name: Ema
Text: Why are your lips turning all purple, Mr. Wright?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Anyway, let's get on with the cross-examination. So long as you tell the truth, we should be able to flush out the real murderer.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The defense may now begin its cross-examination.

Name: Lana
Text: When I arrived, I found Mr. Marshall's body impaled on that suit of armor's sword.

Name: Gant
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Gant
Text: Come now, Udgey. This is the poorest excuse for a trial I've ever seen!

Name: Judge
Text: Chief Gant...

Name: Gant
Text: What, now you want to make me out as the bad guy too? If so, I'd like to put in a word or two in my defense.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm afraid it's too late for that.

Name: Gant
Text: What?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You already declined testimony. That means you forfeited your right to make statements of any sort.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This must be the "risk" the judge was talking about...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Just sit back, relax... and enjoy the sound of the noose tightening around your own neck.

Name: Gant
Text: GGGCCKCKCCKKKK...! ... Ah, so what? You think I'm worried?

Name: Gant
Text: Sorry to disappoint you, but I don't need to make any statements.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Gant
Text: The evidence will do all the talking for me. Even if I can't testify, I can still present evidence.

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, that's true... Wait! You mean... you still have some conclusive evidence?

Name: Gant
Text: No, I don't. But someone does.

Name: Judge
Text: "Someone"...?

Name: Gant
Text: So then... what's your excuse Wrighto?

Name: Gant
Text: Why have you been keeping quiet about it? You do have something to show us, right? Something that proves who knocked over Neil Marshall, causing his death. Conclusive evidence, that leaves no room for doubt!

Name: Judge
Text: I-is this true, Mr. Wright!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (If I show that piece of evidence now... Ema's sure to be made out as the murderer!)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! If you have any more evidence, present it now! And if you try to conceal anything... you will be the one appearing before the Board of Inquiries!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What do I do now!? I'd better think this through carefully. I can't afford to make the wrong decision! Should I present that piece of evidence? The one that shows who really killed Prosecutor Marshall?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, I don't have any evidence I can present at this point in time.

Name: Gant
Text: What!? You lie!

Name: Judge
Text: Chief Gant?

Name: Gant
Text: You... you opened my safe! I know you took what was inside! The conclusive evidence!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't know what you're talking about.

Name: Ema
Text: Mr. Wright! Why don't you show them? We found it together!

Name: Gant
Text: Oh, I see. It's because you know the truth, don't you? You know whose fingerprints are on it. That's why you won't present it!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What are you talking about, Chief Gant!?

Name: Gant
Text: Can't you figure it out? Take a good look at this picture. See the victim's vest? Notice anything odd about the chest area?

Name: Judge
Text: It looks like part of it's been cut off for some reason.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You mean, you had this...? In your safe?

Name: Judge
Text: What!? That means you... the Chief of Police... concealing evidence! This is going to be the biggest scandal in the history of the Police Department!!!

Name: Gant
Text: ... Impressive... To be honest, I didn't think you had the gall, Wrighto.

Name: Gant
Text: Well, I can't just let you pin me up as the murderer. I'll tell you what really happened.

Name: Judge
Text: What!? You mean you admit to it!?

Name: Gant
Text: I was the first person to arrive at the crime scene that day. It then occurred to me that I could use the situation to control Lana.

Name: Ema
Text: So you really were manipulating her!

Name: Gant
Text: I knew Lana. If I made it look like the blame lay with her sister... That when she saw the scene, she would ask me for my aid.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So you "assisted" Ms. Skye!

Name: Gant
Text: I told her to arrange all the evidence. I had her plant the knife tip in the victim's body, and move the body across the room.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And I ended up using that evidence to get Joe Darke convicted!

Name: Gant
Text: When we rearranged the crime scene, I hid two pieces of evidence. I did this before Lana arrived at the scene.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Two pieces of evidence... You mean those items in your safe!

Name: Judge
Text: But... why?

Name: Gant
Text: For insurance, of course.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Insurance"...?

Name: Gant
Text: I was sure my plan would work, but it's always bet to be prepared for the worst. I wasn't about to let anyone blame me for a murder that girl committed.

Name: Judge
Text: You mean you were calculating that far ahead while forging the evidence!?

Name: Gant
Text: Who do you take me for, a fool? I didn't make police chief by dumb luck. See this jar fragment? I hid the most legible part of Ema's name. I didn't expect Lana to go and wipe the blood off all the pieces.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: But if you fabricated all the evidence... what's to say you didn't fabricate the message on this jar, too?

Name: Gant
Text: Ho ho ho... Some people just don't know when to quit, do they? That's why I kept one more item for "insurance."

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You mean that piece of cloth?

Name: Gant
Text: Come on, Wrighto. Cough it up, already. I know you have it.

Name: Ema
Text: What are you waiting for, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you admit to it then, Chief Gant? That you were hiding the cloth you cut off the victim's vest in your safe?

Name: Gant
Text: Yes, I admit it. I didn't want to have to do that, being Chief and all, but it's a lot better than being portrayed as a murderer!

Name: Judge
Text: Well, Mr. Wright? What do you have to say for yourself? Just a moment ago, you said you didn't have any evidence you could present.

Name: Gant
Text: Foolish move, Wrighto. You should have shown it then before it was too late.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's been a long battle... but the moment of truth has finally arrived! As long as I don't mess up here, victory is mine!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, I do have evidence to present now.

Name: Judge
Text: All right then, let's see this "conclusive" evidence! The evidence that shows who actually murdered Prosecutor Marshall!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let me verify this once more. On the day of the crime, you personally cut out this piece of the victim's vest?

Name: Gant
Text: Oh, yes! At last you've finally brought it out into the open.

Name: Judge
Text: There's a handprint on this piece of cloth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor! The prosecution requests that be immediately sent to the lab for analysis! This handprint on the leather... There must have been a strong impact for it to be left so clearly!

Name: Judge
Text: ! You mean...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It could not have been forged. It must be authentic, conclusive evidence!

Name: Gant
Text: Ho ho ho... You're as slow on the uptake as ever, Worthy!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What?

Name: Gant
Text: Think about it. Wrighto had all this time to present this evidence... Yet he was reluctant to do so. Why would that be?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ...! You mean you already know? You know whose fingerprints are on that?

Name: Ema
Text: M-Mr. Wright... Do you really know?

Name: Judge
Text: Whoever the fingerprints belong to must be the real murderer! Whose fingerprints are they!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Very well. I'll tell you. (It should be okay now. Everything's proceeding as predicted.) The person whom these fingerprints belong to are...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Judge
Text: Ema? Ema Skye!?

Name: Ema
Text: What!? They're mine...!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm sorry, Ema...

Name: Ema
Text: But why... Why didn't you tell me!?

Name: Gant
Text: Oh ho ho ho! You're really something, Wrighto! You knew this girl did it all along, and you still tried to pin the murder on me!

Name: Judge
Text: So it's true. Tragic, but true. This girl really did shove Prosecutor Marshall to his death.

Name: Lana
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Lana
Text: How could you!? You... you monster!!!

Name: Judge
Text: Ms. Skye...

Name: Lana
Text: You knew whose fingerprints those were all along, yet you... you acted like she really didn't...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Skye. It's not over yet...

Name: Lana
Text: What!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I said this trial isn't over yet.

Name: Gant
Text: Ha! But I'm afraid it is over, boy! Not only this trial... but your career too!

Name: Gant
Text: You purposely concealed this conclusive evidence. That, my friend, is a serious offense.

Name: Gant
Text: I'm looking forward to pressing charges after the defendant is convicted. I'll have your badge, boy!

Name: Gant
Text: What's the matter, cat got your tongue? Aren't you going to tell us how it feels? How it feels to be the one who single-handedly turned a poor little girl into a murderer!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Before I do that... there's just one little thing I have to clear up.

Name: Gant
Text: Oh? And what's that?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Who really killed Prosecutor Neil Marshall.

Name: Judge
Text: What!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Chief Gant, you are absolutely right. This piece of cloth proves who the real murderer is. Who killed Neil Marshall, you ask?

Name: Judge
Text: It was Ema Skye, wasn't it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm afraid that's not possible. You see, this piece of cloth contains a critical contradiction!

Name: Gant
Text: What!? A contradiction!? What is this fool babbling about!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm talking about a contradiction. One that proves... who the real killer is!

Name: Judge
Text: M-Mr. Wright! This piece of cloth... What could it possibly contradict!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Chief Gant, your tyrannical reign ends here!) Behold! The piece of evidence that contradicts this cloth!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Gant
Text: And what exactly is this supposed to be...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is the picture Ms. Skye took. Take a good look at it. See where the piece of his vest was cut out?

Name: Judge
Text: Yes... His shirt is showing underneath. It's hard to make out with all the blood on his vest, though.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Exactly my point. His chest is soaked with blood. That's only natural. His lungs no doubt were punctured. Blood poured out of his mouth.

Name: Judge
Text: Oh! But that piece of cloth... Wait... There's no blood on it!

Name: Gant
Text: AAAAAAAHHHHHH!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Since Ema Skye's fingerprints are on this cloth, there's no doubt that she shoved the prosecutor aside! However! Mr. Marshall was not impaled on the sword!

Name: Gant
Text: No! Th-this is nonsense!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Now then, Chief Gant. Let me ask you something. Prosecutor Marshall was not impaled when he was shoved aside.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He most likely hit his head on the ground and was knocked out.

Name: Phoenix
Text: If so, then tell me. Who could it have been? Who could have arrived at the scene before Ms. Skye, picked up the unconscious prosecutor, and impaled him on the armor's sword?

Name: Gant
Text: Hnnngngghgghh...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Then, to make it look like Ema was responsible for the prosecutor's death, said person proceeded to write her name on the jar with the victim's blood. Then he broke the jar on purpose, to leave behind a clue, and make Lana believe her sister did it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Remember what you admitted only moments ago? That you personally cut out this bloodless piece of the victim's vest? Ironic, isn't it? Through the very act of creating "insurance," you proved that you were the actual murderer!

Name: Gant
Text: NNNNNNOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It's finished...)

Name: Gant
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Gant
Text: Heh... Heh heh heh! Oh ho ho ho ho ho ho! That was close, Wrighto! You almost had me!

Name: Gant
Text: Sorry, but you'll have to do better than that. I refute your allegations.

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean, you "refute" his allegations?

Name: Gant
Text: You see, that piece of cloth... is illegal evidence!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! What nonsense is this!?

Name: Gant
Text: Illegal evidence cannot be used to convict a suspect! Remember, Udgey? Earlier, ol' Wrighto here concealed that piece of cloth!

Name: Gant
Text: So then... what's your excuse Wrighto? You do have some conclusive evidence, don't you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Your Honor, I don't have any evidence I can present at this point in time.

Name: Judge
Text: Well, that's true... The defense did refuse to present evidence!

Name: Gant
Text: At that moment, that piece of cloth ceased to be "legal evidence"!

Name: Ema
Text: But that's not fair...!

Name: Gant
Text: Hoo hoo hoo hooooo! Did you actually think you could best me in court? It looks like the last laugh's on you, son!

Name: Judge
Text: I'm afraid Mr. Gant's claim is legally correct. Well, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: True... Illegal evidence cannot be used to convict a person... assuming, of course, that the evidence is indeed illegal.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm? Well, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (It seems... at last... The time for me to reveal my plan has finally arrived.)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. Do you admit to it? That you purposefully and illegally concealed this piece of cloth?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Certainly, I refused to present evidence at one point.

Name: Gant
Text: Aha! So the evidence is illegal!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: No it isn't, Mr. Gant.

Name: Gant
Text: Huh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's not that I "didn't" present evidence then... it's that I "couldn't."

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean, you "couldn't"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: There are certain procedures involved when presenting evidence!

Name: Gant
Text: No, Udgey! Don't listen to his lies! He's nothing but a coward! You can't let him?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There is only one issue left to be resolved in this trial: Is this evidence legal or not?

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Let us settle this once and for all. Earlier you refused to present evidence. If you can prove your conduct was not in violation of the law, then do so now!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is my proof, Your Honor: "Evidence Law."

Name: Gant
Text: What's this?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I've done my homework too, Chief. Indeed, Ema Skye's fingerprints were on this piece of cloth. However! At that point in time, this was merely a piece of cloth, nothing more.

Name: Gant
Text: What?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You see, it's written right here in this book: The second rule of evidence law!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Rule 1: no evidence shall be shown without the approval of the Police Department!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I found this piece of evidence myself... inside your safe. It goes without saying I did not approval from the Police Department.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Rule 2: unregistered evidence presented must be relevant to the case in trial.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And here is the crux of the matter. You see, at the time it was impossible for me to prove the relevance... between the cloth and the SL-9 Incident.

Name: Gant
Text: What!? What kind of nonsense is this!? You want "relevancy"? Just take one look at this picture and-

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sorry, but can you recall... when was that picture presented?

Name: Judge
Text: That was shown only a few moments ago!

Name: Gant
Text: No...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He's right. At the beginning of today's trial, that piece of cloth was still meaningless.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The person who gave it value as evidence... was you, Damon Gant.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You yourself confessed to a certain "truth."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let me verify this once more. On the day of the crime, you personally cut out this piece of the victim's vest?

Name: Gant
Text: Oh, yes!

Name: Gant
Text: NNNNOOOOO!!!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It was then that you approved this cloth... as conclusive evidence. Yes! You, the Chief of Police, personally approved this cloth!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The only person who could have cut this from the victim's vest... is the one who stood before Prosecutor Marshall in his final moments. In other words, the real murderer! And there's only one person who that could be... Damon Gant, the killer was you!

Name: Gant
Text: N... N... Mmph... WA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HEH HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO HO UH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HUH HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HEE HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW HAW!!! I knew I should have gotten rid of him... That good-for-nothing scum! For two years he's been snooping around the department trying to get something on me! Crimes are being committed everyday, yet he insisted on hounding me!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Well, your crime wasn't exactly petty.

Name: Gant
Text: He wanted to reinvestigate the case. He recruited Angel Starr, then convinced Bruce Goodman...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Goodman?

Name: Gant
Text: Yeah, that's right.

Name: Marshall
Text: If the evidence is transferred I'll lose my only chance to find out the truth! Please, you've got to help me!

Name: Gant
Text: Goodman turned him down, as he ought to. Still, Jake Marshall didn't know when to quit.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He stole Goodman's ID card and tried to take the evidence!

Name: Gant
Text: Goodman came to me that day. He wanted to file a lost item report. I went with him to the evidence room. Then all of a sudden he had to speak out!

Name: Gant
Text: What are you talking about, Goodman?

Name: Goodman
Text: Can you please reopen the investigation, Chief? We can't transfer the evidence out. There are too many questions left unanswered!

Name: Gant
Text: He... told me to open up the evidence room and take it out.

Name: Goodman
Text: It's not too late. I'll hand this to Marshall!

Name: Gant
Text: Well, to be honest, I was a little panicked, too. I had a bad feeling about it, but never knew it would come to this. That's when I saw it... that accursed knife. I couldn't just pull it out.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You would only increase the amount of blood and you couldn't finish what you started.

Name: Gant
Text: Even so, the blood was just pouring out. I didn't know who might stumble in, so I was wiping it up. I was worrying so much about the floor, I didn't realize my mistake.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe's bloody hand print...

Name: Gant
Text: I used to be known as the "crime computer"... But everyone has to start somewhere, I guess. I was too nervous. I had no business doing any of it.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Then you put the body in my car?

Name: Gant
Text: I'm sorry! We couldn't think of any other way to move the body. We broke the trunk, but what's the big deal? You pull down a lot more than us detectives!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Grr...

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-what does this have to do with anything? You're horrible! How could you get Ms. Skye involved in all of this!?

Name: Gant
Text: Well, she had as much to lose as I did if the truth came out.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So you took the evidence from Detective Goodman's locker?

Name: Gant
Text: I feel bad for having to do it. I couldn't sit around and pick and choose what to take.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well... you left the jar fragment and gloves.

Name: Gant
Text: ... Yeah... It looks like I was better off being an investigator of crimes than a committer. They all did their best to get in my way... I've got to hand it to them, they do their jobs well... much to my dismay.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Fake evidence doesn't hold up very well upon close examination. You must have known that...

Name: Gant
Text: Tell me, Worthy. What are you doing in court?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Me?

Name: Gant
Text: You despise criminals. I can feel it. You and me... we're the same.

Name: Gant
Text: One day you'll understand. If you want to take them on alone... you'll figure out what's needed!

Name: Gant
Text: Well, looks like it's time to say goodbye. Oh, Udgey.

Name: Judge
Text: Wh-what?

Name: Gant
Text: Looks like we'll have to cancel that lunch date. Sorry old friend!

Name: Judge
Text: ... I'm sorry too, Damon Gant.

Name: Judge
Text: I knew you as you used to be, long ago. You were once a fine investigator, and an example to others on the force. I'm sorry to learn that you are no longer that person.

Name: Gant
Text: Those days are gone now, Udgey. Thanks for all the memories, though... Don't worry, you'll be fine! Now you have Wrighto here... and Worthy. With these two around, you can't go wrong... You see, if I listen carefully, I can hear it right now... The sound of a new beginning!

Name: Phoenix
Text: There are two things I want you to understand.

Name: Lana
Text: Yes?

Name: Phoenix
Text: First, your sister never hurt anyone. Second, Damon Gant betrayed you from the beginning. You see, Ms. Skye... you no longer have any reason to keep silent.

Name: Lana
Text: You're right. When this trial is over, I'll tell everything. All that I've done these past two years... from the time I had Gant help me forge evidence, up until today.

Name: Judge
Text: So... it seems all the questions raised in this trial have been answered.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm sorry, Ms. Skye... I couldn't get you out of all your trouble.

Name: Lana
Text: ... My, my. What high standards you have... for a rookie.

Name: Lana
Text: I can see why Mia thought so highly of you. Who knows? A few years from now, you just might make it to the top. I owe you my thanks, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Skye...

Name: Lana
Text: And to you too, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Lana
Text: You've suffered every bit as much as I have over these past few days. Believe me, I know how much of an ordeal it's been for you.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph! It was nothing.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Liar...)

Name: Lana
Text: I was worried the pressure might break you. And yet... you rose above it all and guided Mr. Wright to victory. You've done well, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: S-stop it! I only did my job!

Name: Judge
Text: In light of this case... It seems a good self-examining is in order for all of us. Ms. Skye.

Name: Lana
Text: Yes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: You are innocent of murder. However... Although the Chief blackmailed you, the fact is you still acted as his accomplice. A trial will be scheduled for these crimes at a later date.

Name: Lana
Text: Yes. I understand, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Is there something amusing about all of this? Why are you smiling?

Name: Lana
Text: It's been a long time, Your Honor. A long time since I've felt free of these heavy chains...

Name: Judge
Text: Well, this trial has gone on far too long already. Regarding the charge of murder, this court finds the defendant, Ms. Lana Skye...

Name: Judge
Text: Not Guilty

Name: Judge
Text: That is all. The court is adjourned!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (At long last... It's finally over...) E-Ema?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why the long face? I'm sorry your sister didn't get completely off the hook, but at least she wasn't convicted for a murder she didn't commit!

Name: Ema
Text: No, that's not it. Just now, after the trial ended...

Name: Lana
Text: I can see why Mia Fey thought so highly of you. I owe you my thanks, Mr. Wright. And to you too, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Lana
Text: You've suffered every bit as much as I have over these past few days. You've done well.

Name: Ema
Text: You know, I did my best too. But... Lana didn't say a single word to me.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hope I'm not interrupting anything.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh... Guess I am. I'll come back later.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ah, Detective Gumshoe! What is it?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: You're doing this on purpose, aren't you? Making a detective run all around while on duty, and to top it off you call me here... I've seen happier people at funerals! Hey, lighten up, pals. I'm only kidding!

Name: Ema
Text: Oh... Are you here because of my sister again?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Nope, not this time! I came today because of you, pal!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: That's right. I thought you'd like to see someone.

Name: Ema
Text: Lana!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Should you be doing this? She's still under arrest, you know.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... Well, I won't tell if you won't.

Name: Lana
Text: Ema... I owe you an apology.

Name: Ema
Text: It's okay, Sis. Don't worry about it.

Name: Lana
Text: That day, two years ago,

Name: Lana
Text: was the first time in my life I ever panicked. It was all I could do to keep myself from screaming. All I could think about was keeping you from getting wrapped up in that mess.

Name: Ema
Text: Sis...

Name: Lana
Text: I asked Gant to help me cover up the "truth." I thought I was doing it for your sake... But now I realize I was wrong.

Name: Lana
Text: I changed after that day. I had to... It was the only way I could make it through the past two years.
